body:
Do you want to be the next #1 on Kaggle? Have what it takes to work alongside the current #1 and two former #1's? Joining team DataRobot means you'll learn and work with Owen, Xavier, and Sergey to change the way we do data science.As a Lead Data Scientists Consultant in Japan, you will be developing opportunities, analysing customer requirements, and providing consulting service in complex technical environments. You will be comfortable leading technical demonstrations of Datarobot product and discussions of specifics of various machine learning algorithms and preprocessing methods. You will work with prospects and clients for developing solutions to complex predictive analytic problems involving many diverse input data sources and high volume real-time implementation scenarios.
You must have all of the necessary skills: 

3+ years of real-world business experience 
Hands experience integrating predictive models in corporate environments 
Strong customer interaction skills experience with customers in consulting roles 
Must possess excellent organisational, communication, writing and interpersonal skills (English and Japanese)
Experience using code (python/R) to manipulate datasets

And at least four of the following: 

Fluency with SQL on one or more of the following databases - Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres 
Strong coding skills in Python or R 
Experience with cloud computing platforms 
Experience with Hadoop and related Big Data technologies
Experience working in an agile sales environment 
Experience with NoSQL databases 
Previous sales engineering experience

body:
As a pioneer and industry leader in data-driven entertainment products, Zynga continues to maintain a strong emphasis on the use of data and data science to improve our extensive network of live and upcoming games. We are looking for an exceptional Senior Product Manager for Analytics to join the organization of the Chief Data Officer.
Responsibilities:

Responsible for the full product lifecycle, from writing specifications, working across multi-disciplinary teams: design, data science, and engineering to develop internal analytic tools and machine learning solutions used by our existing and new game studios.  
Exhibit sound product judgment, ability to formulate product strategy and present clear measurable objectives that will lead to achieving our business goals. 
Expected to provide valuable input into business cases based on in-depth data analysis and demonstrate how that analysis impacts key product metrics. 

Required Skills:

3+ years of experience in product management or equivalent domain experience in mobile gaming or data science strongly preferred
Ability to create wire-frames, product specifications and white papers
Strong project management skills and ability to present work to executive staff
Exceptional data analysis skills
Strong passion for games and creating fun and compelling user experiences
Outstanding written/oral, organizational, analytical skills, and attention to detail
Must be a self-starter, a team-player and driven
Previous start-up, social networking and/or consulting experience is a strong plus
Bachelors or graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics is strongly preferred

body:
Job description
We are looking for talented and motivated professionals for the development of our project in the field of Data Science, Data collection, Data Mining and analysis. For developing recommendation engine and predict for our millions of customers.
If you are crazy about huge amounts of data, like to structure the information, to form hypotheses and draw conclusions so, you are viewing the correct position!
As head of data science, you'll be refining the vision and mission of the team and lead a talented team of scientists. You will be working closely with Software Engineers and Product Management to integrate enhancements and new algorithms to our big data platform to improve our products and solutions.
You will be responsible for the fundamental data science that powers our platform. This will include data mining, data collection statistical analysis, predictive analytics and related work. You will work closely with our software engineers and Lead our Data Scientist to understand requirements and develop solutions. We value creativity, a strong work ethic, and the ability to work well in a team as well as lead the team. In exchange, we offer a competitive base salary, benefits, and flexibility, when you need it.
Main Responsibilities

Demonstrate expertise and be capable of mentoring other team members in the use of data science tools such as R, SQL, noSQL, Python, Spark, Hadoop and Big Data technologies
Create and validate machine learning methods and statistical models that deliver insight about what delights our customers, where they have opportunities to do more and how to maximize customer experience
Design and test algorithms that automate customer and business insight and generate action at various touch points on and off the website and mobile apps
Guide across the company to implement new algorithms and methods based on your work by presenting findings in a clear and confident manner
Write clean code for use by engineers and other analysts in the organization
Define data needs, consistency and cleaning for the Data team and other teams
Keep an eye on and R&D any evolving technologies and data sources to help enhance data
Pitch in new ideas and proposals and how each will be tackled at a Data, Insight and Action touch points

In order to achieve this you will need to love a fast paced and challenging environment, be tenacious, creative, collaborative and visual. In addition to this you will need a blend of the following skills and qualifications:

A Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Finance, or Mathematics is preferred
Significant experience of extracting, transforming and working with large sets of data
Experience with advanced analytic techniques such as decision trees, support vector machines, neural networks and multivariate regression.
Extensive experience of working with business metrics, ideally in an e-commerce/digital setting
Analytical experience in marketing /customer database analytics such as: analytic segmentation, direct marketing test design, response analysis, measurement strategy development, ROI analysis, financial modeling
Experience across a broad range of tech and analytic toolsets including cluster analysis, regression, building models
Passion for digital business, mobile, media and emerging technologies

Requirements

Eligibility to live and work in UAE and in India

To apply, email: jobs@awok.com
WHO WE ARE:
AWOK.com is an integrated eCommerce company founded in 2013 and at the completion of our 2nd year we have already become the leading online store in UAE with year-to-year growth.
AWOK.com was founded with the vision of creating a solution for the problem incurred by everyday consumers where they face the choice between good product or good price, since inception we have strived to never settle for something less than perfect in both areas; be it the product quality or the price; we have done it successfully in the past and will continue to do so. We are focused on Low Prices and Quality Products in categories such as, Mobile Phones, Tables, Laptops, Electronics, Home & Kitchen Appliances, Health & Beauty Products, Apparels, Watch & Jewellery Products, DSLR & SLR Cameras and more.

body:
Senior Data Scientist, Machine Learning (Berlin)
Did you participate in the ICDM2015 competition? Were you a top performer with a high score and the drive to do it all again? Roq.ad wants to hire you! Get noticed for your achievements and include your kaggle username in either your cover letter or CV. You never know – it might just help your chances of joining the Roq.ad Team!
Who is Roq.ad?
Roq.ad is an innovative Berlin based start-up, with a passion for Cross-Device Technology and a dedication to building a world-class technology company. As Europe’s leading multi-device company, our proprietary technology has already garnered industry-wide recognition. We were recently named one of the “Top 3 companies to watch in 2015” by Online Marketing Rockstars and acknowledged as a “Top 25 EU Business” by the European Tech Tour. 
Roq.ad’s primary offering is a cross-device user identification engine dedicated to Real-Time Advertising. We receive billions of events daily, process a graph structure that contains hundreds of millions of nodes, and generate efficient predictive models based on terabytes of data. Our daily routine is the core essence of Data Science.Sounds impressive?
Well, we here at Roq.ad are offering you the opportunity to join us in our Berlin office as a Senior Data Scientist, Machine Learning. Are you a top performing data scientist who is motivated by new challenges, enthusiastic about creating new technology, and excited about working with a talented team of data scientists? You could be our ideal candidate! Make an impact on today’s multi-device society and join the Roq.ad Team!
Your Responsibilities:

Leading the design and development of predictive algorithms to solve complex business challenges and extract information from data sets
Improving our capabilities in large-scale data mining, analysis, information retrieval, data visualization, ML & AI
Identifying market & technology trends and examining current data assets
Identifying data sources, assessing compliance of data sources, testing data quality and overlap, validating segments, reviewing data providers’ taxonomy
Validating data integrity

Your Skills:

Degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research or an equivalent
Knowledgeable in using discrete math, linear algebra, probability & statistics to solve complex questions
3+ years of experience as a Senior Data Scientist in ad-tech industry 
Good understanding of RTB ecosystem
Proven experience with designing and developing Machine Learning algorithms
Proven experience with Data Mining and Information Retrieval
Experience with data visualization of large datasets and data pipelines
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop (HDFS, Hive, HBase, MapReduce), Apache Spark, Spark Streaming would be a plus
Fluency in English

What we offer:

Your job is one big adventure with new challenges every day
An amazing office located in the heart of Berlin
Unlimited supply of drinks, breakfast and fruits to keep you energized!
Valuable insights into entrepreneurship and the Berlin start-up scene
Work closely with the founders and a team of top performers and get first-hand insights on building an international company

 
Are you ready for Roq.ad?We are looking forward to receiving your application! Please send it to jobs@roq.ad

body:
DATA ENGINEER
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Since 2013, Avant set out to change the world of financial technology with our proprietary software that uses big data and machine learning algorithms to change the way people borrow money.
“Data” and “algorithm” may be two painfully overused buzzwords, but to us, these are two central elements to our business. The other part: the brilliant minds behind Avant.
Our team has set out to bring consumer loans from the bank to your computer screen. By combining cutting-edge technology with outstanding talent, we’ve managed to grow from five scrappy entrepreneurs to over 750 employees–and we’re not stopping there.
JOB DESCRIPTION
As a Data Engineer, you will assist in the implementation of scale-able infrastructures for analyzing large real-time data-sets. Furthermore, you will be involved in the effort to deploy interfaces between Ruby on Rails and a back-end serve that generates predictions using trained statistical models.
Within this role, you will be responsible for providing the vision and direction of data architecture, data strategy and guiding best practice in design and integrations. This role will play a key role in guiding new solutions, technologies, and platforms to meet the requirements of our data focused product.
This position reports directly to the Director of Data Engineering.
JOB REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics, finance or other programming related fields from a top tier school
Must possess basic knowledge in DB and SQL programming
Must possess basic knowledge in web and application programming (Ruby, HTML, JavaScript, CSS)
Must be familiar with Object-Oriented Design (OOD) concept
Ability to identify non-obvious solutions to complex problems
Programming ability using R, Matlab, Python or other statistical software
Preferably has a basic understanding in statistics, machine learning modeling techniques
Preferably is familiar with the concept of test-driven development and code review 

BENEFITSAvant’s first office was a windowless room with luxurious amenities like functioning plumbing. Now, that room is where Avantees line up every day at lunchtime to get their free catered meal and gather every Friday for happy hour(s) and Manager Q&A.
Beyond working with some of the best and brightest in the Chicago and Los Angeles tech space, you’ll enjoy these perks:

Work directly with senior management
Winter blues? Take a paid vacation–there’s no limit
BlueCross/BlueShield Medical & Dental Insurance
Stop squinting: VSP Vision Insurance
401k with a 4% match
Snacks on snacks on snacks
Free breakfast and lunch (in case you forgot)
Casual dress on days that end in “y”
No excuse to not call mom: complimentary corporate cell phone plan for Associate level and above
Pre-tax commuter benefits/Flexible Spending Accounts
Discounted gym membership package
Get educated: attend conferences and courses to keep your mind sharp
And more!

body:
About Spatially
We provide location intelligence so you can make better decisions about place and location. We let you answer questions like “where to open your next restaurant?”, "who and where are your customers? “, “where do hipsters hang out for craft beers and where do soccer moms get their coffee and bagel in the morning after dropping their kids off at school?”, “where are our competitors and new opportunities” and so many more.
We do this by aggregating massive data sets, leveraging data science and providing beautiful intuitive tools that anyone can enjoy.
Our team of spatial analysts, @scale engineers and data scientists have been hand picked from around the world to turn unsolved messy challenges into insights, opportunity and joy for our customers.
Spatially is a small stealth-ish start up with team members in the Bay Area, Seattle, Boston and Miami. We are gearing up for big things in 2016 and need the best and brightest to help us get there.
Our culture is casual, lean(kanban), curious, deeply technical, supporting, cloud run, independent, diverse and delusionally ambitious.
Come join us and together lets create the future of location intelligence.
Description & Responsibilities

Work with a motivated team in an innovative Spatial Analytics startup to build data Science, Analytics, and Machine Learning practice
You will advocate, evangelize and build data-fuelled products that help our customers gain true scientifically driven insights. 
You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets. 
You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.
You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. 
You will lead applied analytics and science initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions.. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.
As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on science & mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.

Qualifications

Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field. 
4+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact. 


Expertise in machine learning, predictive analytics, statistical modeling, and data algorithms. Must have knowledge/experience in methodologies and algorithms including: Multivariate Regression, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, Bagging, Boosting, Decision Trees, Lifetime Analysis, Clustering, Mathematical Optimization, Random Forest/Ensemble Learning, Deep Learning Algorithms and Stochastic Processes. 
Strong algorithmic thinking and independent research ability. 
Passion for learning and innovating new methodologies at the intersection of applied math/statistics/computer science. 
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to describe the logic and implications of a complex model to all types of business partners. 
High-energy self-starter with a passion for your work, attention to detail, and a positive attitude. 
Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R, SAS, and/or Weka. 
Strong SQL and deep understanding of Data-at-rest and data-at-transit & other lifecycle points of data
Experience with distributed computing, databases and query languages like Hadoop/YARN, Spark, Cassandra/NoSql Databases, Graph Databases, Hive/Pig and/or general map reduce computing.
Experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Postgres, MySql 
Knowledge of common data structures and ability to write efficient code in at least one language is a plus (preferably Java, Scala, GO, Python). 
Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus

To apply please send resume to talent@spatially.com

body:
If you are a top-notch analytical, insightful, problem-solver who thrives on working with big data to inform, recommend, and to select the best business decisions….keep reading…This challenging role will provide you an opportunity to work in a transforming industry. You will consider factors such as economic trends, demographics, market conditions, system topology, and technological developments affecting electric energy usage today…You will have the opportunity to build partnerships with internal and external customers while providing leadership in the data scientist arena.Great River Energy (GRE) is a consumer-owned generation and transmission company; we are Minnesota’s second largest electric utility. If any of this interests you, please continue to read below about this amazing “put your stamp on it” opportunity.General Summary We currently have an opening for a Principal Data Analyst within our Information Technology Division who will be responsible for providing leadership and technical expertise to conceptualize analytical approaches and develop reusable solutions. This position is responsible for executing complex advanced analytics services on an on-going basis. The Principal Data Analyst will work closely with GRE’s business divisions (internal customers) and member cooperatives (external customers) on “big data” and predictive/prescriptive analytical solutions.Job responsibilities:

Elicits, analyzes, documents, and communicates existing and emerging business information needs to ensure that the right information is available for making business decisions.
Uses mathematical and statistical methods to understand and quantify optimization of existing and new business opportunities.
Creates predictive models to understand likely future outcomes and creates proof of concepts to test prescriptive actions.
Proactively develops, prepares, and presents analysis to monitor ongoing and new development opportunity within GRE and its’ member cooperatives to support their business and special project needs.
Creates data models by applying formal data modeling techniques.
Responsible for leading modeling and analytic processes to ensure high quality resource and optimization of GRE’s assets.
Establishes and maintains data analysis processes and best practices to improve data analysis capabilities throughout the organization.
Partners and mentors others on analytical methods.
Works with business divisions, IT business partners, and member cooperatives to identify and support data analysis opportunities.

QualificationsTo qualify, you typically will have:

Bachelors of Science degree in mathematics, statistics, decision sciences or a related field.
Masters of Science degree strongly preferred.
At least 5 years of progressive work experience to include the following:




acquiring, maintaining and verifying data
conducting and overseeing optimization modeling
conducting mathematical and statistical analysis in a utility or comparable context


Very strong research, analytical, organizational and communication skills are required.
Ability to consult with business users to gain an understanding of their business and analytical needs, advise them on applicable strategies and methodologies, and assist them in designing business intelligence solutions.
Ability to solve business problems via mathematical modeling, statistical modeling, optimization modeling and other techniques.
Understanding of electric utility organizational, operational regulatory contexts, as well as external forces/impacts within the industry.
Thorough understanding of factors affecting electric energy usage including economic trends, demographics, market conditions, and technological developments.
Skill in transforming large quantities of data and reducing complex issues into clear and concise language, and actionable information.
Skill in decision making and creative problem-solving.
Skill in preparing complex written materials including presentations, reports, and correspondence to meet purpose and audience.
Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships, both internal and external to the organization. Ability to establish credibility and trust with stakeholders.

ApplyQualified professionals will find we have a lot to offer: competitive compensation, continued education, an on-site workout facility, generous retirement plan, along with many more benefits. Qualified candidates, please apply at www.greatriverenergy.com under the Careers tab by October 23, 2015. GRE is an EEO/AA Employer.

body:
Job Description
Prism FP is a boutique investment brokerage based in central London that is putting in place ground-breaking ideas for global markets and asset management.
We are looking for a data scientist with experience in quantitative development, who is keen to learn new technologies and open to experiment with new languages.
We will attribute more value to proven ability to deal with complex systems and to think laterally than to the specifics of tools and frameworks that you have used.
You will work within the Quantitative Research Team, and be exposed to all aspects of the business:

we work on new ways of visualizing and finding patterns in financial markets,
we write apps, mainly web-based, to put these analytics in front of our users,
we develop and maintain code to extract, transform and manage our data.

The ability and desire to communicate clearly is important: we share all knowledge within the team and we regularly discuss ideas with our colleagues who use the software we write. We are passionate about the technology we use and our working practices – we want someone who will share our passion and even bring new approaches.
Skills & Requirements
Responsibilities

Design, develop and maintain our internal analytic platform.
Participate in data gathering, cleaning and quality-testing projects.

Requirements

2-5 years of experience working with large data sets.
Strong skills in programming languages for data aggregation/manipulation.
Experience with SQL and database design.

Desirable

Experience in database optimization.
R or Python Pandas.
Cloud-based computing.
Javascript, HTML, CSS.
Spark, Hadoop or other Big Data frameworks.

body:
The Deal:Jimmy John’s Gourmet Sandwiches is a no B.S. company dubbed as one of the fastest growing Quick Service Restaurants in the nation. We are perfect bread, systems in place, and spectacular employees who lead and don’t pass the buck. Since starting as 1 sub shop in 1983, we have grown to over 2,300 locations across 44 states.
“If you measure it, you can manage it,” we always say. So we are looking for an analyst to help us do both. This JJ Data Analyst will have a passion for combing through numbers and deciphering what they mean. They will understand the value of telling a story by uncovering patterns and trends hidden within the business’ numbers.
The Data Analyst will: • Be thoroughly trained in office and store operations – you’ll know the biz inside and out• Analyze raw data (from mayo scoops to dollars) to uncover critical insights • Work both independently and cross functionally – you’ll be our in-house data expert • Clearly communicate results and recommendations to staff on all levels – present the facts and your solution
The Job Essentials: • 4-year degree in a related field• Previous data analysis experience, preferably leading projects• Possess proven, strong analytical skills• Ability and willingness to work on assigned projects as well as create independent ones
To be a JJ Rockstar, you must execute all tasks with a high sense of urgency and follow all projects from start to finish. If you take critical feedback well and thrive on performance-based compensation, this may be just what you’re looking for.
The JJ Perks:• Higher than average earning potential • Casual work environment (jeans allowed!)• Medical, dental, vision and life insurance • 401(k) retirement plan• Paid time off
If you are a self-disciplined numbers guru who is looking for an opportunity to make a real impact and who can communicate findings in a clear, concise manner, click below to apply:

body:
NFA is the premier independent provider of regulatory programs that protect investors and safeguard the integrity of the derivatives markets. Employees are proud to work at NFA because we serve a public good. A healthy derivatives market benefits the economy, and our work gives investors confidence that they will be treated fairly when they trade in these markets.
The Quantitative Analyst will assist NFA's Risk Management Group with the conception, design, development, testing, and deployment of predictive/ statistical models designed to evaluate Member risk.
Duties/Responsibilities:

Act as a Data Scientist in assisting with the design, development, and testing of risk-related information systems, most notably NFA's Risk Management System, particularly as it relates to the statistical and quantitative analysis of Member data.
Work with Information Systems personnel to develop, enhance, and test data elements for use in quantitative based risk parameters.
Develop familiarity with NFA's database systems and develop custom queries as required for risk management purposes or Compliance Department projects.
Develop understanding of existing organizational processes and identify methods of improving their efficiency and effectiveness.
Assist in ad hoc data analysis projects that pertain to improving data quality and data collection processes of database tables that the Risk Management Group relies upon for all analysis functions.
Take an active role in personal career development, concentrating on reinforcing strengths and improving developmental areas.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field and/or equivalent work experience.
Strong proficiency with R, or other analytical software like SPSS or SAS.
Applied knowledge with statistical modeling or machine-learning as part of a predictive analytics framework where your contributions were employed to generate insights for specific business goals.
Ability to consider abstract concepts and interpret unfamiliar information with a high degree of inquisitiveness.
Proactively utilize resources and willingly communicate with team members before acting on assumptions.
A desire to stake out a career on a burgeoning team of data analysts that will rely upon you to contribute from your experiences.
Strong oral and written communication skills for writing reports, proposals and making presentations.
The ability to communicate and translate technical results to a non-technical business audience within the Compliance Department.

Preferred Skills:

Advanced degree in a related field preferred, otherwise 1-3 years of relevant work experience.
Proficient with Python.
SQL programming skills or other experience interfacing with a relational database management system to extract and integrate datasets from many data sources for further analysis.
Experience working with Tableau data visualization software or similar business intelligence software.
Experience with non-academic, imperfect datasets where you have identified and adapted logical solutions to handle bad data.
Futures industry knowledge with ability to conduct research in order to identify and keep current with industry and market developments.

Benefits Information:  NFA offers a generous and competitive benefits package including: medical/ dental insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement program, vacation/personal/sick day allotment, flexible schedules, life insurance, disability insurance and much more. To learn more about our full benefits summary, please visit our Career site.

body:
Goodgame Studios is Europe′s fastest growing gaming company and one of Germany′s most successful technology businesses. With more than 1200 employees at our headquarters in Hamburg we develop innovative online games which are played by more than 270 million players in 26 languages across 200 countries. Our talented, motivated team of experts and newcomers forms the basis of our success. Become a part of the success story and apply now!
As an Online Marketing Analyst (m/f), you will be the link between our business intelligence and marketing departments. You will be responsible for carrying out extensive analyses of various issues in our marketing department and supporting the operations of this department to the best of your abilities.
Your job:

Design and implement various mathematical and graphic models/analyses for our online marketing team, and manage our long term analyses
Make judgments based on your analyses and recommend courses of action with a focus on practical applicability
Develop complex SQL queries for relational and column-based databases
Work closely with our marketing managers to specify our targeting using analysis
Create and develop reports and dashboards with the relevant KPIs
Support stakeholders using ad hoc analyses and selections from SEA, SEO, RTA, display, Facebook, and TV marketing
Identify potentials for optimization and fields for development in marketing and other adjacent business areas in our company
Define the requirements put on our data warehouse team to ensure an optimal data basis

Your profile:

Successfully completed university degree (business studies, business information systems, marketing, mathematics, statistics, or similar subjects with a strong mathematical and statistical focus)
You already have experience in online marketing and are familiar with relevant KPIs
Experience with SQL or other databases, R, Tableau, GoogleAdWords, and Excel is desirable
Analytical working approach, knowledge of statistics, and confident working with large volumes of data, including from heterogeneous systems
You communicate clearly and in a way which is appropriate to the listener, both in your team as well as with all departments
Very good written and spoken English

We offer:

An exciting job where you can assume responsibility and develop professionally
A dynamic team with friendly, highly-qualified colleagues from all over the world
Strong, sustainable growth and fresh challenges every day
Flat hierarchies and short decision paths
A culture of mutual respect and an outstanding working environment
Further training with workshops, language courses and technical reference works, a healthy work-life balance, regular team events, sporting and leisure activities and much more!

Hamburg is one of the most beautiful cities in the world and provides a fantastic range of leisure activities as well as a great nightlife. A maritime atmosphere and its Hanseatic cosmopolitan flair enable an especially high quality of life - and safety. We will make relocating simple, help you find a flat, offer you a German course, and make it easy for you to get to know your new home town.
Your contact person for this job offer is Tim Wiedemann.
We look forward to receiving your application in English (cover letter, your CV and references) as well as your salary requirements and earliest possible starting date through our online application form.
If you have questions regarding your application, please send an email to the following address: bijobs@goodgamestudios.com

body:
Goodgame Studios is Europe's fastest growing gaming company and one of Germany's most successful technology businesses. With more than 1200 employees at our headquarters in Hamburg, we develop innovative online games that are played by more than 280 million players in 26 languages across more than 200 countries. Our talented, motivated team of experts and newcomers forms the basis of our success. Become a part of the success story and apply now!
We're looking for an experienced employee for the position of Data Scientist - Monetization (m/f) to support our monetization department. Your core task will be to analyze data in order to improve the monetization of our games. In addition, you will make noticeable improvements to the quality of our revenue forecasting. You will collaborate with other departments to develop standardized evaluation methods and apply these in a meaningful and goal-oriented manner. You will recommend courses of action based on your in-depth understanding of the economic cycles of our games, the performance KPIs, and our product and feature analyses. 
Your job:

Evaluate monetization features using statistical analyses
Recommend courses of action based on these analyses
Present the results of the analyses
Design new approaches and solutions to prove current and future hypotheses
Develop complex SQL queries for relational and column-based databases

Your profile:

Completed degree in mathematics, physics, computer science, statistics, engineering, business studies, or a comparable qualification
Several years of professional experience in a comparable position
Advanced knowledge of SQL, Excel, and R, and ideally Tableau
In-depth understanding of analysis and confidence in handling big data
Passionate about online games with an in-depth understanding of virtual economic cycles
Very good written and spoken English

We offer:

An exciting job where you can assume responsibility and develop professionally
A dynamic team with friendly, highly-qualified colleagues from all over the world
Strong, sustainable growth and fresh challenges every day
Flat hierarchies and short decision paths
A culture of mutual respect and an outstanding working environment
Further training with workshops, language courses and technical reference works, a healthy work-life balance, regular team events, sporting and leisure activities, and much more!

Hamburg is one of the most beautiful cities in the world and provides a fantastic range of leisure activities as well as a great nightlife. A maritime atmosphere and its Hanseatic cosmopolitan flair enable an especially high quality of life - and safety. We will make relocating simple, help you find a flat, offer you a German course, and make it easy for you to get to know your new home town.
Your contact person for this job offer is Tim Wiedemann.
We look forward to receiving your application in English (cover letter, CV, references, portfolio) as well as your salary requirements and earliest possible starting date through our online application form.
If you have questions regarding your application, please send an email to the following address: bijobs@goodgamestudios.com

body:
metacog (www.metacog.com) is an internet scale educational data platform built to ingest data from learning objects (simulations and game-based learning objects) used by millions of students. Metacog measures how learners tackle challenges (within assessments, simulations, casual and serious games, performance tasks, etc.). As you can imagine, this is a lot more data than simply scores or grades. We want someone who can work with our Educational Data Mining Experts and build engines to analyze, score, and surface learning pathways and patterns. Metacog can automatically detect if students are bored, frustrated, gaming the system, experiencing deep vs. shallow learning and other affects. It also can understand what a learner's cognitive strategies are.
If you want to power the next generation of adaptive learning and continuous assessment solutions and provide learners with real-time, dynamic and interactive prescriptive guidance, talk to us. You will be instrumental in developing the next generation learning and assessment technologies that will be key in shaping the future of our education system.
The metacog platform is a fault-tolerant, distributed system built on the AWS platform that supports both batch and real-time educational data processing with reporting and analytics capabilities. We are looking for an experienced data scientist to help us build machine learning models to detect learner’s affective states and behaviors as they are using the software. Basically the data scientist will be talking to our top learning science advisor and working closely with dev-ops to implement the machine learned models in Spark.
REQUIREMENTS
· Two years experience in applied data science or data science-related degree
· Programming skills e.g. Python, Scala, R
· Knowledge about machine learning algorithms such as logistic regression, support vector machines, decision trees, random forest and k-means clustering
· Familiarity with cloud computing (AWS)
· Experience with social programming tools (GitHub)
· Strong written and verbal communication
BONUS
· Experience with distributed data processing (Spark, MapReduce)
· Experience working with educational data sets
· Software or web development experience
· Research or work experience in the learning sciences
job_title: Data Scientist - Deep Learning Analytics and Educational Data Mining

body:
At Digital Shadows we are faced with lots of exciting data science challenges. From classifying vast quantities of streaming data in real-time to using Deep Learning techniques to create tailored language models.
We provide cyber situational awareness that helps organizations protect against cyber attacks, loss of intellectual property, and loss of brand and reputational integrity. Our flagship solution, Digital Shadows SearchLight™, is a scalable and easy-to-use data analysis platform that provides a holistic view of an organization's digital footprint and the profile of its attackers. It continually monitors more than 100 million data sources in 27 languages across the visible, deep and dark web and other online sources to create an up-to-the minute view of an organization and the risks requiring mitigation.
This is a great opportunity for someone passionate about solving problems to truly advance a career within data science. You will immediately be working with our stakeholders to understand the business problems we face and through placing a strong focus on regularly delivering and deploying working software you will research and develop algorithms and models that will be influential to the success of our business.
You will need to have experience with Python and an understanding of traditional and emerging database management techniques. In return you will have a unique opportunity to create a role within a data-driven environment where you have the freedom to be innovative and creative and with real potential to develop into a pivotal position within the business!
Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning and natural language processing approaches to accurately categorise and risk assess data processed by the application
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in our data to find opportunities to extend and enrich our existing data analytics approaches
Identify and acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to extend the coverage and capabilities of the application
Collaborate across teams to define, design, and shape new features
Work with and integrate external tools, libraries, data sources and API’s
Discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies
Contribute ideas and innovations to the product roadmap

2+ years of experience as a data scientist or equivalent role
Expert knowledge of implementing machine learning (especially text mining) techniques
Experience with Python machine learning libraries and a keen interest in staying up to date on the latest trends in data science
Understanding of traditional and emerging database management techniques
Commercial model development experience
Desirable
Experience of working with unstructured text data from web pages or documents and interfacing with different distributed data stores
Exposure to Deep Learning, Network Analysis and Graphical Models

At COUNTRY Financial, we are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst that will lead in the support of data (architecture, governance, flow) for Marketing Automation and other marketing data efforts.Responsibilities:

Drive business decisions by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers.
Collect, aggregate, and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources to drive insights into business performance.
Produce actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems.
Use analytics and metrics to improve processes and provide data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of new business initiatives.
Communicate findings and insight to stakeholders and provide business strategy recommendations for optimizing business performance.
Provide reporting solutions and respond to ad-hoc report requests across multiple business areas.
May participate in the design and development of business intelligence reporting tools.
May provide consultation to users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues.
Performs data collection and data analytics.
Liaison with Enterprise Data Warehouse team.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree and at least 8 years of analytics experience and at least 1 year of lead experience OR at least 10 years of analytics experience and at least 1 year of lead experience.
Experience with digital marketing tools.
Knowledge of CRM systems.

For more details about careers at COUNTRY Financial®, please visit us online at www.countryfinancial.com/careers and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

body:
We're looking for a Machine Learning Researcher for R&D with free-text. Our research is sponsored by the National Science Foundation. MultiModel Research is a startup in Cambridge, Mass. doing R&D on a new way of representing text for machine learning. Applications include medical coding (ICD-10) and outcomes predictions, multi-label classification of documents, predicting customer decisions, and search for similar documents.
Work would be full-time with an equity stake, or part-time. You can work remotely (in the US), but residing in the Massachusetts Five College area (Springfield/Amherst) is a plus. Graduate students are welcome to apply. Python skills required.
Please send questions / resume to Steve Gallant: sgallant@mmres.com.
job_title: Machine Learning with Text (part time OK; remote possible)
location: Boston area, or Springfield-Amherst MA, or remote

body:
About Us: The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research (MJFF) was founded in 2000 with one clear objective: accelerating meaningful therapeutic advances and, ultimately, a cure for Parkinson’s disease (PD). The Foundation applies extraordinary scientific, business and media assets to this singular focus—thus creating a unique and dynamic organization. Since inception, MJFF has quickly grown into the largest global funder of Parkinson’s disease research outside the U. S. federal government, having funded over $500 million in research projects in both academic and industry labs worldwide.
We believe that to find a cure for PD as quickly as possible, our capital needs to push research forward today—we therefore deliberately have no endowment or reserve. We instead start our fundraising from zero each year and seek to deploy funds raised as quickly and wisely as possible. MJFF raises over $60 million annually. Today, the Foundation has approximately 100 full-time employees who are based in New York City.
Job Summary: The CRM & Analytics Officer will be integral in growing analytics at the Foundation. You will be uniquely positioned to align advanced statistics practices with strategic marketing initiatives. By working closely with Analytics team, you will provide data-driven insights to enrich decision making and better understand the intricacies of constituent behavior. You will have the opportunity to partner across the Foundation actively contributing to MJFF’s goals at large. We are actively seeking someone with a strong quantitative background, sharp marketing acumen, and motivationPrimary Duties and Responsibilities: Predictive Analytics- Model constituent behavior using advanced statistics methodologies (e.g., regression, clustering, data mining, NLP, etc)- Mine and wrangle large data sets to capture insightful data trends- Action data analysis by aligning results with actionable, strategic initiativesAd Hoc Analysis- Evaluate the performance of Foundation-wide efforts including: programmatic (research), development (fundraising), and marketing initiatives- Collaborate with marketers to optimize campaign targeting, spend, and segmentation- Work closely within CRM & Analytics team to collect marketing/revenue data per project requirements Reporting- Create and distribute monthly reports analyzing digital marketing and web performance- Build dashboards in MJFF’s BI reporting platform to automate standard reporting needs- Present observations and recommendations to senior management and key stakeholders across the Foundation
Qualifications and Skills: - Undergraduate degree in related field (e.g., marketing, statistics), advanced degrees preferred but not required- 1-2 years of experience in related field (e.g., data science, marketing analytics) with measurable success and achievement- Highly analytical, sharp and innovative thinker- Excellent communication skills, capable of explaining complex analytics to both technical and non-technical audiences- Strong organizational skills, keen multi-tasker able to support analytics across diverse teams - Effective team player with a collaborative approach to problem-solving- Fluent in Excel, SPSS, R; proficiency in other scripting languages a plus (e.g., SQL, Python)- Experience with Salesforce CRM and Adobe Analytics a plus
Physical Requirements: This is an onsite position in our New York City office and is not conducive to telecommuting.
How to ApplyInterested candidates should send resume and thoughtful cover letter to http://www.jsco.re/559f. We ask that you do not contact our staff directly and no phone inquiries please. Applicants who best match the position needs will be contacted. Submissions without cover letters will not be considered.
The Michael J Fox Foundation is an equal opportunity employer.

body:
Create insights for millions of people
Clue is a mobile app (iOS & Android) used by millions of people to track and understand their reproductive health. It’s beautifully designed and not pink. Our users trust us with their most personal data and we honor this trust by providing them with insights about their body and respect for their privacy.
We collaborate with world leading research institutions as we strive to advance the field of reproductive health. Ultimately we want to be able to predict when a user can get pregnant - or not - and provide scientifically sound interpretations of their data. This is where you come in to level up our Data Science team.
Core skills

Extensive work experience with predictive modeling in mobile or web companies
Machine learning: Regression models, bayesian inference and boosting techniques
Statistics: Statistical hypothesis testing, generalized linear models and prediction intervals
Connection to the data science community: You organize meetups, blog about data or know excellent data scientists to exchange ideas with
Statistical software: SciPy, R, Julia or similar
Machine Learning libraries: scikit-learn, Shogun or similar
Solve problems in SQL that don’t need a Big Data approach

Bonus skills

Tools: Spark, Hadoop, Redshift
App tracking: Localytics, MixPanel, Snowplow or Heap
Data Visualization: Tableau or D3
Knowledge of reproductive health
You care about data privacy
Startup experience

Your Talent. Our Vision. At Resolution Health, a proud member of the Anthem, Inc. family of companies that helps individuals gain greater value from their health plans, it's a powerful combination. It's the foundation upon which we're creating greater care for our members, greater value for our customers and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care. This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve.   Advanced Analytics Consultant  Bring your expertise to our innovative culture where you will have the opportunity to make a difference in people's lives, and to take your career further than you can imagine.   Employs advanced analytics to gain critical insights into member behavior drivers and preferences, product/program concepts and value propositions, operational effectiveness and efficiencies, client specific health gaps and needs. Consults business leaders and internal partners to apply the insights to test and drive product innovation and enhancement, to target the right members for the right service, to measure program outcome and demonstrate value, to help win and retain clients, and to support information based strategic decision making. Provides analytical insights to support business solution development based on quality, use, cost and other key drivers
Develops and refines analysis templates for problem diagnosis and opportunities assessment

 Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America's Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2015 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at antheminc.com/careers . EOE. M/F/Disability/Veteran.

body:
Monsanto is a sustainable agriculture company focused on helping farmers around the world to produce more from their farms, both large and small. As the world's population is expected to exceed 9 billion by mid-century, we seek to help feed that growing population sustainably, affordably, and with minimal environmental impact.We are looking for a creative Data Science Team Lead to help us transform unprecedented genomics data into higher yielding crops and pest control solutions. In this role, you will lead a team to multiply the output of hundreds of scientists by developing data visualization and predictive analytics infrastructure and practices, including laboratory process dashboards and prediction systems, web service frameworks, and bioinformatics packages. Wherever possible, you will be encouraged to publish results and contribute code to open source projects.
Role and Responsibilities:

Lead a team of 5 computational biologists to develop analysis, data analysis web applications and web services
Pair with biologists and computational biologists to create novel algorithms and visualizations to solve Monsanto’s data analysis challenges
Drive the development of reusable libraries for genomics and other data analyses for use by your peers on the genomics team and our internal customers
Promote the use of R and/or Python at Monsanto and best coding practices, including version control, documentation, and tests
Connect with the external R and/or Python communities, and foster greater engagement and support by Monsanto of those communities
Promote the practices and value proposition of open sourcing software by Monsanto

Qualifications:

Bachelors Degree
Experience leading data / computational scientists
Strong statistics and/or machine learning skills
Facility with R or Python
Facility with Git or another version control system
Ability to write SQL queries
Experience designing visualizations of complex & high-dimensional data
Demonstrated ability to learn methods and technologies as necessary to meet objectives
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, especially in communicating conclusions from analysis of complex data
A highly collaborative approach, with the drive and ability to actively create new connections across the Monsanto Technology organization

Desired Skills/Experience:

M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative or science discipline
Genomics domain expertise
Experience working with Amazon Web Services
Experience working with noSQLs (e.g. CouchDB, MongoDB, Hadoop).
Experience teaching R or Python
Experience creating web services using R or Python
Scientific programming skills in a high performance language (e.g. C, C++, Java, Scala, Clojure, Go)
Maintainer of at least one open source project, such as an R package (on CRAN, Bioconductor, or Github) or Python library
4+ years of experience using high performance computing environments such as SGE, LSF, or AWS
Familiarity with Tibco’s Spotfire application and/or R’s Shiny package

body:
Our team builds new technologies that protect millions of people from cyber-attacks. We aspire and succeed to reach far beyond today’s security market.
We are seeking a senior user interface engineer to design and build tools that will shape our unique security web product. The successful applicant will have at least five years of working on client-facing products for the web, and be demonstrably adept at taking initiative and working quickly with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment. The position involves taking specifications from design and product teams and contributing to those specifications. The applicant will be expected to have had good exposure to both user design and user experience principles, and be able to work well with these other teams.
The primary responsibility of this position is to implement client-facing products on a website (PC/Mac). To do this they must be highly skilled in implementing CSS across platforms, including features such as transitions. Especially important, are skills and experience in JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks. We currently use React, but experience in angular, ember, backbone or similar would be advantageous. The applicant must be able to structure their code well to be understood and used by others. They also must be able to write performant code and to be able to minimize deliverable errors.
You are driven to push JavaScript and the web browser beyond what others have already done. You will own architectural strategy and develop core front-end components of a fast, scalable, complex web application. You have a reputation for being a skilled programmer and also have a passion for the way the pixels look on the page. You’re an experienced professional of building amazing things that speak for themselves.
As a senior user interface engineer, your experience and thinking will inform how our product grows. You will build client-side applications that perform well and drive our users decision making. You will collaborate with our team to develop new ways to present and interact with our insights. You will design, develop, test, deploy and maintain our user-facing applications. You are passionate about creating extraordinary web experiences by writing beautiful code.
We are walking down a road never traveled — it makes all the difference. We only hire the best. Please inquire.
QUALIFICATIONS

BS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Mastery of JavaScript, CSS and semantic HTML
Expertise with UNIX and JSON
Deep understanding of client-side application performance
An attention to detail and a passion for creating useful things
Capacity to think outside of boxes — even boxes with rounded corners
Experiences with some combination of Node.js, React, d3, Ember, Angular, Python, SVG, and Flux 
Experience with and have strong debugging abilities across all major browsers
Knowledge and experience with backend API's will be considered favorably

Area 1 Security is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

body:
Our team builds advanced technology that protect millions of people from malicious attacks on the World Wide Web. We analyze hundreds of millions of events each day to identify and stop targeted attacks against some of the largest organizations on the planet. We aspire and succeed to reach far beyond today’s security market.
We are seeking both skilled software engineers who enjoy security work and software development experts who specialize in data analysis, visualization and the design and construction of large-scale systems.
We are a team first, and a company second. We are proud of the things we make, and we demand excellence in ourselves and each other. The problems we’re solving are hard; but we’ll only solve them if we greet each other in the morning, laugh together during the day, and say “good night” when we leave the office, so we do.
No text book will prepare you for this job. We only hire the best. That’s probably you. Please inquire.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

BS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience designing and implementing software systems

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

MS or PhD in Computer Science.
4 years of experience designing and implementing software systems in Java, C, C++ and/or Python

body:
Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.
There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialize after work almost every Friday.
B.responsible

Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights. 
Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.
Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.
Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.
Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.

B.skilled

Minimum 3 years of experience in a relevant role
Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.)
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, machine learning and programming. Strong working knowledge of Perl, Python, Hadoop, SQL, R and/or Excel.
Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders

B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.
This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

body:
Paddy Power is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing sports betting companies with millions of customers in Europe and Australia and is listed on the London and Irish stock exchanges with a market capitalisation of over €4bln. Across all industries Paddy Power is one of the most respected businesses and employers in the UK, Ireland and Australia with over 5,000 employees globally.
Today over half of our customers’ sports bets are struck at odds which are calculated with the help of one of our predictive sports models. At the core of Paddy Power’s group strategy is to lead innovation in sports betting product. So it follows, that we believe that our ability to generate innovative predictive sports models is at the core of the Group’s ability to compete and grow.
Director of Sports Modelling
The successful candidate will be responsible for the development and output of the team who create our quantitative predictive sports models.
As such this is a strategic role for the group and is supported by material resources.
The successful candidate will be:A proven thought leader who is both creative and experienced in their approach to delivering and refining predictive stochastic models for dynamic real time environments;A driven and mature leader who will deliver against group strategy through this vital function:

hiring, developing and retaining the class leading modelling team;
assisting senior team members with specific modelling challenges and is instrumental in developing their abilities; and 
working productively with colleagues from technology, risk and trading and analytics
creating clear and efficient ways of working, development environments, data capture tools and continuous improvement programs.

Key Requirements:

A successful track record in leading teams who deliver predictive models of complex dynamic systems;
A minimum of 10 years’ experience in a numerate/quantitative role, at least 3 of which at a senior level;
Prior experience of risk management tools such as ERMA, RAT, GP fieldbook and efficient payment paths are a distinct advantage.
Excellent academic record in a numerical discipline
Fluent English
Available to work in Dublin, Ireland.

body:
Want to work at a place where every day is a Kaggle competition?
As we seek to transform credit markets, using the combination of machine learning technology and vast amounts of data sources, ZestFinance is looking to add to our modeling team as we expand into interesting and revolutionary frontiers in the credit world.
If you're interested in joining the team, please send me your resume:
jbc@zestfinance.com
More about Zest
ZestFinance was founded in 2009 by Douglas Merrill, former CIO of Google, along with a team of data scientists from Google and lending experts from Capital One. Together they set about revolutionizing credit underwriting for underbanked Americans.
As it stands today, good people are being denied credit because old world processes do not take advantage of today’s data rich environment. ZestFinance applies machine learning and large-scale data analysis to evaluate thousands of potential credit variables.
Using this more sophisticated approach, ZestFinance can better assess default risk and the viability of a long-term customer relationship allowing the company to offer loans at a fraction of the rates of its competitors. The company also makes its technology platform available to other organizations, enabling them to use data to make smarter underwriting and business decisions.
Requirements
- Bachelor’s degree in Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related discipline; Advanced degrees preferred- Extensive use of R, Python, or Matlab, and Linux- Understanding of statistical analysis, algorithm development, and advanced machine learning techniques- Commitment to creating reproducible, well-documented code- An independent and self-motivated work ethic- A proven, demonstrable track record of success- Successful participation on Kaggle a plus

body:
Summary of Position:
The Data Scientist will be a key member of the leadership team of 1st Merchant Funding’s online lending division, a rapidly growing line of business at the intersection of finance and technology within 1st Merchant Funding. This thought leader and his/her team will use machine learning and other techniques to design, evangelize, and implement state of the art solutions for never before solved problems. This role will report into the Chairman and CEO including supervised ML by our Director of Credit Risk and team lead engineer. 
The Company is leveraging PowerForce® a proprietary business funding platform, to substantially increase our efficiency and funding levels. We are expanding our footprint including online lending and real-time decisions. We believe we are in a unique position to service our customers by leveraging very large datasets in new ways. We are looking for top data scientists experienced at applying machine learning to mission critical big data tasks. Fully automated lending calls for a machine learning approach because it requires the prediction of human behaviors that are complex and hard to model. This role offers tremendous scope for creativity and real world impact. We have current and future projects in streamlining data analysis, natural language processing, online learning, fraud detection, and more. Machine learning at 1st Merchant Funding is a high priority activity, and theoretical analysis and innovation are also welcome. The Data Scientist will work closely with software engineers to put algorithms into practice.
As a deep domain expert, the Data Scientist and his/her team will partner with technology and business leaders to build new services that surprise and delight our customers.
The key strategic objectives for this role include:

Delivering into production key machine learning innovations in credit decisioning, marketing, and risk management across diverse geographics, products, and customer types.
Setting priorities, mentoring, developing talented staff, and providing key input into work product.
Building products from the ground up.
The role will co-lead the development of product strategy with a special focus on risk.

Skills and Qualifications:
MS in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Data Engineer, or a related quantitative field.
3+ years of relevant experience including:

Hands on experience in predictive modeling and analysis
Strong algorithm development experience
Skills with Java, C++, or other programming language,
Skills with R, MATLAB, Python, Hadoop, Data Mining, Business Analytics, or similar scripting language
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including an ability to effectively collaborate with both the Business and Technical teams. Financial background a plus.

What's in it for you?Full Benefits / Health / Dental / Vision / Competitive Compensation / Paid Time Off
Relocation assistance available.

body:
This is a unique opportunity for a rock star data scientist to be the business leader of our content engagement strategy.
Engaging clients with the right piece of advice is core to our economics, and challenging due to the size and complexity of our proprietary research and the range of issues that we help our clients with. Over the last 6 years, we’ve worked closely with partners to build out proprietary recommendation engines, taking advantage of collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, user clustering, and hybrid-filtering models. These efforts have led to demonstrably higher engagement amongst our user base, and significant business impact. We are now looking to bring this core capability in-house, and looking for an established data scientist leader to spearhead this effort from the business side. Key responsibilities would include taking ownership of all of our client engagement recommendation systems and looking to both improve and supplement our efforts with new systems prioritized by business impact. This will require a highly collaborative approach, working cross-functionally with other business units and senior management. A key part of this role will be to lead the other data scientists on the technical team, providing both thought leadership and quality control.
The product development team is full of ex-scientists and academics from leading institutions that have successfully transitioned to leading roles in industry, and we are personally invested in the professional development of our team. 
• PhD in a quantitative research field (e.g., Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Mathematics, etc.)• 5-10 years post-graduate business experience building out recommendation systems and / or improving search to achieve business objectives in a B2C setting (e.g., e-commerce, retail, travel, etc.)• Practical, intuitive problem solver with a demonstrated ability to translate quantitative analysis into actionable business strategies• Strong expertise in foundational approaches to Informational Retrieval and Recommendation Systems; Deep connections to the recommendations and / or information retrieval academic community; familiarity with the state of the art through conference proceedings and journals• Experience and proficiency with various programming languages (e.g., Java, Python), statistical packages (e.g., R, MatLab, Mathematica), data modeling, databases, and application servers
job_title: Managing VP - Head of Data Science

body:
AppLovin is the fastest growing mobile advertising technology company. We enable brands to acquire and re-engage customers on mobile. Our mobile marketing platform moves beyond targeting and segmenting to use customized ad creative, data and predictive models to deliver dynamic mobile advertising. Our automated media buying technology makes it easy for brands to acquire new customers profitably while also helping them re-engage their pre-existing users and drive higher conversion rates in a measurable way. AppLovin offers dynamic ads to over a billion consumers each month and works with 300+ world-class brands including OpenTable, Hotels.com, eBay, Spotify, GREE, Zynga, and Groupon.
You love reading papers and coding. You are eager to use your coding skills to hack in a Big Data scenario, which means you not only use off-the-shelf tools, but you also implement algorithms from the ground up for performance and scalability. Computer science, statistics, and applied math are the most important components of your skills. You will collaborate with other engineers to work on data pipelining and data preparation for your projects.
You’ll operate on a technology stack including large clusters of Vertica and Spark that deal with hundreds of terabytes of data daily.
What You'll Do
As a data scientist, you will do ground-breaking work in several areas including: Optimization problems, Machine Learning / Prediction, Streaming Data processing / Time Series analysis, Clustering Recommendation SystemsYou will have freedom and responsibility end-to-end from feature selection to designing algorithms and implementing them at scale.Your contributions will have direct impact on revenue and costs of the business.
You:

Love to analyze data, solve problems, develop models and implement solutions
Have strong programming in Java/C or Python and knowledge of SQL
Think probabilistically and solve problems for fun.
Be able to understand an algorithm presented in a paper and implement it.
Know a wide variety of models and algorithms, and understand their strengths and weaknesses
Given a business problem, be able to articulate a strategy to solve it, in your own words.
Know how to wield the right tools to tame data such as R, SQL, Matlab/Octave, Perl, MapReduce and Natural Language processing
Mobile Advertising industry experience is a huge ++ ! 
Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics or Physics is needed.
Prior modeling experience for real world, internet scale problems is preferred.

The Perks:

Free medical, dental, and vision insurance
Daily lunches
Fully stocked kitchen
Pet Friendly office
Free public transit
Free laundry service
Free gym membership
Stock Options & 401k matching
Fun company parties and events
Autonomy to make decisions in a rapidly growing company
Unlimited vacation policy - work hard and take time when you need it

Interested? Send us your resume and let's talk!

“We make magic.” That’s our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. And it permeates everything we do. At Disney, you’ll help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen!
The Revenue Management and Analytics (RM&A) team supports clients across Walt Disney Parks & Resorts including Ticketing, Resorts, Merchandise and Food & Beverage in the core competencies of yield management, revenue planning, forecasting, pricing, promotions and optimization. Candidates should have a natural curiosity to understand the "why" behind business performance, take a proactive role in problem-solving, be results oriented, be able to prioritize and be a team player in a collaborative environment.

This posting is a talent pool for upcoming roles within Revenue Management and Analytics.  We will be interviewing talent from within this pool to fill Analyst and Sr. Analyst level positions. These are the minimum qualifications you need to be considered for these positions:
Minimum one to two years of experience in analytics, strategy development or equivalent roleProficiency in Microsoft Office SuiteDemonstrated strong problem-solving and decision-making skillsExceptional partnering skills and teamwork abilitiesDemonstrated leadership and influencing abilitiesProven ability to complete multiple projects at one time 
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in SAS, SQL or other program languageProficiency of data visualization/business intelligence software such as TableauDemonstrated knowledge of Disney Theme Parks & Resorts operations, business units, and product offeringsProven ability to perform job responsibilities with minimal supervision and attention to detailDemonstrated advanced skill set in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Required Education

body:
The Walt Disney Company is a world-class entertainment and technological leader. Walt’s passion was to continuously envision new ways to move audiences around the world—a passion that remains our touchstone in an enterprise that stretches from theme parks, resorts and a cruise line to sports, news, movies and a variety of other businesses. Uniting each endeavor is a commitment to creating and delivering unforgettable experiences — and we’re constantly looking for new ways to enhance these exciting experiences. Bring your individual talents here and discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you’ve been looking for.                       “It takes people to make the dream a reality.” Walt was on to something when he said that, and it continues to ring true today. No matter the stage in your career, being a part of Walt Disney Parks & Resorts means being a part of a team where you help bring innovation to life through unsurpassed products, services and most importantly remarkable experiences. As a Cast Member you are the steward and connection to our legacy and the backbone of our thriving innovations. Join our team and watch your dreams come true.
The Management Science & Integration team is a dynamic group that belongs to the Revenue Management & Analytics organization.  The team provides analytical consulting support to a number of business units across The Walt Disney Company, including Media Networks, Parks and Resorts, Studio Entertainment, Consumer Products and Interactive Media. This position will be engaged in projects that involve the use of complex models to answer difficult business questions, improve business efficiencies, or guide strategy development. 
Responsibilities
In this specific role you will be part of an integration team that explores the drivers of ABC and ABC Family digital video content consumption and works with the business to build and maintain statistical models in support of Ad Sales and Research.This position will dig into forecasts and historical data to provide business insights and ensure accurate and timely forecast updates of ad inventory.  
Basic Qualifications
Experience with SAS toolset and programmingExperience with data mining and building insights using large data setsExperience translating complex problems and solutions to all levels of an organizationAbility to develop clear and concise thoughts into proposals, recommendations and findingsProficiency acquiring, organizing, cleansing and manipulating large amounts of dataDemonstrated experience performing exploratory and quantitative analysisAbility to adapt to a rapidly changing business environment and manage multiple priorities Preferred Qualifications
Experience with advanced modeling and data mining techniquesFour plus years experience with SAS tools (e.g., Base, Enterprise Guide, Enterprise Miner, etc.)Four plus years experience with SQLPrevious experience working with digital media dataKnowledge of granular digital usage and delivery data (e.g., Omniture, DoubleClick, FreeWheel, etc.)
Required Education
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent Preferred Education
Master's degree in Data Mining, Statistics or a quantitative field or equivalent

The Experience Insights team seeks to tell the story of our Guests’ holistic vacation experiences and pioneer new tactics that enhance Guest vacation experiences through data science, data integration, statistical modeling/analysis, and delivery of innovative services. Through close partnership with other analytical groups throughout Walt Disney World, the Experience Insights team also serves to get our organization to view the Guest experience and our business in exciting new ways.
