This position will be responsible for delivering information to support strategic decisions with data-driven insights on both new and established Guest experience drivers. Responsibilities include: heavy data mining and analytics; strong statistical expertise; integration with key business and technical partners; and visualization of the broader scope.

body:
Biomedical Data ScientistBrown Center for Biomedical Informatics (BCBI)Brown University, Providence, Rhode Island
The Biomedical Data Scientists will support research initiatives within the newly formed Brown Center for Biomedical Informatics (BCBI), a trans-disciplinary group leading initiatives that span the full spectrum of biomedicine and health care. They will join Brown’s Data Science Practice, a central team of data scientists who support a range of data-intensive projects across the University. The Biomedical Data Scientists will primarily support projects at the BCBI, but will have opportunities to explore other biomedical informatics and computational biology projects supported by the Data Science Practice.
The Biomedical Data Scientist’s principal efforts will be focused on the development of programs and web applications for analyzing and visualizing biomedical and health data, which may be defined by work supported by extramural grants and contracts. He or she will serve as the technical liaison for assigned projects with BCBI collaborators across Brown University and its affiliated hospitals, as well as regional/national/international partners. The Biomedical Data Scientist will be an active participant in exploring creative new approaches for leveraging heterogeneous data to support biomedical research, healthcare, and policy initiatives in alignment with the vision for BCBI. Additionally, he or she will assist the BCBI Director and Associate Director with strategic planning for BCBI and work collaboratively with other members of the Center, including additional Data Scientists and trainees.
PLEASE NOTE: This is a three year fixed-term staff position, with the possibility of extension contingent upon available funding.
Qualifications:
Candidates will be hired at the grade commensurate with their professional experience, as noted here below:
For Grade 11E:• Bachelor’s degree preferred and 3 years of related work experience or Advanced degree preferred with 1 – 2 years of related work experience (Advanced degree in Biomedical Informatics, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or with a similar technical and computational emphasis).• A track record of delivering products or services, or conducting and publishing original research.• Working knowledge with most of the following: Linux operating system, programming languages (e.g., Java, Ruby, R, or Julia), database management systems (e.g., MySQL or Oracle), and Web languages and technologies (e.g., Ruby on Rails or D3)• Ability to work both independently and as a team member.• Ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines, and an eagerness to take ownership of challenging and open-ended assignments.• Effective at communicating with audiences whose technical backgrounds vary widely.• Experience with biomedical or health data.• Working knowledge of several of the following areas:• statistics• machine learning• information retrieval• natural language processing• data mining, exploration and visualization• databases and data management• algorithm design and evaluation• software engineering• human-computer interaction• high-performance and distributed computing• privacy and security
For Grade 12E:
• Bachelor’s degree preferred and 5 years of related work experience or Advanced degree preferred with 2 – 3 years of related work experience (Advanced degree in Biomedical Informatics, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or with a similar technical and computational emphasis). A track record of delivering products or services, or conducting and publishing original research.• Working knowledge with most of the following: Linux operating system, programming languages (e.g., Java, Ruby, R, or Julia), database management systems (e.g., MySQL or Oracle), and Web languages and technologies (e.g., Ruby on Rails or D3)• Ability to work both independently and as a team member.• Ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines, and an eagerness to take ownership of challenging and open-ended assignments.• Effective at communicating with audiences whose technical backgrounds vary widely.• Experience with biomedical or health data.• Experience leading and mentoring a technical team.• Expertise in several of the following areas:- Statistics- machine learning- information retrieval- natural language processing- data mining, exploration and visualization- databases and data management- algorithm design and evaluation- software engineering- human-computer interaction- high-performance and distributed computing- privacy and security
All offers of employment are contingent upon a completed criminal background check and education verification that is satisfactory to Brown University.
To View More Details and To Apply, please use the following link to the position on the Brown Career Site: https://brown.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/staff-careers-brown/job/3-Davol-Square/Biomedical-Data-Scientist-2_REQ121386-4 - For full consideration, applicants are asked to submit a cover letter and resume.
Brown University is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive academic global community; as an EEO/AA employer, Brown considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of, gender, race, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

body:
About Us: The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research (MJFF) was founded in 2000 with one clear objective: accelerating meaningful therapeutic advances and, ultimately, a cure for Parkinson’s disease (PD). The Foundation applies extraordinary scientific, business and media assets to this singular focus—thus creating a unique and dynamic organization. Since inception, MJFF has quickly grown into the largest global funder of Parkinson’s disease research outside the U. S. federal government, having funded over $500 million in research projects in both academic and industry labs worldwide.
We believe that to find a cure for PD as quickly as possible, our capital needs to push research forward today—we therefore deliberately have no endowment or reserve. We instead start our fundraising from zero each year and seek to deploy funds raised as quickly and wisely as possible. MJFF raises over $60 million annually. Today, the Foundation has approximately 100 full-time employees who are based in New York City.
Job Summary: The Director, CRM and Analytics plays a key leadership role in enabling the Foundation to meet its strategic goals. You will have an opportunity to use your technical and strategic skills to continuously improve the efficacy of the CRM and its impact on Foundation operations. You will have significant responsibility for all platforms in our data ecosystem, analytical activities, and vendor relationships. We are looking for an individual who excels in several key areas: CRM and marketing technology, business intelligence, management and development of people, budgeting and planning, and internal/external relationship-building. This position reports to the Senior Vice President, Marketing and Digital Strategies. This is an onsite position in our New York City office and is not conducive to telecommuting.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities: Provide strategic and operational guidance on implementation of a large scoped CRM optimization project within a team, across the Foundation, and externally in collaboration with vendors/partners. Manage the delivery and maintenance of the Salesforce CRM, Convio, Adobe Analytics and Exact Target Marketing Cloud solutions, with a focus on continuous improvement Develop and manage the delivery of a single business intelligence reporting platform integrated with other platforms and data sources Display leadership in working with senior management to ensure activities are aligned with overall business and departmental objectives  Develop consistent data guidelines and manage relationships with other Foundation teams to ensure smooth running of the operation and maintenance of CRM ecosystem Proactively manage multiple commercial relationships with key vendors that support the staff members reporting to them or those indirectly impacted by CRM platforms outside of the team Maintain and manage expenses of annual CRM & Analytics budget  Mentor, coach and manage 3 team members
Qualifications and Skills:  Bachelor’s degree, advanced degree preferred 7-10 years of experience with demonstrated success in managing similar teams in a CRM management or development function at a top organization  Experience in building and managing budgets and strategic plans within a large organization The ideal candidate will possess deep, hands-on experience managing CRM and marketing technology, either with a large consumer or non-profit brand or interactive agency with high-volume digital and non-digital campaign requirements Proficient functional expertise in CRM and marketing technology, Campaign management, Predictive analytics, Business intelligence  Understand the end-to-end data management process, including quality assurance and demonstrated proficiency in reading logical and physical data models, understanding database data types, understanding table structures, and building queries. Proficiency in the following technologies: Business intelligence (e.g. Tableau, Domo), Predictive analytics (e.g. SAS), Database platforms (e.g. MS SQL Server), Web analytics (e.g. Adobe Site Catalyst)  Working knowledge of Salesforce and Convio Luminate platforms a plus.
Additionally, the ideal candidate will possess the following personal attributes: Passionate about data and online marketing, with an ability to assess, formulate and deliver data driven marketing solutions Positive can-do attitude, creative, resourceful, entrepreneurial , and solutions oriented Able to multi-task and deliver under tight deadlines Strong, executive-level presentation skills Highly organized and performance driven Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
How to Apply Interested candidates should submit a resume and thoughtful cover letter describing their specific qualifications and interest in the position. Submissions without cover letters will not be considered. Please click on the following link http://www.jsco.re/5mgh . Please, no telephone inquiries and do not contact our staff directly. Only applicants who best match the position needs will be contacted.

alert_message: This job post has expired (either the position was filled or the post is no longer listed). You are viewing an archived version.
body:
About Us: The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research (MJFF) was founded in 2000 with one clear objective: accelerating meaningful therapeutic advances and, ultimately, a cure for Parkinson’s disease (PD). The Foundation applies extraordinary scientific, business and media assets to this singular focus—thus creating a unique and dynamic organization. Since inception, MJFF has quickly grown into the largest global funder of Parkinson’s disease research outside the U. S. federal government, having funded over $500 million in research projects in both academic and industry labs worldwide.
We believe that to find a cure for PD as quickly as possible, our capital needs to push research forward today—we therefore deliberately have no endowment or reserve. We instead start our fundraising from zero each year and seek to deploy funds raised as quickly and wisely as possible. MJFF raises over $60 million annually. Today, the Foundation has approximately 100 full-time employees who are based in New York City.
Position Summary: The Associate Director, CRM (Campaign Operations) plays a key role in enabling the Foundation to meet its marketing goals. You will have an opportunity to use your technical skills to assist the Foundation in scaling its marketing efforts through Salesforce Marketing Cloud. You will have responsibility for designing and deploying multi-channel campaigns, supporting campaign requirements across the Foundation and reporting on and optimizing the results of campaigns. We are looking for an individual who excels in marketing technology, campaign management and digital marketing. This is an onsite position in our New York City office and is not conducive to telecommuting.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:  Build and deploy multi-channel campaign communications to a number of Foundation constituents leveraging the Salesforce Marketing Cloud solution (Exact Target). Provide input into the development of contact plans/journeys by segment to improve operational and marketing effectiveness, as well as annual and quarterly campaign plans Design and deploy a quality assurance and authorization process for automated campaigns  Liaise with external vendors to secure any required supporting services (e.g. Salesforce for email, direct mail print house) Liaise with colleagues responsible for data integration to ensure that required data is loaded into the Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Salesforce CRM Configure, maintain and distribute standard campaign management reports in the Salesforce Marketing Cloud Review results of campaigns and predictive models with the relevant teams and refine campaign requirements and plans Support Salesforce CRM data uploads as needed
Qualifications and Skills:  Bachelor’s Degree in digital marketing or similar area- advanced degree preferred 5-7 years’ experience in building and deploying multi-channel campaigns using an industry standard campaign management application, e.g. Salesforce Marketing Cloud (Exact Target), IBM Campaign management (Unica), SAS Campaign management (SAS CI), Adobe Campaign management (Neolane) Strong working knowledge with the business application of the following technologies: Business intelligence e.g. Tableau, Domo, etc., Predictive analytics e.g. SAS, Database platforms e.g. MS SQL Server, Web analytics e.g. Adobe Site Catalyst, CRM platforms e.g. Salesforce Understanding of the end-to-end data management process including quality assurance, as well as the end-to-end marketing process and the role of campaign management across an organization  Proficiency in reading logical and physical data models, understanding database data types, table structures and the role of keys in the building of queries Although not essential, the ability to write SQL against medium to complex data structures would be desirable
Additionally, the ideal candidate will possess the following personal attributes: Positive can-do attitude, creative, resourceful, entrepreneurial , and solutions oriented Able to multi-task and deliver under tight deadlines Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills Highly organized and performance driven
How to Apply Interested candidates should submit a resume and thoughtful cover letter describing their specific qualifications and interest in the position. Submissions without cover letters will not be considered. Please click on the following link http://www.jsco.re/5mf8 .Please, no telephone inquiries and do not contact our staff directly. Only applicants who best match the position needs will be contacted.
The Michael J. Fox Foundation is an equal opportunity employer.
company: The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research

body:
The Assistant Director leads the Advanced Analytics and Innovation team within Astellas. The Assistant Director will be responsible for leading the following areas: 1) Managing overall commercial analytics environment, 2) Leading digital strategy and analytics, 3) Building and maintaining core internal reporting tools, 4) Improving commercial decision-making through advanced analytical tools and methods. The Assistant Director will partner closely with other members of the commercial analytics organization as well as with brand and new product marketing teams.  
Essential Job Responsibilities
Managing overall commercial analytics environment:

Builds and refines big data analytics environment
Increases efficiency of analytics through development of core subject areas and analytics tables
Promotes increasing adoption and usage within the commercial analytics team
Identifies and incorporates innovative data sources

Leading digital strategy and analytics:

Defines the roadmap in enabling world class digital analytics capabilities
Working in close collaboration with therapeutically aligned analytics teams, supports execution of a measurement and analytics plan to support brand’s digital campaign objectives
Identifying and prioritizing digital innovation pilots and analytics

Building and maintaining core internal reporting tools:

Builds and maintains core brand performance reporting platform
Builds and maintains internal knowledge management tool
Identifies additional infrastructure needs to improve analytics efficiency and effectiveness

Improving commercial decision-making through advanced analytical tools and methods:

Develops patient flow models and segmentation to support business development and pipeline assessments
Partner with other commercial teams to provide analytic capabilities as necessary

Leadership responsibilities

Leading the Advanced Analytics and Innovation team to deliver world class analytics excellence
Proactively identifying and addressing opportunities to develop technical skill and leadership capabilities to enable long term commercial analytics vision
Developing talent through coaching, rewards and recognition, and providing experienced based developmental opportunities

Quantitative Dimensions

Over the course of the year, the Assistant Director oversees analytics projects of up to $1.5 million dollars in value. 

Organizational Context

Assistant Director manages 2-3 direct reports (managers and senior managers)
The position requires extensive collaboration and partnering with internal customers and stakeholders

Required Qualifications  Experience/ Education

Minimum of 10 years statistical analysis and research design experience, preferably in the healthcare/ pharmaceutical industry and 3 years statistical modeling experience
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools such as SAS, R, Qlik, Tableau
Proficient in big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Hive, Hue)
Deep understanding of the data sources commonly used in the healthcare/ pharmaceutical industry (i.e. script data, patient longitudinal, promotional, chart audits, etc.)
Working knowledge of various statistical modeling techniques and their application within complex analytical projects, e.g., regression modeling, promotion response modeling, ROI, marketing mix and correlation coefficient.
Bachelors degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics; advanced degree (MS/PhD) preferred

Leadership ability

Demonstrated strong and successful strategic and operational leadership experience
Strong interpersonal, collaboration and partnering skills with demonstrated ability to lead and work in a team based environment
Excellent at stakeholder management and is able to drive groups, including senior level groups, to conclusions
Ability to influence decision-making and gain the respect, collaboration and support of stakeholders without line-authority
Communicates complex messages effectively and persuasively in writing and speech with a broad range of stakeholders, including senior executives

Analytical ability

Strong analytical, problem-solving and quantitative skills
Demonstrated proficiency in managing complex analytical projects and leading cross-functional teams
Can effectively define/scope projects and propose a structured and practical approach to solving complex and ill-defined problems
High level of intellectual curiosity, self-motivated to solve difficult issues, continually seeking ways to improve

body:
1.1 DescriptionAt Barclays, our goals revolve around helping people achieve their ambitions in the right way – and that’s what makes this such a great place to work. Here, you’ll be part of an international organisation with a clear vision and strong shared values, where you’ll always be recognised and rewarded for your contributions.Working within Data Science at Barclays, you’ll join a dynamic team that understands the artistry behind the science of data. We’ll rely on you to look beyond the ones and zeroes to find meaningful, human insights into our products, services and processes. Engaging with customers, you’ll think creatively to solve business problems and implement your innovative vision to improve our customers’ experience. Put simply, it’s all about making sure people are always at the heart of our data strategy.To make that happen, you’ll be surrounded by some of the most enthusiastic and knowledgeable colleagues in the business, as well as all the tools, training and opportunities you need to take your career even further – in a way that’s right for you.A range of diverse and exciting data science roles are currently available, based in the financial capital Johannesburg, all offering a competitive salary and excellent benefits. 
1.2 Key responsibilities:- Building relationships with people across the business to provide authoritative technical advice, acting as a trusted expert in your area- Analysing complex data to assess our business challenges, identify their root causes and design effective solutions- Designing and implementing innovative ways to identify and connect with our customers’ unique needs and ambitions- Converting data into meaningful, customer driven insights and presenting to audiences with limited technical expertise- Actively collaborating on projects that will improve the accuracy and availability of our data
1.3 Experience required: - Experience in a technical or analytics role, preferably developed within a digital, telco, finance or customer-focussed industry- A proven record of creating customer segmentation and behavioural models, developing and delivering useful data through campaign management tools 
1.4 Skills and Qualifications:A range of roles are available within the Barclays Data Science team with varying technical and strategic specialisms. Skills and qualifications required vary depending on the role but may include: - A technical degree in a relevant discipline (Statistics, Computer Science, Maths, Physics, Engineering)- Programming expertise across multiple platforms, including SQL, HTML, Python, R, CSS, Hive, Pig and JavaScript.- An excellent understanding of data mapping/modelling- A practical knowledge of data warehouse and management information practices and principles- Strong commercial skills, and the ability and confidence to drive value by transforming data into creating compelling, customer-driven stories- A passion for data outside of work, with a drive to explore new technology - A team player with ability to self motivate - Some SAS knowledge could be beneficial
Apply Online Here (first, solve a small fun quiz, to show you are qualified)

body:
The IBM Data Science Studios in London and Ohio’s missions are to design, build & help implement differentiated, advanced analytics solutions for IBM clients in a wide variety of industries. The Data Science Studios are a client collaboration hub to apply IBM advanced analytics solutions, and rapidly demonstrate value to our clients. The studios also serve as an intellectual hub for data science solutions – uniting clients, analytics Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), researchers, academics from the area and analytics experts from industry.
We are looking for experts/Senior Data Scientists to join our team. These Senior Data Scientists will be focusing on specific advanced analytics solutions, including Predictive Customer Intelligence, Supply Chain (including Demand Forecasting, Inventory Optimisation, and Network Optimisation), Fraud, and Predictive Asset Optimisation. You will already be working in an analytical role (e.g. in an external/internal consulting, technical sales, Strategy, Finance, Supply Chain, Operations, Sales, Marketing or Operational Research Department), and we are particularly interested if you have proven experience of delivering high-quality customer analytics, working for a marketing, product, analytics or strategy group – gained within a commercial environment such as in Financial Services, Energy & Utilities, Retail, Telco etc.
Typical responsibilities include converting business problems into analytical solutions in collaboration with the client’s team, and IBM Business & Analytics experts. You will also be working with experts in a business area to understand underlying business process, strategy and execution, and identifying approaches to improve the accuracy and effectiveness of analytics models.
To best carry out this role, you will have experience of manipulating large volumes of data and be familiar with key internal and external data sources and how they are gathered and retrieved. This will be matched with experience of languages and tools (data, analytics and big data), along with the ability to select a suitable tool to work with data to achieve the analytics solution. On top of this, you will create visual presentations of analytics results and translate quantitative insights for a non-technical audience, whilst displaying a proven ability to deploy analytics into the business to create value.
In addition to broad and deep data and analytics skills, you will have a strong business acumen, coupled with the ability to communicate findings to both business and IT leaders in a way that can influence how organisations approach business challenges. Typically you will not be tied to a particular functional area or individual project, but rather perform as an expert who is able to address problems across the organisation, identifying the business problems that have the most value for the organisation.
It is preferred that you will have:

A Master's Degree in Mathematics or Statistics
Experience in analytic skills, yet be a strategic thinker who seed the 'big picture' while managing the details
Experience in hands-on use of statistical packages (i.e. SPSS, SAS, R)
Experience in identifying and defining requirements and turning functional requirements into a predictive or prescriptive analytics solution that address difficult business solutions
Experience in optimising software packages (i.e. CPLEX)
Experience in solving clients' analytics problems and effectively communicating results and methodologies
Experience in leading teams
Fluent English language skills

This is your chance to work with other highly qualified Data Science experts, solving a variety of client business problems across industries with advanced analytics in an evolving Agile-based environment. So, if you are deeply engaged in Data Science, and looking to be part of an exciting new growth area, then please apply.
To apply, visit the URL for the appropriate location below:

body:
Are you interested in how non-traditional data sources can be applied to algorithmic trading? Do you want to work in a rapid product development, start-up environment backed by one of Europe's most successful investment management businesses?We are hiring for a data scientist to lead a small data engineering group at our office in San Francisco. This is a key hire in the development of our US business. You will be the business lead for our data vendor relationships on the west coast and work closely with senior data and research executives in our NY and European research centres.  You will report regularly to the management teams across the company.
Responsibilities:
- Lead a small (but growing!) team of Data Engineers to architect processes to deliver a wide range of data sets into Winton’s data pipeline
- Build systems to acquire, process, integrate and analyse data at large scale (see technology list below)
- Search and appraise new data sources; negotiate and structure deals; manage business relationships with vendors
- Develop new analytics frameworks for a variety of data sources
- Turn analytics insights into actionable recommendations for Winton’s research programme
- Technologies used include: Python, MongoDB, SQL Server, Matlab, R.
Requirements:
- A substantial track record in delivering data pipelines and actionable analytics insights against business requirements
- Knowledge of the data product landscape in the SF/SV area
- Previous leadership experience with team/performance management and recruitment skills
- Strong communication skills
- A willingness to learn new technologies
- A strong research background with at least an MS/PhD in statistics, econometrics, physics, computer science or other technical field
- Experience with data pipeline technologies

body:
Primary Purpose
GuideStar is the world’s leading source of information about nonprofits. The Director of Data Science will serve as the principle person on staff conducting quantitative analysis on GuideStar’s extensive data and information. This position is central to providing innovative, high-quality data analysis to the nonprofit sector.
Key Responsibilities
• Drive Research on Nonprofits and Philanthropy: Develop and execute a research agenda to help reveal the dynamics of the nonprofit sector. You’ll have GuideStar’s 2.5 billion pieces of data on over 2.4 million organizations at your fingertips—and will be encouraged to supplement our data with external sources.• Develop Insights to Drive Feature Product Development: Use our data to help us build decision-making tools to serve our 7 million users—and the entire nonprofit sector—better. Work with our developers to prototype and build new features for use by thousands of nonprofits, donors, funders, journalists, policymakers, and others. • Serve as a Thought Leader: Your research will identify what factors drive nonprofit effectiveness, and we want you to share these insights with the sector. Write blog posts, white papers, and other content pieces showing important context, trends, relationships, or other findings from data exploration.• Help Strengthen GuideStar’s Data Architecture: Help us determine the best decisions to make around data acquisition, digitization, and which systems to adopt for powerful analysis. We’ll rely on your expertise to make our strategic data decisions.
Qualifications

Dedication to positive social change required; prior nonprofit sector experience highly preferred.
Required analytical experience and skills: 

Statistical analysis using R and/or related tools 
Basic HTML, CSS, and Python skills for prototyping; 

Larger-scale web-based development experience preferred 

Experience writing complex SQL queries, managing relational databases, and No SQL environments
Familiarity with social science research methods 

Preferred analytical experience and skills: 

Experience with machine learning approaches
Experience using “Big Data” technologies (e.g. Elasticsearch, Hadoop, Hive, Spark)
Experience using data visualization technologies (e.g. D3, Tableau, Splunk)
Experience with geospatial analysis (i.e. GIS) 

Comfort operating in a complex, dynamic, geographically dispersed, partnership-oriented organization. 
Commitment to GuideStar’s organizational values: courage, compassion, clarity, and collaboration.
Master’s degree with coursework in quantitative research methods required (e.g. MS, MBA, MPP, MPA), PhD preferred.

Reporting Structure
The Director of Data Science reports to the Vice President of Products and works closely with staff across the organization.
How to Apply: 
Please send a one-page resume and cover letter to Anisha Singh White at guidestarjobs@guidestar.org.

body:
We are seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our super talented Research and Development (R&D) Team!
This individual will be responsible for analyzing physical sensor and image data, coupled with market data (prices, volumes traded) extract signals of interest, build models to transform signals into market relevant information on transitions, patterns, seasonal and other phased behavior. The individual will work closely with other R&D team members, product owners and operational data teams to expand the collection of unique signals and deliver unique information to global commodities and energy markets (Oil, Refined Products, Petrochemical, Electric Power and Natural Gas). The candidate should have broad experience in signal processing, and extraction, data manipulation, and model development. Solid experience in producing results from data mining and measurement.
Want to know more about our R/D Team?! Get a sneak peek into the "Day in the Life" via our Genscape Culture Blog! http://www.genscape.com/blog/day-life-genscaper-rd-spotlight
A typical day in the life of Data Scientist / Physics will include the following:


Relentless focus on developing novel approaches for signal\ discovery and collection
Develop tools and processes to extract signals for data model development and testing
Helping design, develop and deliver information based on data models to market participants
Interact with clients to gain an understanding of both the trading marketplace as well as the desired signals that are missing
Identify and pursue performance, reliability, reproducibility and process improvements
Collaborate with a global team of developers operating with an agile methodology to implement development goals.


This job might be for you if:


You have a Ph.D. in Physics, Data Science or a related field with a strong experimental data component. You are experienced working with physical sensor data that may have a low signal-to-noise ratio, interference, missing or incomplete data, resolution limitations, and any of the other factors inherent to real-world physical measurement data collection. You thrive as a signals hunter!
You have a strong understanding of at least one of the following; fluid dynamics, flow engineering (e.g. petroleum or chemical industry), electromagnetic fields, algorithmic pattern recognition, analog and/or digital signal processing.
You have experience programming automated routines for data manipulation, sorting, transforming, and filtering to produce reproducible, scalable and high integrity datasets from sensor networks.
You may have worked in areas such as high energy physics, astrophysics, semiconductor physics, materials characterization and testing, combinatorial chemistry, wavelet analysis, statistical classification, genomic sequencing.
You are comfortable with statistical data analysis
You are very enthusiastic about discovering of new signals
You are obsessed with detail, data quality and critical thinking
You enjoy working on a team or independently


To land this position:


You need to have a Ph.D. degree in Physics or related hard science field.
You must have familiarity with one or more of the following C#, R, SQL, Matlab, LabView, Python, OpenCV, Machine Learning, multiphysics simulation
Some cloud-based software architecture experience would be of interest
Communication to technical and non-technical audiences is key in this position
It is a bonus if you have working knowledge of the petroleum, energy, mining, or large-scale agriculture industries and/or time series commodity market data


Over your first few months in this position, you will know you’re successful if:


You demonstrate a strong initiative and enthusiasm to provide value in a highly collaborative, fast paced team environment.
You demonstrate self-awareness and personal time management and are able to deliver results quickly
You present novel analysis solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences and seek immediate and ongoing feedback on your approach to the puzzles you are assigned
In your first 60 Days you begin to prototype and present models
In your first 90 Days you have delivered a prototype model utilizing newly discovered data signals


Once you land this position, you’ll get to enjoy:


A fun, fast paced, entrepreneurial environment
Being part of a team of scientists, technologists and engineers
A company that offers a strong focus on work life balance
Plenty of paid time off
Excellent benefits and perks!

body:
Director of Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Products
 Inspirus LLC
Our mission?  To bring joy to work, one experience at a time.
How do we do it?  Recognize. Engage. Inspire.
Inspirus is a leading HR technology company located in Fort Worth, Texas. Since 1997, we have helped more than 500 companies make recognition meaningful for their employees via our amazing technologies. Our global engagement platform continues decades of experience helping market-leading companies inspire their employees and bring joy to work for everyone.
When was the last time you had truly meaningful recognition for a “job well done” from your manager?  And we don’t mean, a “pat” on the back.
At Inspirus, using our own technologies, we recognize your accomplishments daily.  It’s in our DNA.  We have built a team of the best and brightest in the industry. We move quickly and collaborate constantly to accomplish goals others would think to be unattainable. We live for challenges.  We hunt for solutions.  That’s why our clients love us. 
We're looking for driven, innovative people who embrace our core values.  
If you have what it takes, these are just a few of the perks you can expect:

Great company culture, Great Place to Work in Texas (7 years running) & Fortune Great Rated
Growing, profitable, privately held, & fast tracking technology company
Flexible summer hours with shorts & flip flops as the norm
Frequent celebrations for hitting goals
Opportunities to use water balloons
Location, location - an upscale Fort Worth office minutes from biking trails
A fast paced, fun environment where we will celebrate & reward your success.

Who are we hiring?
Inspirus LLC is seeking a new Director of Data Analytics & Business Intelligence Products. This Product Owner position for Analytics & Data Management will lead the strategy, requirements gathering and implementation of all technology required to support the data management, analytics and reporting functions of a global employee engagement technology platform.
The Director of Data Analytics & Business Intelligence Products will work with business stakeholders, clients, and external technology partners to drive collaborative business solutions using data reporting, visualization, and analytics methodologies. They are responsible for working with internal and external technical resources to ensure the solution is effectively implemented and meets the business objectives.
The Product Owner is responsible for understanding the needs of key stakeholders such to ensure our solution meets the analytics and reporting requirements of the enterprise level engagement platform today- and in the future. This role will be focused on delivering an integrated reporting & analytics solution. The Product Owner must be skilled at collaborating internally with other technology product owners, client success solutions, plus marketing and business development teams to leverage existing product assets and knowledge.
This role will work closely with the organization’s top leadership.  This position reports to the Senior Vice President of Technology Solutions and will provide vision and leadership for all data science, visualizations, models, reporting and analytics for the global employee engagement platform.
Who is a good fit?
The right candidate is an experienced product owner who has a passion for utilizing data to facilitate strategic decision making. The right candidate understands the importance of data visualizations to simplify complex data sets to enlighten business leaders. They should be just as comfortable when presenting these solutions to a client or other key stakeholder.
What qualifications do you need for this position?

 7 plus years of extensive enterprise experience, including implementation experience with one of more BI solutions
A broad, enterprise-wide view of the business and an appreciation for strategy, enabling technologies, and organizational structure
Experience in analyzing data, identifying trends, and building visualizations using data visualization technologies (e.g. Tableau, Domo, Pentaho, Splunk, etc)
Proven experience designing and driving data & analytic solutionsExperience with data modeling, logical schema design and data warehouse concepts including techniques for handling structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data
Experience with Agile implementation methodologies
Experience implementing relational data models & predictive analytics
Demonstrated success building, defining and launching products
Effective leadership skills and the ability to establish effective working relationships; able to build collaborative partnerships with team and cross-functional business partners.
Understanding & use of traditional ETL tools & RDBMS
Strong knowledge of data and database management systems, with good SQL language skills
Ability to positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of the organization
Strong aptitude toward communicating complex business and technical concepts using visualization and modeling aids
Experience conceptualizing and designing sophisticated wireframes, workflows, and diagrams
Strong interpersonal and oral and written communication skills
Detail-oriented with strong planning and organizational skills
Effective problem identification and resolution skills
Skills to systematically analyze situations and issues, identify options, draw logical conclusions and sound inferences, determine and recommend practical courses of action using innovation, creativity, good judgment and strategic thinking
Effective project management and time management skills 

What are we looking for you to do?
This job is responsible for the Reporting & Analytics product ownership within the Inspirus Engagement Platform.  This Product Owner is responsible for developing and delivering market leading third party data analytic solutions, implementing data-driven solutions to key stakeholders, and developing best practices that support our client’s need for relevant, intuitive, & actionable data.

You will develop and manage processes that enable integration of advanced reporting and analytics capabilities into the Inspirus Engagement Platform.  You will focus on developing data visualization strategies, metrics, and solutions to drive better decisions.
You will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to identify and understand the reporting requirements from a functional perspective, using Agile and collaborative techniques for requirements gathering and exploration of best practices to deliver relevant, timely and insightful information to users of our enterprise applications.
You will translate the requirements into User Stories, according to the Scrum methodology, so experience in an agile environment with the SDLC is preferred.
You should be able to discuss with the development teams the requirements from both the functional and technical point of view, in order to ensure the teams’ understanding of the users’ needs and to get an effort estimation.
You should have experience in defining the Product Vision and the Product Roadmap, to drive the product’s evolution from a strategic point of view.
Be able to prioritize the work and ensure that the teams have a clearly defined backlog that supports the business priorities & prepare the release plans of product features.
You will verify the fulfilment of requirements having acceptance test sessions with the development teams &communicate continuously with stakeholders, providing updates on projects’ progress, risks and releases.
You will be leading a team of resources to deliver the data analytics solution on time, on spec and within budget while providing leadership and direction to direct reports.
As a hands-on leader, you will be assessing team structure and competencies to ensure fit for future state & adjust accordingly.
You will be focused on maintaining end-to-end accountability for customer satisfaction and overall delivery excellence, as well as adherence to business vision.
You will be asked to stay abreast of market technology developments and serve as an advisor for potential technology improvements for the Inspirus Engagement platform and suite of analytic tools.
Previous experience working in a SaaS environment is a plus.

What is the ideal candidate profile?
Education:
A degree in Computer Science and or a business related degree (equivalent knowledge gained through formal education, specialized training, or additional job experience)
Experience:

body:
Established in 1997, FOREX CLUB is the brand name for a group of companies that provides clients from over 120 countries with platforms and services for trading forex, CFDs and other online trading and educational products. We offer every client effective tools in training, analytics and education, as well as personal support where they want it. FOREX CLUB has over 650 employees worldwide.
At present the Company is on the stage of transformation – on the one hand, we have gained a great experience on the financial markets, but on the other, - we do need to change together with the world around us.
New data driven methods replace traditional ways of doing business. Our main priority is providing to the clients highly-automated, advantageous, personalized services based on machine learning and big data technologies as well as the keen insight of the client’s behavior and needs. The services which predict the client’s actions and enable the Company to offer him the products which he may need tomorrow, in advance – can be a good example of this priority. Another example of such services is the systems which control the risks of fraudulent operations online.
You, as part of the Data science team, are going to participate in development and implementation of such systems, to study the clients’ behavior and needs and support business with clear insights. But the most important thing is the opportunity to do independent researches, to find areas for improvement and implement your own models.
Our team is international and young, with flat hierarchy (the CEO is directly involved in setting and monitoring of the key-objectives of the team) which implies fast development and great opportunities.
We are located in Montenegro – a South European country on the Adriatic coast. It offers the best ecology in Europe, the warm sea, activities like kitesurfing and mountain hiking in summer and mountain skiing and snowboarding in winter. Stunning nature, no traffic jams and nice food!
To summarize: a good quality of living.
Play. Learn. Trade.
Main responsibilities:

Development and implementation of cloud based machine learning systems (real time)
Dealing and Risk Analytics – deep analysis and predicting of trading behavior. Development of risk and fraud predicting and management systems
Develop insights into client trading behavior and motivation Conduct analysis to provide clear understanding and insights to complex business cases (e.g. products profitability and positioning)
Reporting and analysis of current profitability, trading aspects, general market situation Insights lookup and ad-hoc reports and investigations

Requirements:

Good knowledge of statistical, mathematical and machine learning approaches 
At least Bachelor’s degree in Math, Computer Science, Statistics
Proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel
Extensive use of Python, R
Experience in mapReduce, Spark is a plus
Experience in practical data mining and working with big volumes of data
Successful participation in Kaggle competitions is a plus

Resume you can send by e-mail to: ivanova-ga@fxclub.org

body:
Gild is looking for a Data Scientist that is ready to have a huge impact on the design and development of new features for the Gild Platform as well as the enhancement of existing features and applications. Gild is building an intelligent and collaborative end-to-end hiring platform that will change the way people are hired forever.
Note: For this role you must already be legally authorized to work in the United States.
What's in it for you?

Work on a small data science team in charge of data mining, predictive modeling and analytics design
Work closely with a product engineering team to propose, validate and iteratively build data-driven product features
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
Take ownership of individual projects with defined deliverables and regularly communicate progress to the lead Data Scientist and product team
Collaborate with non-technical teams to build Gild’s brand and marketing position through data driven insight of the hiring and recruitment landscape
Play an integral role in synthesizing customer feedback and prioritizing product development

Should you join, you'll get to work on...

Model data in NoSQL datastores and our professional expertise graph
Use NLP and machine learning to power an intelligent hiring team workflow
Use ElasticSearch, Redis and a micro-services architecture to deliver real-time data driven feedback to users
Build predictive models to help our customers maximize their hiring ROI

To be successful in this role, you most likely have...

BS or MS in a relevant technical field and a few years experience in a relevant role
Experience with many of the components of our stack or related technologies: Python, Scala, Cassandra, MongoDB, ElasticSearch
Demonstrated experience (e.g. GitHub, Kaggle, public projects) using machine learning or quantitative analysis to derive insight from complex data from varying sources
A passion to drive product development by understanding market opportunities and customer needs
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

About Gild
Gild is transforming the talent acquisition industry and fundamentally changing how the world hires. Fueled by data science, consumer-friendly technology, and predictive analytics, Gild’s smart hiring platform powers the way companies find, nurture, and hire talent across all industries and functions. Gild is used by growing companies to hire the talent they need to innovate and succeed – smarter and faster. Founded in 2011, Gild is headquartered in San Francisco, CA with offices in Salt Lake City, UT and Milan, Italy.
Benefits

Competitive salary + equity package
Comprehensive benefit plans, including health, dental, vision, and fully-reimbursed public transit! 
"Take as you need" vacation policy
Flexible schedules 
Mac equipment + whatever else you need to be successful!
Weekly catered team meal
Fully stocked fridge/pantry!

body:
AssetMetrix, founded in 2013 in Munich, Germany, provides a completely new service concept for fund managers, institutional investors, family offices and financial service providers in the alternative assets segment. We focus on offering our clients a complete outsourcing of their selection, evaluation and supervision of alternative asset portfolios. This includes market coverage, state-of-the-art systems and methods of analysis, individualized reporting as well as the administration of alternative assets. Our AssetMetrix team has more than 20 years of institutional investment experience. AssetMetrix provides its clients with a modern infrastructure, proprietary technology and a broad and well-established business network. Our business model allows for considerable cost reduction and the needed transparency in the alternative assets segment to make portfolios "more investable". AssetMetrix is revolutionizing the in-house structures, thus expanding the potential of the promising segment of alternative assets.We are currently looking for a Quantitative or Scientific Developer to support our Munich team. Are you a creative mind motivated to make a decisive impact on the technological and quantitative analytics capabilities of AssetMetrix? Do you want to join a dynamic team, and, within a flat hierarchy, contribute to the growth of a company that is aiming to become the pioneer for the next natural stage of development of internal structures of fund managers, institutional investors, family offices and financial service providers?
Your Responsibilities:

In a small but strongly innovation-oriented IT team you will be the leading expert for transforming advanced analytical tools from Excel prototypes to fully integrated software modules. Existing tools include but are not limited to performance forecasting, risk optimizing and benchmarking algorithms for alternative-asset portfolios, supplemented by an ambitious release roadmap of quantitative modules to come.
You will additionally be responsible for database design and development and for building customized data access queries to both fulfill ad hoc business requests and to advance the AssetMetrix data analysis and reporting automation to the next level.
You will be able to influence the technologies employed to implement the analytics modules, with Python and Julia being natural candidates, while at the same time you will need to understand, transform or maintain existing logic in SQL, VBA and Microsoft Access. 
You will collaborate with data visualization experts, UI developers and system integrators to provide a unique, high-quality, high-value-added user experience to our customers.
You will furthermore be involved in the on-boarding of new customers onto our systems, in the development of prototypes and in the experimentation, from a technological point of view, with innovative data-processing and visualization concepts.

Skills and Requirements:

You hold a master's degree in computer science, (applied) mathematics, theoretical physics or in any other field with a strong focus on quantitative or scientific software development.
You have a strong track record in quantitative software development, preferably in the Python data science stack (e.g. SciPy, NumPy, pandas etc.) or in Julia.
You have a strong track record in SQL and a good working knowledge of Microsoft Access and Excel scripting capabilities, in particular of VBA.
You are ideally familiar with R or SAS.
You have ideally good command of a .NET programming language.
You are optionally skilled in data visualization with d3 and in web-service technologies.
You have a strong focus on quality in all aspects of software development, enjoy solving challenging problems and are able to deal with complexity in pragmatic, intelligent ways.
You perceive software development as a team effort but can nevertheless pursue your objectives pro-actively and independently, if required.
You have experience in agile development practices.
You are fluent in German or English.

Our Offering:

We offer competitive remuneration.
We offer the opportunity to influence all technological aspects of a rapidly evolving IT environment and grow with your responsibility. 
We offer the opportunity to be part of a culturally diverse, motivated and highly skilled team at an early stage of business development.
We offer a working place in the center of Munich.

Are you the right candidate for us? Then we look forward to receiving your application which you please send electronically to Ms. Silke Gebhard at the following email address: recruiting@asset-metrix.com

At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you’ll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. body:
Applied Research in Acoustics (ARiA) applies broad interdisciplinary expertise in acoustics, modeling & simulation, signal processing, and cognitive science toward innovative science and engineering research and development for a diverse set of government and corporate clients that focuses on modeling & simulation for training and model-based signal-processing and artificial intelligence for detection and classification. Partnering with government, industry, and academia, ARiA solves critical challenges.
To enable effective and efficient transition of applied research to advanced development of products and systems, ARiA is structured to bring together top-quality research scientists with development and software engineers in an environment in which research and development mutually benefit from joint leveraging of in-house expertise.
ARiA is a small business where you can make a big difference. Our employees, including those at entry-level, are working together with the CIO of the Air Force to use cognitive computing to change the way the government acquires technology and working with top Navy leaders to use video games and simulation to change the way sailors are trained to use sonar.
ARiA: Real Research. Real World.TM
For more information, visit www.ariacoustics.com.
ARiA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Position Description:
Software engineer with expertise in machine learning / data science to perform a variety of tasks including development and implementation of machine-learning algorithms and software, and design, development, and testing of machine-classification and cognitive systems, working in close coordination with ARiA scientists and engineers
Responsible for:
Algorithm and software design, development, research, and testing to support prototypes and products
Supporting the transition of research algorithms to fielded prototypes
Preparing documentation to summarize design and status of prototypes and products
Assisting with in-field integration, testing, and support, with some local travel required
Sample tasks:
Using deep learning to understand the relevant physical features in acoustic scattering data for use in a project on remediating underwater sites contaminated by unexploded ordnance
Developing a cognitive tool that allows natural-language query of legal documents to answer user questions about government regulations
Developing an ontology-based expert system to suggest scenario designs for training and performing knowledge engineering to encode representations/models
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or equivalent
Knowledge of and experience with developing machine-learning applications/software (supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, kernel machines, latent semantic analysis, etc.)
Facility designing and developing code in standard languages (e.g., C, C++, Java, and Python)
Completion of at least one sizable software or systems engineering project, such as creating a machine-learning application or contributing to an open-source project
Exceptional ability and desire to acquire new knowledge and skills to solve challenges
Ability to work independently but collaboratively
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced professional office environment
Ability to communicate technical solutions to project management and the development team
Good oral and written communications skills
Applicants selected for employment will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements, including U.S. citizenship, for access to sensitive information.
Desirable Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:
Experience with natural-language processing
Experience with GPGPU programing (CUDA, OpenGL)
Knowledge of and experience developing knowledge-engineering or semantic-web applications
Experience with scientific computing (numerical integration, special functions)
Knowledge of and prior practical work in signal processing (linear-system theory, digital signal processing)
Exposure to signal processing applications in radar or sonar such as: beamforming, matched filtering, and spectral estimation
Knowledge of and facility with concepts from college-level physics (acoustics, wave propagation)
Knowledge of and facility with concepts from college-level mathematics (partial differential equations)
To apply submit resume/CV and cover letter with salary requirements to hr@ariacoustics.com.

Fitbit is the leader in the explosive market of health and fitness wearables. We empower and inspire our users to lead healthier and more active lifestyles with simple and delightful products.Fitbit Research is world-class team of hacker-scientist-types who dream up, prototype, and deliver shipping products. We investigate a big set of problems from hardware development to embedded signal processing algorithms to data mining. Experimentation is critical. We work in a dynamic and collaborative environment where the goal is to learn things quickly, iterate fast, and make awesome products.
Your Role:
You will lead a team of data scientists and analysts to invent compelling data products in the Fitbit ecosystem of wearables, connected devices, and software services. Think the ultimate personalized fitness coach that is driven from your data, then combine that with sleep, nutrition, weight, and all the other data in the Fitbit experience. You will have large responsibilities in generating or taking ideas and growing them into a final product. You will help dream up and prototype new data-based features, perform analysis to determine what is interesting and useful in those features, design experiments to focus feature development, and design scalable machine learning . You will do a lot of experiments. You will provide mentorship and oversight to a team of scientists and work with a diverse group of technical experts in the research department to figure out hard problems and, ultimately, help ship products with the other engineering teams at Fitbit.
Qualifications:

8 or more years experience as a technical lead and manager in data products with expertise in one or more of the following: recommender systems, classification algorithms, data mining 
History of strong technical mentorship, managerial, and leadership experience
Proven experience growing and hiring a team
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Physics or a related technical field
Adept at full stack feature prototyping: back end infrastructure, large scale algorithms, and front end experiences
Skilled at creating and transferring production worthy code
Mastery of programming and scientific computation (Python, R), data visualization (d3, shiny) and presenting data in an relatable way
Expert at querying SQL and NoSQL database
Motivated, independent, efficient and able to handle several projects
Friendly, articulate, and interested in working in a fun, small team environment

body:
Data Scientist – City of Cincinnati Office of Performance & Data Analytics
The City of Cincinnati’s new Office of Performance & Data Analytics is seeking qualified candidates to help establish a predictive analytics program that expands the office’s suite of initiatives driving improvements to City agencies’ delivery of services through the use of data.
This employee will be the Office’s first data scientist. The office was created in 2014 to implement a comprehensive suite of performance improvement programs, and has already received significant recognition from multiple local and national media outlets including Government Technology, Backchannel, and Government Executive.
https://medium.com/backchannel/how-a-fiddler-and-an-astrophysicist-brought-predictive-analytics-to-cincinnati-c5583468f4cc
http://www.govtech.com/dc/articles/Data-Programs-Revolutionize-Cincinnati-Government.html
http://www.cincinnati-oh.gov/manager/opda/
In the summer of 2015, the City piloted a predictive analytics project focused on proactive blight reduction in partnership with the University of Chicago’s Data Science for Social Good fellowship program (http://dssg.io/2015/08/20/cincy-blight-prevention.html). This person will build on this initial work and help fully implement a predictive analytics program as a part of the Office’s overall performance improvement efforts. The employee will develop predictive models for a broad array of municipal functions through integration and statistical analysis of datasets that include, but are not limited to: crime data, emergency and non-emergency calls for service, parcel and building data, permit and code enforcement inspections data, and infrastructure condition data. These predictive models will be used to help municipal operations evolve from a reactive customer service model to proactive service delivery. Initial applications will be focused on public safety and quality of life with the goal of scaling the use of predictive analytics across the organization over time.
This position requires database programming ability, statistical expertise, and interest in wide-ranging municipal issues. The office is a fast-paced environment and employees gain tremendous experience learning the details of municipal operations. Must be able to balance competing priorities to help provide and communicate effective solutions to executives in the organization. Salary is commensurate with experience. More highlights from the description are provided below and the full position description is provided at this link.
To apply, go to http://bit.ly/1HYxiTQ located on the City’s Job Opportunities portal. Please also send a copy of your resume and cover letter to Chad.Kenney@Cincinnati-oh.gov.
Applications will be accepted and reviewed on a rolling basis through December 16, 2015. 
REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited academic institution in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Physics, Machine Learning, Economics or other quantitative field is required; Ph.D. or Master’s preferred. Candidates with B.A. in a quantitative field and 4 or more years of relevant academic and/or professional experience in applied data science will also be considered.
Knowledge of:• Programming in SQL, Python, R or related analytical or programming language such as SPSS, SAS, or JMP
• Statistical methodologies, including: spatial statistics, data mining, or multi-variate regression analysis, predictive modeling, hypothesis testing, machine learning, and agent-based models,
• Principles of data science, real-time analytics and business intelligent platforms
Skill to:
• Apply data to develop predictive data models for service needs and future outcomes
• Share and articulate data models
• Extract data from Oracle database systems
• Integrate datasets from multiple systems
• Adapt quickly and rapidly change direction based on data analysis
Ability to:
• Query databases and perform statistical analysis; develop and/or program databases
• Develop hypotheses and test carefully by experience; develop and improve predictive modeling algorithms; understand and work around possible limitations in models
• Conduct Social Network Analysis and transfer data between applications and data sources
• Work both autonomously and collaboratively when necessary in a fast-paced, competitive, multidisciplinary environment
company: City of Cincinnati Office of Performance and Data Analytics

You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. body:
Would you like to translate terabytes of data into unforgettable holidays for millions of people around the globe? Booking.com, the world’s largest accommodation booking website, is looking for rock star Data Scientists to add to join our highly successful Personalization Team within the Front End department.
This product development team crunches endless amounts of data to provide our customers with the best possible experience. They focus on anything from understanding and predicting market data, to ranking all properties on our website, and providing our customers with the most relevant personalized recommendations.
As a Data Scientist you’ll work side by side with Developers, Designers and Product Owners, and take full ownership of your work – from the initial idea-generation phase to the implementation of the final product on our website. Our ideal candidate is result-focused, innovative and has solid quantitative background and a good business understanding.
B.responsible

Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. You’ll use the model’s output to create and improve products for our customers, preferably in short development cycles
Research & Development on how to improve customers’ experience, by using our vast amount of data
Actively contribute to taking Data Science at Booking.com to the next level

B.skilled

Minimum two years of relevant work experience
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.)
Excellent English communication skills; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders
Prior experience with a few of the following models: Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, (Deep) Neural Networks, Hidden Markov Models, Conditional Random Fields, Game Theory, Mechanism Design and/or Latent Dirichlet Allocation

Required

Experience with at least one scripting language, e.g. R, Octave, and one programming language, e.g. Python, Perl, C/C++, Java
Exposure to SQL and relational databases

Preferred

Experience implementing a real-world Recommender or Ranking system
Worked with the Hadoop Ecosystem
Implemented multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment

B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT has monthly hackathons, trainings and attends/speaks at global conferences.
This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

body:
As the leader of the Data Analytics and Security Innovation Team within the Optum Cyber Defense Operations (CDO) organization, you will lead a team of data engineers and scientists as they collect and analyze data related to UHG’s enterprise cyber security from multiple and diverse sources. The team is focused upon innovative and novel use of that data in the pursuit of increasing and enhancing UHG’s cybersecurity capabilities as well as situational awareness. This team will directly support the other teams within CDO that are more directly adversary facing, assisting in their understanding of the available data and helping them answer complex questions in pursuit of their mission to defend the network and enterprise. This team will also help CDO gain a fuller understanding of UHG’s complex environment and the risks it is facing allowing for decision makers to operate with clear vision and situational awareness in a persistent, dynamic, and highly complex threat environment.
Primary responsibilities will include:
Leadership and management of a small team of highly qualified experts, focused upon quick solutionsDefining the right questions and stakeholder information needs and requirementsEngaging with cybersecurity peers and helping them form appropriate questionsCollecting, cleaning, processing, and analyzing data related to enterprise cybersecurityBuilding, testing and deploying predictive models and/or machine learning algorithms on large static and/or streaming data setsReporting findings by creating useful and appropriate data outputs tailored for different audiencesDocumenting all processes used in deriving the approach to data analytics activities Leading the associated engineering activities related to the infrastructure required to support the efforts of the teamStaying current on cyber security news, issues, vulnerabilities and threats (specifically as they apply to the healthcare and financial industries)Working with and supporting other team members, management, and partnersIdentifying additional technical solutions and helping to implement themContinually finding innovative new uses for existing security data
Requirements To be considered for this position, applicants need to meet the qualifications listed in this posting. 5 + years of professional experience working in a large, complex organizationUnderstanding of incident response methodologies and challengesProven experience with fundamental statistics, analysis and data science tools (such as R, Git, SAS, Hadoop and/or Tableau) and demonstrated technical analytical expertise with these toolsBackground experience with data engineering with an affinity for code (and not just management of applications) Foundational knowledge in information technology, including hardware, networking, architecture, protocols, file systems and operating systemsFamiliarity with Big Data technologies and track record of implementing them Foundational knowledge of multiple areas of cyber security operations, such as attack surface management, SOC operations, Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS), threats (including APT, insider, etc.), vulnerabilities and exploits; incident response, and/or investigations and remediationUnderstanding of security tool capabilities and forensic artifactsDemonstrated critical thinking and problem solving skillsAttention to detailIntense curiosity Strong communication skills (both written and verbal) with both business and technology audiencesExperience expressing analysis via a narrative that laymen can understandDemonstrated success with advanced mathematics, statistics, data science, data engineering, or analysis in academic environments Willingness and ability to pursue continued training and/or education to support the role and team goals Relevant bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experiencesPreferred Qualifications:
Previous experience as a Data Scientist/Data EngineerPrevious experience in the health sectorExperience presenting to large teamsKnowledge of machine learning and/or neural networksUS Government Intelligence Community (IC) cyber experienceProject Management Professional (PMP) or Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM)Industry certifications in cyber security, such as CISSP, GSEC, and/or Sec+Willingness and ability to obtain a US Government Top Secret Security Clearance
Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.SM
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
job_title: Manager, Data Analytics and Security Innovation - Cyber Defense Operations
location: Washington, DC or Plymouth, MN or Telecommute

Contact: Jonas Albergatti - jonas@divisionx.chLocation: ZurichFunction: Software development / System Architecture / IT / Internet / full time
We are looking for a CTO to be a part of our core management team. With your “can do attitude” and creativity you will lead and develop the core technology for our start-up division. The new business unit will be a part of the BBC-Group, a family owned Swiss industrial company. Our business idea will bring two customer segments together and automate management processes within operations. Since we are in a very early stage you will have the opportunity to significantly shape the Start-Up division. We offer you very good employment conditions including profit sharing opportunities.
If you're looking to work in a real start-up environment without risk – join us!
Responsibilities

Research and development of algorithms using a variety of machine learning techniques to create new and innovative machine learning services
Design and implementation of suitable data structures for our core technology
You will be in charge of interface development to our backend systems and third applications
Shaping the start-up and its future product structure, strategy and technology roadmap

Required skills are

2- 4+ years relevant work experience in data analysis and Machine Learning methodology
Ambition to actively help to establish a great start-up division
Must be proficient in Python, R, C++, MATLAB or equivalent programming languages
Familiar with Scrum/Agile software development best practices
Dynamic individual with great teamwork and interpersonal skills

Please send your application by email to Jonas Albergatti – jonas@divisionx.ch
job_title: CTO - Software Engineer Machine Learning for a new business unit (Start-Up Division)
