body:
PacificSource is anything but a typical health plan. We’re a growing, independent, not-for-profit organization with an 82-year history and reputation for service excellence. At PacificSource it is our 700+ employees that make a difference. We invest in the communities we serve by partnering with local providers to deliver high quality, accessible healthcare, and through charitable giving and personal involvement with non-profit organizations. Join us in our mission of helping people get the healthcare they need and let your work make a difference, too. We offer excellent benefits, competitive wages, and opportunities for growth and promotion.
Benefits: PacificSource provides excellent benefits to ensure the well being of employees and their dependents. Employer-paid benefits include medical, vision and dental insurance, incentive program, paid time off and holidays, 401k plan, training and education opportunities, life insurance and additional voluntary programs including a flexible spending account.
Nature and Scope: Provide data analysis for PacificSource to achieve the goals and initiatives identified in our Strategic Plan. Primary subject of analytic support will be related to analysis of cost and utilization of health services, in support of large employer reporting, financial modeling for provider contracting analysis, and identification of opportunities and evaluation of health services activities, including, but not limited to, disease management, wellness programs, and early identification of high risk populations. Analytical role may vary and involve knowledge of contract language, healthcare utilization, performance analysis for clinical programs, state and federal guidelines.
Essential Functions:

Perform accurate and complete data extraction from claims data warehouse, including medical, pharmacy and laboratory data sets, to meet project requirements.
Analyze health care data, utilization, quality initiatives, outcome, and performance analysis for clinical programs.
Assist in the development, implementation and evaluation of disease management and pharmacy management methodologies across diseases. Develop analyses to evaluate new program features including testing and implementation of new clinical programs.
Prepare and analyze regular cost and utilization reporting for large external customers, including interpretation of results and recommendations to improve performance through benefit, disease management, and other program changes. Work with underwriters to prepare employer presentations.
Serve as lead for the monthly reports produced in AUA by owning the project and coordinating with all contributors. Facilitate the meetings related to the monthly reports.
Support of provider contracting through analysis of cost and utilization and modeling of new contractual provision.Provide information and support for ad hoc analytic projects for internal customers.
Gather and generate information used to understand health costs and assist with making recommendations to health plan on cost analysis.Work with very large data sets and performs statistical analysis and modeling techniques, including the use of standard statistical packages such as SAS, SPSS, or KXEN.
Perform data analytics including standard deviation, downside risk etc. as well as utilize index characteristics.
Assist in the development of capabilities and performance measurements.
Respond to ad-hoc analytic requests.

Supporting Responsibilities:

Meet department and company performance and attendance expectations.
Follow the PacificSource privacy policy and HIPAA laws and regulations concerning confidentiality and security of protected health information.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Work Experience: Three years experience in medical/health insurance is preferred as is demonstrated by business experience with analyzing data. An understanding of healthcare data trends and experience with financial modeling tools is essential. Experience with predictive modeling tools and program evaluation a plus. Familiarity with NCQA is helpful but not a requirement.
Education, Certificates, Licenses: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Public Health or similar research related field or equivalent work experience required.
Knowledge: Working knowledge of medical costs is desired, while experience with medical coding and terminology is also preferred. Proven ability to manage multiple projects and competing deadlines. Ability to solve complex problems. Ability to deal responsibly with confidential information. Proficiency in SAS and other technical applications such as SQL, ACCESS, and web-based database tools. Skilled in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook. Ability to work in a team environment and manage multiple priorities.
Environment: Work inside in a general office setting with ergonomically configured equipment. Travel is required approximately less than 5% of the time.
Physical Requirements: Stoop and bend. Sit and/or stand for extended periods of time while performing core job functions. Repetitive motions to include typing, sorting and filing. Light lifting and carrying of files and business materials. Ability to read and comprehend both written and spoken English. Communicate clearly and effectively.
Disclaimer: This job description indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position and is subject to change. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position. Employment remains AT-WILL at all times.
For more information on this or other positions and to complete a required application, please visit us online at www.pacificsource.com/careers.
PacificSource is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status, such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or age.

body:
Great products are our vehicle for success.
But we place equal importance on our human talent.
Our remarkable people – with their digital fluency, product knowledge, and ability to position our differentiators – are as important as the products themselves. 
Join a team of innovative visionary’s and make an impact.
WHO ARE WE?
MediaNews Group, dba Digital First Media – and in partnership with AdTaxi, our digital arm - is one of the largest media groups in the U.S., serving high-value audiences and connecting advertisers to them. DFM publishes award-winning content (49 Pulitzers) that amasses and engages a nationwide audience via 800 multi-media platforms including web, mobile, social, and print. We are transforming the news industry.
WHO ARE YOU?
We’re looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to generate actionable insight and solutions for our business. The ideal candidate is more than just a data scientist, but a leader and innovator that can design and develop programs, processes and systems that will reveal meaningful and actionable insights from our data.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
• Lead and develop a defined data strategy and department to achieve company’s strategic objectives• Collect, process and cleanse raw data from a wide variety of sources• Transform and convert unstructured data sets into structured data products.• Identify, generate, and select modeling features from various data sets.• Identify, generate and build machine learning models to address business needs• Build advanced data models and make them consumable by existing products• Design and implement statistical tools for developing and validating new models• Validate models for roll-out and analyze the performance of existing models• Assess the usefulness of new data sources, transformations and techniques• Support other team members with their modeling and analysis projects• Work with product, marketing, sales and audience to develop models to support specific business needs• Innovate, share and educate team members and community
WHAT WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE:
5+ years experience in:• Proven track record of delivering high quality analytics insights and solutions • User behavior metrics, content optimization, digital ad serving optimization, digital advertising, web analytics • MSc. or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics• Experience building production-ready systems and/or developing solutions for company-wide use• Big Data platform experience• Experience communicating with diverse teams of engineers, product managers, ad operations, data scientists, sales leadership and executive management • BI tool experience including Tableau
YOU WANT:
• The opportunity to control what problems you want to solve and do ground-breaking work• To make a huge impact on a business that is aggressively positioned for significant growth• Be a part of a passionate, fun and dynamic team 
Send your resume to jobs@digitalfirstmedia.com or apply via the link.

With its focus on steady and controlled growth NOVOMATIC is one of the global market leaders in the gaming industry. Currently we are strengthening our team and recruiting for the following position:
 
Data Scientist (m/f)Austrian Gaming Industries GmbH,a subsidiary of the NOVOMATIC Group,Gumpoldskirchen / Austria
 
Your responsibilities:• Design Data Products based on a deep understanding of the business value they provide• Prototype effectively in order to quickly understand customer needs• Design the Software Architecture based on a deep understanding of the latest Big Data technologies• Implement complex Data Products with a DevOps approach in distributed environments • Communicate, visualize and report the results of your analysis to key decision makers
Your profile:• You have at least 3 years work experience in Data Science, Machine Learning or a related field• You have a PhD/MS/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other quantitative field or relevant work experience• You are energetic, enthusiastic, detail-oriented and passionate about producing high-quality analytics deliverables• You have exceptional communication skills, a strong bias-to-action and a selfless team-oriented personal style• A strong track record of successfully deployed Data Products is an advantage
SVE-IN-NW
The minimum salary for this position is € 49,000 gross per year. However, the actual salary per year is negotiable depending on your qualifications and experience.
If you are interested in sharing your professional experience with a dynamic, successful, international company that promotes a family atmosphere, please apply by providing your application documents via e-mail to careers@novomatic.com.
Please append a list with all relevant Data Science tools (Machine Learning, Databases, Visualization, DevOps) and all relevant programming languages that you have used in the past to your application. Rate your experience in each of them on a two level scale:- Used for prototype-level applications- Used for production-level applications

body:
We would like to invite applications for the position of postdoctoral researcher in bioinformatics. The successful candidate will have a leading role in an exciting new Motor Neurone Disease Association funded project. The project is a collaboration between researchers working in motor neuron disease, and computer scientists working with biological information.
The postholder will develop a platform (using technology such as Docker, iRods and TranSMART for example) that will let researchers easily use and share genetic, clinical and lifestyle information that has already been collected, and add new information as it is produced. The system will make it easy to see patterns in the relationship between clinical features, lifestyle, and gene variations, to compare genetic variations between groups of people, and to share the information between research groups.
The system will be developed in collaboration and consultation with the ENCALS European research group, and the NEALS US-based research group, as well as research consortia within the US, Europe, and internationally, to make sure that it provides solutions that everyone finds useful, and will be widely used.
This post will be based within the NIHR BRC for Mental Health bioinformatics group (15 post docs; core.brc.iop.kcl.ac.uk) and the Department of Basic and Clinical Neuroscience based at King’s College London, but collaborating with Dr Ben Neale at the Broad Institute and colleagues in the European JPND funded STRENGTH consortium. The group has extensive experience in the development of similar pipelines using Docker for example (http://khp-informatics.github.io/ngs/)
Essential: the successful candidate will have a PhD or equivalent in a relevant discipline (e.g. bioinformatics, computational biology, statistical genetics). Relevant programming skills are required. The candidate should have experience with writing and publishing papers of high scientific standards.
Desirable: Specific knowledge of tools such as iRods, Transmart, Docker and similar, as well as a keen interest in initiatives such as the Global Alliance for Genomic Health.
For an informal discussion of the post please contact Dr Richard Dobson via email at richard.j.dobson@kcl.ac.uk.
To apply for this post, you will need to register with the Hirewire system first to download and submit the application form. Please note, should you wish to submit a CV or a short statement, you will need to copy & paste these documents after the application form as the system will only accept one document to be uploaded.
Equality of opportunity is College policy.
Closing date: 24 December 2015

body:
Kabbage is more than a lender for small businesses; our data and technology platform is now being used as a fully branded product by other lenders, and our products are expanding. In addition to hitting Unicorn status, we’ve received numerous awards & recognition including “36th fastest growing company in the US” on the INC 500 List, Fast Company’s "Top 10 most innovative companies in finance" and Forbes' "America’s Top 100 Most Promising Companies" among others.The Environment: We have all of the requisite goodies: unlimited food and beverages (of all kinds), lunch catered daily, regular ping pong tournaments, free parking and white boards filled with questionable drawings. More than that, we have a pretty tight team of passionate, driven individuals with whom you wouldn't mind spending a big part of your day.
A day in the life of a Data Scientist at Kabbage

Work with multiple, complex data sources at large scale
Build predictive models including but not limited to credit risk, fraud, marketing response and propensity
Perform thorough testing and validation of models and support various aspects of the business with data analytics
Design, build, implement and test machine learning models and ship deployment ready versions into production
Build frameworks to test various risk strategies and portfolio optimization
Identify new data sources/patterns that add significant lift to predictive modeling capabilities
Some of the things we're looking for in you
Highly motivated to tackle multiple projects in parallel
Aptitude to independently learn new technologies
Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to share findings with a large, non-technical audience
You possess a spirit of generosity
An excellent communicator, teacher and student
A perfectionist who tempers it with deadlines

What we're looking for in a Data Scientist

Strong background in applying statistical machine learning techniques to predictive modeling
Proficiency in programming in Python, R, SQL, Java and shell scripting
3+ years in using big data technologies and building predictive systems on big data platforms
Fluency in big data platforms, Hadoop, Mapreduce, Hive, Spark
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math or related disciplines with 4+ years industry experience OR Master’s Degree with 2+ years experience

Why Kabbage?

The people! We are very proud of our people, our products, and our fun, friendly, and passionate culture.
100% paid benefits
Fully stocked kitchen & daily catered lunches
Casual work environment - jeans every day! 
Top of the line Macs
Excellent equity options

“Kabbage is an equal opportunity employer. At Kabbage we make all employment decisions, which include hiring, promoting, transferring, demoting, evaluating, compensating and separating, without regard to sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, religion, age, national origin, pregnancy, citizenship, disability, service in the uniform services, or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.”

body:
The Walt Disney Company is a world-class entertainment and technological leader. Walt’s passion was to continuously envision new ways to move audiences around the world—a passion that remains our touchstone in an enterprise that stretches from theme parks, resorts and a cruise line to sports, news, movies and a variety of other businesses. Uniting each endeavor is a commitment to creating and delivering unforgettable experiences — and we’re constantly looking for new ways to enhance these exciting experiences. Bring your individual talents here and discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you’ve been looking for.
“It takes people to make the dream a reality.” Walt was on to something when he said that, and it continues to ring true today. No matter the stage in your career, being a part of Walt Disney Parks & Resorts means being a part of a team where you help bring innovation to life through unsurpassed products, services and most importantly remarkable experiences. As a Cast Member you are the steward and connection to our legacy and the backbone of our thriving innovations. Join our team and watch your dreams come true.
The Revenue Management and Analytics (RM&A) team supports clients across The Walt Disney Company, including Walt Disney Parks & Resorts (WDP&R), Disney Cruise Line, Media Networks (i.e. ABC, ESPN), Studio Entertainment and Disney Interactive Media in the core competencies of yield management, revenue planning, forecasting, pricing and optimization. Key partners to the RM&A organization include Marketing, Finance, Business Development, Research and Operations. Roles within RM&A develop, analyze, and execute strategies to maximize profitability and improve the value proposition for our Guests, Cast Members and Shareholders.
The Decision Science team within RM&A specializes in creating innovative scientific models and data-driven decision support tools to optimize business decisions. The team consists of experts across many disciplines, including Statistics, Econometrics, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, and Psychology.
ResponsibilitiesLead the research, design and innovation of decision science concepts and models and drive translation of that effort into actionable plans for implementationsProvide leadership to Decision Science and clients/partners in a broad range of analyticsDetermine appropriate science methodologies and modeling approachesProvide project and technical leadership support for Decision Science work streams and activitiesAssess, design, and develop appropriate forecasting, simulation and optimization models to solve business problems across The Walt Disney CompanyIdentify revenue and profit opportunities through data analysis and researchDevelop tools to measure effectiveness of revenue management and pricing practicesProvide science calibration support for decision science modelsIdentify and apply best practices in the field of applied science (statistics, operations research, etc.)Act as science consultant to all business units within the Walt Disney Company
Basic QualificationsMinimum three years of equivalent industry experience applying advanced analyticsDemonstrated strong mathematical modeling skillsWorking knowledge of one or more computer programming languages such as SAS, Visual Basic, C/C ++, JavaAbility to explain complex topics in simple termsDemonstrated strong written, verbal communication and presentation skillsDemonstrated strong organizational and time management skills with attention to detailDemonstrated strong partnering and influencing skillsDemonstrated aptitude and willingness to learn new business problems, science, software applications and toolsDemonstrated experience managing projectsDemonstrated leadership experience
Preferred QualificationsExperience in revenue management and/or pricingExperience with emerging big data analytics, such as machine learning
Required EducationMaster’s degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent
Preferred EducationPh.D. in Operations Research or equivalent

“In this volatile business of ours, we can ill afford to rest on our laurels, even to pause in retrospect. Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.” Walt was on to something when he said that, and it continues to ring true today.
The Experience Insights team seeks to tell the story of our Guests’ holistic vacation experiences and pioneer new tactics that enhance Guest vacation experiences through data science, data integration, statistical modeling/analysis, and delivery of innovative services. Through close partnership with other analytical groups throughout Walt Disney World, the Experience Insights team also serves to get our organization to view the Guest experience and our business in exciting new ways.
ResponsibilitiesThe Experience Insights team supports a range of critical projects and issues by leveraging their deep understanding of all areas of Walt Disney World. This position will be responsible for delivering information to support strategic decisions with data-driven insights on both new and established Guest experience drivers. Responsibilities include: heavy data mining and analytics; strong statistical expertise; integration with key business and technical partners; and visualization of the broader scope.
Measurement:Compile and aggregate data sets from multiple sources leveraging SQL/SAS/RProvide insight into changes and recommendations for improvements including predictive modeling/forecastingTranslate Guest experience data into insightful and actionable information to support business decisions
Strategic Decision Making:Interface with multiple teams and stakeholders, e.g., consumer insight, technology, marketing, operations, revenue management and analytics, industrial engineering, etc.Structure and execute operational and strategic initiatives by gathering and synthesizing relevant data, leading analyses and working with Experience Insights team and key stakeholders to deliver recommendations
Basic QualificationsMinimum 5-7 years experience in relevant field of workDemonstrated proficiency with statistical, forecasting, and optimization software and programming languages including SAS and SQLExperience with forecasting and segmentation methodologiesExperience with developing recommendation algorithms which incorporate both real-time inputs and location-based awarenessDemonstrated strong organizational and time management skills with keen attention to detailDemonstrated strong partnering and collaboration skillsMust be a creative, critical thinker who enjoys problem solvingHigh aptitude and willingness to learn new science, software applications, and toolsStrong written, communication, and presentation skills
Preferred QualificationsBroad knowledge of The Walt Disney Company and Walt Disney Parks & ResortsProficiency with data and text mining including model scoring, social network analysis, and predictive analyticsProficiency with visual analytics and dashboard solutionsFamiliarity with graph networks and databasesProficiency with discrete event simulationKnowledge of statistical methods such as linear regression, generalized linear models, hierarchical/mixed modelsFamiliarity with unstructured data analyticsFamiliarity with spatial/geographic analytics and pathing analyticsAdvanced degree in Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Math, or related areas

Preferred EducationMasters Degree preferred

At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.
The Walt Disney Parks & Resorts Management Science & Integration (MSI) consulting team is responsible for supporting clients across The Walt Disney Company including Parks and Resorts, Media Networks (e.g., ABC, ESPN, etc.), Studio Entertainment (The Walt Disney Studios, Disney Theatrical) and Disney Consumer Products and Interactive Media. MSI leverages technology, data analytics, optimization, statistical and econometric modeling to explore opportunities, shape business decisions and drive business value. MSI seeks forward-thinking team members who are passionate about delivering quality results and enjoy working closely with key partners on both strategic and tactical challenges. Candidates should have a natural curiosity to understand the "why" behind business performance, take a proactive role in problem-solving, be results oriented, be able to prioritize and be a team player in a collaborative environment.
ResponsibilitiesThis posting is a talent pool for upcoming roles within Revenue Management and Analytics. We will be interviewing talent from within this pool to fill Consultant and Sr. Consultant level positions. Act as a company-wide consultant leveraging advanced analytics and complex science models to solve business problemsEngage in projects that drive value/improve business efficiencies, or guide strategy developmentConduct thorough analysis including gathering requirements and documenting the current business processCollect and analyze large data sets. Present and effectively communicate key findings and recommendations in a concise, actionable and efficient manner to all stakeholdersDevelop polished presentations appropriate for their intended audienceManage and prioritize multiple tasks independently in a fast-paced environment
Basic QualificationsThese are the minimum qualifications you need to be considered for these positions:Two plus years experience with SAS and SQL coding (or equivalent programming language)Demonstrated experience performing exploratory and quantitative analysisKnowledge of statistical methods, forecasting and modelingProficiency in acquiring, organizing, cleansing and manipulating large amounts of dataAbility to simplify complex analytics into recommendations that are easily understood and executableAbility to strategically influence stakeholders and partnersDemonstrated strong written and verbal communication skillsDemonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skillsAbility to adapt to a rapidly changing business environment and manage multiple priorities
Preferred QualificationsProven experience with and strong understanding of advanced analytical methodsKnowledge of revenue management and dynamic pricingExperience with marketing, sales, or digital mediaExperience with data visualization tools such as TableauExperience with C++, R, Python, or JavaFour plus years experience with SAS tools (e.g., Base, Enterprise Guide, Enterprise Miner, etc.)Four years experience with SQLBasic language skills in Mandarin, Cantonese or French and/or experience in a multi-cultural environment

Bring your individual talents here and discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you’ve been looking for.
“It takes people to make the dream a reality.” Walt was on to something when he said that, and it continues to ring true today. No matter the stage in your career, being a part of Walt Disney Parks & Resorts means being a part of a team where you help bring innovation to life through unsurpassed products, services and most importantly remarkable experiences. As a Cast Member you are the steward and connection to our legacy and the backbone of our thriving innovations. Join our team and watch your dreams come true.
Consumer Insight, Measurement, & Analytics (CIMA) is a Global Marketing & Sales organization who informs strategy development and decision-making through actionable data analytics, integration and insights. Within CIMA, the Sales Analytics & Insights (SAI) team provides objective decision support for Sales and Sales Strategy Teams in the following areas: Client & Cast Incentive decision support, Channel analytics & optimization, and Sales Strategy decision support.
The Sr. Analytics & Insights Analyst role is a full time salaried position providing support for the Sales, Strategy, and Sales Planning teams related to accessing, reporting, and analyzing data to help them do their jobs more effectively. The scope responsibilities are to provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to help drive sales recommendations and uncover opportunities to grow the business.
ResponsibilitiesGiven the role’s joint blend of quantitative and qualitative based work, a successful candidate will have the ability to work closely with internal partners developing an understanding of the business needs, identify business trends, and provide insights. The candidate must also be able to develop communication (presentations, visual diagrams, process maps, etc.) documenting current state as well as frame up issues and options for consideration. Responsibilities include data mining leveraging Business Objects, SAS, and/or Excel; strong statistical knowledge, researching discrepancies in data and root cause issues; and visualization of the broader scope.
Basic QualificationsDemonstrated ability to leverage data integration software skills including spreadsheets, databases, and graphics softwareDemonstrated strong problem-solving and critical thinking skillsStrong knowledge of and experience with relational databases, online data management skills, and data warehousing practicesStrong interpersonal skills, including the ability to partner with others and deal effectively with multiple projects and changing prioritiesProven experience with data operations as well as understanding and documenting complex data process and flowsDemonstrated strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to develop and articulate actionable, fact-based, insights and recommendations. Deliver this by telling a simple, compelling story to varying types of audiences to guide decision-making
Preferred QualificationsDemonstrated solid experience working with reporting and data mining tools such as SAS, Teradata SQL, Tableau, Business Objects, Crystal Reports, etc.Walt Disney Parks and Resorts experienceTravel industry experience
Required EducationBachelor’s degree or equivalent with concentration in Data Analysis, Statistics, Information Technology, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research or Finance.
Preferred EducationMaster's Degree or PhD in Advanced Analytics/Data Analytics, Statistics, Operations Research, or Industrial Engineering; MBA

body:
SageAxcess is a funded startup which specializes in the user behavior analytics in the exciting and rapidly changing field of network security. We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist who can model data, choose appropriate analytical models to meet business objectives, and develop novel approaches to machine learning within our market. This is a senior position and we expect the person filling it to be able to start contributing in a practical manner very quickly. This is a full-time telecommute position, with occasional visits to our Detroit headquarters. Here are the highlights of what we're looking for:
•Expertise in machine learning and statistical analysis approaches such as classification, clustering, regression, statistical inference, etc.
•Strong problem solving skills
•Proficient in Python
•Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
•Experience with Hadoop technologies like Spark and Mahout
•The ability to automate and deploy models in a production system
•Any experience with behavioral analysis in security, marketing, or other field is a plus
If this sounds like you and you want to change how organizations can protect themselves from hackers and malicious users we'd love to hear from you. Please contact us with information about yourself and why this position is a good match for you.

body:
Data Analysis Manager – Digital Data Analytics
At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we were a tiny startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and that little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.
Twenty-five years after Capital One was started it’s still led by its founder. Be ready to join a community of the smartest people you’ve ever met, who put the customer first, and want to use their data skills to make a difference.
What you’ll do:
- Drive current and future strategy by leveraging your analytical skills - Assist with building and using models to test and validate data- Experience working with vast amounts of data in new and evolving environments- Be a part of growing and developing our brand in new and emerging markets- Leverage analytics to create a customer experience above our peers- Lead a team of talented junior analysts on an exciting professional journey while mentoring them and elevating their careers- Be a part of the full life cycle of projects and see end results - Collaborate across business units - Work with top talent in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment where analytics and good data are a top priority- Experience real work life balance, with little travel involved
On any given day you will be:
- Mining data to arrive at specific and crucial information for the organization - Identifying and implementing process, data, and reporting improvements for the organization - Working with large and complex databases containing millions to billions of records - Improving operational efficiencies and effectiveness - Conducting analysis to evaluate processes and tests - Extracting and analyzing data to gauge product offerings - Consulting on the design and implementation of new production and data storage systems - Developing and implementing strategic tests of products, initiatives and marketing materials- Managing up to 5 people
An ideal candidate will be on the leading edge of Analytical technology with a passion for the newest and most innovative tools. Possessing strong problem solving and conceptual thinking abilities in addition to communication, interpersonal and leadership skills are also important. This position will be in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment where you will be handling multiple concurrent projects while working independently and in teams.
Basic Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s Degree - At least 4 years of professional data analysis work experience - At least 2 years of programming experience- At least 1 year of experience in people management
Preferred Qualifications:
- Master’s Degree- 7+ years of professional data analysis work experience- 1+ years of project management experience- 1+ years of experience with Hadoop- 1+ years of experience with R or 1+ years of experience with Python- 1+ years of experience in Tableau
Applications requested from candidates currently residing in the Continental United States.
Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.
No agencies please.
Capital One is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state or local law.
Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; Newark, New Jersey Ordinance 12-1630; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries.

body:
ZipRecruiter is looking to expand our Analytics Team!
Do you have a blend of statistics knowledge, programming skill, and business instinct?  Do you love building LTV models, time series analysis, price discovery in auction markets, advertising campaign yield optimization, A/B testing methodologies, customer churn prediction, revenue forecasting, recommendation engines, etc.?  If so, we need your skills!
What you have:

Education: Ideally at least BS in Computer Science, Statistics, or an applied quantitative field. Broad knowledge of applied mathematics, statistical methods and algorithms.
Experience: Data mining, data-intensive application development, databases, object-oriented design, machine learning algorithms and statistics software.
Data visualization: Love creating data visualizations (e.g., matplotlib, RShiny, ggplot, or d3.js). Bonus for experience with Chart.io, Looker or Tableau.
Coding Skills: R and/or Python; Must be at home on the command-line in Linux on EC2.
Bonus skills: Experience with SQL, Hadoop/Map Reduce, and AWS services (e.g., Elastic MapReduce, RedShift and DynamoDB).

What you will do:

Consult with and educate Product, Engineers, Marketing, and Sales to help them use ZipRecruiter's data analytics platform to gain insight and test their hypotheses.
Develop algorithms and predictive models to enhance ZipRecruiter products and services.
Identify and incorporate 3rd party data sources to add perspective and dimension to our existing analytics.
Produce reports and data visualization to help drive business decisions.

body:
ZipRecruiter is one of the fastest growing, profitable start-ups in Los Angeles. We’re looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst that is passionate about data! You should be ready to hit the ground running and have an immediate impact on our team. Your goal is to increase data availability for report generation while focusing on customer goals and growth by leveraging and transforming data into knowledge and value for the organization.
This entry-level role will partner with internal teams (marketing, finance, engineering, sales) to extract and analyze data from large data tables using SQL and other data analysis tools. This person will work on projects such as measuring the effectiveness of acquisition and retention marketing campaigns, evaluating the lifetime customer value, subscription decay, other vital KPIs, and increase efficiencies in Customer Service and Sales through data analysis.

Create reports and data extracts against large data sets using SQL.
Work with engineering teams to improve our reporting.
Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of formats.
Design A/B tests to evaluate behaviors.
Evaluate third-party tools for possible use within the company.

Qualifications:

Experience in accessing SQL databases to fetch data, create procedures, or create ad-hoc reports. Excel and other BI tools for data analysis and presentation.
Experience working with data warehousing concepts, terminology and architecture.
Analytical approach to problem solving.
High degree of intellectual curiosity.
Ability to think creatively and to work well both as part of a team and as an individual contributor.
Experience working with large data sets and loves to work with data.
Strong communication skills.
Quick learner.

body:
Summary of Role:

The Manager of Business Operations will work closely with our Business Analytics team to discover operational and product insights, then be in charge of coming up with and implementing initiatives that take advantage of those insights to drive revenue and profitability.
We are looking for someone who is highly analytical and possesses strong leadership skills to be able to work with executives across all functions to get things done. You will be working directly with VP and C-level executives across the company.
This role is a great training ground for aspiring entrepreneurs and future CEOs.

About ZipRecruiter:
ZipRecruiter is one of the fastest-growing tech start-ups. We recently raised $63MM from Institutional Venture Partners and Basepoint Ventures. We have a great culture and we love coming to work! Our offices are located right next to the beach in Santa Monica, CA.
Detailed Job Description:
The Business Operations team’s mission is to drive top- and bottom-line impact for ZipRecruiter through objective analysis, operational insights, and strategic initiatives. We are looking for a high-performer to join our Business Operations team to drive operational and product efficiencies based on data.
Responsibilities Include:

Partner with Business Analytics leadership to deliver on strategic projects
Serve as a liaison between leadership and the teams across Product Management, Marketing, Sales Operations, Finance, and Customer Support
Leverage ZipRecruiter “Big Data” assets to drive informed, data-driven decision making
Create and manage financial/operational dashboards to monitor business line performance and to continually analyze business drivers

Requirements:

SQL experience key!
Passion for internet products and technologies
Highly productive coupled with high degree of ownership and proactivity: Ability to be highly productive with limited oversight on day to day direction. This role is intended for somebody who is independently capable of seeking information, solving conceptual problems, corralling resources, and delivering results in challenging situations.
High-energy, team-first, positive attitude: Team-first, “get it done” attitude. Must be motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment to help our company scale up in a hyper growth mode…and to play hard as well by becoming a key part of the fabric of the team and ensure a fun work environment.
Very strong analytical skills: Experience solving real world business and product problems with data-driven analysis. Advanced Excel modeling and relational databases knowledge a must; experience working with large datasets and using practical statistical analyses a strong plus.
Established strong communication and presentation preparation: Able to articulately present and debate recommendations with senior leadership. Quick and high quality presentation creation using PowerPoint is a must. Tracking operating metrics and financial modeling required as part of the role.

Experience:

3-4 years of work experience at a top-tier management consulting firm or investment bank or private equity or venture capital firm.
Product Management experience a big plus!
MBA a plus!

body:
McKinsey & Company is seeking innovative and visionary Data Scientists to help expand our Operations Analytics capabilities and to build new ones.
About the Role:
McKinsey & Company’s Operations Practice is seeking innovative and visionary Data Scientists to take a core role in building the future of big data and advanced analytics within our diverse client organizations. We are in search of creative and curious consultants who will engage with our clients in creating new strategies across a wide platform of projects, from network optimization to large-scale global transformation to predictive maintenance, and more. The successful candidate will not only expand our current Analytics capabilities, but will help architect new strategies and applications within a dynamic innovative organization. McKinsey’s Operations Data Scientists will shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and using that data in creative ways, and create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations, with an eye on optimizing every aspect of our Clients’ operations practices.
Responsibilities:
The role of the Data Scientist / Analytics Expert has three broad sets of responsibilities:
Operations Analytics• Create valuable, transformative business strategies through the measurement, manipulation, reporting and dissemination of broad sets of data• Apply and advise on state-of-the-art advanced analytic and quantitative tools and modeling techniques in order to derive business insights, solve complex business problems and improve decisions• Review, support and advise on the day-to-day analytics requirements of clients’ key operational processes while continually improving the impact of these processes• Continually explore innovative analytical techniques, processes, tools, etc. to better serve clients and to be a thought leader in the industry
Client Service Support and Development• Act as a core member of the consulting team, conduct deep analytics on a broad set of client and external data• Play a lead role in team problem solving through findings and insights from analysis• Create value for clients by understanding their needs and translating them into optimal desired analytical services• Act as a leader in overseeing analytics process and data integration between clients and McKinsey
Knowledge transfer and practice development• Lead and support development of knowledge for the Firm’s analytic group • Create a roadmap for a greater understanding of analytics and its impact in the consulting population• Partner with Data Engineers to ensure timely and effective methods of the extraction, assembly and transfer of broad, complex sets of data
Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications• MS in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Quantitative social sciences or related field• 3+ years of deep technical experience in distributed computing, machine learning, and statistics related work• Programming experience with R, Python, C/C++, and/or Java• Proficiency in statistical data analysis and data mining packages SAS, SPSS, MatLab, R, STATA, Excel, etc.• Proven comfort and an intellectual curiosity for working with very large sets of data, pulling in relevant team members to address identified – and sometimes undiscovered – client needs• Strong communication skills, especially around breaking down complex structures into digestible and relevant points for a diverse set of clients and colleagues, at all levels• High-value personal qualities including critical thinking and creative problem solving skills; an ability to influence and work in teams; resourcefulness; tenacity; independent thought leader; self-confident, etc.• Willingness to travel up to 80% (Monday-Thursday)• A strong desire to learn and develop, within a dynamic, self-led organization
Preferred qualifications• PhD Computer Science, Applied Mathematics/Science, Engineering, Statistics, Quantitative Social Science or related field• Experience developing or designing large software systems
About McKinsey:McKinsey & Company is a global management consulting firm. We are a trusted advisor working with 90 of the world’s top 100 corporations and 90 governments as well as leading non-profit foundations.
Our knowledge as well as our scale – approximately 20,000 people in more than 100 cities in 60+ countries – enable our teams to address and solve challenging problems no one else can. Our people are as diverse as our clients with MBAs, PhDs, MDs, engineers and scientists (as well as dozens of other backgrounds) working in more than 180 areas of expertise and 20+ industries. The scope of our work enables our people to ‘make their own McKinsey’ and follow their strengths, interests and passions. McKinsey is a springboard to exceptional careers both within the firm and after - 28,000+ alumni remain part of the McKinsey network and a resource to our people.
From day one you will be supported by mentors and peers as well as by significant training – we invest more than $100 million in annual learning and development – to build your capabilities and leadership skills.
About the Practice:As a member of McKinsey’s world-class Operations Practice you will be responsible for blending strategic thinking with the latest tools and technologies, advising on developing and defining operational strategies and solutions to help our clients around the world solve their most critical problems. By applying advanced analytics to address challenges across all areas of operations, we help our clients gain significant, sustained improvements in performance. We work with clients to identify where to focus, convert data and models into actionable insights, and develop institutional skills and structures to sustain impact. We use advanced analytics not only to improve the design of physical systems but also to address management infrastructures and employees’ attitudes and behaviors so that clients are able to lead change independently.

body:
Our company brings together a unique combination of expertise in human computer interaction, machine learning, and hardware integration to create revolutionary interactive solutions.
We are looking for a machine learning expert who loves working with sensor data, loves developing new algorithms, is not afraid of challenging, open-ended problems, and wants to help us shape the future of touch interaction. You will be working with a small and highly capable team of machine learning engineers and will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the growth of a burgeoning startup.
As a Machine Learning Engineer, your responsibilities will include:

Designing experiments to advance our machine learning understanding and techniques
Running experiments to improving the core algorithms of Qeexo products on consumer devices
Modeling accuracy of Qeexo products on new hardware and sensor platforms
Developing new algorithms to improve our engine calibration process
Working with customers to design and implement Qeexo solutions

Ideal Candidate
An ideal candidate will have:

A proven track record of academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning and signal processing, particularly in acoustic analysis
Deep knowledge of statistical and machine learning approaches and problem domains
Computer Science or EE background (MS or BS) with strong coding ability and familiarity with Java, C++ or other OOP language. (You will not be doing production-level coding but you will need to build some prototypes/tools for experiments.)
Proven success with multiple ML/AI/classification projects (research papers, kaggle, open source implementations, etc.)
Expertise in one or more specific areas of research: neural nets/deep learning, signal processing or digital imaging, ensemble learning and system identification
Research-minded, ability to run experiments independently and present results to leadership
Comfortable working in a terminal environment, writing scripts (Bash/Python) to process data
Experience in mobile or other consumer electronic devices

Skills & Requirements

Machine Learning (expert)
Python (expert)
Deep Learning (proficient)
Ensemble Modeling/Classification (proficient)
Signal Processing (familiar)
Java (familiar)
C (familiar)
Data Structures and Algorithms (familiar)

Bonus Qualifications
As a bonus, the candidate will also have:

Familiarity with acoustics or mechanical wave propagation, signal processing, approximation theory, and information theory
Understanding of applied mathematics, computational science, computational statistics, approximation theory, compressive sensing, representation learning, and/or pattern recognition
location: Mountain View, CA or Pittsburgh, PA

McKinsey & Company is seeking innovative Data Engineers to help expand our Operations Analytics capabilities and to build new ones.
About the Role:
We are in search of creative consultants to engage with our clients and team members as they architect new strategies for extracting, transforming and standardizing data from complex, sometimes disparate client networks. Further, the Data Engineer will transform that data to prepare it for a new application or analysis.
The successful candidate will expand McKinsey Operations' current Analytics capabilities, helping create new strategies and applications within an innovative organization. McKinsey's Operations Data Engineer will help shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, creating new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations.
The Data Engineer - Operations will work through our clients’ entire data ecosystem to understand what’s available, what’s missing - and where to find and collect that information. This role will develop, implement and maintain effective programs around all elements of data engineering with a constant eye toward continuous improvement.
We are looking for following core technical capabilities in our Data Engineer - Operations:

Proven experience extracting, importing, profiling, cleaning, standardization, transforming, converting, warehousing, archiving, and validating large complex sets of data
Well versed with performance tuning and able to optimize the application at all of its layers
Easily understand the complex algorithm and logic to process data
Embrace the agile software development environment
Optimize table schemata based on usage patterns
Able to design and develop relational databases for collecting and storing data, and build and design data input and data collection mechanisms.

Experience with various data sources (e.g., ERP, MES, PLC, Sensor), data management tools (SQL, PL/SQL, UNIX shell scripting), Big Data platforms (Hadoop, hbase, CouchDB, hive, Pig) and secure cloud environment (Azure, AWS, etc.)
Worked with TeraData, Oracle, MySQL, Informatica, Tableu, QlikView or similar reporting and BI packages

Solid understanding of broader Operations trends, their impact on business strategies, and their implications in creating and sustaining competitive advantage

body:
theScore, Inc. (www.thescore.com, mobile.thescore.com, www.thescoreesports.com, www.swoopt.com) is an independent creator of mobile-first sports experiences, connecting fans to what they love through an addictive combination of comprehensive and personalized real-time news, scores, stats, alerts and daily fantasy sports contests via its mobile sports platforms ‘theScore,’ ‘theScore eSports,’ ‘ScoreMobileFC’ and ‘Swoopt.’ theScore’s mobile platforms are used by 10.2 million active users a month.
theScore Inc. is a place where data, measurement, and analysis is integral to smart decision making and building amazing products. The ideal candidate has a passion and curiosity for solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches and automating those solutions.
Responsibilities:
• Drive data driven implementation across all departments and products• Have a deep understanding of how users interact with theScore’s suite of apps and websites• Build statistical and machine learning models from 1st and 3rd party data that drive key product features• Develop, create, and plan multivariate or A/B testing• Continuously improve analytics implementation and adapt to changing technologies Requirements:

body:
Would you like to mentor a budding data scientist?
SlideRule is looking for expert industry Data Scientists who use Python or R in their day-to-day work and are passionate about teaching/mentoring.
We run online, self-paced Python and R-based Data Science workshops where participants learn with the help of a curated curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert industry mentor.
Our mentor community - the biggest strength of our programs - has experts from the best organizations in the world. Mentors range from experienced data scientists and researchers at premier companies (Uber, Facebook, Etsy, Apple) to a wide variety of top-notch startups and consulting firms.
What do I have to do as a mentor?
As a mentor, your role will be to ensure that your mentees have a great learning experience. Here’s what that means for you:

You will have a weekly 30-minute video call with each of your students at a time of mutual convenience. 
Most mentors takes 4 mentees, but depending on your availability, you can commit to more or fewer. 
You will be compensated for your time with a per-student honorarium.

I’m interested! Tell me more about the curriculum
We currently have two Data Science workshops, one based in R and the other in Python.

Our R-based workshop, Foundations of Data Science, is targeted to students with little or no programming background, who want to get a taste of data science
Our Python-based workshop, Data Science Intensive, is meant for students with some programming experience and statistics background, who want to transition to data science
In both cases, our curriculum is curated by experts to include the best materials in the field: think of us as a college professor who includes book chapters, videos and other material to create the best learning experience.

Excellent! What about the students?
Our students are working professionals and college/graduate students from all over the world, interested in getting started with data science. They go through the curriculum at their own pace and have a weekly 30-minute check-in with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice. Typically, most students take about 3 months to finish.
I’m sold! Where do I sign up?
Send an email to mentors@mysliderule.com with a bit of information about yourself. A resume or an updated LinkedIn profile, along with a brief cover email work perfectly well!

body:
Do you know why X and Y are connected? We do. 
At Yewno we are building the next generation knowledge engine. We leverage leading edge computational semantics, graph theoretical models as well as quantitative analytics to tackle the information overload problem. Our solution helps people research and understand the world.
We're a small team of hands-on entrepreneurs and data scientists with multi-million dollars exits under our belts. We’re venture funded and our product is in private beta with leading institutions.
We’re looking for a team member who gets things done, not likes talking about getting things done. We invest in technologies that help us deliver great services and experiences, not just because they’re cool and new or because we feel comfortable in them.
This role is key to our company and you will also be an integral part of our Data Science Leadership Team. We offer competitive salary, stock options and great benefits like healthcare, 401(k), an unlimited vacation policy, and more.
Role Summary

Creating, designing and implementing the next generation of knowledge discovery tools and big data analytics.
Successful candidates will be expected to develop cutting-edge machine learning algorithms that can be used to extract decision-making signals from heterogeneous streams of unstructured data in real-time.
Applicants must have a strong background in machine learning, computational semantics, and statistical modeling for predictive analytics. In addition, candidates are expected to have hands-on experience in deploying data analysis and machine learning algorithms on distributed systems.
Core focus will be on collecting and preprocessing data, prototyping concepts, designing cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and testing them on production data.

Key Qualifications

PhD or a Master’s degree in Computer Science or related fields (preferably with major in machine learning / AI)
3+ years relevant experience
Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art algorithms in machine learning (e.g. Bayesian learning, latent/topic models, approximate inference, deep networks, stochastic processes), graph analysis (e.g. community detection, random walk) and statistical modeling (e.g. hypothesis testing, dimensionality reduction)
Proficiency in standard data analytics toolkits such as R, Matlab or Python
Hands-on experience of Hadoop 2.0 Ecosystem (Spark, MapReduce, HBase) is highly beneficial

 
If you are interested in applying, send your CV to hello@yewno.com

The Mason School of Business at the College of William and Mary is seeking to fill a teaching position in the Operations Management and Information Systems (OMIS) area. This is a non-tenured, fixed term, renewable contract position. Candidates should have a terminal degree in operations management, industrial engineering, operations research, analytics, or related fields. The position begins in August 2016.
The successful candidate should be willing and able to teach courses in operations management, statistics, and business analytics. The OMIS area offers a Business Analytics major in the BBA program, is active in the MBA program, and in the Fall of 2016, is launching a Masters program in Business Analytics. The ideal candidate is expected to contribute to the teaching needs of these programs. Responsibilities of this position are teaching and service.
Candidates should have:
a) terminal degree in operations management, industrial engineering, operations research, analytics, or related fields; and b) commitment to excellence in teaching.
Candidates without teaching experience will be considered, those with a proven record of excellent teaching will be given preference in the selection process. Industry experience in operations management and/or analytics, while not required, is desirable.
To apply submit your vitae, a teaching statement, and teaching evaluations. You will be prompted to submit online the names and email addresses of three references who will be contacted by us with instructions for how to submit a letter of reference.
For full consideration, application materials must be submitted by the review date, December 16, 2015. Applications received after the review date will be considered if needed. This posting may close at 5p.m. EST on December 16, 2015 if applicable applications are received.
The College of William & Mary values diversity and invites applications from underrepresented groups who will enrich the research, teaching and service missions of the university. The College is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.

body:
metacog (www.metacog.com) is an internet scale educational data platform built to ingest data from learning objects (simulations and game-based learning objects) used by millions of students. Metacog measures how learners tackle challenges (within assessments, simulations, casual and serious games, performance tasks, etc.). As you can imagine, this is a lot more data than simply scores or grades. We want someone who can work with our Educational Data Mining Experts and build engines to analyze, score, and surface learning pathways and patterns. Metacog can automatically detect if students are bored, frustrated, gaming the system, experiencing deep vs. shallow learning and other affects. It also can understand what a learner's cognitive strategies are.
If you want to power the next generation of adaptive learning and continuous assessment solutions and provide learners with real-time, dynamic and interactive prescriptive guidance, talk to us. You will be instrumental in developing the next generation learning and assessment technologies that will be key in shaping the future of our education system.
The metacog platform is a fault-tolerant, distributed system built on the AWS platform that supports both batch and real-time educational data processing with reporting and analytics capabilities. We are looking for an experienced data scientist to help us build machine learning models to detect learner’s affective states and behaviors as they are using the software. Basically the data scientist will be talking to our top learning science advisor and working closely with dev-ops to implement the machine learned models in Spark.
REQUIREMENTS
· Two years experience in applied data science or data science-related degree
· Programming skills e.g. Python, Scala, R
· Knowledge about machine learning algorithms such as logistic regression, support vector machines, decision trees, random forest and k-means clustering
· Familiarity with cloud computing (AWS)
· Experience with social programming tools (GitHub)
· Strong written and verbal communication
BONUS
· Experience with distributed data processing (Spark, MapReduce)
· Experience working with educational data sets
· Software or web development experience
· Research or work experience in the learning sciences

body:
Wentworth Institute of Technology seeks to fill an Assistant Professor of Applied Mathematics position that would start in September 2016.
We are especially seeking candidates with data science or actuarial experience in industry and/or in higher education.
The majority of students that our applied math professors teach are engineering majors and computer science majors. Many of these students are also applied math minor students. Professors in the Department of Applied Mathematics do teach and mentor applied math major students, also, but they are a small percentage of the student body. We value creative and passionate educators that can teach all students.
We are also excited about educating students in an environment that fosters EPIC-Learning: Externally Collaborative, Project-based, Interdisciplinary Curricula for Learning. This EPIC approach to learning mimics what happens in many workplaces across the country. The undergraduate Applied Mathematics major is an interdisciplinary curriculum, so we seek applications from candidates with wide intellectual interests and a demonstrated commitment to excellence in teaching, advising and scholarship. The ideal candidate must be able to develop interdisciplinary projects and foster connections within the Applied Math Department, with other departments at Wentworth and with the external professional community that enrich student experience.
Faculty participate in teaching (especially project-based); curricular development; scholarly activities; advising applied math majors andpotentially other majors; recruiting students for the Applied Math B.S. program; collaborating with our Industrial Professional Advisory Committee (and recruiting new members for this committee, as needed) and other service to the Applied Mathematics Department and to the Institute.
Candidates should have:
a) a Ph.D. in applied mathematics, data science or a related discipline.b) a commitment to excellence in teaching. 
If you are interested in preparing our next generation of engineers and designers and if you have substantial experience with project-basedlearning and undergraduate mathematics education innovation then we’d love to hear from you. Please apply at: https://jobs.wit.edu/postings/2451
In your application please include: 1) a cover letter that addresses this job description; 2) a current cv or resume, including references; and 3) a statement of your teaching philosophy.
Wentworth seeks to increase the diverse perspectives of its faculty and encourages applications from members of underrepresented groups in STEM.

body:
Mosaic Ventures
Mosaic Ventures is a new Silicon Valley-style venture capital firm based in London, focused on Series A stage tech. We are investing a $140 million fund in founding teams that are fundamentally reshaping big markets.
Our partners have 30+ years of experience investing on both sides of the Atlantic. In that time, we have invested across 10 countries in over 70 companies that together have created about $200 billion of value. We also bring extensive operating experience at leading West Coast start-ups.
For more background, please see our website www.mosaicventures.com for what we invest in, our values, and the Mosaic story.
MANAGER, BUSINESS OPERATIONS
Summary
You'll be tasked with increasing and optimizing the effectiveness of our deal sourcing efforts - making sure we focus our energies on the most ambitious and transformational start-ups and founders in Europe. You will ensure every member of the investment team is armed with data and insights to make them as productive as possible. You’ll pursue any crazy idea to help us meet more quality start-ups, track these leads, and later process potential investments more effectively. You should be passionate about finding inefficiencies in how we operate, and enjoy brainstorming and building workflow solutions. You love number crunching, analysis, insights and organizational efficiency almost as much as you love tech.
Role and Responsibilities
Sourcing Support

Analyse large volumes of data related to new startup activity 
Synthesise data and create workflows to direct investment team efforts
Update and maintain our CRM and contacts database
Drive management process for our investment pipeline
Research target investment opportunities (founders and start-ups), focusing on priority sectors and geographies

Organization and Time Management

Build systems and processes to optimize our professional networks thematically and geographically
Design and implement internal reports 
Map landscape of 3rd party service providers and resources, and help us manage those relationships
Identify low hanging fruit for opportunities/processes to support Mosaic’s portfolio companies

Ideal Candidate

Highly motivated and thrives in a small, unstructured office environment
Proven passion for technology and innovation
Driven self-starter, resourceful, great with lists, uber-organised
Strong written, oral communication and analytical skills
Able to design, develop and document custom internal applications and integrations with third party applications
Experience managing developers on bespoke basis (for Mosaic, this may be contractors outside the firm) and can write ad hoc scripts
Highly proficient in Excel and VBA or eager to rapidly master these skills 
Skilled at planning, organizing, prioritizing and executing simultaneous projects and activities and seeing them through to operational efficiency 
Proven ability to work well under pressure and adapt quickly to change

Experience
Minimum 2 years in a business operations role at a fast-growing start-up, tech, or investment company.  
Mosaic will consider sponsoring the right candidate for a work visa in the UK if necessary. 
To Apply
Please send your CV (resume) to careers@mosaicventures.com with the subject line 'Business Operations Manager.'

body:
We protect children and save lives.
Our technology analyzes textual data created by students (chat, email, documents, etc) for the purpose of identifying child abuse, bullying, suicide, and other serious concerns that affect today's youth.
You will work on a small team to design and implement innovative ways to better solve this problem.
We have a number of challenges in both the quantity of data we analyze, and the timeframe in which we must make accurate predictions to better allow our 24hr monitoring staff to make decisions on how best to intervene in serious cases.
Put your Machine Learning knowledge to use in a way that can make a real difference in the lives of children.
Skills and Requirements

BS, MS or PhD degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related technical field.
Strong background in Text Analysis or Natural Language Processing
Experience coding in Java, Scala, or Python.
Strong background in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence.
Experience training/tuning/deploying Machine Learning models in production environments for real-time processing

Gaggle.net's Core Values
Before we get to the technical requirements of the job, let's make sure Gaggle is an environment you're going to enjoy and be successful. We have a number of core values that we use to guide how we work together, and how we grow as a company. These aren't motivational poster gimmicks. They're recurring themes that have worked for us as we've grown as a company and we keep them in our minds during those times when we tackle the big challenges:

Innovation over Perfection - We've always been a company that has pushed hard to come up with new solutions to problems even at the risk of getting it wrong. We make mistakes, but that's ok. Our drive to innovation is a strength of Gaggle, but it also leads to some real challenges and even outright problems. We need to know and understand this about ourselves; celebrate it and at times compensate for it.


Hire Exceptional People (and let them do their job) - Working with great people is a powerful motivator. It makes us better when we are challenged by great coworkers. On the other hand, working with someone who doesn't carry their weight drags everyone down. Let's never settle!


Work Hard; Make it Better - If you see something that is not right, roll up your sleeves and pitch in to find a solution.

body:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a work environment that encourages new ideas, having fun and challenging the status quo!
Our Business Intelligence team is looking for a Data Scientist who can help drive trivago forward by applying their analytical mind to our search engine marketing (SEM) strategy. In this role you will focus your attention on our bidding algorithm which plays a crucial part in helping us place value on keywords when bidding for higher ranks in search engines. You will work closely with our team of marketing professionals to assess their business needs and optimize the algorithm accordingly. Part of the work is to consult them so that they come to informed decisions and achieve better results. You will also monitor and analyse theperformance of SEM campaigns in over 40 countries by building reports, dashboards and metrics. We want a proactive individual who will improve our bidding algorithm so that it provides us with better estimates, someone who will question and prioritize the requests that come from our marketing teams and in general help drive our SEM team and trivago forward.
The ideal candidate:

Speaks English (our company language) fluently.
Holds a master's in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or similar field.
Has exceptional analytical skills and is confident working with large sets of data.
Experience working in business intelligence or online marketing would be a plus.
Has a basic understanding of SQL or programming languages.
Has heard of Hadoop and R. Basic knowledge or experience would be a huge plus.
Is a fast learner and eager to acquire new skills.
Can be trusted to work independently.
Wants to work in a lively, multicultural environment.
Can start as soon as possible.

Life at trivago:
trivago is an exciting hub of multicultural activity where nationalities from all around the world come to share their knowledge and work together on redefining the travelling experience for millions of people. We nurture all our talents and provide them with the support they need to develop professionally as well as personally. We encourage fanatic learning through regular workshops, seminars and constant feedback as well as promoting quick decision making in keeping with our trial and error philosophy. Flexible working hours are in place to create a trusting environment where productivity is measured through goals rather than hours spent in the office. For our internationals, we help with relocation and provide language classes for those wanting to learn or practise their German.
Join us at trivago – a place where talented minds meet, crazy ideas are shared and innovation is born.
Additional information:

Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.
We do not require the services of an agency for this position.

They aim at providing tens of thousands properties with the best Revenue Management System on the market, bringing the latest technologies and optimization techniques to the field.

Monitor all our outputs to create and improve our recommendations.
Be proactive to bring additional value to our product and always question the way we do things.

 B.skilled

probabilistic and statistical modeling
convex / linear / non linear programming,
stochastic processes, optimization and simulation,
dynamic programming,

Requisition ID 13770Career Category Information TechnologyPosted Date 12/9/2015
Location US-MD-Silver SpringDivision Enterprise Operational Services DivisionType Company Employee Full-Time
Position Summary:
The Sr. Data Analyst will work directly with the Sr. Manager of Data & Analytics and other members of the Global Data & Analytics team to develop analytic capabilities that drive business outcomes.For example, she/he will build and apply predictive and prescriptive statistical models for many business applications, including advertising sales, marketing and digital media.
