The Sr. Data Analyst will also be actively involved in managing relationships with internal stakeholders and leading usage and maintenance of corporate data products, such as the company’s multichannel marketing tool.
Responsibilities:
Advanced Analytics1. Work with stakeholders to translate business problems into data science and analytic problems2. Identify, retrieve and organize appropriate data for the identified problem, using SQL or other related techniques3. Build and apply appropriate statistical models (regression techniques, classification models, supervised and unsupervised learning, etc.), including implementations on large data sets4. Communicate the results of models in clear business terms5. Create repeatable processes to support similar business problems in the future6. Stay current with new analytical tools and industry trends
Data Engineering7. Work closely with the Data Technology team to extract, transform and load new data sources into Discovery’s central data repository for analytics8. Analyze, monitor and measure the quality of data collection and management in Discovery’s central data repository for analytics
Other9. Assist in managing usage and maintenance of corporate data products, such as the company’s multichannel marketing tool
Requirements:
* Master’s degree in a quantitative field (statistics, economics, physics, computer science, etc.)* Minimum of 3-5 years proven business experience and technical expertise in data modeling and analytics* Strong experience with modern statistical learning methods (regression techniques, classification models, supervised and unsupervised learning, etc.)* Expertise in statistical packages such as R or the Python scientific stack (NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, pandas)* Experience with SQL databases; Experience with map reduce techniques preferred* Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills* Ability to present complex information in an understandable, concise and compelling manner* An ability and eagerness to constantly learn and teach others* Must have legal right to work in the United States
Discovery Communications, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Discovery is committed to being an employer of choice, not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. To that end, we strive to recruit and maintain a workforce that meaningfully represents the diverse and culturally rich communities that we serve. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disabled status or, genetic information. EEO is the Law If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application process, please send an email request to hr@discovery.com.
Apply Here

Carlisle & Company offers exciting opportunities for Associates to be engaged in global challenges in the motor vehicle industry, and to contribute to a growing company. Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds, but all are keen business analysts, excellent communicators, and subject-matter experts. We are passionate about the industry, the products and solving problems. Carlisle is an intellectually challenging environment where you are expected to learn new things and apply them immediately.Carlisle seeks a Data Analytics Engineer to support a new practice area in expanding the firm’s capabilities in data warehousing, extraction, and analysis. The Data Analytics Engineer will be responsible for the development and maintenance of systems to securely extract, transform, store, and analyze complex and disparate data for multiple clients.
Key Competencies:
• Able to design and maintain relational databases on platforms such as MySQL, PostgreSQL and SQL Server.• Experience in extracting, importing, cleaning, transforming, and validating large, complex datasets.• Proficiency with cloud-based database platforms such as SQL Azure, Amazon RDS, and/or Google Cloud SQL.• Proficiency with visualization tools such as Tableau, SAP Lumira, Qlikview, Plotly, D3, and/or ggplot.• Familiarity with statistical analysis and predictive analytics approaches, including feature engineering and model selection.• Familiarity and interest in developing and enhancing web applications.• Proficiency in Python, R, and Javascript.
Primary Requirements:
• A Bachelor’s degree within a discipline such as engineering, computer science, quantitative social sciences or related fields• One to three years of experience in database development, statistical analysis, and predictive analytics/machine learning.• Outstanding analytical abilities and creative problem-solving skills.• Excellent communication skills—both written and verbal.• Able to work independently as well as in a small team environment.• A professional demeanor.
For consideration, please send cover letter and resume to recruiting@carlisle-co.com.
Privately-held Carlisle & Company is the preferred provider of strategic guidance and tactical solutions for many of the world’s most prestigious motor vehicle brands. Our expertise is in after-sales program development and enterprise strategy, after-sales best practices and benchmarking, and vehicle market strategies for industry-leading manufacturers. Our projects include supply chain strategies, sales and marketing, pricing and brand strategies, market sizing and share model, market research and customer satisfaction surveys.
Our clients are a broad range of domestic and import original equipment manufacturers, including Volkswagen, General Motors, Caterpillar, and Daimler Trucks. Carlisle & Company takes pride in its dynamic and entrepreneurial culture, its non-hierarchical structure, and commitment to providing the best solutions to our clients. We are looking for people who want to help create company, not just fit into one.
To learn more about us, please visit www.carlisle-co.com, LinkedIn/Carlisle & Company, and follow us on Twitter @carlislecompany.

body:
DIRECTOR OF DATA SCIENCEPOSITION DESCRIPTION
Who We Are
Murmuration seeks massively improved education outcomes for kids by providing information, infrastructure, and support for education-related public advocacy and community building efforts.
One of Mumuration's key initiatives, mInsights, is a technology product that seeks to aggregate data from a combination of sources such as partner organization’s member data, publicly available data, consumer data, voterfile data, and more. These data will then be used to build a variety of models and tools that will position Murmuration’s partner organizations to activate and expand their supporter bases effectively, and mobilize them for sustained political change. Traditionally these data have lived in silos within individual organizations or been un- or under-utilized. Murmuration has the unique opportunity to build, with partners, a massive dataset that can leverage creative data science to profoundly change the way that advocacy efforts and service providers engage their bases.
About the Position
We are looking for an experienced, innovative Director of Data Science to lead our rapidly growing internal analytics team. The ideal candidate is more than a number cruncher. The role calls for strong expertise in predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and data visualization as well as the ability to clearly communicate complex analysis to non-technical audiences. Working with Murmuration’s team of analysts and top political strategists, this individual will be chiefly responsible for drawing inferences from mInsights by designing experiments, statistical models, and machine learning algorithms that will have national application and impact.
The Director of Data Science will: • Manage and coordinate Murmuration’s day-to-day analytics strategy• Build and manage the Analytics team, overseeing hiring and the long-term strategic direction of the team• Develop a vision for Murmuration’s data and analytics architecture and workflow across the organization• Consult on the design of Murmuration’s suite of tools and products built to optimize such major campaign functions as messaging, diffusion, voter turnout, fundraising, and lobbying• Design and analyze experiments over millions of voters to study the impact of Murmuration’s tools and products • Develop and test robust statistical models for analyzing the efficacy of Murmuration’s products in conducting messaging, diffusion, voter turnout, fundraising, lobbying activities, and more• Work with Murmuration’s technology team to develop robust machine learning algorithms and engines to improve upon Murmuration’s core products• Work with Murmuration’s program team to prioritize advanced analytic deployments• Create accountability systems that will aid the leadership team in decision making and monitoring progress to goal
Candidate Profile Murmuration attracts employees with distinctive and diverse backgrounds and accomplishments. Integrity, creativity, flexibility, and drive are key attributes of competitive candidates.
The ideal candidate will have: • BA/BS in econometrics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, political science or other technical field, MS or PhD preferred • Strong foundation in predictive analytics (especially machine learning), survey methodology, causal inference, experimental design and analysis • Experience analyzing and conducting statistical modeling and machine learning over very large datasets• Expertise using analysis packages and tools such as R, Python, STATA or SAS• Experience writing SQL queries • Significant experience leading a small team to complete time-sensitive development projects • Must be an expert at communicating complex statistical/technical concepts to a variety of audiences• Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, D3 or similar• Interest in politics and/or educational policy
LocationThis position will be based in New York, NY and requires some travel.
Compensation and BenefitsThe Director of Data Science is a full-time, salaried position with a comprehensive benefits package. Salary for this position is commensurate with experience.
How to ApplyIf you are interested in this opportunity, please submit a cover letter, resume and three references at https://murmuration.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=11.
An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to DiversityMurmuration is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as an organization committed to diversity and the perspective of all voices, we consider applicants equally of race, gender, color, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, disability, political affiliation and national origin. We reasonably accommodate staff members and/or applicants with disabilities, provided they are otherwise able to perform the essential functions of the job.

body:
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT
 You will be a key player in a small but advanced data scientist team, acting as a partner for sales and marketing executives and collaborating with colleagues in management accounting, IT.   Your tasks include:

Advancing our global market and customer potential estimation tool.
Enhancing the short and mid-term customer forecasting process, implementing and running it in our CRM environment
Managing and improving our product recommendation engine to deliver tangible product recommendations via our digital channels.
Conceiving, testing and implementing the identification / targeting and conversion of new customers and new business with existing customers
Developing procedures to measure campaigns on a global level together with managers and executives in marketing and sales
Acting as a specialist in modeling techniques (clustering, time series analysis, shopping basket analysis, conjoint analysis) for ad hoc projects to e.g. identify new business opportunities, analyze customer lifecycle and journeys and act as a sparring partner for our internal and external platforms teams (e.g. Online Shop, Websites etc.)
Acting as an interface to like-minded colleagues in marketing, sales, production and IT as well as a global data-rich environment with possibilities to prove your modeling capabilities in real world

WHAT WE EXPECT
 You are characterized by analytical thinking and good communication skills. Passionate for data analysis and capable to deal with a complex environment and not well defined business requests/needs.   Furthermore you:

Demonstrate a solution oriented approach to problem solving and bring a proven track record in working within a strongly data and analytics oriented work environment (at least 5 - 8 years professional experience in developing and implementing advanced analytics topics (example: churn modelling, econometric forecasting, recommendation models, shopping basket analysis,…)
Demonstrate business acumen and hands-on knowledge in retrieving and analyzing large amount of data (millions records) from multiple systems (SAP, CRM Systems, databases systems) in your work approach
Have a strong ability in modeling data using current statistical analysis software (R or Python is a must)
Have a good working level in database / ERP technology (e.g. SQL ...) for business applications
An academic degree in a subject with a focus on empirical analysis and statistics (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science). This may be compensated by substantial practical experience.

 Fluent English skills are a prerequisite for this position. Experience in the field of apparel, jewelry or lighting (e.g. retail, branded manufacturer) are a plus but not required.   Do you think you would enjoy this role? If so, we look forward to receiving your online application.

DescriptionSo you want to be a Data Scientist?-Are you innately curious, a natural born problem solver, a contrarian or a risk taker?-Do you want to solve complex, challenging problems?-Do you want to have fun while doing so?-Do you want to work alongside others who are passionate about using data science to change the world?
Did you know?
Booz Allen Hamilton is no longer “just” a consulting firm. We offer an environment in which you can create and deploy data-driven tools while serving as a trusted advisor to your clients. We solve cutting-edge commercial and government problems through research, development and collaboration among teams working with leading edge technology. Our Strategic Innovation Group offers the best of both worlds: a start-up environment with the backing of an established consulting firm. You will be met with a 100-year history of success and a firm-wide belief that our team should lead the way in innovation by being disrupters and thought leaders in data science.
Our Data Science team:
In this role, you will join a diverse, collaborative and ever-growing data science team. You will work alongside highly-skilled practitioners, including a master-class Kaggle competitor, a member of the Apache Software Foundation, and nationally recognized data science thought leaders (with coverage in WSJ, HBR, and many others). You will deliver intellectual capital and solutions that enable our clients to derive the maximum value from their data while solving solve our client’s most pressing business needs.
A day in the life – what our Data Scientists do:
- Tap into the firm’s consulting roots to define business problems while manipulating data, developing analytical solutions and executing models- Identify new opportunities to further apply advanced analytics solutions with our existing clients- Work across all of our markets with private and public sector clients in Energy, Financial Services, Life Sciences (Health) and Defense- Pioneer and champion data science for social good while working with national museums, international organizations and non-profits- Enhance the diversity of the firm by helping to attract, develop and retain our existing talent
This position is located in Washington, DC, Boston, MA, San Diego, CA, Houston, TX, or New York, NY.
QualificationsBasic Qualifications:-2 years of experience with advanced data analytic techniques, including data mining, machine learning, statistical analysis, and Natural Language Processing-1 year of experience with programming in an object-oriented programming language, including Java or Python-Experience in working with massive data sets, including structured and structured with at least 1 prior engagement involving data gathering, data cleaning, data mining, and data visualization-Ability to show a proven track record of weaving data and analysis into a compelling format that is client- and solutions-driven and easily digestible resulting in client approval-Ability to obtain a security clearance-BA or BS degree
Additional Qualifications:-Experience with scientific research processes and bioinformatics, health and analytical tools related to genomics, medical imaging, phenotypic, or related data-Knowledge of government-funded research processes and initiatives-Experience with an object-oriented programming language, including Java or Python-Experience with articulating the overall story derived from data and analysis and explaining complex analyses and themes to non-technical and technical audiences-Knowledge of advanced data analytic techniques, including data mining, machine learning, statistical analysis, and Natural Language Processing-Ability to show a track record of solving large, complex problems-BA or BS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, EE, CS, or related fields preferred; MS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Biology, Bioinformatics, Biomedical Engineering, Genetics, Neuroscience, or similar health-related fields preferred; MA, MS, or PhD degree in Biomedical Engineering, Bioinformatics, Biology, Genetics, Neuroscience, or related fields
Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Integrating the full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems, working by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.
We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet.

CEP America and MedAmerica is looking for a statistician to join a talented team of physician leaders, scientists, analysts and engineers. The CEP Director of Analytics and the Data Science and BI team work on a variety of exciting analytics and modeling projects that have a direct impact on improving care for CEP America/MedAmerica’s patients. The ideal candidate will be a strong analytic thinker with 10+ years of industry experience focusing on forecasting, modeling and statistical analysis to drive analysis and innovation based on stakeholder data.
Responsibilities include a wide variety of data analytics, forecasting and predictive modeling problems, providing analytical/strategic-thinking and leadership skills that enable project teams to:
• Isolate clinical and business issues;• Design and execute analytics for studying business issues (market research, scenario planning, forecasting, market share, profitability, etc);• Bring technical/content expertise (competitive intelligence, utilization, financial analysis, deep data analysis and programming);• Vet findings and make formal recommendations to senior levels of leadership;• Create documents (strategic segment plans, utilization reports) that inform critical strategic issues.
 
Analytics and Modeling:
• Perform quantitative analysis, extracting information from data and using it to predict future trends and provide insights.• Create and optimize highly scalable predictive models and rule sets in order to analyze large-scale and complex data sets to uncover new trends and patterns.• Analyze, mine and interpret custom data and determine the “why” of the results; prepare the “story” and present findings using dashboards, charts, graphs, reports and presentations.• Recommend, implement and provide leadership regarding best practices for the application of statistical methods.• Provide statistical consulting to stakeholders, evaluating new statistical methods and proposing new statistical methods when necessary.
 
Research and Publication:
• Work as part of a team to design, analyze, and publish research findings.• Contribute to the conduct of studies including leading the study design, secondary research and advising on study decisions that have implications for the analysis.• Lead development, design and authoring of white papers, industry reports and various publications.
 
Our Ideal Candidate Profile:• MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Business Administration or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).• Extensive health care clinical, quantitative and operational experience to understand client needs.• 10+ years of industry experience in data mining, natural language processing, machine learning, statistical analysis and modeling.• Experience with BI/data visualization tools (QlikView, Tableau, Business Objects, MicroStrategy, Cognos, GoodData, Birst, or OBIEE etc.).• 10+ years experience with predictive analytics and data discovery tools (Stata, R, SAS, SPSS, etc.).• Expert in data aggregation, defining facts, dimensions, KPIs and hierarchies.• Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills.• Results-focused, proactive and detail-oriented.• Demonstrated capacity for learning quickly in a fast-paced environment and handling multiple tasks simultaneously.• Maturity to strike a balance between showing initiative and seeking appropriate guidance and input from others.

The Program Director will establish and lead the strategic, high impact, data program from inception through value realization. The Program Director will be fully accountable for all aspects of the program including: objectives and goal setting, approach strategies including Go-to-Market and client engagement tactics, roadmap development, solution architecture, program staffing and vendor sourcing, implementation planning and execution, budget management, and sustainment of the production environment once deployed.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Drive the strategy and execution for gaining data sharing agreements with 3rd party sites. Develop detailed execution plans for technical and business proof of concepts, follow-on rollout and plans to support the transition of legacy data warehouse services to the new platform. Develop a detailed business case in partnership with Program Sponsor and track key KPIs utilizing these metrics to make informed data-driven decisions. Provide day-to-day leadership to the program team members performing data acquisition, data warehouse and BI/analytics development work throughout the product development lifecycle. Build and manage the program plan. Track progress and escalate to issues to program steering committee and/or program sponsor as appropriate. Own communication to sponsor, program steering committee, stakeholders, and program team. Manage 5 direct reports. Establish and provide oversight for vendor contracts for the outsourced program components in the data acquisition and data warehousing functions
Minimum Qualifications:
Formal Education & Certification
BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent; MBA desired but not required PMI certification preferred (PMP-Agile Certified Practitioner or PMP)
Knowledge & Experience
10+ years of project and program management experience, including track record of success leading all aspects of data warehousing projects (data acquisition, data warehousing, data governance and BI/analytics). Significant prior experience leading business and technical teams with 10 – 20 staff. Working knowledge of the product development lifecycle, having previously taken a new concept to market following a formal, structured approach. Working knowledge of applied analytics. Excellent presentation, oral and written communications skills. Previous experience developing and executing communications plans. Working knowledge of data warehouse architectures and related tools and technologies. Experience in Agile development methodologies and related tools such as Scrum, and Agile preferred. Experience in healthcare business required; depth in Health Information Exchange and/or Hospital-based provider services a strong plus. Experience working with customers and prospects in a consulting or professional services capacity a plus Domain expertise in healthcare software products such as Epic, Cerner and Meditech helpful but not required
Personal Attributes
Possesses well-developed business judgment, which permits the creation of meaningful insight from potentially disparate findings. Aptitude to quickly come up to speed on new concepts with ability to grasp complexity, coupled with a passion to simplify High degree of intrinsic motivation to learn new knowledge and skills Flexible, optimistic attitude, coupled with tenacity and resourcefulness Results-focused, proactive and detail-oriented Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority Ability to multi-task, prioritize, schedule and meet deadlines Analytical orientation and possess strong problem-solving skills, demonstrated by the ability to structure an issue and analyze alternative solutions.

body:
CEP America and MedAmerica is looking for a statistician to join a talented team of physician leaders, scientists, analysts and engineers. The CEP Director of Analytics and the Data Science and BI team work on a variety of exciting analytics and modeling projects that have a direct impact on improving care for CEP America/MedAmerica’s patients. The ideal candidate will be a strong analytic thinker with 5+ years of industry experience focusing on forecasting, modeling and statistical analysis to drive analysis and innovation based on stakeholder data.
Responsibilities include a wide variety of data analytics, forecasting and predictive modeling problems, providing analytical/strategic-thinking and leadership skills that enable project teams to:• Isolate clinical and business issues;• Design and execute analytics for studying business issues (market research, scenario planning, forecasting, market share, profitability, etc);• Bring technical/content expertise (competitive intelligence, utilization, financial analysis, deep data analysis and programming);• Vet findings and make formal recommendations to team;• Create documents that inform research questions and hypotheses.
Analytics and Modeling:• Perform quantitative analysis, extracting information from data and using it to provide insights.• Conduct analysis on large-scale and moderate to complex data sets to uncover new trends and patterns.• Analyze, mine and interpret custom data and determine the “why” of the results; prepare the “story” and present findings using dashboards, charts, graphs, reports and presentations.• Provide statistical consulting to stakeholders, evaluating new statistical methods and proposing new statistical methods when necessary.
Research and Publication:• Work as part of a team to design, analyze, and publish research findings.• Contribute to the conduct of studies including leading the study design, secondary research and advising on study decisions that have implications for the analysis.• Contribute to development, design and authoring of white papers, industry reports and various publications.
Our Ideal Candidate Profile:• MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Business Administration or a related field.• Extensive health care clinical, quantitative and operational experience to understand client needs.• 5+ years of industry experience in data mining and statistical analysis using analytic tools such as Stata, R, SAS, SPSS.• Experience with BI/data visualization tools (QlikView, Tableau, Business Objects, MicroStrategy, Cognos, GoodData, Birst, or OBIEE etc.).• Experience in data aggregation, defining facts, dimensions, KPIs and hierarchies.• Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills.• Results-focused, proactive and detail-oriented.• Demonstrated capacity for learning quickly in a fast-paced environment and handling multiple tasks simultaneously.• Maturity to strike a balance between showing initiative and seeking appropriate guidance and input from others.

body:
We’re looking for a communicative Data Scientist to become part of our outstanding team in Munich. Along with your colleagues you are responsible for optimizing the algorithms which power our search results. If you are interested in algorithm’s prototyping as well as in application - then Stylight is the place to be for you!
Your Responsibilities

You develop models for the ranking algorithm of our search server.
You evaluate advances in scientific literature if adaptable to our use cases.
You implement prototypes for ranking on search pages.
You evaluate A/B tests and devise test roadmaps.

Your Profile

You have at least two years experience doing quantitative analysis and a MSc or better degree in engineering or mathematics.
You posses in-depth knowledge of statistics and statistical software such as R, MATLAB, python.
You are experienced with machine learning algorithms and modeling.
You have ideally worked with tools to process large scale, sparse datasets (e.g. Hadoop, hive, spark).
You have experience in administering A/B tests, ideally in e-commerce.
You have previously brought scientific findings to production.
You have working coding knowledge sufficient to build prototypes and analyse large data sets.

Your Team

We work in a cross-functional team with our business people and develop the ranking of our products.
We are an agile team and there will be four other engineers and developers within your team.
We code primarily in Python.
We visualize our tasks on analog boards.

Why join Stylight?

We asked your future colleagues, here are their top responses:
Hands-on work after quick ramp up & openness to new solutions and improvements.
You are provided with moral and financial support to learn, go to conferences, do other things than your tasks.
International and highly motivated environment with open business culture over all departments and flat hierarchy.
Munich's landscape, architecture, nature, museums, and restaurants are all top notch. In terms of life quality, it has been reported to be in the top 10 of the world.
For more information check out: http://tech.stylight.com/

Up for the Challenge?Does this sound like the perfect job for you? Then do not hesitate and apply today on www.stylight.com/jobs/. We are looking forward to receiving your complete application! Your contact person: Sandra Jasarevic

Our Sr. UX Designer will be responsible for leading and driving the strategic UI and design future of our web and mobile sites and applications. Along with a Product Owner and Lead Developer, the Sr. UX Designer is a member of a product discovery team, which in turn is responsible for assessing the viability, usability, and technical feasibility of new product ideas. In this critical product leadership role, the Sr. UX Designer provides broad user experience strategy, visual and interaction design leadership, and user-centered design methodologies to deliver measurable satisfaction and performance improvements. This position is responsible for working closely with product owners, web developers, and other designers to create innovative designs, translating business needs into best-in-class user-focused solutions.

Organize and nurture user panels.• Participate with product owners in the development of product strategies and roadmaps that deliver outstanding web and mobile experiences.• Participate in the definition and improvement of product performance metrics.• Keep abreast of industry trends and technologies and perform competitive analyses to identify new opportunities to serve the company's goals.• Refinement, maintenance and enforcement of our current design guidelines and strategies. body:
PacificSource is anything but a typical health plan. We're a growing, independent, not-for-profit organization with an 82-year history and reputation for service excellence. At PacificSource it is our 700+ employees that make a difference. We invest in the communities we serve by partnering with local providers to deliver high quality, accessible healthcare, and through charitable giving and personal involvement with non-profit organizations. Join us in our mission of helping people get the healthcare they need and let your work make a difference, too. We offer excellent benefits, competitive wages, and opportunities for growth and promotion.
Benefits: PacificSource provides excellent benefits to ensure the well being of employees and their dependents. Employer-paid benefits include medical, vision and dental insurance, incentive program, paid time off and holidays, 401k plan, training and education opportunities, life insurance and additional voluntary programs including a flexible spending account.
Nature and Scope: Provide data analysis for PacificSource to achieve the goals and initiatives identified in our Strategic Plan. Primary subject of analytic support will be related to analysis of cost and utilization of health services, in support of large employer reporting, financial modeling for provider contracting analysis, and identification of opportunities and evaluation of health services activities, including, but not limited to, disease management, wellness programs, and early identification of high risk populations. Analytical role may vary and involve knowledge of contract language, healthcare utilization, performance analysis for clinical programs, state and federal guidelines.
Essential Functions:
1.Perform accurate and complete data extraction from claims data warehouse, including medical, pharmacy and laboratory data sets, to meet project requirements.
2.Analyze health care data, utilization, quality initiatives, outcome, and performance analysis for clinical programs.
3.Assist in the development, implementation and evaluation of disease management and pharmacy management methodologies across diseases. Develop analyses to evaluate new program features including testing and implementation of new clinical programs.
4.Prepare and analyze regular cost and utilization reporting for large external customers, including interpretation of results and recommendations to improve performance through benefit, disease management, and other program changes. Work with underwriters to prepare employer presentations.
5.Serve as lead for the monthly reports produced in AUA by owning the project and coordinating with all contributors. Facilitate the meetings related to the monthly reports.
6.Support of provider contracting through analysis of cost and utilization and modeling of new contractual provision.
7.Provide information and support for ad hoc analytic projects for internal customers.
8.Gather and generate information used to understand health costs and assist with making recommendations to health plan on cost analysis.
9.Work with very large data sets and performs statistical analysis and modeling techniques, including the use of standard statistical packages such as SAS, SPSS, or KXEN.
10.Perform data analytics including standard deviation, downside risk etc. as well as utilize index characteristics.
11.Assist in the development of capabilities and performance measurements.
12.Respond to ad-hoc analytic requests.
Work Experience: Three years experience in medical/health insurance is preferred as is demonstrated by business experience with analyzing data. An understanding of healthcare data trends and experience with financial modeling tools is essential. Experience with predictive modeling tools and program evaluation a plus. Familiarity with NCQA is helpful but not a requirement.
Education, Certificates, Licenses: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Public Health or similar research related field or equivalent work experience required.
Knowledge: Working knowledge of medical costs is desired, while experience with medical coding and terminology is also preferred. Proven ability to manage multiple projects and competing deadlines. Ability to solve complex problems. Ability to deal responsibly with confidential information. Proficiency in SAS and other technical applications such as SQL, ACCESS, and web-based database tools. Skilled in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook. Ability to work in a team environment and manage multiple priorities.
Environment: Work inside in a general office setting with ergonomically configured equipment. Travel is required approximately less than 5% of the time.
Physical Requirements: Stoop and bend. Sit and/or stand for extended periods of time while performing core job functions. Repetitive motions to include typing, sorting and filing. Light lifting and carrying of files and business materials. Ability to read and comprehend both written and spoken English. Communicate clearly and effectively.
Disclaimer: This job description indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position and is subject to change. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position. Employment remains AT-WILL at all times.
For more information on this or other positions and to complete a required application, please visit us online at www.pacificsource.com/careers.
PacificSource is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status, such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or age.

body:
MedAmerica is embarking on a plan to improve the information security posture of the organization. The Information Security Program Manager will need to help establish, implement and manage the program along with associated projects to ensure the projects/activities are adequately managed, communicated and aligned with the broader initiatives within the CEP/MedAmerica organization.    

Purpose of Role

Establishes InfoSec Program, develop cadence, manages budget and communicates program status to Stakeholders and Compliance
Actively Manages Information Security Projects and initiatives.
Performs project management or coordination functions with a focus on requirements gathering, assessment and selection of suitable vendor technologies, coordinating internal resources for process development and documentation and coordinating with 3rd party implementation partners.


Key Responsibilities

Establish InfoSec program, plan and execute projects and initiatives
Plan, perform, document, and communicate program status for information security projects that result in the implementation of processes, applications and technologies addressing information security-related risks and threats.
Coordinates closely within IT (Service Desk, InfoSec, TechOps, Product Development, etc.), Legal and Compliance, HR, Privacy and Communications teams to ensure project milestones and deliverables are met.
Collaborate with and communicate project status to key stakeholders, including CISO, CDO, Legal, Compliance, IT leaders, Application and Technical teams.
Proactively communicate emerging project risks, such as resource conflicts constraints to project sponsors
Work closely with Information Security, IT, Legal, HR, Compliance and Privacy leaders to understand applicable regulatory and policy requirements.


Qualifications

Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in enterprise security management, preferably in a healthcare industry.
Experience with planning and implementing technical projects with an emphasis on information security (i.e. Vulnerability Management, Data Encryption, Access Control, SIEM, Security Policy and Procedures implementation, etc.).
Understanding of HIPAA Security and Privacy rules.
Understanding of NIST 800-53, 800-66 and NIST Security Guidelines.
Demonstrable knowledge of information security areas, such as authentication, encryption, logging & monitoring, vulnerability management, data loss encryption, identity and access management.
Information Security certifications such as CISSP, CISM preferred.
Agile, Scrum, PMP and/or ITIL certification is a plus

body:
“In this volatile business of ours, we can ill afford to rest on our laurels, even to pause in retrospect. Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.” Walt was on to something when he said that, and it continues to ring true today.
The Experience Insights team seeks to tell the story of our Guests’ holistic vacation experiences and pioneer new tactics that enhance Guest vacation experiences through data science, data integration, statistical modeling/analysis, and delivery of innovative services. Through close partnership with other analytical groups throughout Walt Disney World, the Experience Insights team also serves to get our organization to view the Guest experience and our business in exciting new ways.
ResponsibilitiesThe Experience Insights team supports a range of critical projects and issues by leveraging their deep understanding of all areas of Walt Disney World. This position will be responsible for delivering information to support strategic decisions with data-driven insights on both new and established Guest experience drivers. Responsibilities include: heavy data mining and analytics; strong statistical expertise; integration with key business and technical partners; and visualization of the broader scope.
Measurement:Compile and aggregate data sets from multiple sources leveraging SQL/SAS/RProvide insight into changes and recommendations for improvements including predictive modeling/forecastingTranslate Guest experience data into insightful and actionable information to support business decisions
Strategic Decision Making:Interface with multiple teams and stakeholders, e.g., consumer insight, technology, marketing, operations, revenue management and analytics, industrial engineering, etc.Structure and execute operational and strategic initiatives by gathering and synthesizing relevant data, leading analyses and working with Experience Insights team and key stakeholders to deliver recommendations

body:
About CrossLend: 
At CrossLend, we’re proud to be trailblazers in the bold new world of digital credit mediation and financing, with our pioneering cross-border marketplace lending platform.
It’s our vision to resolve the supply and demand dilemma of traditional lending in the European market by connecting borrowers from high-interest rate countries with investors from low-interest rate countries, through our unique cross-border marketplace lending platform. We’re bridging Europe’s credit divide to create fresh opportunities for people on both sides of the coin.

About your role:

You will be the person responsible for all technical decisions. Our data science system makes decisions on loans which amounts sum up to 7 figures per month.
You will retrieve data from any source (mostly APIs), wrangle it and integrate it into our system.
You will prioritize your own work and find pragmatic solutions to our problems.
You are not scared of doing different things. You can work close to DevOps, web services or PHP programmers in a given moment.
You will help us build a team of Pythoners in the near future.


About your profile:

You are a Python guru and you have some experience with libraries like numpy and pandas.
You have solid experience with relational databases. You don’t have to write code for a problem that you can solve with some SQL tricks.
You have a solid background in math and statistics, you are not scared of code that performs interpolations and statistic calculations.
You know when and how to say no to stakeholders.
You bulletproof your code against errors and strive to make it beautiful and simple.
You are capable of working with machine learning specialists.
You are fluent in English and willing to learn (some) financial language.


About CrossLendians: 
We are an awesome team of more than 60 people from 20 different countries. We work cooperatively in the same building located in the heart of Berlin (at the Sony Center at Potsdamer Platz) with our office language being English.
What characterises us:

We love to work in a very international and communicative environment
We are all driven by passion and results
We all believe that everyone has a big impact in the organisation
We value personal and professional development inside the company
We have fun at work. A lot. Full branded kicker, free coffee, fruit and beverages are always available


Do you identify yourself with the position? Would you like to be part of our team?
We are looking forward to receiving your application! 
This position is available immediately.
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.
APPLY TODAY, START TOMORROW!

body:
Join a place where innovation and creativity are a way of life- and love what you do.
Why Progressive? We're a company that doesn't stop until a job is finished, with a goal to consistently test our limits and exceed expectations.
Data Scientist
As a member of the Pricing Data Science team, you’ll use advanced analytical, machine learning and data transformation techniques to develop practical tools and analyses that solve complex pricing business problems. In some cases, you’ll use languages like R or Python to employ newer techniques like tree ensembles, neural nets, and clustering to solve questions that we’ve had for years. In other cases, you’ll try to answer questions that we really haven’t asked before. The problems you’ll have to solve are wide-ranging and will require a lot of different techniques, including some you’ll probably have to research, learn or create. Final products could range from just reporting out the results to simple web apps to more sophisticated visualizations and decision-support tools.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience Needed to be Successful: * Bachelor's degree with quantitative focus in Econometrics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science or related field (e.g. Mathematics) and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience (including working towards a Master's degree) in Statistical/Quantitative Modeling and/or Machine Learning tools (R, Python, etc) and in using various database tools (e.g. Hadoop, SQL) processing large volumes of structured and unstructured data. * In lieu of a degree, a minimum of 4-6 years of relevant experience in Statistical/Quantitative Modeling and/or Machine Learning tools and in using various database tools processing large volumes of structured and unstructured data * A minimum of 2-4 years experience with mathematical model creation and/or evaluation, hypothesis testing and experimental design. * Demonstrated skills in data mining, machine learning, programming, dynamic optimization * Experience in thought leadership in applying data driven models that had a tangible impact on business * Ability to query databases and apply advanced data manipulation techniques across multiple sources * Passion for empirical research and answering hard questions with data * Strong communication skills, both verbal and written * Ability to understand and articulate the “big picture” and simplify complex ideas * Solid project management skills and ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting tight and potentially changing deadlines in a high-paced and dynamic environment * Strong problem solving and structuring skills; ability to mine large datasets and surface actionable insights. * Ability to identify and learn applicable new techniques independently as needed
Highly Preferred Skills and Experience: * Experience with R, Python or similar programming or statistical scripting languages * Experience with distributed computing systems like Hadoop and/or Spark * Experience with machine learning algorithms including but not limited to gradient boosted trees, random forest, neural nets and ensemble methods * A demonstrated command of the concepts of hyperparameter tuning, model validation, statistical inference and feature engineering * Experience with in-memory database and data transformation tools such as data.table or dplyr (R), pandas (python) * Experience working with remote environments such as Amazon Web Services and Linux Servers * Experience working with version control software such as Git, Mercurial, or SVN. * Working knowledge of designing, developing, programming and supporting software programs/applications
Progressive Offers:
* Gainshare bonus of up to 30% (Our annual Gainshare bonus program rewards employees based on the company's achievement of annual performance objectives)* Flexible work arrangements, casual dress, and great corporate culture * Ongoing training, tuition assistance and opportunities for career advancement* Award winning, inclusive environment with Employee Resource Groups* On-site clinical care and fitness center * Employee discounts* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits* 401(k) plan
 Apply Now
Apply now and find out what it's like to be valued for the talent and passion you invest in all that you do.Here are a few things to keep in mind when applying with us:* You'll be asked for information around your employment history and educational background* After applying, you are able to monitor your status in the recruiting process on your profile* A recruiter will contact you by email or phone if you are under consideration for a current position* Some positions require candidates to meet company requirements on our online assessment test* Candidates must pass a comprehensive background check.
Sponsorship is not available for this position. Progressive generally does not sponsor foreign national candidates for work authorization except for positions that in Progressive’s determination require highly specialized knowledge and for which candidate sponsorship is appropriate. Equal Opportunity Employer

body:
Wrap Media is looking for a Senior Data Engineer who is interested in incorporating a multitude of data sources to design and build data frameworks. The data engineers will work closely with the engineering team and product management to meet new business requirements and develop data processing workflows.
Wrap Media is a groundbreaking mobile-first story telling and commerce platform delivering the narrative web. We are democratizing mobile by providing a web-based native app alternative enabling unprecedented engagement, activation and conversion for brands, publishers and digital businesses.
Responsibilities 
− Design and build data frameworks (ingestion, processing, distribution, access) for core data platform.
− Design and build robust and scalable data engineering solutions for structured and unstructured data conducive for business insights, reporting and analytics.
− Design and implement data models that scale across the enterprise. − Work closely with stakeholders (Reporting team, Analysts and Business) and source system domain experts.
− Function as data expert on usage of data at Chegg.
Requirements 
− 5+ years working as an engineer in a data focused team building data processing frameworks and capabilities. We are not looking for a traditional data warehouse ETL developer.
− Extensive experience working with structured and unstructured data, programming, and scripting languages.
− Experience working with big data technologies (like Hadoop, Java Map/Reduce, Hive, Pig, Impala, Presto), real-time processing frameworks (like Storm, AWS Kinesis), MPP platforms (like Redshift, Greenplum, Vertica) and relational databases.
− Expertise troubleshooting data quality issues, analyzing data requirements, and utilizing big data systems.
− Passionate about producing high-quality engineering deliverables and communicating results to a broad audience.
− Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams.
What Sets Wrap Media Apart Unlike other great technology companies started by first time founders, Wrap Media’s founding leadership team has numerous wins building and leading great technology companies. We are channeling this experience to build something remarkable at Wrap Media.
• CEO/ Founder of Wrap Media founded & took public companies Viant and Scient.
• Leadership team comes from Yahoo, Salesforce.com, Oracle, Frog Design, Bazaarvoice, Icix, Terracotta, Pantheon, InMobi, Scribd and AudioPress.
• Closed Series B for a total of $18.2 million within a year of launching the company, led by Raine Ventures and Salesforce Ventures.
• Wrap Media is the first “WE” corporation, 10% of Wrap’s capitalization is willed to philanthropy.
• As a WE corporation, we hire leaders, visionaries and advocates of a meaningful work culture that inspires people to challenge themselves and use their voice.
Life at Wrap Media Wrap Media attracts the thoughtful, naturally inquisitive and spirited.  We think about mobile from new perspectives. We encourage each other to push boundaries. Our office is based in downtown San Francisco convenient to all public transportation. Our people enjoy access to the best tools available, an open and collaborative work environment and a supportive culture inspiring them to do their very best. We offer great salaries, generous equity, 100% employee health coverage, three weeks vacation and delicious catered meals among other perks. We encourage you to learn more about working here!

body:
360dialog is a dynamic and expanding app marketing automation start-up based in the heart of Berlin. As a first-mover in the market, we help brands to (re)engage and convert their audience in order to maximize customer lifetime value and enhance the customer journey. We were chosen as experts in mobile solutions for major players (such as Axel Springer group or LOVOO, … ).
Our platform deals with huge amounts of data and billions of requests. Our international and multi-disciplinary team, consisting of Developers, QA Engineers, Product Managers and Data Scientists, has an excellent proven track record in realtime computing (working in Finance and AdTech). Together we are developing the next generation of marketing automation technology. Distributed and fault tolerant, our system is able to process vast amounts of data in realtime. We are looking for a passionate Senior Data Scientist who wants to have a direct impact on the optimization strategies for our realtime platform.
Your responsibilities: 

Design and implement data ingestion and storage strategies for large scale datasets
Design and implement machine learning and similar optimisation strategies.
Work together with the Development team on the implementation of optimization strategies.
Work closely with the business stakeholders and make sure our data and optimization strategies are aligned with the business goals.
Support the ongoing optimization of our data architecture and infrastructure.
Support our Product Management team on optimization and data requirements.
Support our Business Analysis team with data crunching, analysis and interpretation.

Our Ideal Candidate Profile:

Master degree or better in Mathematics or Statistics.
At least 3 years of proven track in data modeling and quantitative analysis.
Strong experience with modern machine learning methods ( incl. logistic regression, neural networks, support vector machines, clustering).
Expert in using a statistical package, such as R, Matlab/Octave or the Python scientific package.
Experience working with the Big Data ecosystem (Map Reduce, Spark).
Very strong set of data analysis skills.
Must have exceptional written and spoken communication skills (English).

Why work for us? 

The opportunity to use your skills to the full and get recognized for your accomplishments.
You will be part of creating the next level solution in marketing automation technology.
Independent work in an innovative, rapidly growing company committed to success.
An open, supportive and fun atmosphere in an international and dedicated team.
If you are relocating to Berlin, we support you will all you need to get settled in.
We value each individual and enjoy each other’s company at team events.
Cereal, fruits, sweets and beverages you like await you each day…

Sainsbury’s is streets ahead of the retail industry in terms of digital innovation. Here at our centre of excellence in the heart of London, which is itself evolving as our business does, we’re crafting world-beating apps and services to delight our customers. And we’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented Digital & Technology professionals in the UK.
Right now, we’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to source and analyse all kinds of data to tell articulate engaging stories using the results. The projects you work on will bring about the development of dazzling new applications and systems, turning your clever hypotheses into actual, real life solutions that wow our customers.
As a Senior Data Scientist you’ll:
• Support the planning and execution of Data Science projects
• Enable the development of amazing new applications based on your insights and algorithms
• Help create a production solution that facilitates our Business As Usual (BAU) team’s work
• Develop close working relationships with key internal customers and really raise awareness of Data Science
You’ll need:
• A postgraduate qualification or equivalent experience in pure mathematics, physics, statistics or similar
• Specialist ability to source and extract data at scale • Brilliant analytical skills and the ability to turn your insights into powerful narratives
• The kind of people skills that will help you build great relationships with internal customers

Don't miss this opportunity to join one of the most forward-thinking retailers in the UK.

body:
InnoGames, based in Hamburg, is one of the leading developers and publishers of online games with more than 150 million registered players around the world. Currently, more than 350 people from 30 nations are working in the Hamburg-based headquarters. We have been characterized by dynamic growth ever since the company was founded in 2007. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.
The Analytics Department at InnoGames supports and counsels all departments of the company with data-based findings. The four areas Game Analysis, Marketing Analysis, Data Mining and Market Research allow us to comprehensively examine a variety of issues from different perspectives. As a Data Scientist you take on the expert role of complex statistical modelling as part of our Marketing Analysis in our team of 13 and get involved in exciting issues such as Lifetime Value forecasts or the influence of TV spots on other Marketing channels.
Your mission:

Maintain & continuously refine our Marketing Attribution & Forecast modelling with algorithms that represent spill-over-effects, the impact of store rankings and the like
Continuously monitor and analyze our international campaign activities in Performance Marketing, TV, CRM, and Partnerships
Create forecast models and business cases for risk assessment and budget planning
Advise the Marketing Department by identifying risks, potentials and trends of campaign performances as well as propose a recommended course of action
Evaluate country-specific marketing campaigns and KPI trends
Continuously evolve our marketing reporting by defining relevant KPIs and a compelling visual format of the complex campaign structure
Closely collaborate with other subdivisions of the Analytics team for joint projects as well as the perpetual communication with the Marketing departments

Your profile:

You hold a university degree with a focus on Statistics or Marketing
You are an expert in working with R to summarize and analyze large quantities of data with adequate statistical methods. It is a plus if you have already worked on projects with Predictive Modelling/Scoring
Experience with query languages is desirable
Basic knowledge of online marketing campaigns and experience in evaluating performance-oriented campaigns would be a plus as well
You have extensive professional experience (5+ years) in Analytics, Market Research or Marketing, preferably in the online business, ideally in the gaming industry
You are dedicated and work with a pragmatic approach. You enjoy to do pioneering work and to explore new ideas and areas independently, but you are also a good team player

Preferable:

Experience in testing mobile applications
ISTQB/ISEB certification
Experience in automating tests on the UI-level as well as on the service-level
Experience with MySQL/Oracle/PostgreSQL databases
Experience in mobile HTTP debugging (using for example Charles Proxy)

Why join us?

Agile and multi-disciplinary team for quick decisions
Learn from strategy game freaks
Be part of the success story of InnoGames
Smartphone or tablet of your own choice
Flexible working hours
Amazing team that sticks together
We help you to relocate to Hamburg

Be bright - Light up your career!
What makes us special?
We are here to make great games for our playersWe empower people within an international company cultureWe work result orientated and strive for long-term successLive in Hamburg – the Games City of Germany!
Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a QA Technical Tester (m/f) with us? Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Christopher Grundmann.

body:
We're on a mission to make millions of children around the world more curious, clever and kind.
Lost My Name combines the power of stories with the possibilities of technology, to create magical, personalised books for children. Our books have redefined personalisation in the publishing industry. Started as a pet project by three dads and one uncle, we’ve now sold over 1 million copies worldwide. Backed by Google Ventures among other leading investors, we’re embarking on an exciting journey to create a magical and personalised entertainment company that inspires children everyday.
The Opportunity
We’re looking to kick off a brand new Business Intelligence team and you’ll be our first hire! This role comes with have a wide remit to oversee the development of a full data analytics & technology toolkit. You’ll lead the creation of best in class solutions to help us gather, store, process, analyse and share all business intelligence requirements.
The Head of Business Intelligence will also create a strong technical platform on which to grow an agile team of analysts. You will direct the scoping, selection and build processes on:
Improving retention & customer lifecycle managementETL and data quality managementData visualisations & dashboarding toolsPredictive analytics & machine learningYour first big project will be to get to grips with our marketing analytics database. We are building our marketing data infrastructure and you will work closely with marketing and technology teams to make it smarter and bigger. You’ll lead on marketing analytics data and analysis, from tagging campaigns through to attribution modelling to help design the system.
Who you’d work with
As you’re building our BI discipline you will have the opportunity to engage and deploy solutions across:
MarketingProductOperationsInternationalFinanceBoard LevelThe Head of Business Intelligence will work closely with our Founders to help shape future strategy as well as coaching and mentoring all parts of the business to the value and application of data analysis.
Lost My Name in numbers
Here’s some interesting facts (we think so anyway!) and data about us:

Experience of complex data structures and large data stores working with API'sExperience in statistical modelling and machine learningKnowledge and experience of working in a start-up environmentBenefits

body:
General Overview
Legendary is a leading global media company with film, television, digital and comics divisions dedicated to owning, producing and delivering innovative content like Jurassic World, Godzilla, and The Dark Knight to mainstream audiences with a targeted focus on the powerful fandom demographic. In aggregate, Legendary Pictures-associated productions have realized grosses of more than $10 billion worldwide at the box office. A trusted brand built on quality and authenticity, we create unmissable cultural event properties and breathe life into the most epic myths of our time.
Legendary’s Applied Analytics division sources and leverages emerging data sets to quantitatively model, predict, and influence consumer purchasing decisions in the entertainment industry and beyond. Based in Boston, Legendary’s Applied Analytics division is a major strategic initiative for the company, supported with more than 40 full time staff. A highly innovative, rapidly growing group within one of Hollywood’s most successful film studios, Legendary Applied Analytics is unique within the industry.
Applied Analytics is seeking quantitative researchers with applied experience in scientific research, computation, and statistics looking for an opportunity in a fast paced business environment within a dynamic industry. The Researcher will work with a diverse team of scientists, software developers, and business strategists to advance Legendary’s content development and positioning through quantitative analysis and statistical modeling. Applied Analytics’ areas of impact include Legendary entertainment properties spanning film, TV, and sports and extend to other domains and consumer brands.
Examples of quantitative team projects have included:

Adapting cutting edge natural language processing methods to explore, model, and interpret the millions of social media posts around our properties in order to improve marketing and positioning.
Informing the decision making of studio executives on which movies and TV shows have the greatest potential based on the statistical synthesis of diverse social listening practices.
Predicting box office performance of films with a Bayesian framework incorporating audience traits inferred from social media, thematic decompositions from machine learning approaches, market characteristics, and more.

This role will provide the opportunity to work on exciting new properties in film and throughout entertainment, to develop novel and creative statistical methodologies for the analysis of original datasets, and to communicate analytical results to other researchers and entertainment domain experts. Our research group has broad freedom to explore cutting-edge technologies and help shape the agenda for entire Applied Analytics division.
This position is based in Boston.
Responsibilities include, but will not be limited to:

Focus on research and development through statistical modeling of large datasets from across the entertainment industry
Use data to interpret and predict consumer decision-making behavior throughout entertainment
Develop, extend, and apply models and code from our team’s toolkit of statistical and analytical methodologies for industry-specific, social media, and consumer records datasets
Being an active member of Legendary's Research Team -- comprising researchers with PhD's and advanced degrees in the computational, physical, and social sciences -- by participating in group meetings, working on collaborative projects, and mentoring junior researchers.

Required qualifications:

Master’s degree in statistics, physical or quantitative social sciences, computational science or a related field; or 3 years applied experience in data science and statistics
Fluency with one or more of the following numerical computation environments: python scientific computing stack, R, Matlab
Experience in the analysis and visualization of large, complex datasets 
Expertise with one or more of the following machine learning and statistical modeling domains: quantitative textual analysis, Bayesian modeling, statistical or network analysis of social media data, image recognition and classification
Available to begin summer 2016 or earlier.

Recommended qualifications:

Ph.D. or 5 years applied experience in a related field
Can contribute expert domain experience and a proven record of proposing and developing original research ideas
Demonstrable experience in communicating research methods and results to both technical and non-technical audiences
Fluency with SQL, version control software, Unix, and other data management and development systems

Interested candidates should e-mail analyticsrecruiting@legendary.com with a resume and cover letter.

body:
Arterys (www.arterys.com) is working on applying artificial intelligence and deep learning to healthcare to impact the lives of millions of people. We are looking for passionate and talented computer vision experts to advance the field of medical imaging using deep learning.
Much of clinical radiology consists of clinicians performing tedious tasks that would greatly benefit from automation, such as early detection of cancerous lesions, segmenting anatomical regions and characterizing pathologies. Arterys’ goal is to use the latest machine learning technology to automate these tasks and help radiologists work more efficiently and improve outcomes.
As an Image Scientist at Arterys, you will be part of the core team responsible for developing novel deep learning-based approaches to automate many aspects of radiology across many different imaging modalities (CT, MRI, etc.) and organ systems (heart, brain, lung, etc.). Algorithms that you develop will save radiologists valuable time and increase the accuracy and consistency of radiological analysis while improving patient outcomes. You’ll spend time discussing important clinical problems with key physicians, prototyping novel algorithms and helping to productize and integrate them into our state-of-the-art cloud-based radiological viewing software. You’ll develop beautiful tools from messy, real-world data sets and you’ll help improve the lives of millions of patients.
Required Skills
- Strong background in machine learning and deep learning, particularly convolutional neural networks- M.S. or Ph.D. in computer science or a related engineering discipline- Excellent software development skills- Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, particularly Python and C++
Nice to Have Skills
- 2+ years industry experience- Experience in the following areas:  - Image processing, particularly with OpenCV  - Medical images and the DICOM format  - Amazon Web Services, particularly EC2 and S3  - Crowdsourcing (e.g., Mechanical Turk)
How to Apply
Please e-mail your resume and a short cover letter to ai-careers@arterys.com

Master degree or better in Mathematics or Statistics
3+ years in data modeling and quantitative analysis
2+ years in ML algorithmic design, predictive modeling, and recommendation systems 
Experience implementing Regression, Bayesian, Decision Trees, Random Forests, SVM, Clustering, Instance based methods, Association Rules, and Dimensionality Reduction
Expert in using a statistical package, such as R, Matlab/Octave, the Python scientific package or other
Experience working with the BigML, Google Prediction API, Azure ML, or other hosted machine learning systems
Very strong set of data analysis skills
Must have exceptional written and spoken communication skills (English)

Why work for us?.  

We are fun, easy-going people, who love what we do
We value working with the best and brightest
We reward both experience and efficiency

body:
Job Description
Come talk with us if you are interested in tackling questions like the following:
What is the best movie of all time? (And how can you be sure?) Are there really only 5 kinds of films? Does Bacon distance matter? Scott Rivers distance? “I need that 3Q ROI forecast by COB Tuesday, so …" How much uncertainty does a first-time director bring to a project? Which actors and actresses working today are underpaid? Can we detect word-of-mouth momentum in films? Which director should retire now?
To answer these questions, the ideal candidate should have a good understanding of probability, linear algebra and multivariate statistics, as well as some mathematical maturity. Some exposure to, and experience with, natural language processing, 'machine learning,' time series, graph theory, etc. are desired.
The ideal candidate should be enthusiastic about data and the movies.
Note: We will be very excited to speak anyone with Natural Language Processing OR Film/Media domain experience.
Skills & Requirements
Since the data does not just come to us, the role involves a fair amount of 'QWERTY work.' The candidate would be responsible for the collection, regularization, storage, and retrieval of data from free, semi-free, and proprietary sources. At a bare minimum, the candidate should be comfortable with R, Python, MySQL, and the linux command line. Experience with docker, GNU Make, bash scripting, cloud computing would be considered favorably.
About CoreCast
At CoreCast, we want to change the way the media industry does business.
Our office in SoMa is close to BART and other transit options.
We're foodies, bikers, and cinephiles. Join us!
If interested, please email a cover letter and resume to jobs@corecast.io. Thanks!

body:
InnoGames, based in Hamburg, is one of the leading developers and publishers of online games with more than 150 million registered players around the world. Currently, more than 350 people from 30 nations are working in the Hamburg-based headquarters. We have been characterized by dynamic growth ever since the company was founded in 2007. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.
The Analytics Department at InnoGames supports and counsels all departments of the company with data-based findings. The four areas Game Analysis, Marketing Analysis, Data Mining and Market Research allow us to comprehensively examine a variety of issues from different perspectives. As a Data Scientist you take on the expert role of complex statistical modelling as part of our Marketing Analysis in our team of 13 and get involved in exciting issues such as Lifetime Value forecasts or the influence of TV spots on other Marketing channels.
Your mission:

Maintain & continuously refine our Marketing Attribution & Forecast modelling with algorithms that represent spill-over-effects, the impact of store rankings and the like
Continuously monitor and analyze our international campaign activities in Performance Marketing, TV, CRM, and Partnerships
Create forecast models and business cases for risk assessment and budget planning
Advise the Marketing Department by identifying risks, potentials and trends of campaign performances as well as propose a recommended course of action
Evaluate country-specific marketing campaigns and KPI trends
Continuously evolve our marketing reporting by defining relevant KPIs and a compelling visual format of the complex campaign structure
Closely collaborate with other subdivisions of the Analytics team for joint projects as well as the perpetual communication with the Marketing departments

Your profile:

You hold a university degree with a focus on Statistics or Marketing
You are an expert in working with R to summarize and analyze large quantities of data with adequate statistical methods. It is a plus if you have already worked on projects with Predictive Modelling/Scoring
Experience with query languages is desirable
Basic knowledge of online marketing campaigns and experience in evaluating performance-oriented campaigns would be a plus as well
You have extensive professional experience (5+ years) in Analytics, Market Research or Marketing, preferably in the online business, ideally in the gaming industry
You are dedicated and work with a pragmatic approach. You enjoy to do pioneering work and to explore new ideas and areas independently, but you are also a good team player

Why join us?

Agile and multi-disciplinary team for quick decisions
Learn from strategy game freaks
Be part of the success story of InnoGames
Flexible working hours
Amazing team that sticks together
We help you to relocate to Hamburg
Smartphone or tablet of your own choice

Be bright - Light up your career!
What makes us special?

We are here to make great games for our players
We empower people within an international company culture
We work result orientated and strive for long-term success
Live in Hamburg – the Games City of Germany! 

Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Data Scientist (m/f) with us? Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Christopher Grundmann.
