body:
DESCRIPTION: 
Onfido is the engine that powers online trust in the new global economy. Having raised over $5m in funding from some of the world’s most prestigious investors, Onfido is one of London’s hottest tech start-ups. A true market-disruptor, our intelligent software revolutionises the archaic background checking industry through automated data aggregation and verification. When it comes to building our team, we don’t mess around. We work in an intense, high growth and fast paced environment and only look to have the best join our growing family. Our brilliant team that has been carefully crafted from all over the world is a group of diverse, tech-savy innovators who believe in rapid iteration and constant growth.
The Role:
Onfido is seeking Machine Learning/Computer Vision Engineers to help us continue to build our amazing product. You'll join a talented and friendly engineering team who pride themselves on delivering great code in an industry where privacy, security and reliability are crucial It's a critical time at Onfido as we aim to scale and evolve our product without sacrificing robustness and quality; an agile, automation-driven and passionate test team will be crucial to our success. The ideal candidate will have industry experience working on a range of classification and image processing problems, e.g. document classification, image auto-rotation, optical character recognition, language modelling, face verification and face recognition. We are looking to hire engineers to build the next generation of the product. We’re looking for experienced back-end engineers to join our talented and rapidly growing engineering team.
Our Stack:
We aim to stay flexible and primarily build in Ruby, with Rails, and our stack also includes PostgreSQL, Redis and RabbitMQ. We’re not dogmatic about technology: we try to make sure we’re choosing tools that are the best fit for the problems we’re solving.
As our Machine Learning/Computer Vision Engineer, you will be responsible for the following:
Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based models.Suggest, collect and synthesise requirements and create effective feature roadmap for Onfido’s background checking technologies.Code deliverables in tandem with Onfido’s engineering team.Adapt standard image processing and machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU).
REQUIREMENTS:
MS degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field with 3 years of relevant experience or Ph.D degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field.
Experience in at least two of the following areas:

Computer Vision
Image/Video Processing
Optical Character Recognition (OCR)
Face Verification, Face Recognition
Document Processing
Large Scale Data Extraction from Documents
Machine Learning
Deep Learning
Coding experience in at least two of C, C++, Lua, Scala, Java
Coding experience in at least two of Perl, Python, PHP or shell scripts
Experience in at least one of the machine learning libraries Torch, Theano or Caffe
Experience in at least one of the environments MATLAB, R

BENEFITS:
Be driven by ambition and curiosity, infused with a lot of fun to make a true impact with an industry-disruptive product. Grow in a stimulating environment brimming with visionary talent, and receive the guidance needed to push your career trajectory forward. We are committed to making Onfido a fantastic place to work, so we go to great lengths to give you what you need to succeed. Everyone who is part of the Onfido family will benefit from:

Share options where our valuation has historically doubled in value every 6 months
A fully stocked kitchen with breakfast, juice bar, soft drinks, unlimited snacks and fresh fruit every day to stay fuelled
A subsidised gym membership to keep the mind clear and the body strong
Unlimited budget for any software or books you need to make your life more efficient and develop your knowledge
Monthly company dinners at some of the hottest restaurants in town
Weekly yoga classes to promote a healthy and balanced mind
Company 5-a-side football league
Quarterly socials (including cookery classes and private cinema trips)
Friday afternoon wine and beers
Relaxed & informal office environment

body:
Position Title: Data ScientistLocation: Naperville, IL
Ecolab is looking for a full-time data scientist in Automation RD&E team. This position will be based in Naperville, IL.
Responsibilities 

Work closely with domain experts from multiple functions in the enterprise (e.g., R&D, marketing, sales, IT, supply chain) to identify problems/gaps that can be solved by data analytics, and growth and/or innovation opportunities that can be enabled through data analytics and modeling.
Collect and understand the business and domain requirement for the problems/opportunities, and translate them into data analytics problem formulation.
Perform explorative research and analysis on available data sources within the organization to proactively identify value added ideas based on the data available. 
Work collectively with other data scientists and analysts from global locations to design and develop data mining and machine learning models and algorithms to solve
Work with stake holders to implement POC (proof of concept) to operationalize ideas and prove the value. 
Provide consultation and support as needed when the ideas and solutions move into production development stage and eventually commercialized.

Qualifications 

PhD or Master's Degree in chemical engineering, systems/industrial engineering, physics, physical chemistry and other related scientific disciplines with 3+ years of industry experience.
Background or experience in statistical data analysis, algorithm design, preferably in the chemical or process industry.
Experience in any of the data analytics software packages such as SAS, Statistica, JMP, MATLAB, R, or Minitab is plus.
Familiarity with general data mining and analytics practices and processes.
General understanding on information management/database technologies.
Past industry experience in water treatment, food services, or food safety is plus.
Strong communication skills with an ability to interact with cross functional stake holders and domain experts.

body:
As a top-10 Global Bank and the most recognized brand in the Australian financial services industry, we offer an environment of opportunity where you can make a significant impact to diverse international businesses.
As the Director of Strategy & Testing in Group Decision Science, you'll be part of a team that is responsible for deriving unique insights from unconventional data sources in order to develop a competitive strategy for expanding our business globally. You will be exposed to a range of international lending products, interacting with culturally and geographically diverse business partners, managing all aspects of the credit and financial management cycle and identifying key learnings that can be applied across different sectors. 
Your role• Creating and managing strategies that support the mission of financial inclusion while driving bottom line growth and profitability for the group• Developing product designs for a wide array of financial services products across multiple markets including articulation of value propositions, and analysis and modelling of financials• Drive stable credit performance in the portfolio by basing decisions on a foundation of novel structural insights; perform analysis using best-in-class techniques to optimize policies, rules and decisions at each stage of the customer life cycle• Leading a small team; provide coaching and mentoring across the organization to support development of talent• Participating as a key stakeholder in the development and deployment of next generation models, scorecards, customer segmentation schemes, expert rules and other types of decision analytics to detect risks and improve returns by leveraging advanced statistical techniques and expert-based methodologies• Developing and executing test strategies and rapidly adjusting course in order to achieve business outcomes• Partnering with business leaders across the organisation in multiple countries to drive results• Some international travel is required 
You will bring• Excellent communication and partnership skills, which are essential for interacting with key stakeholders at all levels, in order to manage, inform and influence outcomes• A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics• Ability to build and leverage the capabilities of a high-performing team, as well as business partners across the enterprise. You will foster innovation, drive critical decisions, hold business partners accountable, and be able to consistently deliver results • A focus on achieving both short and long term goals, even in ambiguous circumstances • Conceptual business thinking – ability to intuit consumer behavior and structure approaches to white-space problems• Ability to understand, consume and think critically about complex concepts, and the confidence to challenge and put forward new ideas• Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and changing environment
Your qualifications• Bachelor's degree (required) or advanced degree (preferred) in Engineering, Quantitative Finance, Operations Research, Econometrics or related field• Minimum of 5 years experience in Consumer financial services analytics including experience in the following: developing and managing credit policies, marketing optimization, quantitative analysis, product development and P&L management• 2 years experience in Management Consulting (preferred)• 2 years experience in People Management
We are looking for people who want to solve interesting problems and be a part of a high performing, world class decision sciences team. You will be able to use your skills to make a real contribution to our business whilst learning from other experts. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D75JNEhCHQw
We are committed to building a respectful and inclusive workplace, supporting diversity and appointing the best person for the role. All information will be held in the strictest of confidence.

body:
Click this link to hear from our team!
As an Associate Director, Data Science at Group Decision Science, you’ll be part of a team that’s building next generation information and analytics capabilities for this top-10 global bank.  Applying cutting edge in real time banking technologies, using transaction information for tens of millions of customers, and leveraging alternative data sources to secure and enhance the financial wellbeing of people, customers and communities. Your efforts will enable financial inclusion for everyday people and small businesses across the globe making a tangible positive difference in their lives and prosperity of local communities. 
Responsibilities

Understand complex business challenges, develop hypotheses, integrate internal and external data sources, analyze them using cutting edge machine learning or statistical modelling techniques to uncover causality (i.e., we go beyond correlations and interesting trends in making decisions that affect people’s financial wellbeing) and synthesizing insights
Propose innovative modelling solutions, evaluate their effectiveness through proof of concept experimentations and refine and enhance them as necessary to ensure scalability and provide support for their implementation. 
Create new models through entire life cycle using the most effective application of supervised, semi-supervised and unsupervised parametric and non-parametric modeling methods.
Investigate the impact of new computing technologies and niche, cutting edge analytical techniques and specialized applications, on the future of banking
Drive, understand, and adapt latest developments in machine learning and statistical modelling and apply them appropriately to solve business problems. 
Clean, manipulate and investigate large data sets

Ideal Qualifications:

Intellectual curiosity. You ask difficult questions and don’t take no for an answer. You contribute in team’s brain storming sessions, provide input on the team’s ideas and look forward to getting feedback on your ideas! Complex and unstructured problems and big data sets don’t faze you but cause you to look for root causes. 
Action focus. You drive results by initiating action, trying things (and sometimes failing at them) through quick prototyping and taking accountability for communicating to the team what works and what does not. You know how to find data, move it around, transform and fill in the gaps and implement your ideas through programming/statistical languages. 
Innovation. Strong academic record and publications in journals or notable outcomes in data science competitions. You look forward to the problem that are new to the industry. Both breakthroughs and continuous improvement of what we do makes your day
Passion for data. You realize that your mathematical representation of reality which we call a model, is 100% dependent on the data it is built from, or implemented on. You like pulling your own data, structuring it, cleaning it and understanding the human and financial behaviors it represents.

Basic Qualifications:

PhD/Post Doc in any field with advanced quantitative focus in modelling oriented discipline including but not limited to Machine learning, Statistics, Psychometrics, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Bioinformatics, Econometrics, Neuroscience, Computer Science.
5+ years of analytical experience including 2-3 years of post-PhD experience in the field of advanced quantitative techniques while working for leading global academic institutes or corporate innovation research labs or analytics organizations of large corporate or in consulting companies in analytics roles.
Nice blend of big data technologies coupled with strong knowledge of predictive modeling methods! Additionally, you must be skilled at clearly communicating your findings and translating them into practical solutions.

Sound knowledge and application in the following:

Advanced statistical methods including complex multivariate statistical methods, discrete choice modelling, conjoint based analysis
Advance knowledge of machine learning methods including classification, regression and clustering methods
Knowledge of heuristic methods and optimization techniques including system modeling and simulations.
Deep programming skills and 3+ years’ experience in R, Perl, Python, or other languages appropriate for large scale analysis of numerical and categorical data 
Advanced quantitative methods relevant to modelling risk and consumer behavior: both parametric and non-parametric modelling, using unguided, semi-guided and guided approaches as appropriate.
Willingness and desire to learn from other data scientists and modellers in the team on the art and science of modelling, feature engineering, decision trade-offs between model complexity and model deployment
Excellent prototyping skills
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills, ability to explain complicated mathematical concepts, algorithms and data structures to all business partners

Technical Pluses:

Experience with graph algorithms such as semi-supervised learning on graphs, graph clustering, community detection, interest/topic graphs, and social network analysis
Knowledge of emerging platforms

We are looking for people who want to solve interesting problems and be a part of a high performing, world class decision sciences team. You will be able to use your skills to make a real contribution to our business whilst learning from other experts. 
We are committed to building a respectful and inclusive workplace, supporting diversity and appointing the best person for the role. All information will be held in the strictest of confidence.
job_title: Associate Director, Data Science at Group Decision Sciences

CommBank is a top 10 global bank and the most recognized financial services brand in Australia. body:
We’re Seldon, a disruptive data science start-up based in London. We believe that machine intelligence will soon be at the core of every business as processes become increasingly automated. That’s why we created Seldon, an open source platform with cutting edge artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms to help companies improve their business intelligence.
Several multinational companies are already using our platform, meaning the work that we do impacts hundreds of millions of users monthly. And that gives us a warm fuzzy feeling inside :-)
As well as improving our core platform, we’re also experimenting with neural networks, deep learning, machine learning, computer vision and computational neuroscience to create cutting edge technology that will change the future of business intelligence.
Finally, we’re an engineering-led organization that puts open-source at the centre of everything we do. So you’ll feel right at home amongst a team of passionate fellow data scientists and open-source enthusiasts.
Feel free to browse our website or fork us on GitHub.
Where do you come in?
Seldon is looking to recruit another data scientist to work on a broad range of exciting large-scale client projects and play a key role in the development of our open-source machine learning platform and SaaS service.
Requirements
Essential

Core expertise in machine learning and recommender systems

Highly desirable

Experience with machine learning toolkits: scikit learn, Spark MLlib, Vowpal Wabbit, XGBoost, Torch, other Deep Learning frameworks
Familiarity with Java, Python, Scala
Experience with deep learning at a theoretical and practical level
Commercial machine learning experience
Bonus points
Contributions to Open Source software
Participated in Kaggle competitions

Benefits

Work directly with the CTO and VP Engineering.
Share options to align you with the long-term success of the company.
Exciting fast-paced start-up challenges with an ambitious technical team and unlimited potential for professional growth.
Satisfaction of knowing that your efforts, in partnership with some of the world’s most exciting and prestigious companies, will help to impact hundreds of millions of people.
Some of London’s most vibrant startup culture at Warner Yard in Clerkenwell, a hub of technical excellence and home to Techstars and investors, with constant activity and events.
Opportunity to travel regularly and represent Seldon at industry events.

body:
IHG is one of the world's leading hotel companies – we have 726,876 rooms in more than 5,000 hotels in nearly 100 countries around the world.We operate a broad portfolio of hotel brands – InterContinental®, HUALUXE® Hotels and Resorts, Kimpton® Hotels and Restaurants, Crowne Plaza®, Hotel Indigo®, EVEN™ Hotels, Holiday Inn®, Holiday Inn Express®, Staybridge Suites® and Candlewood Suites®.
We are currently recruiting for a Data Scientist to join our team in Denham, Buckinghamshire. Working as part of a team of analysts you will provide analytical support related to brand and commercial management, direct marketing and mass marketing campaigns, and analysis of consumer behaviour and response. Guide the Region in the set-up and use of the programmatic ecosystem and marketing problem solving. Engage stakeholders in the planning, reporting and analysis of the DMP, DSP, and global brand marketing strategies. Support the data management platform manager, our Adobe partnership, and media agency relationships. Support or initiate projects to address strategic and tactical marketing issues for Distribution & Commercial Marketing. Create recommendations on various projects and initiatives through the modelling of customer, company, and industry data sets. Interpret and explain technical findings to business stakeholders in practical non-technical language. Work well independently, as part of a team, and as leader of a team.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Collaborate with the DMP manager to identify and classify key audience segments and create custom audience segments utilizing 1st and 3rd party data.
Develop measurement methodologies and audience segment reporting to drive effective targeting and monetization.
Use campaign management (Adobe Audience Manager), data mining software, forecasting models and statistical/computational models to achieve analytical objectives such as maximizing response and the guest experience while minimizing cost.
Analyse results of various testing initiatives in frequency and non-frequency applications, A/B Testing, etc and make actionable recommendations for campaign management as a result.
Consult with relevant business functional areas (Marketing, Sales, Revenue Management, Operations, and Digital) to establish analytical support objectives
Design complex performance tracking methods for relevant programs and initiatives and create reporting that maintains alignment with regional and global brand efforts during the pre, mid and post campaign time frame.
Evaluate performance to devise best practices / optimization strategies.
Make recommendations for enhancements to relevant databases from an information needs perspective including internal and external data sources
Assist managers on the development of content for formal Analytical Skills training courses and/or lead and review the work of less experienced staff by providing mentoring, technical guidance and/or training in daily activities. .
Develop presentations to management inside or outside the department in order to report findings, interpret the data analysis, and make recommendations based on results.
Support the broader Distribution & Commercial Marketing strategy with expertise, mentoring and ad-hoc project support for key Regional or Global strategic initiatives

The ideal candidate will have 5+ years progressive work experience, with an emphasis on business and marketing analysis and data mining. They will have experience of programmatic marketing including working with DMPs, DSPs and Ad Exchanges alongside a broader understanding of the digital marketing landscape including display, mobile, video and email. Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager and related analytics platforms is essential.  Preference will be given to those with demonstrated expertise in the relevant business areas supported, and demonstrated ability to lead project teams. Technical Skills and Knowledge

Knowledge and demonstrated use of Adobe Audience Manager
Knowledge and demonstrated use of statistical and database software (preferably SAS and SQL) and application of multivariate methods (e.g. regression, factor analysis, discriminant analysis, cluster analysis, conjoint analysis)
Demonstrated proficiency in developing queries in order to transform data from relational and flat-file database structures including parsing and cleansing
Experience in conducting quantitative marketing analyses including some or all of the following: market segmentation, product positioning, perceptual mapping, product pricing, concept testing and market sizing
Demonstrated knowledge of statistical techniques for promotion design, post promotion analysis and response modelling (e.g. design of experiments, ANOVA, and logit regression)
Demonstrated familiarity with financial concepts: ROI, NPV, pro forma modelling
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, and proficiency with MS Word and PowerPoint for the purpose of translating technical and statistical information into actionable business insights for clients, vendors, senior management and staff
Demonstrated project management experience in organizing, planning and executing large-scale projects from conception through implementation.


In return we'll give you a competitive financial and benefits package including hotel discounts worldwide and the chance to work with a great team of people. Most importantly, we'll give you the room to be yourself.

Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.
There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. About the Center for Data Intensive Science
The Center for Data Intensive Science at the University of Chicago is a dedicated team of researchers and engineers drawing from different backgrounds and ideas to push the boundaries of data intensive science.  Our mission is to pioneer translational data science to advance medicine, healthcare, and the environment.  Our research interests include data commons, bioinformatics, high performance analytics, virtualized infrastructure, and pipelines for large-scale data analysis.

alert_message: This job post has expired (either the position was filled or the post is no longer listed). You are viewing an archived version.
body:
Would you like to mentor a budding data scientist?
Springboard is looking for expert industry Data Scientists who use Python or R in their day-to-day work and are passionate about teaching/mentoring.
We run online, self-paced Python and R-based Data Science workshops where participants learn with the help of a curated curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert industry mentor.
Our mentor community - the biggest strength of our programs - has experts from the best organizations in the world. Mentors range from experienced data scientists and researchers at premier companies (Uber, Facebook, Etsy, Apple) to a wide variety of top-notch startups and consulting firms.
What do I have to do as a mentor?
As a mentor, your role will be to ensure that your mentees have a great learning experience. Here’s what that means for you:

You will have a weekly 30-minute video call with each of your students at a time of mutual convenience.
Most mentors takes 4 mentees, but depending on your availability, you can commit to more or fewer.
You will be compensated for your time with a per-student honorarium.

I’m interested! Tell me more about the curriculum
We currently have two Data Science workshops, one based in R and the other in Python.

Our R-based workshop, Foundations of Data Science, is targeted to students with little or no programming background, who want to get a taste of data science
Our Python-based workshop, Data Science Intensive, is meant for students with some programming experience and statistics background, who want to transition to data science

In both cases, our curriculum is curated by experts to include the best materials in the field: think of us as a college professor who includes book chapters, videos and other material to create the best learning experience.
Excellent! What about the students?
Our students are working professionals and college/graduate students from all over the world, interested in getting started with data science. They go through the curriculum at their own pace and have a weekly 30-minute check-in with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice. Typically, most students take about 3 months to finish.
I’m sold! Where do I sign up?
Send an email to mentors@springboard.com with a bit of information about yourself. A resume or an updated LinkedIn profile, along with a brief cover email work perfectly well!

About DueDil
DueDil is a tool that helps you to understand any private company, the people that run it and the markets in which it operates.
Our easy-to-use technology improves transparency, reducing the risks of doing business and helping users find new customers and partners.
DueDil is one of Europe’s largest sources of private company information, with a database of more than 45 million businesses across 20 European countries.
Since 2010, the London-based company has raised nearly $30m from respected investors in the US and UK, including Oak Investment Partners, Passion Capital and Notion Capital.

body:
Want to work at a place where every day is a Kaggle competition?
As we seek to transform credit markets, using the combination of machine learning technology and vast amounts of data sources, ZestFinance is looking to add to our modeling team as we expand into interesting and revolutionary frontiers in the credit world.
If you're interested in joining the team, please send me your resume:
jbc@zestfinance.com
More about Zest
ZestFinance was founded in 2009 by Douglas Merrill, former CIO of Google, along with a team of data scientists from Google and lending experts from Capital One. Together they set about revolutionizing credit underwriting for underbanked Americans.
As it stands today, good people are being denied credit because old world processes do not take advantage of today’s data rich environment. ZestFinance applies machine learning and large-scale data analysis to evaluate thousands of potential credit variables.
Using this more sophisticated approach, ZestFinance can better assess default risk and the viability of a long-term customer relationship allowing the company to offer loans at a fraction of the rates of its competitors. The company also makes its technology platform available to other organizations, enabling them to use data to make smarter underwriting and business decisions.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related discipline; Advanced degrees preferredExtensive use of R Matlab, or Python, and LinuxUnderstanding of statistical analysis, algorithm development, and advanced machine learning techniquesCommitment to creating reproducible, well-documented codeAn independent and self-motivated work ethicA proven, demonstrable track record of successSuccessful participation on Kaggle a plus

Are you interested to join SAP Singapore as a Data Scientist?
As a Data Scientist for machine learning you will work in a team of experienced researchers, data scientists and application developers taking on challenges posed by the SAP customers and product units. You will have the chance to work with the richest data sets available in the world addressing real-world problems. Your primary goal will be to implement state of the art algorithms and to develop new approaches and technologies for deriving value from our customers` data. You will have a chance to select and implement the best technologies and approaches based on your own experience, judgment, and experimentation results. This role combines (1) experience with machine learning (2) practical knowledge of working with scalable platforms for processing of huge data sets, and (3) ability to understand the data, associated processes and business implications, (4) scaling from minimum viable product up to shippable production code, (5) build and maintaining innovative new products from the ground-up.
Tasks include:
Push the frontiers of what is possible in the area of machine learning so as to create new IncubationExplore, understand, and implement most recent algorithms and approaches for supervised and unsupervised machine learningComfortably handle multi-terabyte data sets in scale-up and scale-out environments
Qualifications
Master degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or related field Track record of developing novel learning algorithms and/or systems Proficiency in handling of multi-terabyte datasets in distributed Linux/Unix environments Experience with Machine / Deep Learning software packages such as Caffe/Torch/Theano/TensorFlow Ability to visualize data and present core insights in a clear and compelling way

body:
Some interesting facts:

Our gaming platforms currently attract approx. 100 million unique visitors each month
Lots of opportunity for implementing a wide variety of data science solutions
>0,5 billion personalized recommendations sent to production daily
Data throughput: ~1.2 – 1.4 billion events per day (~12 – 16K per second) loaded in near real time
35 TB, >100B rows in Data Warehouse
More than 100 sources integrated within the Data Warehouse

The Business Intelligence Team is focusing on providing insights around (mobile/web) customers and their behavior and is serving several departments with insights in order to provide data driven decision bases.
The focus of the Data Scientist role is to provide business intelligence insights in reports and a dashboard environment in order to enable each stakeholder to get all relevant information for their decisions. The Data Scientist furthermore acts as a consultant for different teams from publishing, live operation (published native games), corporate development and marketing and helps to transform the needs of the various stakeholders into actionable KPIs.
Additionally the Data Scientist will work on establishing a (infra)structure for tracking and data collection for new mobile gaming products and coordinating the data warehouse development together with a business intelligence developer.
The tasks and responsibilities include:

Analyzing data with standard statistical methods, interpreting the results, and providing recommendations for improvement;
Partnering with other teams in the company to make data-driven decisions;
Use different data sources to solve business research questions in order to transform stakeholder needs into actionable methodologies and analysis;
Creating predictive models to personalize the Spil experience;
Design and maintain dashboards that capture the metrics needed to monitor the product performance;
Work closely with the development team to define business and technical requirements for integrating new tracking into games; and
Conduct questionnaire on the user base to understand user behavior

Your profile

Master’s degree in Analytics / Econometrics / Mathematics (PhD is a plus)
2+ year experience with machine learning, statistics and statistical programming, including multivariate statistics, A/B testing and experience with statistical analysis in R, SAS, or SPSS (R preferred)
Experience working in a non-research commercial setting/company is required. E.g. Demonstrated experience in using Big Data and complex analytics to support business decisions
Highly proficient in using SQL for business analytics (required)
Experience with Tableau or comparable tools like Qlickview or Spotfire
Expert in MS Excel
Excellent communication skills with experience presenting results in both written and verbal form
Interest for the Online and Mobile Games Industry
Ability to work independently and manage a range of parallel projects
Fluent English written and spoken
Experience in Games or related industries is a big plus
You must have a valid EU work permit to apply for this opportunity

Why join Spil Games?
Level up your career—be part of a rapidly growing leader in the online gaming industry, where playing games is all part of a day’s work. Spil Games also offers these great benefits:

A competitive salary and bonus system
Flexible hours (from 7 AM till 7 PM)
A pension and collective health insurance plan
Reimbursement for your daily commute
Extras, such as a fitness plan and canteen
And, most importantly, training and development programs—because when you grow, we grow with you!

body:
Our Team
The Content Science & Algorithms team is a world class group of data scientists focusing on the super interesting question of which movies and shows Netflix should create or purchase the rights to. The team seeks to use data science to better understand this problem and build tools to support the content acquisition teams in their decision making.
The Role
We are looking for experienced individuals who are passionate about data science and enjoy working in a collaborative environment. Members of the team typically work on one or two projects (e.g. predicting movie viewership) over any six month period.
​Ma​chine learning tends to be our primary tool however, we use that in combination with a wide variety of techniques including​ ​descriptive analytics, causal inference, crowd-sourcing, network science, A/B testing and data visualization. While we also partner with an engineering team, we do a great deal of coding ourselves and the ability and desire to code is a must. We primarily use Python and R, but maintain the flexibility to use the best tool for the job.
Qualifications
-Experience with, and a strong desire to use, the latest machine learning and data mining algorithms.
-Strong coding ability. Desire to work in Python. Experience with any of these is a plus: scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, R, ggplot, JavaScript, D3, SQL, Hadoop, and Spark. Preference towards open source software.
-Appreciation of good design in both software UI and slideshow presentations.
-Willingness to give equal weight to both generating great results and communicating those results to technical and non-technical business partners. 
-Hunger to continue learning and developing as a data scientist. Willingness to help further build the team, including contributing fresh ideas, establishing best practices, interviewing data science candidates, following trends, and attending conferences (e.g. KDD, NIPS).
-Strong academic background preferred, but all backgrounds (e.g. startup) considered.
-Love of television and film a plus!
Culture
You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment. You will work with smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect, but also foster high performance. For a more in-depth look into our culture, check out http://www.slideshare.net/reed2001/culture-1798664

body:
Combient is looking to recruit a data scientist to play a key role in the development of our automation platform. The data scientist will be focusing on predictive maintenance (PdM) within industry manufacturing, which is used to, for example, predict future failures based on historical maintenance data of equipment, and then schedule maintenance tasks accordingly.
The position is placed in Stockholm, Sweden. Applicant must have a Swedish/EU work permit and be fully fluent in English. No recruiters or agencies, please.
What you will do:

Support ongoing projects with expertise in statistical models and machine learning
Perform ad hoc statistical and data mining analyses
Research, implement and build algorithms and solutions
Explain the results of analyses to team members and customers

Must-have skills and experience:

Master degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science focus on machine learning
+3 years of proven track record in data modeling, quantitative analysis and machine learning
Working experience with modern machine learning methods including logistic regression, neural networks, support vector machines, clustering, deep learning common bayesian methods using n-gram, dimensionality reduction of data using SVD, PCA, and random projections
Experience in using a statistical packages, such as SAS,R, Mathematica, Matlab/Octave, Python or Spark/Hadoop libraries
Knowledge in SQL and knowledge in programming in at least one modern language

Valued feathers in your cap:

experience with industrial systems and predictive maintenance (PdM)
experience with process automation and process mining techniques allowing for extraction of information from workflow automation systems
experience with data mining toolkits such as KXEN, Kamanja and Rapidminer
experience working with Spark/Hadoop clusters, and the tools in Hadoop ecosystem
experience working with stream processing (Apache Spark Streaming, Storm, Apache Flink etc)
familiarity with ETL, data quality, database modeling and data warehousing principles and you have deep knowledge of SQL

About the company:
The mission of Combient AB, a joint venture between a select group of global enterprises from a broad range of industries, is to be a catalyst for collaboration around Industrial Internet and related technologies.
Our technology platform builds on our own development, best-of-breed Open Source components augmented with existing partner-developed technology. By facilitating combinatorial innovation Combient connects cutting-edge research results and the latest Internet technologies with industry applications to accelerate technology innovation, digitalization and software based automation. The ambition is to enable open and innovative collaboration, knowledge sharing, joint development and new ecosystems.
Our owners include: Atlas Copco AB, Electrolux AB, Ericsson AB, FAM AB, Investor AB, LKAB, Saab AB, SEB AB, Sigma AB, SKF AB and Stora Enso AB
Location:
The position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
No agencies or recruiters, please.
Combient accepts no charges for any CV´s submitted on speculation and will accept no fees or costs for hiring of a person that may or may not have been presented to Combient through a unsolicited CV.

body:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a work environment that encourages new ideas, having fun and challenging the status quo!
Our Business Intelligence team is looking for an algorithm expert to develop our real-time anomaly detection algorithm. You will work towards having a state-of-the-art anomaly detection tool that detects issues before anyone else is aware of them, then alerts the relevant parties. The goal of the anomaly detection tool is to immediately uncover short-term as well as long-term disruptions to our KPI trends (e.g. click-stream incidents, major user behavior changes, advertiser-specific metric changes, etc.) in order to ensure that trivago operates smoothly in the market. You will integrate all important metrics for monitoring the dynamics of the market and predict market trend development. You must be capable of astutely analysing data in order to pinpoint the main causes of anomalies. We want someone who is willing to experiment with new methods in order to constantly improve the algorithm’s accuracy and who has the eye for detail required to avoid mistakes when conducting data tests and reviewing code. If you have the desire and drive to see your ideas go from conception to execution in order to push our algorithm forward, we’d like to hear from you.
The ideal candidate:• Holds a M.Sc. or Diplom degree in one of the natural sciences (Mathematics, Physics, etc.) or Computer Science.• Has 1-2 years’ experience working in an environment where they were focused on machine learning and data analysis.• Is proficient in a programming/coding language. Proficiency in SQL, R, Python or a good working knowledge of Hadoop would be particularly beneficial.• Speaks English fluently.• Is an independent worker capable of recognizing what will add the highest value to a project.• Has the analytical mind and eye for detail required to find patterns in data and spot any potential errors.• Can start as soon as possible.
Life at trivago:trivago is an exciting hub of multicultural activity where nationalities from all around the world come to share their knowledge and work together on redefining the travelling experience for millions of people. We nurture all our talents and provide them with the support they need to develop professionally as well as personally. We encourage fanatic learning through regular workshops, seminars and constant feedback as well as promoting quick decision making in keeping with our trial and error philosophy. Flexible working hours are in place to create a trusting environment where productivity is measured through goals rather than hours spent in the office. For our internationals, we help with relocation and provide language classes for those wanting to learn or practise their German.Join us at trivago – a place where talented minds meet, crazy ideas are shared and innovation is born.
Additional information:• This is a full-time, unlimited-length contract with a long-term perspective.• Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.• We do not require the services of an agency for this position.

body:
ABOUT PLUM
Plum is leading the transformation of commercial real estate lending through innovative and breakthrough technology, pioneering the fintech revolution within the $3.3 trillion CRE loan market. We deliver to our clients expedited execution, improved transaction visibility and an unparalleled client experience.The team includes former senior level executives and talent from Wells Fargo, KKR, Starwood Capital, Goldman Sachs and AMD. We have extensive experience with CRE sourcing, underwriting and funding processes, as well as deep networks of institutional financing channels. The team has a combined 75 years of CRE lending experience in the U.S. with deal volume totaling over $50 billion, and team members have sourced and underwritten 1,570 CRE loans across virtually all property types and geographic markets. Our founder and CEO, Bill Fisher, has had decades of experience building successful startup businesses including GetSmart.com, Xing and Trivago. In August 2015 Plum secured our Series A funding led by Renren Inc., who has built an exceptional record of backing fintech companies including SoFi, LendingHome and Motif Investing. Renren’s decision follows an earlier seed investment by QED Investors, a pre-eminent VC firm led by the founders of Capital One, whose portfolio includes Prosper, Orchard and ApplePie Capital.We are an early stage, high growth company with endless opportunities for advancement for individuals that are driven to deliver tangible results and do whatever it takes to move Plum forward. We seek to build Plum into a new national financial services brand as well as a fantastic place to come to work. We are located in the heart of San Francisco’s Financial District in an airy, industrial loft, close to all forms of public transportation.
JOB SUMMARYWe are looking for a data-driven problem solver who can automatically discover and extract information from multiple data sources. You'll work to recognize patterns and productize your solutions and techniques for integration into our products and our processes. You will have a high degree of authority and autonomy, be capable of managing multiple high-priority tasks in a timely manner, and collaborate across the business. A successful data extraction engineer at Plum needs to be innovative, detail-oriented, team-focused, strategic and effective in new and changing environments.
BENEFITS
• Early equity in a startup that is revolutionizing commercial real estate lending.• Competitive package of base pay and stock options.• Generous health, dental and vision coverage for employees and family members, along with commuter pre-tax program.• Unlimited vacation policy.• Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the disruption of an industry and to shape the building of a company and culture.• Chance for your direct input to be realized and put into action.• Freedom to stretch the boundaries of your past work experience, learn skills outside of your immediate job description and grow your career.• Autonomy, flexibility and a flat corporate structure.
RESPONSIBILITIES
• Participate heavily in architecture, design and implementation of large-scale distributed crawlers that extract semantically meaningful data from the Classic-Web and Social-Web.• Data munging with emphasis on ability to deal with imperfections in data.• Develop, refine and scale data management and analytics procedures, systems, workflows, best practices and other issues.• Development of data-driven products.• Visualize and communicate data clearly for use both internally and externally.• Collaborate with our engineers to produce excellent products for Plum clients as well as streamline internal processes.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or related discipline.• 3+ years-experience in developing large scale distributed software systems and/or data science.• Web crawling and/or scraping skills with or without a framework.• Experience with scraping social media, using social media APIs.• Experience in data cleansing, curation, parsing, integration, semantic mapping, and editing.• Proficiency in high level language such as Java, Scala, R or Python.• Experience with HTML/Javascript/XPath/JSON and other web technologies.• Strong knowledge of Linux / UNIX systems.• An entrepreneurial spirit as well as passion for solving difficult challenges through innovation and creativity, with a strong focus on results.• Conscientious and well organized.• Eager to produce results and drive forward progress while managing deadlines.• Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas for this job.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Knowledge of machine learning concepts and NLP techniques.• Experience in working with big data technologies Spark, MapReduce, NoSQL databases.• Experience with AWS infrastructure.• Basic understanding of statistics.• Experience with finance technology/analytics and commercial real estate.

As a data scientist on the Community Application team, you will engage with the developer community to evangelize DataRobot through "hacktivism". In this role, you will leverage DataRobot's automated machine learning platform for community-facing data science activities such as Kaggle competitions, hackathons, blog posts, and data-science products. The goal of this role is to engage with the data science community and demonstrate the power of Datarobot by creating content using open source tools. You should be comfortable with GitHub and iterating quickly to produce portable data-science products. You will be joined by web developers and software engineers to assist you in creating these deliverables.
We are looking for someone who enjoys hacking on data science projects and is comfortable with gluing together all of the components of a data science pipeline: data acquisition (from databases, scraping, etc.), feature engineering, predictive modeling, and visualizations. Additionally, we are looking for someone who has strong communication skills and can produce referenceable, public facing code.
Qualifications:

Outstanding written communication skills. Must like helping/teaching others.
Comfortable with using the command line and Github
Strong experience with Machine Learning
History of public data science activity - blog posts, participation in open-source projects, etc.
Ability to write compelling end to end applications that are easy to understand.

Experience with Spark and Hadoop
Visualization libraries such as GGPlot, MatplotLib, and/or D3
Databases/Message Queues - ElasticSearch, Cassandra, Redshift, Kafka, and more

body:
At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.
The Revenue Management and Analytics (RM&A) team supports clients across The Walt Disney Company, including Walt Disney Parks & Resorts, Disney Cruise Line, Media Networks (e.g., ABC, ESPN), Studio Entertainment (e.g., The Walt Disney Studios, Disney Theatrical Group) and Disney Consumer Products and Interactive Media in the core competencies of yield management, revenue planning, forecasting, pricing and optimization. Key partners to the RM&A organization include Marketing, Finance, Business Development, Research and Operations. Roles within RM&A develop, analyze, and execute strategies to maximize profitability and improve the value proposition for our Guests, Cast Members and Shareholders. Candidates should have a natural curiosity to understand the "why" behind business performance, take a proactive role in problem-solving, be results oriented, be able to prioritize and be a team player in a collaborative environment.
Your Role:
Provide data integration services: Acquire, cleanse, merge, validate, visualize and data mining analysisCollaborate: Partner with our technology teams, analytical consultants and data scientists across various initiatives and platformsBe the primary data domain expert: You will become the subject matter expert on your projects and will work to integrate data inputs and outputs into custom built tools/applicationsEnable business decisions: Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed
What We’re Looking For:
Four to six years in the field/hands-on experienceExperience gathering and processing raw data (structured/unstructured) at scale (including writing scripts, web scraping, calling APIs, writing SQL queries on a variety of platforms, etc.)Experience transforming unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis (cleaning, transforming, enriching)Experience working closely with partner engineering teams to integrate prepared data sets and algorithms into production systemsExperience writing code (Python, JavaScript, Java, SAS, etc.)Experience configuring/tuning software applications, database connections, etc.Demonstrated ability to champion projects from beginning through implementation, meet deadlines, handle multiple priorities and perform job responsibilities accurately with minimal supervisionAbility to work in a team environment with a positive demeanorDemonstrated creative problem solving and decision making skillsDemonstrated ability to teach/explain technical concepts/ideas to audiences of varying levels of technical aptitudeBachelor's degree in fields such as Computer Science, MIS, Data Mining, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent.
How To Stand Out:
Solid understanding of data architecture principlesData domain knowledge (media, entertainment, theme parks, resorts, etc.)Experience navigating a *NIX environment and working on the command-lineExperience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, QlikView, Charts.js, etc.Experience with analytics tools like SAS, SPSS, R, etc.Knowledge of big data querying tools, such as Pig, Hive, Impala, etc.Experience with online web data such as Omniture, DoubleClick, Freewheel, etc.Experience contributing to/leading software tool evaluationsMaster's degree in a technical field or equivalentWho We Are:
“We make magic.” That’s our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. And it permeates everything we do. At Disney, you’ll help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen!

body:
About Centralway
Centralway’s focus is on developing products to manage banking transactions and assets. The platform provides banking services for the consumer, as well as the development and implementation of banking software towards financial institutions. We are currently looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist, at the earliest possible start date, to strengthen our position in the industry.
This role is based at Centralway Headquarters, Zürich.
Responsibilities
As Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be responsible for working closely with senior management and their teams, developing an understanding for their information needs. These needs and agreed upon solutions will then be used to form the Business Intelligence strategy.
You will gather and develop requirements related to data and reporting, providing technical input throughout the design, development and implementation of specialised tools.
You will produce actionable data reports, presentations and visualisations for decision-makers in the company and offer your expert interpretation. Through creating and managing insightful automated dashboards and data visualisations, you will track key business  metrics. As a result, you will contribute to the continuous improvement and maintenance of key performance indicators used throughout the organisation.
Together with data scientists and engineering teams, you will gain access to new data sets. You will deliver these findings back to the engineering teams in order to put new algorithms into production. You will analyse large data sets and run experiments to generate new insights and find patterns, cleaning as a preparation for optimal processing.
Interaction with other teams will be a core part of your duties, consulting and supporting the Centralway stakeholders in all Business Intelligence questions. Through positive and helpful reviews, you will become a part of the technical process. You will remain up-to-date with the latest technologies, and understand their benefits and limitations when furthering the development of the company.
Additionally, you will be required to participate in workflow tracking (JIRA) and documentation (CONFLUENCE), in order to ensure scalable, industrialised processes that facilitate business growth.
Requirements
Master’s degree with strong academic performance in a quantitative discipline (Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or Econometrics)At least 3 years experience in a Business Intelligence, data analytics, data mining or a similar analytical positionExperience in the banking/financial sector is a plusHands-on experience in processing and analysing large data sets (in R or Python) with proven ability to extract useful information from dataProven understanding of Business Intelligence principles, practices and systems, particularly in regards to integration in existing systems (modern, mobile, scalable)Excellent communication skills in English (German is a plus) in order to concisely and effectively present the results to a non-technical audienceClose attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindsetPassionate about technology and willing to develop expertise in any emerging fieldService-oriented and flexible personality with a proactive dispositionThe ability to work independently, and within a team environment with strong follow up, organisation and prioritisation skills and excellent attention to detailA desire to work in a fast-paced and challenging work environmentQuick to learn and fast to adapt
Our Office
Centralway expects passion and commitment from our employees in order to reach our goals. Our unique working environment has been tailored to this purpose:
Café and restaurantAir-conditioned cinemaFree breakfast and lunch buffets, snacks and ice-cold drinksSports clubFitness studioMany extra perks and benefits

body:
• State of the art facilities, in the sought after QLD Sunshine Coast region (Australia)• Build and inspire cutting edge data modelling techniques• Salary + attractive employee incentives program
Why Youi… Youi is changing the general insurance market! We've become one of the most recognisable brands in the Australian market and continually build inertia. Based in Australia on Queensland’s Sunshine Coast, we are one of the largest employers in the region. Our extensive employee benefits and recognition programs are just some of the things that set us apart from our competitors.
We’re a data (and values) driven organisation and are aware of the ever-changing landscape and so are always on the lookout for top talent who can help us gain insights from our rich troves of data. We know that, now more than ever, being able to make sense of the many sources of BIG, noisy, dirty and downright unhygienic data is an essential for any forward looking organisation. No other employer in Australia offers the same end-to-end exposure to insurance operations. At Youi, you see the work you do directly add value in the business with a focus on quick turnaround of quality results.
What does the role involve?You can expect to be dealing with people from right across the organisation in support to operational departments. You will also be encouraged to identify opportunities for continuous improvement and enhancements of all aspects of the business by leveraging your data science background, modelling and advanced analytical skills to create value for our clients out of the big data we have generated. Provide guidance and technical expertise to the business and collaborate on multiple business critical projects.
About You:• You have extensive quantitative expertise and experience to put the Science into “Data Science”.• Technical skills to put modern Data Science solutions together that are congruent with development best practice.• Ability to work in a world class development team with a focus on the product not on the tools.• You are someone our company values will resonate with (Awesome Service, Dynamic, Human, Fast, Honest, and Passionate).• You are inquisitive, comfortable experimenting, have an open mind and capable of critical and independent thought.• A relevant degree in Econometrics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related studies will be highly regarded. • Excellent written and communication skills in English language.
We are looking for a natural leader and communicator, who find it easy to articulate what’s going on in the data and how knowing this could help us make better sense of the future. In return we can offer you a challenging, fun and progressive environment; your role will play a pivotal part of the Telematics team and part of a growing business that genuinely cares about its people.
This role will require you to live on the Sunshine Coast, in Australia and as such offers a very attractive remuneration package. Furthermore, Youi can offer you real career progression opportunities, in addition to exceptional employee rewards and benefits! We are prepared to offer Visa sponsorship for the right candidate applicant.
If you're bored with the status quo then take your career to the next level – APPLY NOW on our careers website www.youi.com.au/careers

body:
Job DescriptionSkyTruth is seeking a machine learning engineer to join the team that is building Global Fishing Watch to help develop and operationalize algorithmic behavior classification of the movements of fishing vessels extracted from time series position data detected by satellite.  
Essential Functions

Design, develop and implement algorithms to reliably detect defined vessel behaviors from time series movement data
Evaluate the effectiveness of competing approaches to behavior classification in terms of accuracy and performance
Work directly with Google 20% engineers that have developed application prototypes
Direct the production of machine learning training data
Build tools for analysts to use to interact with algorithm inputs and outputs
Perform ad hoc statistical and data mining analyses
Explore big data sets and discover interesting new patterns of behavior

Skills and Requirements

Python experience: 5+ years
Experience using machine learning techniques
Experience with scalable data architecture – e.g. Hadoop, Apache Storm, Cascading, Cloud dataflow etc
Experience working with big data in a data science role
Ability to work in a distributed team

Nice to Have

Experience with google cloud platform
scikit-learn
caffe, tensorflow
open source collaboration experience
gdal and other spatial tools
Java, Scala, R

About SkyTruth and Global Fishing Watch
SkyTruth is a not for profit, remote sensing and big data company with a mission to protect the environment by making more of it visible. In 2014 we launched an ambitious project called Global Fishing Watch which uses satellite tracking to detect when and where commercial fishing is happening in every ocean around the world, in near real time. Our goal is to help save the oceans from damaging overfishing through greater transparency across all large commercial fishing operations in every country of the world. We plan to accomplish this through cutting edge application of machine learning and big data tools, media and outreach impact created by project partner Oceana, and technology depth provided by project partner Google.
About the SkyTruth TeamSkyTruth is a small group of dedicated people using remote-sensing technologies to help protect the earth by making more of the impacts of human activity visible to the people who live there. We use scientifically credible satellite images and other visual technologies to create compelling pictures that vividly illustrate environmental impacts, and provide these pictures and supporting data to environmental advocates, policy-makers, the media, and the public.
location: Washington DC, San Francisco, London or Remote

body:
Our company brings together a unique combination of expertise in human computer interaction, machine learning, and hardware integration to create revolutionary interactive solutions.
We are looking for a machine learning expert who loves working with sensor data, loves developing new algorithms, is not afraid of challenging, open-ended problems, and wants to help us shape the future of touch interaction. You will be working with a small and highly capable team of machine learning engineers and will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the growth of a burgeoning startup.
As a Machine Learning Engineer, your responsibilities will include:

Designing experiments to advance our machine learning understanding and techniques
Running experiments to improving the core algorithms of Qeexo products on consumer devices
Modeling accuracy of Qeexo products on new hardware and sensor platforms
Developing new algorithms to improve our engine calibration process
Working with customers to design and implement Qeexo solutions

Ideal Candidate
An ideal candidate will have:

A proven track record of academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning and signal processing, particularly in acoustic analysis
Deep knowledge of statistical and machine learning approaches and problem domains
Computer Science or EE background (MS or BS) with strong coding ability and familiarity with Java, C++ or other OOP language. (You will not be doing production-level coding but you will need to build some prototypes/tools for experiments.)
Proven success with multiple ML/AI/classification projects (research papers, kaggle, open source implementations, etc.)
Expertise in one or more specific areas of research: neural nets/deep learning, signal processing or digital imaging, ensemble learning and system identification
Research-minded, ability to run experiments independently and present results to leadership
Comfortable working in a terminal environment, writing scripts (Bash/Python) to process data
Experience in mobile or other consumer electronic devices

Skills & Requirements:

Machine Learning (expert)
Python (expert)
Deep Learning (proficient)
Ensemble Modeling/Classification (proficient)
Signal Processing (familiar)
Java (familiar)
C (familiar)
Data Structures and Algorithms (familiar)

Bonus Qualifications:
As a bonus, the candidate will also have:

Familiarity with acoustics or mechanical wave propagation, signal processing, approximation theory, and information theory
Understanding of applied mathematics, computational science, computational statistics, approximation theory, compressive sensing, representation learning, and/or pattern recognition
location: Mountain View, CA or Pittsburgh, PA

body:
The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory, a national leader in scientific research and development, is looking for an experienced, hands-on Senior Data Scientist that can lead the development of a data science/data analytics service, leveraging strong hands-on technical expertise, exceptional communications and interpersonal skills and people management experience.
Your Role:
• Apply expertise in analytics, quantitative analysis, data visualization techniques and modeling to find solutions for a variety of business and technical needs. Explore promising new tools and maintain/gain technical edge required for projects, engaging in analysis to influence decisions at various levels across the organization. Share approaches and methods. 
• Establish a strong understanding of the Agile Information Solutions (IGS) Group core services and market/promote those services in the organization in order to develop opportunities for funding for the Group. Serve as a catalyst and evangelist for data science concepts and approaches to problem solving.
• Supervise the Information & Research section. Actively participate in hiring processes, mentoring and guiding staff growth, providing feedback and addressing performance issues. Ensure work assignments are consistent with staff development plans and project needs. Participate as a member of the group’s management team and the department’s extended management team.
Your Background:
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field with 7 years of industry experience.• Strong computer science background including hands-on experience with open source programming, analysis and visualization tools.• Minimum of 5 years of experience with software development/engineering.• Experienced statistician with strong conceptual understanding and experience applying statistical methods.• Programming expertise, e.g. Python, Java.• Ability/experience working with emerging analytical and visualization techniques, e.g., NoSQL, Hadoop stack, R.• Extensive experience with data transformation/conversion – extracting, transforming, parsing, porting data into defined data structures.• Very strong communication and interpersonal skills– excellent story teller with unique ability to describe problems/findings to different audiences (technical, non-technical), leveraging visualization tools effectively. • Ability to think about problems from a data perspective, establish conceptual connections to data sources, understand relationships among data, see the forest and the trees, be comfortable with uncertainties/approximations.
We Offer:
A comprehensive benefits package including a liberal vacation plan, a matching retirement program, significant educational assistance, a scholarship tuition program for staff with dependents, and competitive salaries commensurate with skills and experience. 
For more information about our organization, please visit our web site at www.jhuapl.edu.
Equal Employment Opportunity: Johns Hopkins University/Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer that complies with Title IX of the Education Amendments Acts of 1972, as well as other applicable laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

body:
Data Scientist / Machine Learning / NLP at VC-backed start-up. Full-time position in San Francisco.
About the position
As a member of our research / data science team, we want you to bring experience building real products in the real world from the ground up. Your teammates should see you as a 'data artist' and go to you with tough analytical problems. You should be comfortable jumping in the deep end and learning new skills on a cutting edge platform. You’ll use a marketer mindset with a quantitative approach and love of all things digital to play a key role in new product definition. In this role you'll act as the trusted partner to our product team and key clients as you help wow our customers by repeatedly and predictably scoring hit shows.
We're growing our research / data science team and looking for talented people to help us with projects ranging across the full spectrum of NLP, Machine Learning and Statistical Programming disciplines. We are aggressively building out language driven predictive systems and methods for training our systems and improving our our core algorithms. We are specifically interested in people with experience with extensive NLP and ML experience. In other words, our ideal candidate has prior experience as a machine learning programmer for linguistic systems.
We’re looking for a candidate who can work as a part of the core research team developing our next generation self learning platform. You’ll work with the server side team, product team, and mobile technology teams gaining experience and defining the necessary components.
What we’re looking for in candidates
As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate closely with developers and business stakeholders on the transition of your research into high value business applications.
Our human computation platform gives us the power to reinvent machine learning solutions for web scale language processing, especially for short form text. We build scalable and innovative technology in-house, and build strong connections to complementing technology and academic faculty. We want those individuals who will drive our team further to join us to build the information processors of the future.
Experience in hands-on processing, representation, and transformation of information datasets using tools such as UIMA, and domain-specific tools. Experience using open source tool kits for text or image processing such clearTK, Stanford CoreNLP, NLTK, OpenCV, Caffe Neural Networks.
Experience with large-scale algorithms and familiarity with big data computing infrastructure such as Hadoop, etc. Your peers should see you as a top-notch problem solver. You should be comfortable defining new ideas and refining existing ones. Comfortable in a small, intense and high-growth start-up environment
Candidates with MS or PhD in CS/Machine Learning or Statistics with extensive focus on NLP.
Application Requirements
Please include a Resume & Cover Letter. You could also include any relevant portfolio / projects / experience or a link to github account.
About msg.ai
msg.ai is a VC-backed, artificial intelligence based platform for conversational commerce with offices in San Francisco, NYC and India. We are backed by Y-Combinator, Salesforce Ventures, Bowery Capital and some of most influential AI leaders in the world. msg.ai's artificial intelligence platform enables world's top brands to automate interactive, 1:1 conversations with their end users / customers on various popular messaging platforms.
Perks
This role is based at our San Francisco office. This is a full time position with competitive compensation, benefits and equity options.

body:
Parker Hannifin, a Fortune 500 company,  is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our Global BI & Analytics team at our Corporate Headquarters in Cleveland Ohio. We are looking for individuals with a passion for learning and using data mining and modeling techniques to address strategic and tactical business problems that help drive growth. Successful candidates will be comfortable using a variety of tools and techniques and will also be able to do data engineering in order to accomplish analysis and predictive modeling objectives, as well as data visualization to communicate results and the methods and tests used to validate those results. We code mainly in R, we have a wide variety of tools and we are open to additional tools and techniques. This is a green-field opportunity for somebody willing to wear multiple hats to help us build our competency in this area.
Position Summary:
Develops, maintains and communicates results of predictive models and data and business analysis. Performs data mining analysis and supports design and implementation of processes and tools to deliver the intelligence necessary to support optimal and proactive business decisions throughout the corporation.
Essential Functions:
Builds and maintains data products and predictive models to forecast performance at enterprise, group, division, customer, and other meaningful levels of aggregation like groupings of customers and or products. · Builds and maintains predictive models to forecast customer retention and defection at enterprise, group and other levels like divisions or for specific groupings of sales forces and or clusters of specific customer populations and communicates results to sales and marketing teams for follow up action. · Provide up to date basket of good association rules output for use in assisted online up and cross selling, for use in sales training and promotions and for product marketing and other uses. · Share of wallet analysis using D&B purchased firmographic data at the enterprise level, and at multiple layers of product group, division and product line, geography, and market · Develop data quality and normalization and attribution models needed to make multiple disparate data sources usable for data mining and other analytical uses · Adapt models and respond to ad hoc requests for all types of business intelligence and analytics as an advisor and or team member for other key projects as needed · Manage the integration of external data sources into central repository of leading indicators for use by BI&A and Econometrics teams for forecasting and other analytics · Lead the design and maintenance of customer and product pattern file databases for use in predictive modeling and other data mining analysis.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, BI, Statistics, Physics, Econometrics, Mathematics or technical/quantitative discipline. Master's Degree preferred Minimum 5 years of progressively increasing responsibility applying advanced analytical algorithms, and predictive modeling to impact business results. Experience in data mining, feature engineering, machine learning and regression analysis in a business setting. Comfortable with data wrangling, working with large data sets of varying quality to solve business issues. Proficient in Statistical Software (R, Python, and Stata), Java, SQL, Microsoft Office, and multiple online and other data feeds.
Parker is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Parker is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job related reasons regardless of race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, gender identity, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Resident is required for most positions. (“Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/VEVRAA Federal Contractor”)
