body:
LIVE THE DREAMWe’re on a mission to change banking for good. That’s a brave statement, but we’re not scared to dream big. Not only are we up there amongst the UK’s top 10 credit card providers, but we want to lead the digital revolution in financial services. We put our customers first, pride ourselves on innovation and are always looking for the next breakthrough. Since we started out, we’ve been a company built on bold, new ideas and an entrepreneurial spirit. Now we’re taking it further - we want to disrupt the industry from within to make it better for everyone. COULD YOU BE THE ONE?We’re on the lookout for the very best and brightest post-graduates to join our team. To us it’s all about the idea, that bright spark that sets the world alight. That’s why we’re interested in finding Dreamers, Deliverers and Disrupters – the people who think laterally, scrawl ideas on the wall on neon post-it notes, dream up new concepts and bounce thoughts off each other.OUR DATA SCIENTISTS CRAFT SOLUTIONS“Big data” is a word that you’re likely to have heard a lot of late. But Capital One were big data before it got its notoriety. We were founded on an Information Based Strategy, so every decision is an informed one, because data is just filling up servers unless it’s put to work. This is where our Data Scientists get their kicks; using the latest distributed computing technologies to build models and data products to unlock big opportunities for the business and our consumers.DATA SCIENTISTSIf knowledge is power, then our Data Scientists could compete with the national grid. Data Scientists at Capital One are continually increasing our understanding of customers and of the markets in which we operate; helping us to predict risk, modelling response to marketing and developing frameworks for analysing transactions.What do our Data Scientists do?

Get to the heart of business problems; writing code, finding data, designing tests, building models and data products and lead development of our understanding of complex customer behaviour across billions of transactions
Identify when we can apply statistical or machine-learning techniques to improve business performance and selecting the appropriate techniques
Build models, design statistical experiments and report these findings to senior stakeholders
Help us to evaluate new products or processes
Scan the horizon for new tools and techniques

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?We hire individuals not box tickers. You don’t have to have studied a particular subject: who knew when they were applying to university what they wanted to be? But as this is a specialist role, you will need an in-depth knowledge of data-mining with strong Python programming skills and experience in extracting nuggets of insight from huge amounts of data.As such we’d expect you to have a very strong academic background to Masters or PhD level where you’ve had the opportunity to conduct extensive research into a particular data problem. We also want to see that you can demonstrate analytical thinking, entrepreneurial flair and have bags of personality.WE’LL TREAT YOU RIGHTWe treat our associates right – after all, one of you could be our future CEO. That’s why our salaries start at £32,000. We also offer a generous £5,000 signing on bonus as well as an annual performance related bonus.
It’s not just about the pound signs, though. We like to make sure our associates are well looked after – in every sense. Here’s how: 

25 days’ holiday & option to buy up five extra days
Private medical insurance & dental insurance
Interest-free travel season ticket loans
Cycle to work scheme
Subsidised restaurant and free onsite gym
Educational assistance programme 
Employee discount scheme at highstreet retailers
Life assurance scheme
Group personal pension scheme

Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

Data EngineerBrown UniversityProvidence, Rhode Island
The Data Engineer will join Brown’s Data Science Practice ((https://brown.edu/web/data-science), a central team of data experts who support a range of data-intensive projects across the University. The Data Engineer’s primary role will be to collaborate with top researchers in economics at the Rhode Island Innovative Policy Lab (RIIPL) and assist with developing and maintaining secure database infrastructure that integrates sensitive data from various state agencies. This infrastructure supports an exciting new set of projects that harness big data and cutting-edge scientific research to design smart public policies with higher per-dollar impact to better serve families in need.

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.• 1 - 3 years of experience working with real world data• Expertise with exploring, understanding, cleaning, and wrangling big data.• Strong software engineering skills and a track record of contributing to software projects and collaborating with other developers.• Working knowledge of the Linux operating system, a programming or data analysis language (e.g., Python, R, Stata), and databases (e.g., MySQL, Oracle, NoSQL).• Ability to work both independently and as a team member.• Ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines, and an eagerness to take ownership of challenging and open-ended assignments.• Effective at communicating with audiences whose technical backgrounds vary widely.• Experience working with sensitive data in secure computing environments is preferred.• Expertise with ETL processes, visualization tools, and web programming also preferred.
Please note: a cover letter, resume, and transcripts must be included in all applications.Candidates will be hired at the grade commensurate with their professional experience.
To View More Details and To Apply, please use the following link to this position on Brown’s Career Site: https://brown.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/staff-careers-brown//job/3-Davol-Square/Data-Engineer_REQ122414
Brown University is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive academic global community; as an EEO/AA employer, Brown considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of, gender, race, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.
Rhode Island Innovate Policy LabThe Rhode Island Innovative Policy Lab (RIIPL) at Brown University is a new collaboration between Brown University and the Office of the Governor in Rhode Island to develop evidenced-based policy using data and state-of-the-art research. RIIPL is headed by a team of Brown economists, world renowned for their work on big data and smart policy design. This team will lead and accomplish scientific research which will help the governor and state agencies design policies with higher impact per dollar to better serve Rhode Island families and make Rhode Island a leader in policy innovation.
About Brown (Please visit our website and get to know us better at: www.brown.edu)
Brown University is an Ivy League university with a beautiful campus in the heart of downtown Providence, Rhode Island. Brown offers competitive benefits through a generous retirement plan, an employee education program, and a tuition aid program for employees’ dependents.
The employee education program reimburses employee’s tuition for up to three undergraduate or graduate courses per fiscal year, and is available after 6 months of employment. Through this benefit, the Data Engineer will have the opportunity to engage in coursework that aligns with RIIPL’s portfolio of research. Additionally, this coursework could be counted toward a master’s degree if the employee applies to and is accepted into a Brown master’s program.
This unique position offers the Data Engineer an opportunity to use his or her skills to impact the world around them through supporting science and smart policy design. It also offers an opportunity to invest in career development through the opportunity to work with and learn from top researchers and take computer science courses from a top, ivy league program.
Providence, Rhode IslandProvidence boasts wonderful restaurants, plentiful farmers’ markets, a vibrant arts scene, easy access to beaches, and more. Kiplinger has named Providence the nation’s 3rd best city for commuters, and Providence has appeared on numerous Travel and Leisure lists, including being named number 1 on “America’s Favorite Cities 2014,” number 2 on “America’s Best Cities for Food Snobs” (March 2015), number 3 on “America’s Best Coffee Cities” (October 2014) and number 4 on “America’s Best Cities for Hipsters” (November 2013).

body:
Faculty of BusinessManagement Division – Centre for Decision ResearchLecturer in Business Analytics and Decision Science
The Faculty of Business at the University of Leeds is seeking to appoint a Lecturer in Business Analytics and Decision Science, working in the Centre for Decision Research. This post is intended to deepen the Centre’s research and teaching capability in business analytics. You will have a strong commitment to using data analysis and statistical modelling to support decision making. Candidates with experience with ‘big data’ approaches, and commercial or company-based projects with ongoing links will be considered as advantageous. You will be expected to contribute to teaching in business analytics and decision science, to be committed to conduct cutting-edge research, to raise the profile of the Centre for Decision Research and to attract funding from external resources. You will have or soon expect to have a PhD in Business Analytics, Decision Science, Management Science, or a related discipline.This post links to the Centre for Decision Research, which was founded in 1996 and has grown into a leading research centre. Our research builds on basic and appliedapproaches to understand and support real-world decisions. Centre members in theBusiness School include Professor Wändi Bruine de Bruin, Professor Bill Gerrard,Professor Alan Pearman, Emeritus Professor John Maule, Professor Barbara Summers, Senior Lecturer Dr. Nicola Bown, Lecturers Dr. Richard Hodgett, Dr Gulbanu Kaptan, Dr.Yasmina Okan, Postdocs Dr. Simon McNair, and Dr. Andrea Taylor, as well as PhD students. The Centre hosts regular research meetings and seminars that are attended by researchers from across the university. The Centre additionally maintains active international interdisciplinary research collaborations, and regularly hosts international visitors. Information about the Centre for Decision Research can be found on its homepage: www.leeds.ac.uk/decision-research/Further information about the Business School is available using the following web link: www.business.leeds.ac.ukUniversity Grade 8 (£38,896 - £46,414)Click here for further information about working at the University of Leeds www.leeds.ac.uk/info/20025/university_jobs
Closing Date: Wednesday 24 February 2016Reference: LUBSC1090  Job Description Responsible to: Head of Decision Research (Leeds University Business School)Reports to: Head of Decision Research (Leeds University Business School) Main duties and responsibilities-Research • To build an active research programme in business analytics and/or decision science.• To engage in interdisciplinary collaborations within the University of Leeds as well as at other national and international institutions.• To contribute to the international research profile of the Centre for Decision Research, the Business School, and the University of Leeds.• To establish and maintain a track record of research publications in leading internationally renowned peer-reviewed journals (i.e., a listing of 3* or 4* according to the Association of Business Schools (ABS) or equivalent is the guiding expectation)• To regularly submit papers to international academic conferences in the field.• To actively participate in research meetings and seminars in the Centre for Decision Research.• To provide research supervision and attract research students to the university.• To take part in knowledge transfer activities where appropriate and feasible. Teaching• To develop and teach modules in business analytics, including statistics, and decision science more generally.• To be fully involved in the assessment of course work and examinations.• To contribute to the review of modules and programmes, and to quality assurance mechanisms.• To utilise innovative approaches to learning and teaching.• To contribute to the planning and development of modules within the relevant subject area.• To undertake a teaching load as deemed appropriate by the Head of Division/Director and take part in other teaching-related activities, as appropriate.• To contribute to Faculty policy and practice in teaching, where appropriate. Administration• To contribute effectively to the administrative process and the committee structures of the Division, and as appropriate of the Faculty and wider University as appropriate.• To manage or lead major executive tasks (sustained or one off projects) which facilitate the School’s performance or business.• To be actively involved in the management of Faculty business• Any other duties as may reasonably be required, consistent with the grade of the post Career ExpectationsThe University of Leeds is committed to developing its staff. All staff participate in the Staff Review and Development scheme and we continue to work with individuals, supporting them to maximise their potential.Progression to a higher grade is dependent on an individual taking on an increased level of responsibility. The scope for this job may grow over time, allowing possible progression should the post holder demonstrate the skills and a wish to develop and increase their responsibilities. University Values All staff are expected to operate in line with the University’s values and standards, which work as an integral part of our strategy and set out the principles of how we work together. More information about the University’s strategy and values is available at http://www.leeds.ac.uk/comms/strategy/. Person SpecificationEssential • Completed or about to complete PhD in Business Analytics, Decision Science, Management Science, or a related discipline• To be committed to developing an active research programme in business analytics and/or decision science• Experience in applying business analytics to real-world decision problems• To be committed to publishing in leading internationally renowned peer reviewed journals• Evidence of being able to pursue independent research projects• Ability to teach effectively at all levels and an enthusiastic approach to all aspects of teaching• Experience of Excel, R, statistical software, SQL, Hadoop/ big data systems• Ability to contribute effectively to administrative activities• A high level of interpersonal and communication skills• Evidence of the ability to work as a member of a team• Evidence of high levels of self-motivation Desirable• Commercial experience and/or links with commercial organizations• Active membership of the Society of Judgment and Decision Making (SJDM), the European Association for Decision Making (EADM), the Society for Risk Analysis (SRA), The Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS), (UK) Operational Research Society or related Professional societies• A successful track record of applying business analytics to decisions in contexts such as finance, health, environment, sport and/or risk• Experience of presenting at academic conferences in the field• Experience with successful interdisciplinary collaborations and working with companies• Experience of obtaining external funding• Evidence of impact on real-world policy and practise
Additional InformationThe University offers generous terms and conditions of employment, a wide range of benefits, services, facilities and family friendly policies. Full details are available on the Human Resources web pages accessible at www.leeds.ac.uk/hr The PartnershipThe Partnership has been developed by students and staff and describes the mutual expectations of us all as members of the University of Leeds community. More information about the Partnership is available at http://partnership.leeds.ac.uk Disclosure and Barring Service checksA Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Check is not required for this position. However, applicants who have unspent convictions, cautions, reprimands and warnings, including any pending criminal proceedings must indicate this in the ‘other personal details’ section of the application form and send details to the Recruitment Officer at disclosure@leeds.ac.uk. Disabled ApplicantsThe post is located in the Maurice Keyworth Building. Disabled applicants wishing to review access to the building are invited to contact the department direct. Additional information may be sought from the Recruitment Officer, email disclosure@leeds.ac.uk or tel + 44 (0)113 343 1723.Disabled applicants are not obliged to inform employers of their disability but will still be covered by the Equality Act once their disability becomes known.Further information for applicants with disabilities, impairments or health conditions is available in the applicant guidance.

body:
Geneva Trading is seeking an experienced Data Scientist for their Chicago location. This individual will focus on automated trading strategy development on a variety of horizons. 
Responsibilities:

Design, testing, and deployment of automated trading strategies
Analyze and research model performance, optimization, and new market opportunities
Apply data analysis techniques along with real world trading experimentation to expose trade opportunities

 What skills and tools do you need?

Advanced Degree (MSc, PhD) in Statistics, Physics, Mathematics (or similar) 1-3 years’ experience in quantitative research
Working knowledge of game theory, forecasting and data mining techniques such as regression analysis, support vector machines, model optimization
Analytic mindset with the ability to manage numerous research projects with ease
Motivation and resourcefulness to quickly solve hard problems
Excellent interpersonal skills with a desire to work / grow in a fast paced,
collaborative, and entrepreneurial environment
Comfortable development in Python, R, Matlab, kdb

About Geneva
Geneva Trading is a Principal Trading Firm with offices in Chicago and Dublin, Ireland. We are committed to ongoing development of our traders and employees. Our flat organizational structure and casual work environment encourage the exchange of new ideas.
Geneva offers competitive salaries, performance-based bonuses, 401(k) with Company Match and generous PTO.

body: Job Summary A Statistical Data Analyst conducts statistical research analyses by developing research protocols, compiling data, managing data bases, analyzing data using specialized statistical computer programs, and presenting research results in numerical and graphic formats. This position will analyze data surrounding our Manufacturing, Sales, Quoting, Market Research and Web Data. This position will also oversee a new Business Intelligence dashboard reporting initiative.Nature of Work This position gathers, organizes and statistically analyzes research data. The position determines data requirements, designs data collection tools, constructs and manages databases, conducts statistical analysis of data, and reports results. Duties include use of specific statistical analysis software such as SAS or SPSS and may include SQL or other programming. Examples of Duties • Develops statistical surveys by designing data collection instruments, calculating sample sizes and selecting appropriate analytical procedures. • Conducts data analyses, and reports results associated with a research study, using R, SPSS, SAS, and other statistical analysis software. May use SPSS or other programming languages. • Summarizes statistical results of a research project by creating graphs, tables and charts. Interprets and conveys results to Project Leaders, Managers and Executives. Refines statistical models after consultation. • Designs ad hoc reports or dashboards screens as requested.• Recommends the most appropriate statistical techniques to be used in particular projects. This may require studying how other companies define trends and baselines for the analysis.• Designs large datasets in conjunction with systems programmers. Minimum Qualification Requirements • This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in a field directly related to the research or data analysis.• Minimum of one year of research experience; or a Master’s degree in one of the same fields.• Expert knowledge of a modern statistical analysis software package, such as SPSS, SAS or equivalent.• Working knowledge of a Business Intelligence dashboard software package, such as iDashboards. SPSS or other programming languages.Summarizes statistical results of a research project by creating graphs, tables and charts. Interprets and conveys results to Project Leaders, Managers and Executives. This may require studying how other companies define trends and baselines for the analysis.Designs large datasets in conjunction with systems programmers.Minimum Qualification RequirementsThis position requires a Bachelor’s degree in a field directly related to the research or data analysis.Minimum of one year of research experience; or a Master’s degree in one of the same fields.Expert knowledge of a modern statistical analysis software package, such as SPSS, SAS or equivalent.Working knowledge of a Business Intelligence dashboard software package, such as iDashboards.

body:
Ladders is a data driven responsive website that helps people ‘Manage, Market and Move-up’ in their careers. We are a dynamic, fast-paced, high-growth internet company that rewards meritorious performance. We work hard and have fun. We are a results oriented, goals driven team with a strong commitment to excellence. We want the best and the brightest individuals. We are looking for a talented Lead Data Scientist who is passionate about generating actionable insights and business opportunities from our data sets and has the leadership skills to grow and mentor the Data Science team. This team specializes in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistical Modeling and Analysis, Reporting, and Business Intelligence.
Responsibilities of the Lead Data Scientist:

Identify data opportunities to enhance business analytics
Provide hands-on leadership in the development of data-driven products
Build, develop and lead team of highly skilled data scientists and data engineers
Display creativity around solutions in presence of incomplete datasets, complex processes to model and tight deadlines
Work with leadership to develop strategy and best practices

Basic Qualifications of the Lead Data Scientist:

Master’s degree in a quantitative field (mathematics, computer science, physics, engineering, etc.)
3-5+ years of hands-on experience with building analytical solutions, using machine learning algorithms, statistical analysis, and business intelligence techniques
Strong understanding of data management (SQL, Hadoop MapReduce framework), implementation of machine learning algorithms (R, Python, Scala, Spark) and various statistical modeling techniques
1+ years of management experience leading data scientists and data engineers
Excellent oral and written communication skills and an ability to interact and understand technical subjects and emerging technologies and their relevance to the marketplace

Preferred Qualifications of the Lead Data Scientist (Not Required):

Doctorate degree in a quantitative field
Demonstrated track record of prototyping and launching industry leading data-driven products in recommendations, search, optimization, and/or data mining
Experience with full stack engineering: back end infrastructure, large scale algorithms, and front end experience design

SUMMARY OF POSITIONWarner Bros. Entertainment Inc. seeks a Big Data Engineer for the CM&DT: Data & Analytics department. Warner Bros. is building a team to support our Next Generation Data Platform initiative. We are looking for a Big Data Engineer to support Data Engineering for our Consumer Intelligence team.
Warner Bros. engages with hundreds of millions of consumers around the world on web, mobile, television and movie screens. The Warner Bros. Consumer Intelligence (WBCI) team aggregates and analyzes data generated by these platforms to support digital advertising strategies for Warner Bros. Theatrical, Home Entertainment, Digital Entertainment Group and Interactive Entertainment divisions.
As our Big Data Engineer, you will design, develop, orchestrate, and implement complex Data Pipelines leveraging the latest Big Data Technologies. Our system blends data from dozens of internal and third party sources. Your job will be to manage and own the Technology that enables data to be exchanged across the studio.
A key aspect of this role is to ensure that Data Delivery meets agreed upon SLAs and that Data Quality is always a priority. You will be responsible for requirements gathering, design, development, testing, survivorship, monitoring and ongoing support. The Big Data Engineer will need to be able to work in a fast paced environment and be able to adapt to new technologies and new ideas.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES• Design and develop new source system integrations from a variety of formats including files, database extracts and APIs.• Design and develop highly scalable Data Pipelines that incorporate complex transformations and efficient code. Data will need to flow to and from unstructured and relational systems for analytic processing.• Design and develop solutions for delivering data that meets SLAs and is of high quality. to various WB divisions for marketing and reporting as well as external vendors.• Investigate problems and resolve as required, including working with various internal teams and vendors. Proactively monitor the data flows with a focus on continued performance improvements.
JOB REQUIREMENTS• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.• Minimum of 4 years of relevant ETL/ELT experience.• Minimum of 1 year working with AWS S3, Data Pipeline, Redshift and EMR.• Minimum of two years of experience working with Hadoop solutions.• Expert in SQL and Python and developing data extraction applications.• Experience with data movement and transformation technologies.• Experience troubleshooting data-related issues.• Experience operating a production ETL/ELT solution.• Experience working with Apache Spark, Hive.• Expert problem solver with experience troubleshooting data-related issues.• Experience making large volumes of data actionable.• Experience using Git or SVN and Jira.• Experience integrating external APIs.• Experience with Java or Scala a plus.• Experience with Ad platforms or CRM solutions a plus.• Strong communication skills.• Ability to work independently or collaboratively.• Strong analytical skills and experience with analytical platforms a plus.• Detail oriented with strong organization and prioritization skills.• Entertainment and/or Social Media experience a plus.• Demonstrated ability to work well under time constraints.• Must be service-oriented.• Must be able to work flexible hours, including possible overtime, when necessary.• Must be able to maintain confidentiality.• Management has the right to add or change duties and job requirements at any time.
The Warner Bros. Entertainment Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and considers all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran's status (including protected veterans, as may be required by federal law), sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.

Theatrical, Home Entertainment, Digital Entertainment Group and Interactive Entertainment divisions.

We are looking for someone who is not only passionate about AWS, analytics and security, but it also excited about rolling out new technologies to support multiple studio wide initiatives focused on learning more about our consumers and what they want.
The role will own the infrastructure and networking aspect of our AWS environment, ensuring that the system is available, secure and running like a well oiled machine. • Extensive experience leading the operations of a data warehouse.• Demonstrated initiative to stay abreast of technology advancements.• Experience with cloud infrastructure and technologies.• Passion for Information Security and minimum 2 years experience.• Extensive experience writing SQL.• Experience developing data applications with Python.• Ability to analyze large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching.• Ability to communicate clearly and translate data into understandable documents.• Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously.• Understanding of commonly used protocols and services is required (e.g. SSL, TCP/UDP, WWW, FTP/SFTP, NTP, Telnet, NFS, SSH, LDAP, etc.).• Experience with securing cloud-based solutions is preferred.• Must possess the ability to meet deadlines and manage personnel in an efficient manner.• Must be able to effectively manage a number of projects and priorities in parallel.• Must be able to pay close attention to complex detail and understand written and oral instructions.• Must be able to organize and schedule work effectively.• Must be able to work well under time constraints.• Must be able to handle multiple tasks with changing priorities, communicating changes in scope and schedule to all parties concerned.

body:
Legendary Quantitative Researcher – Beijing, China
Position Overview
Legendary Applied Analytics is looking to expanding its capability in China and seeking Chinese speaking junior quantitative researchers with backgrounds in scientific research, computation, and statistics looking for an opportunity in a fast paced business environment within a dynamic industry. The researcher will focus on projects to analyze China’s fast growing entertainment industry through quantitative analysis and statistical modeling and working on analytic projects to build and maintain relationship with other researchers and entertainment domain experts from external partners.
The researcher will have opportunity to work with a diverse team of scientists, software developers, and business strategists within Legendary to advance Legendary’s content development and positioning. They will also have the chance to work with Chinese film experts in creative, marketing and distribution roles.
This position is based in Beijing.
Interested candidates should contact jdeng@legendary.com including a resume and statement of interest with their message.
Responsibilities include, but will not be limited to: 

Focus on research and development through statistical modeling of large datasets from across the entertainment industry.
Use data to interpret and predict consumer decision-making behavior throughout entertainment.
Develop, extend, and apply models and code from our team’s toolkit of statistical and analytical methodologies for industry-specific, social media, and consumer records datasets.
Being an active member of Legendary's Research Team -- comprising researchers with PhD's and advanced degrees in the computational, physical, and social sciences -- by participating in team meetings and working on collaborative projects.
Communicate with Chinese external partners.

Required qualifications: 

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, physical or quantitative social sciences, computational science or a related field or 1 years applied experience in data science and statistics.
Fluency with one or more of the following numerical computation environments: python scientific computing stack, R, matlab.
Experience in the analysis and visualization of large, complex datasets.
Available to begin mid 2016 or earlier.
Native language is Chinese and fluent in English.
Demonstrable experience in communicating research methods and results to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Recommended qualifications: 

Masters or 3 years applied experience in a related field.
Expertise with one or more of the following machine learning and statistical modeling domains: quantitative textual analysis, Bayesian modeling, statistical or network analysis of social media data, image analysis and recognition.
Fluency with SQL, version control software, Unix, and other data management and development systems.
Experience in Natural Language Processing of Chinese language.

General Overview 
Legendary is a leading global media company with film, television, digital and comics divisions dedicated to owning, producing and delivering innovative content like Jurassic World, Godzilla, and The Dark Knight to mainstream audiences with a targeted focus on the powerful fandom demographic. Legendary’s in production films include Warcraft and Zhang Yimou’s Great Wall. In aggregate, Legendary Pictures-associated productions have realized grosses of more than $10 billion worldwide at the box office. A trusted brand built on quality and authenticity, we create un-missable cultural event properties and breathe life into the most epic myths of our time.
Legendary’s Applied Analytics division sources and leverages emerging data sets to quantitatively model, predict, and influence consumer purchasing decisions in the entertainment industry and beyond. Based in Boston and Beijing, Legendary’s Applied Analytics division is a major strategic initiative for the company, supported with more than 40 full time staff. A highly innovative, rapidly growing group within one of Hollywood’s most successful film studios, Legendary Applied Analytics is unique within the industry.

body:
Join our small and powerful team of scientists and engineers to work on one of the world's largest facial coding databases and a ground breaking project that teaches computers to better understand us humans.
As an industrial partner we design and implement ready to market products that exploit the results from academic collaborations in EC funded projects. The website of one of such interesting projects is: http://www.sewaproject.eu/ . In this project we are going to build a particular recommendation engine driven by human emotions. Your primary task as a Data Scientist and Engineer will be to build recommendation engine based human emotions and behaviour. You will also collaborate with our academic partners, which involves, understanding parts of their behaviour analytics research, integrating into our recommendation engine, travelling to project meetings and presenting the latest results to academic and industrial audience.
Responsibilities:

Analysing facial expression data, audio emotions data and other types of behavioural data to derive new metrics and insights
Building and improving predictive models linking behavioural expression data to external data and answering specific research questions
Building the next generation big-data pipelines for interactive and scalable facial expression data analysis in the cloud
Automating data extraction, loading, transformation, storage and visualisation of different types of data, in particular behavioural data
Staying up-to-date with latest innovation in data science solutions landscape and helping define Realeyes' data strategy

Qualifications & Requirements:

1+ years of experience in data science and architecture, backed up by bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or in other relevant fields
Experience of working with data sets ranging from few gigabytes to multi-terrabytes using either Python (iPython), Scala, R, Matlab or SQL. Previous work on real-life Spark or Hadoop projects is of strong relevance
Comfortable with large data sets and a wide variety of statistical techniques
Expert level understanding of statistical (classification, clustering) and machine learning (SVM, Neural Networks) techniques
Real-life experience in deep learning methods, such as convolutional neural networks, long/short term memory networks would be a great advantage
Good communication skills, able to clearly present complex concepts and insights to clients and less technical-minded team members
Excellent spoken and written English

What we offer:

Exciting work with some of the leading experts in the field of facial expression analysis around the world
Motivating environment
Competitive salary
Budget for professional development
Reduced gym membership
Fun team with lots of varying interests and activities that we often join to do together
Flexible hours
Drinks, snacks and more

body:
Eaton’s Corporate Research and Technology (CRT) located in Southfield MI, has an opening for a Senior Data Scientist in the global Data Analytics team.
Corporate Research & Technology focuses on the front end of innovation by: conducting research to advance the state of the art, emphasizing cross-business impact technologies, and innovating to provide Eaton’s customers’ with safe, efficient, and reliable power management solutions.
The Data Analytics team has the principal goal of identifying, developing, and justifying commercialization of significant growth opportunities for diverse Eaton businesses by developing advanced machine learning, data mining and sensor fusion technologies applied to intelligent devices, systems and services.
As a senior member of the Data Analytics team, the Senior Data Scientist is expected to lead technology strategy and execution for broad applications. This includes acquiring resources, funding and establishing key partnerships both internally and externally to drive technological advancement and business case development. The Senior Data Scientist should serve as a subject matter expert within the area of Data Science for Eaton and maintain Eaton’s technology leadership and engagement with the external technical community in this area.
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications: •Masters or PhD Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Statistics or equivalent technical field from an accredited institution.
•Minimum of 7 years of experience and extensive knowledge of advanced machine learning and data mining technologies with applications in one of the following areas: prognostics and health management, predictive and statistical modeling, self-learning and adaptive systems.
Position Criteria:
•Ability to prototype machine learning algorithms and apply them data driven solutions to problems in new domains and strong business acumen and the ability to understand and formulate compelling value propositions, and to understand and drive through value and adoption chains. Experience to build production grade machine learning enabled solutions end to end in one of the following application domains is highly desired: smart grid, intelligent lighting and data center power management.
•Software development skills in one or more high level languages (C#/C/C++/Java/F#) and rapid prototyping platform (MATLAB/SIMULINK). Expertise with common machine learning tools (R, RapidMiner and etc.) is required. Experience with AWS or Azure is a plus.
•Experience in leading projects with multiple stakeholders in matrix organizations and strong program management skills. Ability to apply six sigma methodologies including QFD, design of experiments, and reliability engineering in the course of their work. Green belt or black belt certification in DFSS or DMAIC is highly desired.
•Proven track record for IP generation and publications in reputable peer-reviewed journals is highly desired.
•Experience in writing government proposals is also desired; demonstrated success as evidenced by being selected for funding and successful execution of government sponsored projects is preferred.
More details about this position can be found at:
http://www.eaton-jobs.com/ShowJob/Id/742871/Senior-Data-Scientist/
Eaton is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Eaton is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

body:
HelloFresh is among the Top 3 largest companies to come out of Europe over the past 4 years (market cap). Our growth trajectory and expansion has been phenomenal – only 4 years after inception we are active in 7 markets on 3 continents, all of which are managed and maintained from our global headquarters in Berlin.
We aim to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch at home. We have received almost US$ 300mn in venture capital and have won multiple prizes for our work. Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring work environment in which you will thrive! Join us and help building up a fresh food global champion!
About the job

Discuss ideas for new data science products with business stakeholders and counsel them how to leverage data most successfully
Build, grow, and lead our team of data scientists, from improving individuals’ skills, identifying training needs to managing day-to-day work
Together with your team develop the algorithms that support our operations, supply chain, and Marketing
Identify new areas where we can leverage algorithms to improve internal processes
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the data science field and how they translate into better data science at HelloFresh
Work with the DWH product manager and develop requirements on data infrastructure in order to make life easier for the internal heavy users of our data Represent HelloFresh’s data scientist community both within the group as well as externally

Who we’re looking for

You are a world-class and enthusiastic problem-solver. When you see a challenge, you dig deep into data to come up with creative solutions and product initiatives to help solve the challenge.
You have first experience coaching other data scientists and have a passion for developing your team members further
You have 5+ years experience in a business environment analyzing very large sets of real data, applying machine learning, predictive analytics, statistics, data mining, scalable algorithms, using Hadoop/Spark and statistical programming environments (especially Python and R)
You have successfully implemented data-driven features/products that run in your company's website / data warehouse

What we offer

The opportunity to get into one of the most intellectually demanding roles at one of the largest technology companies in Europe.
Cutting edge technology, allowing you to work with state-of-the-art tools and software solutions.
Competitive compensation and plenty of room for personal growth.
Great international exposure and team atmosphere.
Work in a modern, spacious office in the heart of Berlin with excellent transport links and employee perks.

Kaggle is looking for a content marketing intern to join our team. This will be a paid position with 30-40 hours of work per month.
What You Will Learn

How to be a truly creative, yet technical, writer across a variety of marketing channels. You will own the creation of content for Kaggle’s competition homepage, our newsletter, the no free hunch blog, and our social media
Blog management and content publishing. You will be the main contributor to no free hunch and will be responsible for framing, formatting, editing, and adding graphics to winners’ interviews and technical posts
Newsletter production. You will learn to create visually appealing and engaging emails for our community

The ideal candidate will be:

Comfortable translating machine learning problems into a compelling story
Excited to interview and work closely with Kagglers on blog content
Familiar with, or ready to quickly learn, WordPress and basic graphic editing
Action-oriented, low-ego, creative, and curious

Goodgame Studios has become one of the fastest growing games developers through the energetic fusion of art and science. We bring together exceptional individuals from both the worlds of analytic science and dynamic creativity. Headquartered in Hamburg, we make outstanding games by harnessing the unique energy generated by the daily collaboration of 1200+ employees from over 60 nations.
As a Reporting Analyst (m/f) with an open-minded and result-driven attitude, you will collaborate with our reporting team on introducing a new and innovative reporting tool and developing a sustainable reporting solution for the future. In your position, you will serve as link, mediator, and the driving force between technical requirements and IT. You give yourself ambitious goals, chase them, and inspire others to do so. Keeping the overall goal in mind at all times and implementing interfaces for a number of departments describes your working style.

Shape the technical development of our reporting technologies
Develop transparent and consistent reporting through all channels (mobile, dashboards, reports, emails, exports, etc.)
Work with complicated data using targeted visuals and an intelligent reporting structure
Engage with stakeholders and assist with a variety of projects in business intelligence
Collaborate with other analysts to define convincing dashboards

Experience working with SQL
Knowledge of developing web applications and coding is a plus
Strong sense of responsibility and an independent working approach
Completed university degree (computer science, mathematics, business administration, business information systems, or similar)
Very good written and spoken English

Your professional growth is important to us. We provide agile structures, flat hierarchies, and ongoing training opportunities
Results-oriented teamwork that values employee contribution
A positive life balance with sports, catering, counseling, and active feedback
Leading technology and analysis opportunities, that give you the freedom to innovate
Sustainable and profit-oriented growth, untouched by external investors

Hamburg is one of the most beautiful cities in the world and provides a fantastic range of leisure activities as well as a great nightlife. A maritime atmosphere and its Hanseatic cosmopolitan flair enable an especially high quality of life - and safety. body:
Summary:
Neural Analytics, a medical device company, is searching for a Senior Data Scientist to help develop innovative, data-driven brain health diagnostics. This individual will join a team responsible for digital signal processing, data mining and machine learning activities within the organization.
Key Responsibilities:

Take a leadership role in the research and development of novel machine learning and analytical models combining multi-modal physiological data, including cerebral blood flow velocity waveforms, electrocardiograms, medical history and other clinical factors.
Apply digital signal processing to physiologic time-series data.
Lead research and technical projects in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Take an active role in grant proposal writing, IP applications and writing publications.
Mentor junior level data scientists.

Minimum Requirements:

MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Bioinformatics or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of professional data science experience.
Expertise in programming (Python, C/C++, Java).
Excellent software development skills within a structured architecture.
Hands-on experience with statistical software (R, Matlab, Python).
Self-motivated, intelligent individual with initiative and drive for overcoming technical challenges.
Outstanding problem solving and structuring as well as the ability to mine complex datasets and surface actionable insights.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Passion, integrity and commitment to excellence.

Preferred Requirements:

PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Bioinformatics or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5+ years of professional data science experience.
Strong publication and patent record as well as success in grant proposal writing.
Expertise in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms and software engineering.
Experience with digital signal processing of time-series ultrasound, fMRI, ECG or similar medical data.
Familiarity with and ability to comprehend medical and technical literature.
Working understanding of human physiology, especially cerebral hemodynamics.
Experience in project leadership.

About the company:
Neural Analytics, Inc. is a well-funded, LA-based startup company that is addressing a global unmet need for immediate and non-invasive diagnosis of head trauma, specifically concussions. The company was born in 2013 and has been cultivating its cutting-edge technology for the past 3 years. Neural Analytics is an agile and energetic workplace, staffed by a growing, high-performing team.

Sportradar, the market leading supplier of sports and betting-related data services with more than 450 bookmakers as clients, is seeking a Risk/Data Scientist that will analyse the betting data in order to assess and manage the implied risk exposure.
Main Responsibilities: • Create automated trading algorithms based on the betting volume and liability of our bookmaker clients• Apply cluster analysis on the bettors and identify model deficiencies based on betting strategies
Other Responsibilities:
• Cleanse data and apply supervised/unsupervised learning methods to identify and interpret data patterns• Document the process followed and report to the quant-team on work-flow• Research new computational/statistical methods for future applications• Collaborate closely with product developers/managers to move projects from idea to implementation• Communicate with clients the key elements that govern the analysis
Essential Requirements:• A postgraduate qualification (minimum 60%) in Statistics/Financial Mathematics or a closely related field with a strong quantitative component• Advanced programming (Python, R, Java etc.) and Excel skills• Experience with modern Machine Learning techniques for solving clustering and classification problems
Desirable Requirements: 
• Good understanding of the betting industry• Big Data analysis (Spark, Hadoop etc)• Experience in Algorithmic Trading and Financial Modelling techniques
 Personal Requirements:
• Fluent in English (written and spoken), another European language will be considered as a plus• Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills• General technical understanding and high interest in technical solutions• Creative thinking, keen to further refine systems and processes• Highly self-motivated, leading by example and enthusiasm• Being a team player, with the ability to work with new teams immediately• Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities as well as product environments and able to work to tight deadlines• Patience, tactfulness, diplomacy and approachability• Commitment to upholding the highest professional work standards and ethics
Company Overview:Sportradar is a global leader in understanding and leveraging the power of sports data and digital content for its clients around the world. We provide cutting-edge solutions and services to media companies, bookmakers, sports federations and state authorities.We are a truly international business employing over 1,300 people in more than 30 locations around the world. Our rapid growth has been driven by technological innovation alongside an understanding of our clients’ business needs. It is our commitment to excellent service, quality and reliability that makes us the trusted partner of more than 800 companies in over 80 countries.We occupy a unique position at the intersection of the sports, media and betting industries. This creates an exciting and fast-moving working environment that rewards creative thinking and hard work. We are passionate about what we do, and we care passionately about our people.If you think you’re up to the challenge, come and help us to grow, innovate and develop!
How to Apply:Please send an email to jobs@sportradar.com with attention to Group Head of HR, attaching a copy of your CV and Statement of Purpose where you should explain:• Why you want to work for Sportradar• How you meet the professional and desirable requirements

body:
Machine Learning ScientistD-Wave is building hardware with the goal of computing as fast as nature will allow. We're working hard on exploiting quantum resources which are known to offer large computational speedups on some problems. The D-Wave quantum annealing computer is able to sample from probability distributions and optimize functions that are computationally intractable using classical hardware. When viewed as a sampler, the native operation of the D-Wave machine is analogous to a sparsely-connected restricted Boltzmann machine. Similar network dynamics have fueled the recent explosion in the field of deep learning, the results of which are presently deployed in products ranging from speech recognition to image search. The D-Wave applications research team is working to exploit the parallels between these architectures to substantially accelerate learning in deep, hierarchical neural networks.Position:We are seeking an experienced machine learning scientist to join our research. In this position you will work with a team of machine learning and quantum computation experts to create novel machine learning algorithms that use the power of the D-Wave quantum computer. You will design and implement algorithms being developed by the team, investigate their properties, and help fine-tune their design.This role offers you the chance to do inventive, ground-breaking research in an exciting and collaborative research environment. As a member of the Machine Learning Researcher team, you will be given the freedom to work within your passions towards our overall goals, encouraged to explore new ideas, and publish your findings.Responsibilities Include:

Work closely with machine learning experts to design, implement, tune, and optimize machine learning algorithms.
Design and implement experiments to test the quality of machine learning algorithms.
Validate promising research concepts with high quality Python, Matlab, or Julia implementations.
Apply fundamental software engineering principles: software design patterns, version control, unit tests, documentation.
Collaborate with a diverse group of technical experts to incorporate their expertise into software projects.

Required Qualifications:

PhD in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, or physics.
Experience in statistical methods for machine learning, ideally including probabilistic models, with a focus on Boltzmann machines and MCMC techniques.
Demonstrated success in the application of machine learning to practical problems.
Contribution to research communities and/or efforts, including publishing papers at conferences such as NIPS, ICML, ACL, CVPR, etc
Excellent coding abilities. Preference given to demonstrated experience using Python, Matlab, or Julia.
Self-motivated, enthusiastic and flexible with excellent problem solving skills

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those who are selected for interviews will be contacted.
It is D-Wave Systems Inc policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status , or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, local law.

body:
About You 
We are seeking talented data scientists to join our data modeling team. This position will help define how our products will evolve by working closely with engineers to rapidly prototype new features and complementary products, delivering our customers actionable intelligence from large data sets. The role involves research as well as software implementations of machine learning prototypes and experiments. Data Scientists are required to be able to understand user needs through interaction with client-facing staff, architect solutions and shepherd products through prototype phase. You will need to be comfortable working in the most agile of environments. Requirements will be vague. Iterations will be rapid. Researchers must be nimble and take smart risks.
Responsibilities
• Mine and analyze data pertaining to customers’ business experience to discover critical business insights
• Generate ideas for new products, from directing high-level concept formation to prototyping
• Synthesize research data, turning data to actionable insights and specific model requirements
• Quickly deploy out-of the-box solutions where possible, innovate when necessary
• Stay current with advancements in machine learning and advocate for the appropriate application of those advancements in our own products
• Work closely with engineers and production developers to ensure clear, effective communication within the team
• Occasionally develop short, optimized pieces of code
Ideal Candidate Profile 
As a candidate, you must have facility in bringing ideas to a scalable reality, meeting equally well the needs of users and business goals. You are equal parts researcher, information architect and hacker. You communicate and collaborate well with software engineers. You care deeply about the details while always keeping the big picture in mind. You enjoy developing creative solutions to difficult problems in an autonomous, startup environment with direct contact to top management and industry experts. You are passionate about innovating and enjoy independence to pursue designated goals.
Skills and Qualifications 
• Machine learning and/or statistics coursework
• Familiarity with recent large-scale machine learning tools (e.g. TensorFlow, Torch, Spark, Hadoop) a plus, but not required.
• Familiarity with a modern scripting language (like Python)
• Database experience (SQL) a plus, but not required
• Research oriented – you seek to understand model behavior, not just apply tools blindly • Able to adapt quickly, and draw from a range of tools as needed
• Industry experience a plus • BS/MS to Ph.D levels available

body:
Senior Data Engineer/Data Scientist
McLean,VA
Job HighlightsMITRE has critical needs to conduct quantitative data analysis using multiple datasets to identify, monitor, and predict air traffic safety and performance in the National Airspace System. The individual will be involved in the retrieval, processing, fusion, and analysis of data to identify hazards associated with current and proposed operations, the development of backend data architecture to support rapid analytics, and the development and deployment of data visualization tools and dashboards for monitoring key performance indicators.
Key Functions- Analyze historical and simulated operational data to support decisions that have implications for aviation safety risk and mitigation strategies- Apply data analysis skills: exploratory data analysis, data mining, time series analysis, distribution fitting, regression, classification, clustering- Develop algorithms to identify anomalous flight behavior and implement at scale on the Hadoop platform- Apply statistical methods for trending analysis, regressions, and predictive models- Draw conclusions from data and clearly and concisely articulate key findings in both written and verbal form- Develop data visualizations/dashboards that communicate findings
Required Qualifications- Proficiency programming in two or more of the following languages: Python, Java, Scala- Proficiency with database tools and Big Data systems/tools, e.g. Apache Hadoop, Hive, Pig, SQL- Experience working in the following operating environments -- Linux/Unix, Windows
Preferred Qualifications- Bachelors in Computer Science, Data Science/Data Analytics, Applied Mathematics/Statistics, - Operations Research, Systems Engineering, or other physical science/engineering fields; Masters or PhD highly desired- Large data sets time-series analysis desired- Extensive statistical modeling experience (regression, classification, clustering)- Fluency in Hadoop Ecosystem, e.g. MapReduce, Pig, Hive, and Spark- Algorithm development on high-performance systems- Experience in data pipeline management, ETL/ELT, and data/system architecture
About MITRE: - Are you interested in contributing to technical projects that you can feel passionate about?- Do you want to feel like your ideas are valued?- Are you interested in working for a company where a 40 hour week is the norm and not the exception?- Do you want exceptional benefits, including generous tuition reimbursement for coursework towards an advance degree in a technical discipline?- Do you want to continue to grow and learn in your field by taking courses in the field of data analytics through the numerous tech talks, innovation exchanges, brown bags and speaker series?
If so, we are your employer of choice. MITRE is a not-for-profit organization that operates research and development centers sponsored by the federal government. We offer exceptional benefits, strongly support policies that promote work/life balance, and operate an extensive internal research & development program. We have employees who are currently working with the Federal Aviation Administration, Department of Veterans Affairs, the Department of Energy, the Internal Revenue Service, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, the Census Bureau, the Department of Defense, and the Department of Homeland Security. We also actively conduct independent research of interest to our government partners. Our employees are expected to work on multiple projects, cross pollinate good ideas across the government, and continuously learn.
Apply at http://www.mitre.org/careers, referencing Job #25262BR

body:
Bankable Frontier Associates (BFA) is looking for a Python Programmer who has proficient programming skills and enjoys working independently in a high-energy environment. This position is for immediate hire.
BFA is a global research and strategy consulting firm, focused in the financial inclusion space, with offices in Boston, New York, Nairobi and Bogota. BFA’s clients include leading international public agencies, influential philanthropic organizations, private financial providers, international NGOs, international banking groups, microfinance institutions and mobile network operators. BFA focuses on the questions and opportunities created by financial sector development, and it has completed assignments for clients based in Asia, Africa, North America, Latin America, and Europe. 
Detailed data analytics is one of the pillars of the evidence-based work we do. We rely greatly on primary quantitative research as we help clients navigate the risks and complexities of new technologies, regulatory options, economic challenges and social change to craft appropriate sustainable responses and long term competitive strategies. With teams based in Boston, New York, Nairobi and Bogota, BFA draws on expertise in specialist areas from a range of skilled associates across the globe. 
What you’ll do
As a Python Programmer, your primary role will include:• Coordinating and facilitating periodic collection of data from third party financial institutions, including but not limited to: core banking systems, mobile product usage, payments and transactions on goods and services, and monitoring and evaluation systems• Writing modules to clean, parse and re-organize data• Supporting an existing set of analytics modules• Building out additional analytics modulesAdditional tasks will depend on project requirements determined by our client-driven work. Qualifications
The ideal candidate for the position should have the following qualifications:• BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent• Proficient knowledge of Python• Exposure to building Python applications• Familiarity with SQL-based databases • Good grasp of data structures, algorithms, and optimization techniques
Any of the following will be considered a plus:• Experience with working on projects involving outside teams• Experience with handling large datasets• Familiarity with statistical analysis and data mining techniques• Familiarity with Stata• Proficiency in Excel• Excellent written and spoken English• Familiarity working with different cultures and languagesLocation
We would be comfortable hearing from candidates based in Boston, New York, Nairobi or Bogota. Provided you already have the ability to legally work in the U.S., Kenya or Colombia, we would be willing to re-locate an outstanding candidate. You may be required to travel and work with stakeholders around the world. What we offer
• Competitive compensation and benefits • A chance to work on exciting problems in developing countries and have a tangible impact on improving the quality of services offered to the poor• Exposure to leading thinkers and researchers in the financial inclusion space • Significant professional growth potential and opportunity to frame evidence-based discussions in a niche industry • A virtually unlimited amount of data to play withHow to apply
Please email your cover letter, resume, and salary requirements to rsoulliere@bankablefrontier.com, with Python Programmer in the subject line, detailing how your candidacy satisfies the description outlined above. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for follow-up.
location: Boston, New York, Nairobi or Bogota-based

body:
BIGCHEM (BIG data in CHEMistry) is a Marie Skodowska-Curie Innovative Training Network (ITN) for Early Stage Researchers (ESR) funded by the European Commission under the H2020 Programme. The BIGCHEM ITN will provide a comprehensive and cross-disciplinary structured curriculum for doctoral students in large chemical data analysis using machine-learning, computational chemistry and chemoinformatics methods. The innovative research program will be implemented with the target users, large pharma companies and SMEs, which generate and analyse large chemical data.
BIGCHEM is a collaborative action of 9 groups in 5 countries from academia and pharmaceutical industry. The complementary expertise of partners in different aspect of large chemical data, including data production, data security, analysis, and development of theoretical methods is the basis of the research topics and allocation of individual tasks and resources.
The project will train ten Early Stage Researchers (ESR). Each ESR will spend at least 50% of time with industrial partners and will be employed for 36 months in total (18 months with academic partner and 18 months with industrial partner or vice versa). The ESRs will be enrolled in the respective Universities and will study towards their PhD degrees. ESR1: Machine learning methodologies for mining very large compound data sets. (Boehringer Ingelheim GmbH & Co KG and University of Bonn, Germany)ESR2: Computational compound screening and profiling by large-scale mining of pharmaceutical data. (University of Bonn, Germany and Boehringer Ingelheim GmbH & Co KG, Germany)ESR3: Big data visualization and modeling using Generative Topographic Mapping (GTM). (University of Strasbourg and Boehringer Ingelheim GmbH & Co KG, Germany)ESR4: Development of frequent hitters filters for HTS screening. (Helmholtz Zentrum München & Lead Discovery Center GmbH, Germany)ESR5: Analysis of Compound Promiscuity Based on Bioassay Ontology. (University of Bonn & AstraZeneca, Germany & Sweden)ESR6: Developing virtual screening methods to exploit large virtual chemical space. (University of Bern & AstraZeneca, Sweden & Switzerland)ESR7: Exploration of uncharted regions of the chemical space by reaction-driven de novo design. (Boehringer Ingelheim GmbH & Co KG and ETH Zürich, Germany and Switzerland)ESR8: Accessing new chemical space for lead optimization based on QSAR models. (AstraZeneca & Helmholtz Zentrum München, Germany & Sweden)ESR9: Integrated ligand- and structure-based approaches for predicting compound polypharmacology based on big data. (University of Modena and Reggio Emilia & AstraZeneca, Italy & Sweden)ESR10: Secure sharing of information using ensemble of machine learning methods and surrogate data. (Helmholtz Zentrum München & AstraZeneca, Germany & Sweden)
Further information about the recruitment process as well as the eligibility criteria are indicated on the BIGCHEM site http://bigchem.eu (or from info AT bigchem.eu). Applications should be submitted on-line through the project website http://bigchem.eu.  Deadline for applications is 20.03.2016.
company: Helmholtz Zentrum Muenchen - Deutsches Forschungszentrum fuer Gesundheit und Umwelt (GmbH)
job_title: Ten doctoral/PhD positions in Data Scientist; Computational chemistry; Chemoinformatics; Machine Learning
location: Europe: Germany Sweden Switzerland Italy France

Our supportive environment can help you make a difference within the company and the communities we serve. Visit our career site at wellsfargo.com/careers and let’s start a conversation about your future.
Data ScientistWilmington, DEOur foundation for success can be summarized in three beliefs:Our product is service.Our value added is financial advice and guidance.Our competitive advantage is our people. It all begins with outstanding talent.
In Wells Fargo's Consumer Lending Group (CLG), we've built our team of top professionals by rewarding their accomplishments and ensuring they have what's needed to succeed. We value and promote diversity and inclusion in every aspect of our business and at every level of our organization.
The CLG team includes Home Lending, Consumer Credit Card, Personal Loans and Lines, Direct Auto, Dealer Services, Commercial Auto, Retail Services and Education Financial Services including the professional services teams that partner with these businesses - Human Resources, Finance, Credit Risk, and Compliance & Operational Risk.
The Consumer Financial Solutions (CFS) team focuses on the growth and management of Wells Fargo's consumer credit card portfolio, including general purpose and co-brand cards. In addition, our team delivers industry-leading rewards, offers, and benefits that recognize and celebrate our customers' relationship with Wells Fargo and keep us focused on earning and re-earning more of their business. We also continue to explore innovative new solutions for helping consumers accomplish their financial goals. All of this is enabled by our strong teams in loan operations, project and systems delivery, customer excellence, strategy, analytics and our partners in risk, marketing, and finance.
The new Digital Incubator team ("incubator") leads Wells Fargo's online and mobile credit card acquisition strategy and execution, partnering with product, marketing, credit risk, and loan operations teams to develop new digital card acquisition capabilities and offerings.
The Digital Incubator will manage all aspects of digital card acquisition, from lead source prioritization, customer targeting, and data measurement & analytics to application origination, underwriting, and fulfillment.
At the Wells Fargo’s Digital Incubator we are all about using smart, innovative, data-driven business solutions to develop and execute a bold and market-leading digital acquisition strategy for our rapidly growing credit card business. Right now, we are looking for a bright and creative data scientist to help us design and build the next generation of predictive tools that will guide our digital capabilities and offerings. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-paced, challenging, and "start-up" like environment.
Responsibilities• Apply various statistical and machine learning techniques, to develop segmentations, predictive models, experimental designs, and decision analyses• Gather, manipulate, and analyze large data sets from multiple sources• Develop algorithms to optimize product offering, pricing, and distribution channel• Transform data into impactful business insights, strategy recommendations and implementation plans to improve key performance metrics for the business• Evaluate model output, formulate and test hypotheses, weigh alternatives, and determine appropriate responses• Apply deep, creative, rigorous thinking to solve broad business problems• Collaborate closely with various functional groups such as Product, Marketing, and Technology to successfully deliver results• Effectively communicate findings and solutions to a variety of audiences
**This position can be located anywhere within the CLG footprint**
Required Qualifications• 6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling
Desired Qualifications• Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis• Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills• Ability to think creatively to find innovative solutions to complex analytical questions• Ability to work in a fast-paced deadline driven environment
Other Desired Qualifications• 6+ years of hands-on experience building predictive models using regression analysis• 3+ years hands-on supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques (e.g. CHAID, random forest, boosted trees, Bayesian modeling, support vector machines, neural networks, clustering, graphical models)• Expert knowledge of SAS and SQL.• Experience with one or more of the following: R, Python, Pig, Hive.• Experience with distributed computing (Hadoop).• Familiarity with web analytics concepts (i.e. sales funnel analysis, click through, impressions, etc.)• Breadth of knowledge includes full lifecycle of customer from targeting to acquisition, customer performance, loyalty, and retention• Financial industry and digital marketing experience a plus• Familiarity with digital channel systems, processes, and analytic tools
Visit wellsfargo.com/careers and search by Job ID # 5191274 to apply.
Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women. Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation. © 2016 Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. All rights reserved. Member FDIC.
