body:
Carlisle & Company offers exciting opportunities for Associates to be engaged in global challenges in the motor vehicle industry, and to contribute to a growing company. Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds, but all are keen business analysts, excellent communicators, and subject-matter experts. We are passionate about the industry, the products and solving problems. Carlisle is an intellectually challenging environment where you are expected to learn new things and apply them immediately.
Carlisle seeks a Data Analytics Engineer to support a new practice area in expanding the firm’s capabilities in data warehousing, extraction, and analysis. The Data Analytics Engineer will be responsible for the development and maintenance of systems to securely extract, transform, store, and analyze complex and disparate data for multiple clients, and develop interfaces (applications and APIs) that deliver insights back to our clients.
Key Competencies:
• Able to design and maintain relational databases on platforms such as MySQL, PostgreSQL and SQL Server• Experience in extracting, importing, cleaning, transforming, and validating large complex datasets.• Proficiency with cloud-based database platforms such as SQL, Azure, Amazon RDS, and/or Google Cloud SQL.• Proficiency with visualization tools such as Tableau, SAP Luminara, Qlikview, Plotly, D3, and/or ggplot.• Familiarity and interest in developing and enhancing web applications, using Python and Javascript frameworks such as Django or AngularJS.• Proficiency in Python, R, and/or Javascript.
Primary requirements:
• A Bachelor’s degree within a discipline such as engineering, computer science, quantitative social sciences or related fields.• One to three years of experience in database development, statistical analysis, and predictive analytics/machine learning.• Outstanding analytical abilities and creative problem-solving skills.• Excellent communication skills—both written and verbal.• Ability to work independently as well as in a small team environment.• A professional demeanor.
For consideration, please send cover letter and resume to recruiting@carlisle-co.com.
Privately-held Carlisle & Company is the preferred provider of strategic guidance and tactical solutions for many of the world’s most prestigious motor vehicle brands. Our expertise is in after-sales program development and enterprise strategy, after-sales best practices and benchmarking, and vehicle market strategies for industry-leading manufacturers. Our projects include supply chain strategies, sales and marketing, pricing and brand strategies, market sizing and share model, market research and customer satisfaction surveys.
Our clients are a broad range of domestic and import original equipment manufacturers, including Volkswagen, General Motors, Caterpillar, and Daimler Trucks. Carlisle & Company takes pride in its dynamic and entrepreneurial culture, its non-hierarchical structure, and commitment to providing the best solutions to our clients. We are looking for people who want to help create company, not just fit into one.
To learn more about us, please visit www.carlisle-co.com, LinkedIn/Carlisle & Company, and follow us on Twitter @carlislecompany.

alert_message: This job post has expired (either the position was filled or the post is no longer listed). You are viewing an archived version.
body:
77 million Americans work for an hourly wage. Their median income is $34,142. They don’t make a lot of money—and worse, their income and expenses are inconsistent. As a result, they frequently don’t have enough income to cover expenses, so these Americans spend $100 billion every year just to make ends meet. They lose 10-30% of their income to things like payday loans, overdraft fees, and late bill fees. It is expensive to be poor.
You want to fix that. At Even, you’ll be using data to help Americans get out of debt faster, build liquid assets sooner, and increase the efficiency of every dollar they earn. You will help us quantify the impact our product has on the American workforce. And you’ll work in an organization that views data science as central to everything we do, because it’s how we know if we’re truly succeeding at solving the problem.
You'll:

Build our ability to quantify what our users are doing: what they’re spending their money on, when and why they’re spending, and what they’re doing when they’re using the Even app
Develop hypotheses for how we might influence those things, and work with our engineering team to test your hypotheses
Collaborate with our engineers on our internal APIs to ensure you spend less time fixing the way you get data, and more time understanding the data
Work with our credit team to feed your understanding into our credit models
Own our ability to disseminate what you've learned. This could include things like dashboards, data workshops, annual reports, etc.

To succeed, you'll need:

Strong statistics and/or mathematics fundamentals. You don’t need a formal degree, but you must speak the language of data.
Intellectual honesty. Your job is to discover the truth, not "validate" your preconceptions.
The technical ability to build your own models and ingest data from our APIs. Python is probably the best tool for this job, but we don't care what technology you use so long as it doesn't limit you.
Familiarity with (or, at least, a desire to learn) algorithms for semi-supervised clustering and classification

body:
At trivago we take data-informed decisions. In undertaking analyses of big data, our Business Intelligence team provides insights that help to determine the strategies of all of our departments. Now the Business Intelligence Team is looking for an analytical thinker to work with our Quality Assurance team in order to help them find the root cause of website issues. Your main responsibility will be to provide consultation to the QA team; you will do this by supporting them in analysing critical incidents and showing them how to correctly read data and interpret results so that they understand the meaning behind the data. You will also be responsible for assisting in analysing the large amounts of data coming from our many A/B tests and search for anomalies. You will thoroughly search through our logging and data warehouse infrastructure in order to understand bugs that appear on our website or in data. We are always looking for ways to improve our current processes so you will be encouraged to enhance our automated anomaly detection system in order to detect anomalies close to real time and allow issues to be quickly resolved.
The ideal candidate:• Speaks English (our company language) fluently.• Holds a B.A. or B.Sc. in one of the natural sciences (Maths, Physics, etc.), Computer Science or a Business-related course where there was a focus on statistics or data analysis.• Has some previous professional experience, including internships, working with data analysis.• Has good Excel skills.• Has at least a basic understanding of analytics tools. Knowledge of SQL or Hadoop, as well as any IT architecture knowledge, would be a plus.• Is analytically minded and capable of drawing valuable insights from raw data.• Is capable of communicating complex information in a simple, crisp and concise way.• Can start as soon as possible.
Life at trivago is...• The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.• Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.• Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.• The freedom to embrace small-scale failures on the path to large-scale success.• The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free workshops, seminars, sports and activities.• The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.• Living in Düsseldorf, the 6th highest quality of living city in the world for expats.Additional information:• Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.• This is a fixed-term position of 1 year with a long-term perspective.• We do not require the services of an agency for this position.
Apply online: http://bit.ly/1QwPOa4
Please note we only process applications via this URL. If clicking the URL in this message does not work, just copy and paste it into the address bar of your browser.

body:
Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.
There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialize after work almost every Friday.
B.responsible

Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights. 
Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.
Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.
Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.
Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.

B.skilled

Minimum 3 years of experience in a relevant role
Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.)
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, machine learning and programming. Strong working knowledge of Perl, Python, Hadoop, SQL, R and/or Excel.
Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders

B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.
This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the world leader in booking accommodations online) and/or its various support companies throughout the world are looking for people to support the business in the fast-growing accommodation markets. Booking.com BV is looking for a Data Scientist - Analytics .

body:
Would you like to translate terabytes of data into unforgettable holidays for millions of people around the globe? Booking.com, the world’s largest accommodation booking website, is looking for rock star Data Scientists to add to join our highly successful Personalization Team within the Front End department.
This product development team crunches endless amounts of data to provide our customers with the best possible experience. They focus on anything from understanding and predicting market data, to ranking all properties on our website, and providing our customers with the most relevant personalized recommendations.
As a Data Scientist you’ll work side by side with Developers, Designers and Product Owners, and take full ownership of your work – from the initial idea-generation phase to the implementation of the final product on our website. Our ideal candidate is result-focused, innovative and has solid quantitative background and a good business understanding.
B.responsible

Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. You’ll use the model’s output to create and improve products for our customers, preferably in short development cycles
Research & Development on how to improve customers’ experience, by using our vast amount of data
Actively contribute to taking Data Science at Booking.com to the next level

B.skilled

Minimum two years of relevant work experience
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.)
Excellent English communication skills; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders
Prior experience with a few of the following models: Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, (Deep) Neural Networks, Hidden Markov Models, Conditional Random Fields, Game Theory, Mechanism Design and/or Latent Dirichlet Allocation

Required

Experience with at least one scripting language, e.g. R, Octave, and one programming language, e.g. Python, Perl, C/C++, Java
Exposure to SQL and relational databases

Preferred

Experience implementing a real-world Recommender or Ranking system
Worked with the Hadoop Ecosystem
Implemented multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment

B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT has monthly hackathons, trainings and attends/speaks at global conferences.

body:
MedAmerica is looking for a dynamic Sr. Network Engineer! The ideal candidate will be an individual who is nimble, expeditious, and an assertive champion of action; someone that is inquisitive, perceptive, resourceful, and is ultimately driven by a burning obsession to implement solutions with a passion to fix problems.
In this role you will be working with an energetic collaborative team that supports Enterprise Infrastructure Services and possesses a passion for continuous learning. You will be responsible for the implementation of Enterprise systems, Hybrid Cloud solutions, Private Virtual Infrastructure, installing and maintaining Network devices and systems and assist with troubleshooting issues related to the company's IT Infrastructure. Are you the candidate we have been looking for?!
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to
Design, implement, analyze and perform end to end provisioning and management of secure Network environment (on premise and in cloud) consisting of firewalls, IDPS, switches, routers, security services such as proxy, content filtering, email protection, etc. Perform Hybrid network design and implementation Perform network security design and implementation Manage and Maintain the WAN/LAN /WLAN Network Environment across multiple Data Centers, branch offices, clinics, etc. Proactively identify and assess problems, perform troubleshooting and research solutions, focusing on root cause Maintain network security through proper configuration of devices according to best practice Perform analysis and tuning of tools designed for monitoring network and system availability and performance (packet loss, signal degradation, etc.) Incorporate best practices from Cisco and other products Identify support challenges and execute to ensure continual service improvements (CSI) Plan for Hardware and resource provisioning per projection of requirements and capacity forecasting Recommend, schedule and perform network improvements, upgrades and repairs Participate in identification of project requirements and explore solutions that meet business objectives Develop relationships with ITS staff and Managers Assist in the identification of project requirements and explore solutions that meet business objectives Assist in investigating security incidents Create and present project recommendations to ITS Teams Special projects as required
Qualifications
Required Around 7-10 years of experience managing and supporting Enterprise Level Networks Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience Expert knowledge of Cisco network devices, Cisco ASA, Palo Alto Networks, Proxy servers (HA proxy), Load Balancers Routing protocols (BGP, EIGRP, OSPF) Designing and implementing Network Security Troubleshooting tools (tcpdump, wireshark, etc.) Understanding of TCP/IP networking concepts Network configurations for virtual platforms Keen awareness of Network, Systems and Applications Security Ability to work in fast paced technical environment with increasing support demands and complexity Ability to multitask and manage assigned tasks to meet deadlines and objectives Strong communication skills (written and oral)
Desired Experience working in DevOps environment, understanding of DevOps culture Experience with automation tools like Chef, Puppet or Ancible Experience with VM Ware Experience with AWS
Why MedAmerica?
MedAmerica is one of the leading healthcare practice management organizations in the United States. Since 1975, we have successfully managed hospital-based physician group practices across the Acute Care Continuum, with expertise in emergency medicine, hospital medicine, ambulatory & urgent care, and other acute care specialties.
We offer employees the opportunity to help positively impact the healthcare industry while enjoying an amazing benefits package and work environment. Check it out for yourself...
Competitive benefits package: Complimentary fitness center, multiple health plan options or reimbursement for non-coverage, exceptional 401k plan (that includes a very generous company match), 3 weeks paid vacation, tuition reimbursement policy, Long-term disability and life insurance, and more.
A Culture of Caring: Friendly, caring, business casual environment. Mid-sized and family oriented, voted a "Best Place to Work in the Bay Area" for 9 years, fun staff activities, health and wellness activities, peer and management directed employee recognition programs.
Location, Location, Location: We are located in the Emeryville Watergate business park overlooking the San Francisco Bay. We are just minutes from away from San Francisco and Oakland.
Your Life. Your Career. Your Partnership. Apply Today!
MedAmerica is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

body:
ABOUT MEDIA IQMedia iQ is an analytics technology company unlocking insights to help drive business growth.
Media iQ has a clear vision for their clients - to inspire through insights. They are experts at ingesting large amounts of data, modelling data to convert into insights and then actioning these insights through a variety of products and services.
Our People have an endearing and unique quality that sets them apart from the rest and that is why our product inspires. Our People make the difference and our values make the people.
In short, Media iQ make data valuable, insightful, and intelligent, which helps clients engage customers, grow sales and generate revenue. The major focus of the business is programmatic advertising on which they enjoy a 97% client retention rate globally across brands such as Walmart, Barclaycard and Ford.MEDIA iQ was built 5 years ago by Gurman Hundal and Lee Puri, with its original base in London, UK. Remaining a self-funded business, the company has now grown to over 250 employees, with 8 global offices covering 4 continents. Our business vision is to inspire through insights. It is for this reason Media iQ has very exciting and realistic growth expectations over the coming years. It’s a great opportunity to work across a global business while becoming a key contributor within a growing, winning organization.
QUICK FACTS• Represent over 450 Client’s Globally• 97% Retention Rate of Client’s since Launch• 250 Global Employee’s, with a 100% Staff Retention Rate in the first 3 years of the business, currently 95%• Offices in London, Manchester, Hamburg, New York, Toronto, Australia and Bangalore• Award Winning Infrastructure – Recently voted for the ‘Best Use of Data’ as well as ‘Best Trading Team’ in• UK and ‘Most Innovative Brand in Mobile’ in North America
THE ROLEMiQ is looking for a Data Scientist to work in the R&D team that builds sophisticated analytical tools and products to scale and diversify our business processes and workflows.The right candidate will be required to understand product requirements and develop and deploy predictive models and provide exciting insights to our end users that will help answer their business questions.The role will report into the Head of R&D. To succeed in this role you will work closely with your peers and mentors.Your key stakeholders will mainly be the Product, Media Analytics and Tech teams in India. You will be supported by your peers and experts across many fields who will help you succeed.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIESYour main responsibilities will include:• Understanding client/business objectives and goals and translate them into data analytics modules• Performing exploratory data analysis on client specific data sets• Generating Predictive outputs for clients or business objectives using appropriate modelling techniques• Staying updated on the latest algorithms, tools and technologies in the big data space• Liaising with engineers on platform requirements or data processing work flow automation• Generating world class insights for clients and business• Proactively producing stories using compelling visuals
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE• 2 – 5 years’ experience in a relevant position, preferably with some exposure to marketing field• Strong experience with advanced SQL is a must• Good experience in big data ecosystem - Hive/Pig/MapReduce, Spark is required• Experience with at-least one programming language - e.g. Java, Python, R is also a pre-requisite
REQUIRED SKILLS• Ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads.• Extreme attention to detail and willingness to roll up your sleeves.• Demonstrated high degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing priorities.• Good verbal and written communication & data presentation skills, including ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.• Excellent Client facing skills• Excellent analytical skills and effective communicator
EDUCATIONBachelors or Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics or statistics is a mustWHAT WE VALUE IN OUR PEOPLE• INNOVATION, the difference between good and great• PASSION, infectious, creates momentum• COMMUNITY, making the world a smaller place• AMBITION, potential is limitless• DETERMINATION, always find a way• ADAPTABILITY, change is exciting• PERSONALITY, endearing, unique and authentic

body:
One of the major challenges in the discovery of innovative medicines is to ensure they are safe enough to test their therapeutic concept in clinical trials and provide novel treatment for patients. Drug safety is assessed throughout the pharmaceutical R&D value chain, but it is during early drug discovery when we can actively design safety attributes into the future candidate drug. Our global Drug Safety and Metabolism (DSM) department partners our Innovative Medicines units during early drug discovery by identifying and optimising new chemical series and other modalities, and selecting novel candidate drugs. Part of the Predictive Compound Safety team, as a Computational Safety Data Scientist you’ll push the boundaries of science to make a real difference to patient care, working in environment where you’ll be valued for your contribution, energized and rewarded for your ideas, and supported by ongoing learning and development opportunities.
Responsibilities/ Accountabilities:
· Develop and apply machine learning algorithms for safety related problems· Develop and maintain computational services and data structures to allow effective use of models by the business· Provide computational support, technical expertise and guidance to support scientific, project and departmental decisions· Provide innovative modelling and informatics support · Train and mentor discovery scientists in the use of models to aid projects progression and decision making· Provide data management, data structure, enabling modeling and informatics expertise to DSM strategies· Drive the development and application of predictive models and tools to support compound design and selection.
Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required:
· Ph.D in life science, data science, informatics, statistics or other relevant field· Track record of scientific programming, application and algorithm development· Proficient in advanced machine learning and data mining technologies with applications in one of the following areas: predictive and statistical modeling, machine learning and text mining· Software development skills in one or more high level languages (C# / C / C++ / Java / F#) and a rapid prototyping platform (Python / Julia / Matlab etc)· Expertise with one or more common machine learning tools (R, scikit learn, Mahout, openCV etc) is required· Experience with web service development and test driven development is also expected.
Desirable:
· Experience with or knowledge of computational techniques in chemistry, such as structure based drug design, molecular dynamics, molecular docking, quantitative structure activity relationships, pharmacodynamics, and cheminformatics.
We push the boundaries of science to deliver life changing medicines.
At AstraZeneca, we believe the best way we can help patients is to focus on breakthrough science in order to uncover disease mechanisms and develop novel, targeted therapies that interact with them. This is at the heart of our purpose as a company: to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines.
We invest in distinctive science in three core therapy areas where we believe we can make the most meaningful difference to patients: oncology; cardiovascular and metabolic disease; and respiratory, inflammation and autoimmunity. Our science exploits our rare combination of capabilities in small molecules and biologics, immunotherapies, protein engineering technologies and devices. These are reinforced by a strong focus on translational science and personalised healthcare capabilities. We build on our own capabilities by collaborating with world-renowned scientists and academic institutions and partner with like-minded science-led companies.
As a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical company that spans discovery, development, manufacturing, distribution and worldwide commercialisation, we are well-placed to turn innovative molecules into medicines that are life changing.
Closing Date: 24th March, 2016

Position Summary: New York University's (NYU) Data Services, a joint IT and Libraries facility, is seeking a full-time Data Services Quantitative Specialist (Academic Technology Specialist) to provide quantitative/statistical research computing and data support to faculty, students, and staff at NYU, especially in the statistical packages R, Stata, and SAS. The incumbent will be working in a vibrant and collaborative environment on a team that supports all phases of the data lifecycle in research, teaching and learning including collections, analysis, and preservation.
Required Education: Bachelor's degree.
Preferred Education: Master's degree or higher, preferably in Sociology, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Political Science, Psychology, Urban Planning, or related field
Required Experience: 3 years relevant experience or an equivalent combination. Must include experience supporting information technology, training, programming and client service.1-3 years conducting quantitative academic research with at least two of the following statistical software packages: R, Stata, and SAS.
Preferred Experience: Experience in an academic environment.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Excellent leadership, interpersonal, organizational, analytical, problem solving, and communication skills. Ability to train and provide technical advice to a non-technical audience.
Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Experience teaching quantitative/statistical software packages and/or research methods. Familiarity with a variety of statistical methods, such as: factor analysis, time series analysis, panel data analysis, multi-level modeling, structural equation modeling, and classificationmethods. Knowledge of computer science concepts including data structures and algorithms; experience programming with a high-level language like Python, Julia, or C++. Basic understanding of geographic information systems (GIS), qualitative data analysis, andsurvey research methods. Experience submitting batch jobs on high performance computing systems a plus.
NYU offers a highly competitive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance; 403(b) retirement plan; tuition remission; disability and life insurance; mortgage programs; adoption assistance; dependent coverage; flexible spending accounts; commuter benefits; gym discounts; an employee assistance program and more. To learn more about benefits, go to: http://www.nyu.edu/employees/benefit/full-time/Administrators-Professionals-Code-100.html.
Quicklink for Posting: www.nyucareers.com/applicants/Central?quickFind=61559

body:
Role: Data Scientist/AnalystLocation: Southampton, UK (flexible)Duration: 6 month contract (renewable), full-time positionStart date: ImmediateReporting to: Senior Operations ManagerSalary: £3000-£4500 per month  =============================================================== THE FLOWMINDER FOUNDATION The Flowminder Foundation is a non-profit organisation registered in Stockholm, Sweden with a large staff contingent located in Southampton. Our mission is to improve public health and welfare in low- and middle-income countries. The data we provide are global public goods. We work with governments, inter-governmental organizations and NGOs. We collect, aggregate, integrate and analyse anonymous mobile operator data, satellite, and household survey data. We often work with extremely large datasets, composed of billions of data points. Our analyses enable us to map the distributions, movements and characteristics of vulnerable populations in low- and middle-income countries. We help save lives by providing analyses and decision support to all relevant parties, based on the latest academic advances. Our work includes both research and operations, aimed towards having a concrete impact on vulnerable populations.
Our success in this area stems from the ability of our teams to:* design and utilise cutting-edge research and analysis methods * develop new software to facilitate these analyses* understand and apply these techniques to real-world problems * work with UN, NGO and government partners to translate our analyses into real-world impact
Our successes so far in 2016 [1,2] have led to ongoing expansion into new geographic regions as we aim to provide analyses for those affected by poverty, health problems and crises. As we expand our team we are looking for exceptional talent to work together with our analysts, addressing the challenges these new regions bring.
1, Winner of the 2016 GSMA Global Mobile (GLOMO) Award in Emergency or Humanitarian Situations (http://www.globalmobileawards.com/3c-mobile-in-emergency-or-humanitarian-situations-flowminder-ncell-and-teliasonera-for-aid-the-displaced-post-nepal-earthquake/) 2, Wilson et al, Rapid and Near Real-Time Assessments of Population Displacement Using Mobile Phone Data Following Disasters: The 2015 Nepal Earthquake. PLOS Currents Disasters. 2016Read more about Flowminder at www.flowminder.organd about Flowminder in the media: www.flowminder.org/news
===============================================================
OBJECTIVES OF THE POSITION
As a Data Scientist with the Flowminder Foundation you will be tasked with developing new methods for processing some of the largest data-sets ever analysed in the development and humanitarian sectors. You will work closely with other subject matter experts to develop robust methods and software to implement these methods. The ideal candidate brings a track record of success in a similar role, strong initiative, and a can-do attitude. Applicants with a proven background in applying machine learning techniques to large data sets are highly encouraged to apply.
===============================================================
PLACE IN THE ORGANISATIONThe Data Scientist:

Reports hierarchically to the Senior Operations Manager
Reports functionally to the Executive Director and Senior Operations Manager

===============================================================
Essential

Genuine interest in, and willingness to further understand, the mission and operations of the organisation
Genuine desire to see the outputs of your work improve the lives of vulnerable populations
Strong ability to combine quantitative analytical thinking with a thorough understanding of real world human behaviours
Ability to work well both as a team member and independently
PhD or Masters degree in computer science, statistics, maths, physics or equivalent quantitative training.
2+ years experience Python data analysis libraries (such as pandas, numpy and bokeh/matplotlib)
Experience writing well-documented, maintainable code
Demonstrable experience in the development and application of machine learning and statistical models to large-scale, real-world datasets
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Desirable

Good understanding of low- and middle-income contexts 
Experience in large-scale data mining or artificial intelligence.
Experience in Big Data ecosystem - algorithms, tools and technologies
IPython/Jupyter
SQL programming skills
Publication in peer-reviewed journals
UNIX admin experience
Data visualisation skills (e.g. bokeh/matplotlib, D3.js)
Version control software (including git)
Able to work from our Southampton office (although we consider strong national and international applicants)

This position will require occasional trips to other Flowminder offices, mostly within Europe, and the flexibility to work outside normal business hours and occasionally on weekends. There will be ample opportunity to travel to low- and middle-income countries as part of ongoing projects. =============================================================== Please submit all applications only by email to “recruitment@flowminder.org” stating “Data Analyst ref:9973” in the subject line of the email.
Please submit your CV and cover letter in ONE file and name the file with your LAST NAME.
===============================================================

body:
Overview
The Institute for Defense Analyses is a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) supporting the Department of Defense and other federal agencies that require rigorous and objective analysis of national security issues. The Strategy, Forces and Resources Division (SFRD) performs interdisciplinary analyses of plans and policies related to national security strategy; the structure and capabilities of US, allied and adversary forces; chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear defense; organizational efficiency and management issues; and human capital challenges. The Strategy, Forces and Resources Division has an opening to assist with quantitative analyses across this research portfolio, especially concerning strategy and risk assessments.
Responsibilities
Research Associates (RAs) are junior members of the full-time professional staff working under the guidance and direction of IDA Research Analysts. Some research tasks will be narrowly focused; others will address a broader spectrum of concerns. In response to assignments provided by IDA Research Analyst, RAs contribute to research teams with information gathering; modeling and simulation; data manipulation, analysis and presentation; and drafting of reports and briefings. Accordingly, RAs are expected to have demonstrated proficiency in technical areas and to be familiar with computer languages and computational and data processing software. RAs are members of interdisciplinary research teams and must demonstrate good communications skills and contribute effectively to a team approach to problem solving. The issues that IDA addresses change constantly and RAs are expected to be adaptable and self-motivated, demonstrating a capacity for independent thought, sound judgment, and creativity in applying quantitative analysis methods to complex policy problems. As part of the research process, IDA research teams will travel to US government or US security partner field locations (typically, but not always, headquarters or office-like locations). RAs will be required to assist in the planning and coordination of these field research activities and will accompany research teams conducting that field research.
Required Qualifications:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Applied Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or Electrical Engineering.Recent experience (within the last 3 years) working with statistical software or programming languages used in research (e.g. Python, R, Stata, MATLAB, etc)A resume and transcripts must be attached in order to receive full consideration for this opportunity.The ability and willingness to travel is required.Experience with distributed computing in a Linux environment is preferred.Experience or coursework in Bayesian statistics and/or machine learning is preferred.US Citizenship is required.Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

body:
Would you like to mentor a budding data scientist?
Springboard is looking for expert industry Data Scientists who use Python or R in their day-to-day work and are passionate about teaching/mentoring.
We run online, self-paced Python and R-based Data Science workshops where participants learn with the help of a curated curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert industry mentor.
Our mentor community - the biggest strength of our programs - has experts from the best organizations in the world. Mentors range from experienced data scientists and researchers at premier companies (Uber, Facebook, Etsy, Apple) to a wide variety of top-notch startups and consulting firms.
What do I have to do as a mentor?
As a mentor, your role will be to ensure that your mentees have a great learning experience. Here’s what that means for you:

You will have a weekly 30-minute video call with each of your students at a time of mutual convenience.
Most mentors take 4 mentees, but depending on your availability, you can commit to more or fewer.
You will be compensated for your time with a per-student honorarium.

I’m interested! Tell me more about the curriculum
We currently have two Data Science workshops, one based in R and the other in Python.

Our R-based workshop, Foundations of Data Science, is targeted to students with little or no programming background, who want to get a taste of data science
Our Python-based workshop, Data Science Intensive, is meant for students with some programming experience and statistics background, who want to transition to data science

In both cases, our curriculum is curated by experts to include the best materials in the field: think of us as a college professor who includes book chapters, videos and other material to create the best learning experience.
Excellent! What about the students?
Our students are working professionals and college/graduate students from all over the world, interested in getting started with data science. They go through the curriculum at their own pace and have a weekly 30-minute check-in with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice. Typically, most students take about 3 months to finish.
I’m sold! Where do I sign up?
Send an email to mentors@springboard.com with a bit of information about yourself. Python skills are especially in demand, so it would be twice as awesome if you could refer friends! A resume or an updated LinkedIn profile, along with a brief cover email work perfectly well.

MLB Advanced Media (MLBAM), the interactive and mobile division of Major League Baseball, is the developer of several award-winning products, apps and services. body:
Our Team
The Content Science & Algorithms team is a world class group of data scientists focusing on the super interesting question of which movies and shows Netflix should create or purchase the rights to. The team seeks to use data science to better understand this problem and build tools to support the content acquisition teams in their decision making.
The Role
We are looking for experienced individuals who are passionate about data science and enjoy working in a collaborative environment. Members of the team typically work on one or two projects (e.g. predicting movie viewership) over any six month period.
​Ma​chine learning tends to be our primary tool however, we use that in combination with a wide variety of techniques including​ ​descriptive analytics, causal inference, crowd-sourcing, network science, A/B testing and data visualization. While we also partner with an engineering team, we do a great deal of coding ourselves and the ability and desire to code is a must. We primarily use Python and R, but maintain the flexibility to use the best tool for the job.
Qualifications
-Experience with, and a strong desire to use, the latest machine learning and data mining algorithms.-Strong coding ability. Desire to work in Python. Experience with any of these is a plus: scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, R, ggplot, JavaScript, D3, SQL, Hadoop, and Spark. Preference towards open source software.-Appreciation of good design in both software UI and slideshow presentations. Willingness to give equal weight to both generating great results and communicating those results to technical and non-technical business partners. -Hunger to continue learning and developing as a data scientist. Willingness to help further build the team, including contributing fresh ideas, establishing best practices, interviewing data science candidates, following trends, and attending conferences (e.g. KDD, NIPS).-Strong academic background preferred, but all backgrounds (e.g. startup) considered. -Love of television and film a plus!
Culture
You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment. You will work with smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect, but also foster high performance.
For a more in-depth look into our culture, check out http://www.slideshare.net/reed2001/culture-1798664

body:
ASCAP is the intersection for capturing listening data globally, hundreds of billions of data points per year from dozens of sources. This is an unique opportunity to build and run models for not only what is happening today but will be happening in the music industry. We want you to use your imagination to create innovative products to help ASCAP better serve our writers and publishers.
The Data Scientist will work collaboratively to design the next generation of unique data capabilities on behalf of ASCAP members, licensees and executives. This media analytics thought leader will have a hands on track record of building analytics that predict the performance of assets, prescribes pricing and promotional strategies, predicts churn, performs micro-segmentation and analyzes social media signals. The Data Scientist will be responsible for near and long-term advanced analytics roadmap, market positioning and competitive differentiation.Just a few of the things we want to model and predict

Create unique models to explain and predict music popularity based on a diverse range of data
Predict popularity across music platforms e.g. satellite, terrestrial and digital
Explain the social influencers of today and who they will be tomorrow

Areas of responsibility/ accountability:

Lead the development of new data analytics capabilities including new data sources, analytical techniques as well as participating in the design of supporting infrastructure, workflow and transport
Collaborate cross-functionally to design new innovative data products to be commercialized or used by internal stakeholders
Oversee and perform as necessary proof of concepts, prototyping and iterating to full data product readiness and advanced analytics acceptance
Evangelize the use of data analytics to push the boundaries of ASCAP and the music industry 

Desired Skills and Experience:

Experience working with the buying and selling of individual or libraries of media assets 
Strong data strategy background in identifying requisite sources in order to predict a specific outcome
Model design and assembly for binning or time-series data for example
Time-series data, graph analytics, simulations, optimizations, clustering, profiling, feature analysis. training and scoring and orchestrating ensemble learning techniques
Syndicated data definition and delivery design
Hands-on skills
General statistics, regression, machine learning and neural networks 
SQL/Hadoop/Spark
Coding in SQL query, Python or R
Multiple BI development environments including Qlik, Tableau, Java and/or D3
REST API, JSON and other data transports a plus

body:
Welcome to CJ Affiliate - we’re transforming digital marketing and looking for leaders. In this role, the VP of Analytics/Data Science, will leverage extensive analytical expertise and take on the leadership role heading our analytics team and strategy. Reporting to the President and a member of the company’s senior leadership team, the VP of Analytics/Data Science will be instrumental in taking CJ Affiliate to the next level as it leverages the extensive data assets within CJ Affiliate, Conversant, and Epsilon. CJ Affiliate is the market leader in affiliate marketing with the power to reach hundreds of millions of consumers shopping online through our affiliate marketing network. CJ Affiliate combines a proprietary technology platform and professional services to deliver a best in class pay-for-performance model that facilitates fair and transparent partnerships between brands and publishers. With more than 3,000 clients globally, CJ Affiliate is the most highly regarded network in the world (ranked #1 by Internet Retailer for Affiliate Marketing and 100% of Merchandise Categories). CJ Affiliate is a business unit within Conversant and Epsilon which is part of Alliance Data, a top performing Fortune 500 company – NYSE: ADS. What We’re Looking For:
CJ Affiliate is now hiring the VP of Analytics/Data Science to lead our analytics team, strategy, and execution. We’re looking for a proven performer who has extensive analytics expertise, has successfully managed teams, and wants to the opportunity to shape and direct the company’s future!
The Position:

As the VP of Analytics/Data Science you will lead our analytics team, inform strategy and drive execution. Specifically, you will:
Lead CJ Affiliate’s analytics strategy and direction - determining where to focus, how to prioritize, and where to make investments.
Lead a high performance team, hiring A level talent and actively mentoring and developing the group’s industry knowledge, technical proficiencies, and essential soft skills.
Train and advance our client teams abilities in analytics/interpreting and using data, e.g., critical thinking, problem solving, drawing conclusions, decision making, and communicating findings.
Evangelize and educate the industry, clients, partners and prospects on the state-of-the-art in digital marketing analytics and the critical value of data and insights in improved outcomes.
Consult with clients on program performance and optimization, e.g., consumer segmentation, customer journey, Omni-channel behavior, LTV, personalized messaging, and new markets.
Continuously improve and scale our current offerings and identify new analytical products and services that can drive better program performance and differentiated value.
Actively contribute, participate, and lead in product development from opportunity identification, prioritization, exploration and development of solutions, launch, and execution.
Collaborate with Conversant and Epsilon organizations to identify synergistic assets and new capabilities that enable CJ Affiliate to accelerate or leapfrog innovation efforts.
Oversee data management processes to effectively and efficiently acquire, manage, and optimize data assets - both internal and third party.
Transform transactional business data using mathematical, statistical, and advanced analytical techniques into valuable insights, decision, and products

Qualifications / Requirements:

10+ years of experience leading a mission critical analytics/data science team within in a digital marketing or data-rich technology company.
Track record of successful innovation including commensurate marketplace gains.
Proven ability to make strategic, complex, and difficult decisions.
Excellent leadership and mentoring skills.
An engaging personal style that thrives on collaboration.
Experience leading both client facing and technical people.
Great communication skills on both the business and technical sides.
Big data experience with tools and systems (e.g., data systems/sources and production software) including practical understanding of technical architecture.
Solid grounding in machine learning techniques, probability and statistics, data mining, predictive analytics, and data visualization.
Advanced degree in statistics or mathematics, or comparable experience.
Knowledge of programming/statistical languages such as SQL and R/Python

Interested? If you’re ready to leverage your proven leadership track record and join CJ Affiliate, we want to speak with you. Apply now and let’s build a world-class analytics/ data science team together.
Conditions of EmploymentAll job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.
About ConversantConversant, Inc. is the leader in personalized digital marketing. Conversant helps the world's biggest companies grow by creating personalized experiences that deliver higher returns for brands and greater satisfaction for people. We offer a fully integrated personalization platform, personalized media programs and the world's largest affiliate marketing network - all fueled by a deep understanding of what motivates people to engage, connect and buy. For more information, please visit http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=http://www.conversantmedia.com&esheet=50979797&newsitemid=20141107006050&lan=en-US&anchor=www.conversantmedia.com&index=1&md5=ceffa9dd43ffb213f30808148e513ad7.
Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career. From tuition reimbursement to scholarship programs to employee stock purchase plans and 401(k)s, we offer associates a variety of benefits that work as hard for them as they work for us. 
About EpsilonEpsilon is the global leader in creating connections between people and brands. An all-encompassing global marketing company, we harness the power of rich data, groundbreaking technologies, engaging creative and transformative ideas to get the results our clients require. Recognized by Ad Age as the #1 World CRM/Direct Marketing Network and #1 U.S. Agency from All Disciplines, Epsilon employs over 7,000 associates in more than 70 offices worldwide. Epsilon is an Alliance Data company. For more information, visit http://www.epsilon.com/, follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg or call 1.800.309.0505.

For San Francisco Bay Area:Alliance Data will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

body:
We are a startup in the clinical automation space that is building the next generation of intelligence to automate the creation of medical treatment protocols for complex diseases that afflict large populations.
We are formulating integrated solutions for patient care, where algorithms can support and supplement medical practitioners in creating treatment plans while also automating monitoring and feedback mechanisms for patient. Beyond commercial applications of this technology, we are committed to leveraging clinical automation to expanding the reach of reliable health care into areas of the world that are under-served.
These initiatives will utilize the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, and we are looking for talented data scientists or software engineers that have applied experience in the fields of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to join our team. Beyond the latest machine learning algorithms, you must be passionate about working with our medical experts to understand the data and provide explanations for the outputs of any machine learning algorithms.
We are open to considering part-time professionals who can contribute to the development and data collection phase of the project. But as we progress, the role will evolve into a more full-time post in the next two months.
As a Data Scientist or Software Engineer with Twistle, you will work on a small team, collaborating closely with our medical experts to gain a deeper understanding of the protocols that are being designed. You will be able to switch projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems.
Twistle is HIPAA compliant and we expect that our employees will maintain confidentiality of all data and information that is shared with them during the course of employment, as per the HIPAA guidelines.
Responsibilities• Participate in cutting edge research in artificial intelligence and machine learning applications in the field of medical treatment.• Rigorously analyze data to develop insights into the problems being studied, identify further requirements and to understand the mechanisms behind any correlations, while creatively generating and implementing new approaches to maximize output. • Develop solutions for real world, large scale problems.
Minimum qualifications• BA/BS in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications• MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related technical field.• Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, JavaScript, or Go.• Strong background in Natural Language Processing or Computer Vision.• Strong background in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence, or Data Science and Statistics.

body:
At trivago we take data-informed decisions. In undertaking analyses of big data, our Business Intelligence team provides insights that help to determine the strategies of all of our departments. Now the Business Intelligence Team is looking for an analytical thinker to work with our Quality Assurance team in order to help them find the root cause of website issues. Your main responsibility will be to provide consultation to the QA team; you will do this by supporting them in analysing critical incidents and showing them how to correctly read data and interpret results so that they understand the meaning behind the data. You will also be responsible for assisting in analysing the large amounts of data coming from our many A/B tests and search for anomalies. You will thoroughly search through our logging and data warehouse infrastructure in order to understand bugs that appear on our website or in data. We are always looking for ways to improve our current processes so you will be encouraged to enhance our automated anomaly detection system in order to detect anomalies close to real time and allow issues to be quickly resolved.
The ideal candidate:• Speaks English (our company language) fluently.• Holds a B.A. or B.Sc. in one of the natural sciences (Maths, Physics, etc.), Computer Science or a Business-related course where there was a focus on statistics or data analysis.• Has some previous professional experience, including internships, working with data analysis.• Has good Excel skills.• Has at least a basic understanding of analytics tools. Knowledge of SQL or Hadoop, as well as any IT architecture knowledge, would be a plus.• Is analytically minded and capable of drawing valuable insights from raw data.• Is capable of communicating complex information in a simple, crisp and concise way.• Can start as soon as possible.
Life at trivago is...• The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.• Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.• Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.• The freedom to embrace small-scale failures on the path to large-scale success.• The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free workshops, seminars, sports and activities.• The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.• Living in Düsseldorf, the 6th highest quality of living city in the world for expats.Additional information:• Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.• This is a fixed-term position of 1 year with a long-term perspective.• We do not require the services of an agency for this position.
Apply online: http://bit.ly/1VyTRbr
Please note we only process applications via this URL. If clicking the URL in this message does not work, just copy and paste it into the address bar of your browser.

alert_message: This job post has expired (either the position was filled or the post is no longer listed). You are viewing an archived version.
body:
Are you ready for bigger, more meaningful data science challenges?
Fast forward one year:
You predicted the future, made us money, and made our CEO happy. Good year!
You built predictive capacity models to predict how every new WeWork building should be optimized to get the best utilization. This made our CEO, CFO, architects, and members extremely happy. Thanks to you, we can also now predict the success of our business in new markets and locations—all due to your data models.
You also helped us prioritize our product roadmap by building a quantitative model that takes quantitative user research data and predicts what will benefit the business the most. We couldn’t be happier!
You know what, we could! Once we identified issues in small sample qualitative studies, you found out if these applied to the broader member population, and transformed data into a dollar figure to compare the money wasted or saved from addressing user experience issues.
Not only that, you also created, collected, and analyzed weekly member engagement metrics, to reflect how WeWork is delivering services. Your reports and presentations are giving our executive team constant feedback on where things are going well, and what we can improve.
As one of the first few team members of WeWork UX, we thank you for your dedication and hard work. We look forward to the next four years!
Now back to today:
WeWork UX is a brand new group to create a holistic experience for WeWork members worldwide through physical spaces, digital products, and service design. Our mission is to create and inspire compelling, effective experiences through deep data-driven human understanding, innovation, design, and best practices. We’re ready to make a critically important hire—our data scientist—that will work directly with researchers, design team leads, other team members, and any relevant WeWork department. If you are an experienced data scientist, and would love to be part of a new approach to physical, digital, and service design, you should strongly consider applying to this position. We promised great data challenges!
You will work in our New York City headquarters. We’ll provide the resources you need to bring out the best in your talents and skills.
If you’d like this to be your story, fill out the application and include a PDF of your résumé and a half-page write-up of your most significant business improvement outcome because of your data science work describing your process and how you came to the outcome. We will be in touch soon!
In the meantime, you might want to check out our social media accounts on Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and two short Medium articles by our Head of UX:
* Why I couldn’t say I joined WeWork after I left Google
* Why WeWork UX won’t have a research team

body:
Mitra Capital LLC is seeking an experienced Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to join our small, entrepreneurial team.
Mitra Capital is a Boston-based long-short equity hedge fund that uses a proprietary and proven framework with roots in the Central Intelligence Agency to analyze the public remarks of company management teams and take positions ahead of earnings events. In the Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer role, you will be challenged to create innovative technology solutions at the intersection of language analysis, data-driven insights and logic-based workflow. The Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer’s core responsibilities will involve building tools that drive the systems underlying the firm’s research process, including advancing the firm’s text mining and machine learning platform. Example projects include writing systems and modules to access, manipulate, and produce outputs from historical databases of company results and market data, and coding and testing modules that enhance and expand the capabilities of the team’s text processing and machine learning systems.
The ideal candidate is a clever and versatile coder with a hacker mentality who is eager to tackle complex problems. The position offers a high rate of learning on a diverse range of projects and the opportunity to quickly have direct impact upon the organization. The Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer must be comfortable working in an agile development environment with high expectations for rapid delivery of prototypes, changing requirements, and direct feedback from the internal business customer.


Candidates should be able to learn fast and learn on the fly in order to work with a variety of languages and projects, and be capable of taking responsibility for delivering code that accomplishes defined objectives.
Hands-on experience coding in Python in Unix environments, as well as experience working with large datasets using SQL, are required for this role. Experience with AWS or other forms of Unix servers is a plus.
We are looking for candidates with 3+ years’ experience and a quantitative background with degree(s) in majors such as Computer Science, Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Economics or similar.


Please include, in CV/resume or separately, detailed descriptions of past relevant projects. Candidates may send a resume and cover letter to recruitment@mitracapital.com. Mitra Capital can only consider candidates who are legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship. Mitra Capital is an equal opportunity employer.

body:
Forecaster team WFM34 uur per week, standplaats: Tilburgvacaturenummer: 811000Wat ga je doen?Het team Workforce Management verzorgt het bedrijfskritische workforce management proces, waarmee de afgesproken kwantitatieve servicedoelstellingen voor klanten gewaarborgd worden. De afdeling verzorgt de forecast (voorspelling) van klantcontacten, capaciteitsbehoefte, overall planning en genereert roosters voor de interne organisatie van diverse afdelingen van CZ. Workforce Management monitort en optimaliseert het klantcontactaanbod per activiteit en/of ocatie op realtime basis en zorgt voor een optimale afstemming tussen verkeer, inzet van personeel, werkplekken en infrastructuur op korte en lange termijn.De Forecaster zorgt voor het inschatten en voorspellen van klantcontact op basis van historie, mailkalenders en overige call drivers. De Forecaster onderhoudt proactief contact met verschillende afdelingen binnen CZ die een invloed (kunnen) hebben op de hoeveelheden klantcontact via de diverse kanalen (telefonie, e-mail, chat en post). Je analyseert resultaten uit het verleden om zo de trend voor de toekomst te kunnen bepalen.De Forecaster is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van verschillende voorspellingen (forecast) met betrekking tot het verwachte werkaanbod. Het betreft hier zowel een inschatting van de aantallen klantcontacten als de daarmee gemoeide afhandeltijden. Je levert tijdig de forecast op in o.a. X+13, X+6 en X+2 op kanaal en skillniveau voor diverse afdelingen binnen CZ. Binnen het WFM team ben je medeverantwoordelijk voor een integrale aanpak van WFM. Je geeft daarnaast advies over verbeteringen binnen de gebruikte WFM systemen en biedt ondersteuning aan de Planner.De kernactiviteiten zijn:

Inschatten / calculeren en voorspellen van het verwachte werkaanbod.
Je gaat proactief op zoek naar informatie die invloed heeft op de forecast, initieert overleggen met je stakeholders om structureel op de hoogte te zijn.
Je neemt vanaf een vroegtijdig stadium deel aan projectoverleggen om forecast expertise proactief te borgen.
Bouwen van modules / formules voor forecasting.
Beheren van het capaciteitsplan en forecasting model.
Omgaan met strategische en tactische forecasting uitdagingen.
Opzetten, beheren en optimaliseren van WFM processen.
Data-analyse (onderzoeken van call drivers).
Je fungeert als back-up voor diverse overige WFM activiteiten.
Je geeft gevraagd, en ongevraagd, advies (vanuit jouw vakgebied) ter verbetering van de dienstverlening zowel richting TL als richting je collega's en teamleider WFM.

Wie zoeken we?Wij zoeken een ervaren Forecaster, met een afgeronde hbo-opleiding en enkele jaren werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie. Je hebt brede kennis op het gebied van Workforce Management processen in een virtuele contact center omgeving. Daarnaast kun je werken met Verint Witness en AVAYA CMS en je beschikt over ruime kennis van Excel. Voor jou is het geen probleem om hoofd- en bijzaken van elkaar te scheiden, daarnaast heb je een proactief karakter en je hebt het vermogen om draagvlak te creëren en anderen te overtuigen.Aanvullende functie-eisGoede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.Aantal werkuren en salarisHet gemiddeld aantal werkuren ligt op 34 per week. Het bruto jaarsalaris op basis van 34 uur per week bedraagt maximaal € 49.000,-. Dit is inclusief 8% vakantietoeslag en 8,5% eindejaarsuitkering.Solliciteren of meer weten?Solliciteren op deze vacature kan alleen via het online sollicitatieformulier (vacaturenummer 811000).Voor meer informatie over deze vacature kun je contact opnemen met Serkan Pehlivan, Teamleider WFM, telefoonnummer 06 30 85 89 20 of kijk op onze website www.czjobs.nl.Overige informatieEen assessment kan deel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure.Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature stellen wij niet op prijs.

body:
Amazon Marketplace enables sellers to put their products in front of hundreds of millions of customers and offers sellers the tools and services needed to make e-commerce successful, efficient and simple. Our customers and sellers trust us to provide a safe, reliable and high quality experience.
We are looking for people who are passionate about helping us ensure that customers can make great purchase decisions and that sellers using Amazon Marketplace are successful listing and selling their products. Our team is tasked with identifying and preventing abuse of product listings and keeping our catalog healthy. The ideal candidate for this role will be comfortable using advanced data analytics as well as a variety of tools and data sources to answer high-impact business questions that impact millions of customers globally. You should be able to break down complex information and insights into clear and concise language and be comfortable presenting your findings.
Responsibilities:
Analyze and validate data using data and statistical tools to ensure high data quality and reliable insightsRecommend, develop and report on the business metrics and KPIs that provide the best measure of the health of our catalog and product listing ecosystem.Partner with data engineering teams across multiple business lines to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insightsProactively identify interesting areas for deep dive investigationsCollaborate closely with product managers and specialists to design, execute and analyze results for experimentsLeverage industry best practices to establish repeatable BI practices, principles & processes
Amazon's mission is to be the Earth's most customer centric company. We empower employees to make decisions, act fast and make a significant positive impact. The Marketplace team is globally focused and is growing fast. Our most important goal is to safeguard Amazon’s catalog so that we can deliver on our mission. To do this we work closely with teams across the company including Engineering, Sales, Legal, Operations, Risk Management and others. Amazon Marketplace offers an exciting opportunity to help grow a new business and product offering.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance or related technical field.Able to understand and translate business and product questions into analytics projectsShould have a mix of technical, development, and program management skillsStrong business acumenExperience with big data and object oriented programming languages (Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, etc.).Experience in data mining using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.Understanding of relational databases and familiarity with statisticsAbility to parse log files for large amounts of data.Expert in advanced Excel functions (e.g., creating formulas, pivot tables) and PowerBI
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Finance, Machine Learning or related technical fieldKnowledge and direct experience using statistical packages and business intelligence toolsExperience in gathering requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting.Track record of executive level reporting to that drive business decisions

body:
Welcome to Zalando, one of the most exciting places for data scientists in Europe. Our data science community develops and applies highly scalable algorithms to recognize patterns and trends in data from every corner of the Zalando platform. Current live projects include product recommendation for our website, fraud detection for orders, optimizing the mix of channels for marketing and much more. We create statistical models, apply state-of-the-art algorithms to our gigantic database, visualize the results and get the impact, all while keeping our focus on increasing customer satisfaction and creating shareholder value. If you have a good idea, you will have the tools to calculate it, the data to test it and millions of customers in 15 countries to benefit from the results. Bold projects, detailed analysis, quick turnaround and fun at work: that is data science at Zalando.
What we are looking for

When you see a problem, you latch on and cannot let go until it is solved. If this describes you, check out the teaser problem below
You have a Masters or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or another quantitative field and having published in highly ranked journals would be a plus
4 or more years experience in the analysis of real data with the tools of Machine Learning, Data Mining, Time Series Analysis and Computational Statistics. You should be able to, for example, clearly explain the differences, advantages and disadvantages of different classification, clustering and regression algorithms
Solid programming ideally in Python and logical thinking skills that enable you to solve problems like http://www.careercup.com/page?pid=coding-interview-questions
You can translate the business problems from different departments into quantitative terms and present the results in an easily understandable manner
Deep skepticism of, plus the ability to identify and debunk, buzzword mumbo jumbo, false assumptions and analysis

Teaser: Zalando's next top Analyst
The Zalando Data Intelligence Team is searching for a new top analyst. We already know of an excellent candidate with top analytical and programming skills. Unfortunately, we don't know her exact whereabouts but we only have some vague information where she might be. Can you tell us where to best send our recruiters and plot an easy to read map of your solution for them?
This is what we could extract from independent sources:

The candidate is likely to be close to the river Spree. The probability at any point is given by a Gaussian function of its shortest distance to the river. The function peaks at zero and has 95% of its total integral within +/-2730m
A probability distribution centered around the Brandenburg Gate also informs us of the candidate's location. The distribution’s radial profile is log-normal with a mean of 4700m and a mode of 3877m in every direction.
A satellite offers further information: with 95% probability she is located within 2400 m distance of the satellite’s path (assuming a normal probability distribution)

Please make use of the additional information in the file http://bit.ly/19fdgVa. If you send us the solution with both code and diagram along with your application, it will help us better assess your skills. However, the task is not mandatory.
About Zalando
Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, operating in 15 markets. Delivering first-class experiences to our +18 million customers requires moving fast with microservices, Agile processes, autonomous teams — and using new and open source technologies. Our 1000+ technologists are passionate about what we do, like to publish our work and have fun while doing it. We are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.
Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!
If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes in Berlin or Hamburg, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh (sameer.shaikh@zalando.de). For opportunities in Dublin, please contact recruiter Martin Murray (martin.murray@zalando.de).

body:
In April 2015 Amazon launched Amazon Business with the vision to build the largest and most innovative Business-to-Business (B2B) marketplace in the world. To realize this vision, we are looking for a talented Business Intelligence Engineer to help us formulate a data driven selection strategy, automate business seller recommendations and build impact prediction models.
The candidate should have a strong background in ETL, data warehousing, and interest in data mining, statistical modeling, and linking data to key business trends. You will design and develop ETLs and statistical models to determine Amazon Business’s selection strategy by, for example, building brand similarity graphs, interpret null searches and find opportunities for sellers to add more products that business buyers demand. You will also build timely, relevant, and actionable recommendations that help business sellers add business relevant selection, lower prices through quantity discounts and business pricing, and improve their fulfillment experience. You will have an opportunity to work with big data and emerging technologies like Redshift, EMR and Spark. You will also join a new and quickly growing team within Amazon and have the chance to shape Amazon Business from the ground up.
A successful candidate will be able to speak the language of business and technical teams, taking business requirements and developing solutions to understand business impact. If you are excited about data analytics, and are results oriented, and like to work hard, have fun and make history, then this is the position for you.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
· Bachelor degree or higher in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar discipline.· 3+ years of relevant employment experience.· Strong background with Advanced SQL (analytical functions), ETL, Data Warehousing. · Advanced data analysis and statistical skills in SAS/R, Excel, and similar statistical packages to access and transform data into insights.· Ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
· MS or PhD in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar discipline.· 5+ years of relevant employment experience · Strong written and verbal communication and data presentation skills
