body:
UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
OptumLabs is looking for a senior data scientist to lead the development of a data science recruitment and training function for Optum.  This position will drive the build out of the data science practice at Optum working with Optum business units to identify and deliver results on high-impact projects leveraging big data analytics and machine learning. You will lead a team of data science mentors who will work with both interns and new hires to apply data science skills to important business problems.  In this position, you will be advocating the power of data science concepts and working with cross-functional teams to create actionable insight across core business lines.  You will identify relevant skill and knowledge gaps needed to solve business problems and will develop training programs to close these gaps while providing hands on experience solving major healthcare problems.  We are looking for someone who is passionate about asking and answering questions through the use of large structured and unstructured data.  It is critical to have exceptional communication skills and the ability to make complex concepts simple and easy to understand.    
Primary Responsibilities:

Lead a team of data scientists to discover insights and identify opportunities through the use of statistical, data mining and visualization techniques
Lead educational efforts to augment employee skill sets with current technologies and methodology
Document findings, including assumptions and validation work in a clear structured manner
Summarize and present findings while adjusting the content and level of detail to the appropriate level for the audience
Advise project teams and project sponsors
Use experience with data mining approaches to develop innovative ways to look at problems
Use strong business, problem solving skills and programming knowledge to quickly cycle hypotheses through discovery
Work closely with clients, clinicians, data stewards, and other business and technology leaders to frame problem definition and potential solutions

Requirements:

Masters or PhD in data science, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, bioinformatics, epidemiology or related quantitative field.
Experience leading high visibility programs and interacting with senior executives
5+ years of statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, and/or forecasting/predicting analytics
2+ years of applying machine learning using distributed systems like Hadoop, Hive, Spark or similar libraries
2 + years of experience with R or Python
3 years experience leading teams either directly or cross matrixed
Experience working in an Agile Software Development environment
Experience working with healthcare data

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with MapReduce associated languages such as Pig, Sawzall, Scala
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau. 
Healthcare business experience including experience analyzing claims and EHR data
Strong history of publications and presence in the health care and data science industry
Experience with big data technologies like  Hadoop, Hive, Spark, H2o and others,

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Document findings, including assumptions and validation work in a clear structured manner
Summarize and present findings; adjust the content and level of detail to appropriate level of the audience
Advise project teams and project sponsors
Use strong business, problem solving skills and programming knowledge to quickly cycle hypotheses through discovery
Work closely with clients, clinicians, data stewards, and other business and technology leaders to frame problem definition and potential solutions 

Required Qualifications:

Advanced degree in quantitative field, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, bioinformatics, epidemiology or similar
5+ years of statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, and/or forecasting/predicting analytics
2+ years of applying machine learning using distributed systems like Hadoop, Hive, Spark or similar libraries
2+ years of experience with R or Python
Experience working in an Agile Software Development environment

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau 
Experience with healthcare data
External reputation in the industry
Experience with MapReduce associated languages such as Pig, Sawzall, Scala
Experience with big data technologies like  Hadoop, Hive, Spark, H2o and others 

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

At SparkBeyond we are harnessing the world’s collective knowledge to solve the toughest problems using data. We’ve built an AI-powered research engine that empowers Data Scientists, Researchers and Business Analysts to accelerate finding insights. The creative process of hypothesis creation and feature engineering is automated and the engine comes up with the best ideas for actionable solutions. Our clients include many Fortune 100 companies and we get to work with the brightest minds across all industries.
SparkBeyond is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team in New York City, taking our unique and disruptive technology to the market.
Responsibilities include:

Mentoring and empowering our customers’ Data Science teams to be successful with the SparkBeyond Discovery Platform
Translating Data Science to business values
Evangelizing our product in the field
Helping to shape new functionality for our unique offering

Experience in Data Science Customer facing experience and excellent presentation and communication skills
Able to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Have a true entrepreneurial spirit

Programming skills that allow you to be self-sufficient in handling data (Python, SQL, Scala, Java)

body:
Job Description
Targeted Victory, a national Republican technology firm is seeking data scientists to work with high-profile national political campaign clients.
About You
You have a Masters degree or a strong Bachelors degree with advanced training in data science, computer science, statistics or an applied quantitative field such as econometrics, quantitative political science, epidemiology, or a similar field.
You have extensive familiarity with Python for machine learning and data analysis.
You are an excellent writer who can communicate findings from quantitative data sets in a clear and concise manner.
You are willing to engage in continuing education through both formal and informal studies to further develop your analytical skills.
You are excited to work on a major Republican campaign and join a firm with clients who include prominent Republican Members of Congress, statewide elected officials, and conservative and liberty-oriented policy organizations and groups.
You are capable of working on numerous projects with simultaneous and often competing deadlines.
You thrive in an informal work environment with flexible hours but inflexible deadlines.
You may have additional valuable skills such SQL and NoSQL, R, Java, or other programming and analytical packages.
About Us
Targeted Victory is a technology company focused on a screen agnostic, audience driven approach to media strategy and buying. Our staff provides an innovative mix of technology solutions, strategy, and analytics, with a creative streak and an entrepreneurial spirit that shows in the work we do. We provide complete, end-to-end solutions to our clients.
With 100+ employees, we have collectively raised our clients more than $265 million in online fundraising, managed over $170 million in advertising, placed more than 11,000 social media campaigns, built social network audiences of over 30 million people, had over 65 million visitors to our sites and sent more than 1.75 billion emails.
We operate in a political culture, which can mean long hours and intense stress on occasion but also means a flexible, casual environment and opportunities to expand your skills and responsibilities quickly.
We value continuous learning and have both a formal political research and data science curriculum that is implemented internally for all analysts and a number of informal opportunities to build your skills and experience.
About the Job
We are hiring data scientists to support major Republican campaigns.

body:
The Research and Development team is responsible for developing the fundamental data science methods, techniques, and best practices that power the mission of our company. Our diverse work includes predictive analytics, algorithm development, experimental design, visualization, and survey research. As a Data Scientist on our Chicago-based Research and Development team, you will work closely and collaboratively with analysts and engineers to develop and operationalize the techniques that quantify and solve big, meaningful problems. Our team works across variety of areas, and we are looking for data scientists from diverse skill-sets.

You might specialize in natural language processing, where you'll apply expertise in machine learning to the analysis of text datasets being collected at Civis Analytics.
You might specialize in statistics, where you'll apply state-of-the-art statistical methods to our research as well as develop entirely new methods to use our data in new ways.
You might specialize in engineering, where you'll tackle the challenging computational and programming problems that are critical for the creation and application of new data science to big data.

We are looking for individuals from a diversity of backgrounds with demonstrated quantitative and problem-solving skills. We value creativity, hard work, and on-the-job-excellence and offer competitive compensation and benefits packages. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States.
Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field, such as computer science, statistics, machine learning, or electrical engineering
Experience using applied statistics or machine learning in a professional or other intensive problem-solving environment with large, complex datasets
Expertise in statistical packages such as R or the Python scientific stack (NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, pandas)
An ability and eagerness to constantly learn and teach others

Preferred Requirements

Master’s or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as computer science, statistics, machine learning, or electrical engineering
Experience with core NLP techniques and tasks
Experience with SQL databases
Established skills identifying and correcting for problems in imperfect data
Demonstrated capabilities with Linux and shell scripting
Familiarity with Go (golang)
Experience with common toolkits for deep learning, such as Theano, Tensorflow, Torch, or caffe

body:
Fanatics is the largest online retailer of officially licensed sports merchandise in the world. We operate the online stores of all major North American professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, PGA), major media brands (NBC Sports, CBS Sports, FOX Sports) and e-stores for over 200 collegiate and professional team properties and our own Fanatics (www.fanatics.com) and FansEdge (www.fansedge.com) brands. We carry more than 250,000 products from over 700 teams. From jerseys to bags, from hats to garden gnomes, Fanatics has it all. We love sports and we love sports fans. We’re sort of Fanatics that way…
Job Description:
At Fanatics, we are passionate about leveraging data to drive growth and operational efficiencies. We firmly believe in putting data at the forefront of delivering an engaging experience for our sports fans! Fanatics Inc. is looking for highly motivated individuals to join our Data Science and Engineering team. You will collaborate closely with engineering, PMs, cross functional business units and address a wide range of challenging problems using techniques from applied statistics, machine learning and/or data mining fields. Job Requirements: Experience developing machine learning, NLP and statistical models for real-world problems using ML algorithms/packages, R, Python or other machine learning/statistical software.Strong algorithmic thinking and passion for empirical research to answer hard questions.Experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Information Retrieval and/or Personalization/Recommendation techniques.Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis, analytic approaches and findings in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.Designing and evaluating A|B experiments and monitoring key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics.Working knowledge of big data processing technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Pig and Spark.Ability to use SQL to perform data analysis.Have a BS/MS/PhD in Statistics, Applied Math, Operational Research, Computer Science or related field.

Job description
Digital Shadows provides cyber situational awareness that helps organizations protect against cyber attacks, loss of intellectual property, and loss of brand and reputational integrity. Our flagship solution, Digital Shadows SearchLight™, is a scalable and easy-to-use data analysis platform that provides a holistic view of an organization's digital footprint and the profile of its attackers. It is complemented with intelligence analyst expertise to ensure extensive coverage, tailored intelligence and frictionless deployment. It continually monitors more than 100 million data sources in 27 languages across the visible, deep and dark web and other online sources to create an up-to-the minute view of an organization and the risks requiring mitigation. We are jointly head quartered in London and San Francisco.At Digital Shadows we are faced with lots of exciting data science challenges to solve. From classifying vast quantities of streaming data in real-time to using Deep Learning techniques to create tailored language models. At the centre of our innovative application is the data that we process upon which we apply a variety of analytics based approaches to identify risks to the security and reputation of our clients.
This is a great opportunity for someone passionate about solving problems to truly advance a career within data science and you will immediately be working with our stakeholders to understand the business problems we face. At Digital Shadows we place a strong focus on regularly delivering and deploying working software so you will research and develop algorithms and models that will be influential to the success of our platformYou will need to have experience with Python and an understanding of traditional and emerging database management techniques. In return you will have a unique opportunity to create a role within a data-driven environment where you have the freedom to be innovative and creative and with real potential to develop into a pivotal position within the business!
Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning and natural language processing approaches to accurately categorise and risk assess data processed by the application
Identify and acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to extend the coverage and capabilities of the application
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in our data to find opportunities to extend and enrich our existing data analytics approaches
Collaborate across teams to define, design, and ship new features
Work with and integrate external tools, libraries, data sources and API’s
Discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies
Contribute ideas and innovations to the product roadmap

Requirements

4+ years of experience as a data scientist or equivalent role
Expert knowledge of implementing machine learning (especially text mining) techniques
Experience with Python machine learning libraries
Understanding of traditional and emerging database management techniques
Self-driven individual with strong analytical skills, methodical thinking and problem solving ability
Strong oral and written communication skills
Commercial model development experience

Desirable

Experience of working with unstructured text data from web pages or documents and interfacing with different distributed data stores
Familiar with Deep Learning, Network Analysis and Graphical Models

Benefits
£50-55k plus equity
If you have any questions, please contact us on careers[at]digitalshadows[dot]com. Please note that we only accept applications through the online application portal.

We believe in the power of data to transform how people make decisions. Our products help our broad array clients - leaders of progressive political campaigns and Fortune 100 companies - to use data to make better decisions around buying TV advertising.
You're the kind of person who:

Can solve a technical problem with Google & StackOverflow posts
Constantly consumes information (breaking news, technology developments, the works)
Builds complex spreadsheets to make your own life decisions

The Junior Analyst will spend her days working with Senior Analysts to analyze large, complex data sets to identify trends and build predictive models for a wide variety of elite clients to inform real-world decisions at a tremendous scale.
Junior analysts will also be responsible for packaging their (and the team's) work into tables, charts and written explanations for memos and presentations. The ability to explain technical and/or complex analyses to an audience with varying technical experience is critical; and whether you’re working independently or collaboratively, you will be a part of the team. You don’t necessarily need experience with predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and big-data processing, but you will learn those skills on the job.
ABOUT AMG
We are a tech and media analytics startup that grew out of the 2012 Obama Campaign where we used individual-level data to change the way the campaign spent their $500M media budget. Though we were outspent, our ability to target our audience in a sophisticated way meant our dollars were better spent than the opposition.
We're bringing this methodology (and scrappiness!) to a broad array of clients who range from Fortune 500 consumer companies to political candidates and interest groups. And we have made waves - check out the New York Times Magazine profile of our approach:http://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/23/magazine/the-obama-campaigns-digital-masterminds-cash-in.html?pagewanted=all
REQUIREMENTS

Desire to learn, develop new skills, and improve existing skills
Basic proficiency manipulating data in any tool (including Microsoft Excel)
Basic proficiency in a scripting or programming language (any language is fine, but R and Python are preferable)
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative, scientific, or engineering field; or significant outside experience (Coursera, other MOOCs, work experience, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communication skills
0-4 years of real-world experience analyzing data

WHAT WOULD GET US REALLY EXCITED

Past work with surveys, demographic and consumer data, or large databases
Data visualization
Background or coursework in statistical analysis or predictive modeling
Experience with SQL or NoSQL databases
Experience with git, subversion, or other version control tools

BENEFITS

Join a mission-aligned team dedicated to delivering outstanding work to clients and growing individually
Comprehensive health and dental insurance (for employees and their families), life insurance, 401k, eligible for participation after one year
Pre-tax flexible compensation plan for medical, transit, parking or dependent care expenses
Salary and equity
10 paid vacation days (although in reality we’re more flexible) and sick days
Remote Fridays

The Honest Company is looking for a Data Engineer to help fulfill its vision of being a highly data-driven organization. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to use cutting edge technologies to design, build and scale a next-generation data platform to support company-wide analytics and big data initiatives. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment centered around team collaboration and exceptional quality of work, this job is for you.
Responsibilities

Manage a Hadoop cluster with HDFS, YARN, Spark, Hue, Hive, Redshift, etc.
Automate data ingestion and processing (ETL – Extract, Transform and Load)
Automate backfilling of data from relational and other NoSQL stores
Automate code deployment using Chef/Puppet/Docker/AWS tools and ensure monitoring, profiling, and debugging of cloud infrastructure is a plus
Maintain and add features in data collection APIs and help build a self-serving data platform
Build Realtime API services for driving data-driven use cases requiring sub-second latency

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree required (computer science or related field)
Experience with programming languages such as Java, Scala, and Python
Experience with Apache Spark, Kafka, Elasticsearch, and large scale data analysis
2+ years of experience with Hadoop/YARN/Mesos and building applications end-to-end
Ability to deliver quality code under tight deadlines in an Agile environment
Strong interpersonal communications skills and ability to collaborate effectively
Strong interest in learning about and working with new data management tools
Experience with networking and infrastructure automation a plus (e.g. Chef, Puppet, Bash, Docker)
Experience with distributed systems and MapReduce architectures a plus

About The Honest Company
The Honest Company is dedicated to helping people live a happy and healthy life. Founded in 2012, the mission-driven company provides 100+ safe, effective, and delightful products across a wide range of consumer categories, including baby, personal care, home care, and vitamins & supplements, to a passionate community of consumers united by values and style. Honest Beauty, the company's latest product offering, is a comprehensive skincare and makeup collection created with the same Honest standards of safety, performance, and spirit that are the hallmark of The Honest Company. Honest products are available across the U.S. and Canada via honest.com and honestbeauty.com and at more than 4,000 retail locations across North America. The Honest Company is privately held and headquartered in Los Angeles, California.
© The Honest Company, Inc. 2016. All Rights Reserved.

AMS Psychographics is a seed-VC-backed venture that is actively seeking an experienced and self-motivated Director of Data Science to join our core team. This role represents a unique, ground-floor opportunity to make your mark on our platform and company.
You are a passionate data scientist with an excellent background in statistics, you’re well versed in Python and machine learning, and thrive on resolving complex problems with elegant, computationally efficient solutions. You’re able to work closely with a cloud engineer, product manager, and advisors, but also able to work independently. You’re interested in human psychology, and in what truly motivates individual differences in behavior in the digital world and beyond. If this is you, then this is an opportunity you can’t miss:
AMS Psychographics has a Data Analytics Engine that optimizes psychographic audiences for high-value ad targeting. Our first objective is to reshape the multi-billion-dollar political advertising industry. By inventing a new class of science-based psychographic data and building a cloud platform that integrates with existing ad platforms, audiences for political ads can be targeted with greater than five times the efficiency of conventional methods. Beyond its game-changing potential in the US 2016 elections, our engine is the only technology of its kind that is extensible to international markets. Other applications include ad targeting in high-value consumer verticals, and predicting world events driven by public opinion with much greater accuracy than today’s methods. The company will leverage its simple licensing model to generate more than $110M in revenue in less than five years.
The company was founded by Dr. Avi Tuschman, an internationally recognized expert on the emerging science of human political orientation (see OurPoliticalNature.com and WhyTheDivide.com). AMS’s algorithms leverage advanced psychometric modeling as well as recent innovations in big-data statistics. No other product on the market has a scientific way to measure or model political orientation.
AMS has attracted world-class talent in psychographic profiling, the business of political technology, and ad tech. AMS has two key data partnerships, is commercially engaged with the third-largest publisher ad network, and has secured $140k in verbal ad-testing commitments from seven media agencies. This is a full- time position with a competitive cash and equity compensation package, plus benefits.
Requirements:

3-5+ years of proven track record providing machine-learning business solutions at large scale
Must have strong Python, with an emphasis on statistics and machine learning
A solid background in statistics, including sampling theory, experimental design, and a deep understanding of modern machine-learning techniques for high-dimensional data
Experience scaling modern machine-learning algorithms

Desired skills: 

Hadoop, Hive are a plus
Experience with or interest in Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Understanding of large-scale optimization and numerical linear algebra
Experience in the ad-tech industry
Comfortable with or interested in Java
Ability to lead small teams effectively
Publication record is a plus

Desired traits: 

Resourceful self-starter and team player with strong leadership skills
Uncompromising attention to details
Proven ability to be creative and resourceful in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Must be comfortable working independently
React well and quickly to frequent project demands and requirement changes
Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills
Strong written and communication skills and positive attitude working with customers and partners
Entrepreneurial spirit

School of Computer Science/ College of ScienceLincolnSalary: CompetitivePost reference: COS281
The University of Lincoln is seeking to appoint a Founding Professor of Machine Learning to join its School of Computer Science. This post is one of four new Chairs in Computer Science currently being advertised, demonstrating the University’s commitment to research excellence and increasing focus on and investment in science and technology.
This important Chair position will provide the appointed post-holder with the opportunity to set up and lead a new research group. It is envisaged that the group will focus on research into theoretical aspects, methodologies and practical applications of machine learning, as well as providing fundamental expertise in core machine learning to the School’s other research areas. A number of staff appointments have been set aside to populate this new group once the Professor has been appointed. This new group will sit alongside the School’s existing research groups in Robotics and Autonomous Systems, Computer Vision and Human Computer Interaction. It is expected that the activity of the new group will complement the School’s existing research profile and reach out to other disciplines both across the University and externally. The University has recently invested heavily in two interdisciplinary Institutes in Health and in Agri-Food Technology, providing further opportunities to develop cross-disciplinary work.
You should have a sustained track record of excellence in scientific publication, income generation, research student supervision, leadership of more junior academic staff, and real-world impact.
As an Athena SWAN Bronze Award holder at both Institutional and School level we are committed to advancing gender equality in STEM, therefore female applicants are strongly encouraged to apply.
Please contact our external adviser Imogen Wilde, Associate Director, Education Practice at Harvey Nash on +44 (0) 207 333 1503 or 077 9193 8533 for an informal conversation about this opportunity.
Alternatively for further information and to apply online, please visit jobs.lincoln.ac.uk
Closing Date: 15th May 2016

We are looking for Data Scientists to be responsible for the optimization technologies that are the foundation components of our platform. In this role, you will work alongside research scientists and engineers in the design and implementation of data-driven algorithms that enhance the performance of our system.
What You'll Be Doing:

Passion for “playing” with tons of data and supporting scientific experiments to improve and validate the performance of algorithms.
Apply deep, creative, rigorous thinking to solve broad, platform-wide technical and/or business problems.
Provide guidance and develop other managers and senior members of the Data Science Team; Educate, mentor and collaborate, both to build out specific projects and to continuously teach and learn new technology and techniques.
Support teammates in using machine-learning techniques, visualizations, and statistical analysis to gain insight into various data sets – some of which are readily available, and some of which we create and curate ourselves (using technology such as Hadoop, Hive or Spark).
Guide team in researching, designing, simulating and/or prototyping new algorithmic product features according to business need.
Communicate findings and solutions clearly to a variety of audiences, by drafting clear, comprehensive specs for engineers or explaining algorithmic concepts to product managers.
Represent our perspective in cross-functional projects, along with the company at large.
Actively seek out a broad understanding of the Tremor platform, product, and value proposition, and align design efforts accordingly.

You...

Knowledge of SQL and several scripting languages including Unix shell programming.
Understanding of machine learning techniques.
Experience with Hadoop and working with multi-terabyte systems.
At least 3 years of development in a Unix environment.
Strong Skills in statistical analysis and debugging.
PhD in Statistics or Computer Science desired.
Able to communicate fluently in English.

With world attention focused on both the environment and the economy, Environmental Defense Fund (EDF) is where policymakers and business leaders turn for win-win solutions. This leading green group, with programs from Boston to Beijing, has tripled in size over the past decade by focusing on strong science, uncommon partnerships and market-based approaches. We help companies, governments and communities find the ways that work to heal the environment and empower people to live better lives. You can be part of a vibrant workplace that welcomes the perspectives, talents and approaches of a diverse group of employees, where innovation and a focus on results are a way of life.
The Office of Chief Scientist (OCS) is the nexus of science at EDF, ensuring that the scientific backbone for all EDF policy positions is based on the best available information. To be effective in this role, OCS works with staff from across EDF and provides programmatic support for all EDF scientists as well as fosters relationships with scientists in academia, government and industry.
EDF is at the forefront of utilizing large data sets for environmental advocacy. Over a year ago, EDF launched the Methane Mapping Project (www.edf.org/methanemaps), which gathers methane concentration data using Google StreetView cars. We analyze the data and then publish maps that show methane leak size and location, to raise public awareness and help decision makers prioritize investments to fix the leaks.
Building on the Methane Mapping project, we are now leading a project to gather, analyze and visualize air pollution data at an unprecedented scale. The project’s goal is to link air pollution data to health outcomes in a way that will help citizens make better decisions in their daily lives.
As environmental sensors become cheaper and more accessible, experts, scientists and community members will have increased access to environmental data. EDF’s overall goal is to help catalyze the movement to get from environmental data to actionable information in a way that maximizes the public good.
Overall FunctionThe Data Architect will lead EDF’s work on the Air Sensor Workgroup, a group of experts from government, industry and NGOs who are developing norms for the air sensor and data field. Under the direction of the Director, OCS, the Data Architect will lead discussions about metadata, sensor testing data, common data formats, and also lead the effort to design elements of a publicly accessible, common air data repository.
The Data Architect will also be an internal resource for other EDF programs that are exploring large scale data analysis and presentation as an advocacy tool.
Key Responsibilities• Lead several components of the Air Sensor Workgroup. Facilitate discussions and bring large group of diverse stakeholders to consensus;• With the Air Sensor Workgroup, create best practices for those developing and deploying air sensors and networks, including potential data repositories for air quality data sets;• Create and implement strategies to demonstrate the power of air sensors and environmental advocacy;• Advise and assist the Methane Mapping team (www.edf.org/methanemaps) on data visualization for methane and other maps;• Advise other EDF programs on emerging projects requiring large data set analysis;• Under the direction of the Director, perform data analysis and advise on associated visualization projects designed to maximize environmental impact for a variety of EDF projects and programs;• Help develop materials in support of fundraising activities;• Supervise research analysts, fellows, or interns.• Candidates should address how their experience and skills address as many of these requirements as possible in either the cover letter or résumé.
Qualifications• A Master’s or PhD in information science, information management, data science, geostatistics, GIS, environmental science or similar field;• At least 3 years of relevant experience designing data management structures and /or collecting and organizing large, location-based data sets;• Experience with data analysis and familiarity with statistics programs;• Proven strategic thinker with demonstrated ability to lead innovative projects;• Demonstrated critical thinking ability;• Proven ability to work and communicate effectively with diverse groups of experts and stakeholders;• Intellectual agility and comfort with working across disciplines;• Highly engaged in the work and the project;• Experience with health or air quality data sets a plus.
Compensation and BenefitsEnvironmental Defense Fund offers an excellent benefits package and a competitive salary that is commensurate with experience.
TermThis is a full-time, 1-year term position with possible extension. 
Environmental Defense Fund is an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to building a culturally diverse and pluralistic organization that respects and values all people and does not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, race, color, sex, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, height, weight, veteran or marital status.

Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.
There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialize after work almost every Friday.
B.responsible

Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights. 
Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.
Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.
Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.
Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.

B.skilled

Minimum 3 years of experience in a relevant role
Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.)
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, machine learning and programming. Strong working knowledge of, Python, Hadoop, SQL, R and/or Excel.
Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders

B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.
This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

We’re looking for an experienced Data Scientist who has 3+ years in Data Science or a related field who is excited about tackling one of the world's largest challenges: Financial Inclusion.
InVenture is a world leader in providing direct loans and financial services in emerging markets. We are a global team with diverse backgrounds who are singularly focused on using technology, data and customer-centric approach to meet the financial needs of the 2+ billion people of the emerging global middle class.
THE ROLE:
Take it from people who have built models and studied problems ranging from microfinance to global climate change: we are tackling an incredibly hard problem with huge social and financial impact. The impact of our models is both intimidating and inspiring. You will be an integral part of the team tackling these challenges.We leverage a unique, diverse, and deep data set. You’ll be surprised by what connections we’ve found between our different data sources. You will be finding these surprising connections and communicating to the team as well as integrating them in the models.
You will own a model, or multiple models, whether building a country-level credit model from scratch, or integrating new data sources into our existing underwriting models.
YOU:
Problem solver. You thrive on finding novel solutions to hard problems. These problems may have ranged from extracting a new dataset from an unexpected source, to building cohorts for customer retention analysis, or the NY Times saturday crossword.
Expert. You have domain expertise. Tell us about the genetic algorithm you implemented to find a solution to your NP-hard problem, or the hobby that keeps you busy on nights and weekends.
Curious. You aren’t content until you understand why the features you have built have the explanatory power they do, and why they aren’t just a spurious correlation.
Opinionated. We are looking for someone to add diversity of thought to our current ensemble of data scientists.
Communicator and Listener. You are an expert in your field. Can you explain it to others in laymen’s terms? Can you collaborate well with our experts in growth/portfolio/customer experience?
Fluent in one or more languages. You may not know how a hash table is implemented, but you know when to use one as opposed to an array. We are language agnostic and have expertise in python, R, Spark, MATLAB, and d3.
REQUIREMENTS:
3+ years of experience in a data science role or equivalent positionA Masters or PhD in a quantitative field
PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
Experience in building fraud and/or credit modelsExpertise in NLP, network analysis, or geospatial analysis
ABOUT INVENTURE
InVenture builds mobile products that help creditworthy individuals in emerging markets validate their financial identities and get access to fair credit to advance their businesses and families. Using a simple Android device, we are able to determine an individual’s financial ability and send and receive all funds instantly via mobile money… and our customers love it! You can see our flagship app in the Kenyan Google Play store www.bit.ly/mkoporahisi and some customer testimonials here: www.inventure.com/love
InVenture is backed by Data Collective (DCVC), Lowercase Capital (Chris Sacca), Google Ventures

Job position reference: Ynsect -IZOO-160405-en-modeling and data analysisStarting date: ASAPLocation: Genopole - Evry – Paris region - FranceDuration: undefined (greater than 12 months)
CONTEXTYnsect is a world-class pioneer and leading company in insect industrial technologies. We develop insect biorefineries. This breakthrough technology consists, on the one hand, of rearing insects at large scale. On the other hand, it consists of recovering and processing specialty molecule streams for agro-food and feed (proteins, lipids), chemical and high-tech industrial applications (chitin derivatives).
Insects are a sustainable resource and show tremendous potential as an innovative way to turn low-value heterogeneous organic resources into high-value versatile materials. They also are a long-awaited alternative for food and feed protein commodity markets.
At Ynsect, we all work together to contribute to building a sustainable system to feed the world. We believe that insects are part of the solution, and that it is the right thing to do, right now.
We are seeking a highly talented and motivated individual to join our team to contribute to the improvement of our rearing techniques, in the Upstream R&D Department.
INTENDED WORK1. The candidate will be in charge of developing mechanistic and/or statistical predictive models, correlating numerous biotic and abiotic factors to insect growth and development, based on literature and real data taken at Ynsect.2. The candidate will also be in charge of the development and maintenance of predictive models and data visualization tools for monitoring and reporting an insect rearing unit, both at lab and industrial scales.3. The candidate will be in charge of the statistical support for the treatment of data on several projects (e.g. model development and classification problems solving) and will help define and maintain data management and reproducible research quality procedures and good practices.
The candidate will carry out the following tasks:
Predictive physiological model development- Literature review- Development, cross-validation, testing and improvement of physiological models- Documentation and internal communication
Insect rearing unit data analysis- Development and maintenance of automated reports and visualization tools based on data from lab and industrial-scale rearing units- Development, cross-validation, testing and improvement of rearing models- Documentation and internal communication- Contribution to large scale industrial business models
Support- Review of experimental protocols- Contribution to results statistical analysis- Recommendation to improve data quality and data collection practices- Study, application and contribution to quality procedures
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
- Diploma (Msc. or PhD.) or equivalent in the field of (or with a focus on) applied mathematics, statistics, computer science or operational research – a must have;- Good knowledge and practice of statistical and/or data mining tools and languages (R, Python…), and their numeric and machine learning libraries (scikit-learn…) – a must have;- Good knowledge and ability to quickly apply statistical inference techniques;- Good knowledge and ability to quickly apply machine learning techniques;- Basic theoretical knowledge and/or affinity with life science and animal physiology;- Very good communication skills, common usage of office software (Pack MS Office);- Affinity for intellectual work;- Autonomy, good interpersonal abilities, initiative, taste for experimentation, inclination for teamwork;- Interest in sustainable development and environmental care;- English spoken and written – a must have;- French spoken and written;
WORKING CONDITIONS
The job will take place at Ynsect office at Genopole - Evry (next to Paris, 40 minutes from Gare de Lyon with RER D).
The position is a full-time position (39 hours/week). The job might include punctual travels in France, and also in Europe and abroad.
APPLICATION PROCESSApplications consisting in a résumé and a motivation letter will be written in English and sent to the following email address: jobs@ynsect.com.
location: The job will take place at Ynsect office at Genopole - Evry (next to Paris, 40 minutes from Gare de Lyon with RER D

body:
The Manager of Forecast and Data Science will play the lead role in ensuring that demand forecasts are created, reviewed, published, and refined when appropriate. The management duties include supervising Demand Analysts, working in conjunction with Sales, Account Management, Marketing, and Materials Teams in understanding forecasting implications of activities & events, and supporting long-term forecasts while determining its affect on supply. The management duties also include being responsible for managing and executing the Sales and Operations Planning process. Additionally, this position will oversee the execution of forecasts and measurements to improve the performance as it relates to key elements of customer service and asset utilization. Also serves as the Forecast subject matter expert.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Advanced data analysis to identify trends/behaviors to improve forecast accuracy
Manage and develop the Sales and Operations Planning process, including reports, demand plan, Supply Chain plan, inventory, and budget.Review and manage the forecasting statistical models and exceptions.Coordinate with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Service to input their recommended adjustments for demand into the monthly demand reports, including inputs for new and discontinued products.Establish processes and leverage tools to accurately predict the Average Daily Participation demand by Customer for particular products on the menu.Maintain item planning factors by Distribution Center and Average Daily Participation by customer within RAMCO.Participate in product development planning, as well as assist in the Product Life Cycle Management process.Create and maintain customized dashboards for marketing, sales, operations, and planning personnel.Measure and report performance on assigned products. Performance indexes include forecast accuracy and bias, customer service, and inventory levels.Collaborate with senior management to develop continuous improvement methodology in key areas of Menu/Forecast and use KPIs to drive and quantify Menu cost optimization while maintaining customer Menu quality and service.Drive coordination of Menu/Forecasting processes and activities across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance and IS.Desired Skills and ExperienceCompetencies:
Extensive knowledge of forecasting theory/model and supply chain managementIndependent and analytical thinking, and the exercise of sound judgmentExperience in strategic planning and executionStrong analytical skills, and the ability to compile data and effectively problem solve high-level, strategic initiativesDemonstrated leadership skills in implementing and managing change.Exceptional oral and written communication skills, and can see the 'big picture"- while paying strict attention to detailCross Functional Leadership skills and experienceExperience with ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning)Experience with advanced data analysisExperience managing a team of analystsExperience with business intelligence tool, such as SAP BusinessObjectsProgramming language, SQL, R, and VBA desiredStrong knowledge of Supply Chain, Finance, Sales, and Customer Service functionsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Supply Chain Management, Finance, Business Administration or similar field requiredEducation AND experience requirements:
Experience with advanced data analysisExperience managing a team of analystsExperience with business intelligence tool, such as SAP BusinessObjectsProgramming language, SQL, R, and VBA desiredStrong knowledge of Supply Chain, Finance, Sales, and Customer Service functionsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Supply Chain Management, Finance, Business Administration or similar field required
job_title: Manager of Forecast and Data Science

body:
StatMuse Inc. is an interactive platform for fans to search, share and discover sports using natural language. With a $10M Series A in January 2016, from the likes of Disney and former NBA Commissioner David Stern, we are poised to build great things.
We are looking for individuals with demonstrated quantitative and problem-solving skills. We value creativity, hard work, and on-the-job-excellence and offer competitive compensation and benefits packages. We're particularly focused on creating innovative experiences by applying the latest in natural language processing techniques.
Come work with us full-time in our San Francisco workspace or remote from your location in the United States. Candidates must legally be eligible to work in the United States and we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.

PRACTICE AREA:
BCG's Advanced Analytics group delivers powerful analytics-based insights designed to help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value-chain: framing new business challenges, building fact-bases, designing innovative analytics workflows, training colleagues in new methodologies, and interpreting findings for our clients. The Analytics Solutions team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing Analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge analytics approaches.
POSITION SUMMARY:
BCG has established the Analytics Solutions team to support case teams in managing and realizing insight and opportunity from the increasing analytical intensity of our clients' problems. Scientific Programmers, together with Data Scientists, Scientific Modelers and Data Engineers, will be the core of the new Analytics Solutions service. They will work closely with consultants and case teams to provide both consultation on analytics subject matter expertise and hands-on support to case teams, focusing on model & tool development, advanced analytics tools, visualization, and custom-developed client-facing analytics deliverables.
The Knowledge Analyst will join a growing team with a global presence, and will work with both customers and team members worldwide. Successful candidates will possess advanced analytical technical expertise, strong collaborative and execution capabilities, excellent communication skills, a practical and flexible mindset, and high attention to detail and work quality.
ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Rapid prototyping and modeling
• Gather requirements and develop advanced models and prototype software tools to encapsulate and test case team ideas in client environments
• Champion additional technical options to enhance case team effectiveness
• Collaborate with project team members to write prioritized business requirements documentation, including scope definition and statement of work
Data visualization
• Develop new methods for displaying data analysis outcomes
• Leverage existing tools to allow clients to explore data in new ways
• Research emerging tools for data visualization and evaluate their suitability to the business
Provide training, assistance, and support to customers
• Provide quick-response support to case teams on subject matter expertise via a central request portal
• Deliver highest-quality work product both within team and to case teams / customers
Other
• Perform internal team projects and duties as assigned or required
• Occasional travel – dependent on project requirements
JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience:
• Undergraduate degree in a field linked to computer science, IT, computer applications, business analytics, engineering, applied mathematics or related field is required; advanced degree is preferred
• 1-2+ years relevant industry experience, focus on analytics focused programming and scripting preferred
• Previous experience working in a global organization or professional services firm is preferred
• Experience with data visualization is preferred
KEY COMPETENCIES:
Professional capabilities
• Problem solving, analytical skills and decision making 
o Able to effectively handle difficult and stressful situations with poise, tact and patience, while demonstrating a sense of urgency
o Able to anticipate, identify, and solve critical problems
o Flexible, self-motivated, and proactive out-of-the-box and critical thinker
• Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills 
o Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
o Fluent written and spoken English (other languages desirable)
o Ability and willingness to give and receive honest, balanced feedback
• Work management, organization and planning 
o Excellent organizational skills with strong attention to detail, efficient time management, and the ability to prioritize work effectively
o Independently and proactively communicates issues, priorities, and objectives
o Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, demanding environment
• Customer and business focus 
o Strong collaborative skills and able to adjust approach to effectively interact with customers at all organizational and technical levels
o Focus on excellent customer service and user needs
• Values and ethics 
o Demonstrates competence and character that inspires trust
o Ability to respect all BCG and client information as personal and confidential　
Technical expertise
• Programming and/or scripting experience: e.g. Python, C#, Perl, SQL, …
o Application development (VBA, C++, .net, Java, …)
o Web app development (ASP.net, Javascript, …)
o D3 libraries a plus
o Text mining & unstructured data analytics a plus
• Familiarity with a broad base of analytics tools a plus: 
o Data management: e.g. Excel, SQL, PostGRESql, Hadoop/Hive, Alteryx, …
o Data visualization: e.g. Tableau, …
o Analytics platforms: e.g. SAS, R, RapidMiner, SPSS, …
• Experience in core analytics methods a plus: 
o Statistics (t-tests, ANOVA, …), variable reduction (FA, PCA, …)
o Segmentation/clustering techniques
o Predictive modeling: e.g. logistic regression, linear regression, …
o Simulation: e.g. MC, dynamic, discrete event, …
o Optimization: e.g. linear programming, heuristic, …
　
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
• Fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment
The Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable.
location: Chicago, IL; Boston, MA; Los Angeles, CA

body:
About Us
Oasis Financial is the nation’s largest and most recognized brand for providing legal funding to consumers with injury-based claims. Oasis has pioneered the market for providing a non-recourse financial solution to help people put their lives together after they have been unexpectedly injured both physically and economically in an accident that was not their fault. Oasis provides cash upfront to people at the time they need it while they pursue fair compensation from the responsible party, and only recovers remuneration if their customers are successful in resolving their claim.  Oasis is located in Rosemont, Illinois, and a short commute from Chicago and accessible via the CTA Blue Line and a free shuttle service.
Job Description
With a commitment to innovation, Oasis is well established as the market leader in the industry.  Harnessing business intelligence derived from mining its proprietary data is key to Oasis’ future success and growth.  The Senior Data Analyst will enable improvements to Oasis’ data infrastructure and provide analysis to senior leadership to allow for speedy strategic and operational decisions.
Position Responsibilities:

Curate, mine and model large data sets of historical customer activities to help Oasis understand customer needs and activities
Interpret results of analyses to create business solutions, actionable plans, and dashboards that will optimize success in the Company’s marketing, sales, operations, underwriting and new product development activities
Enhance data architecture to allow business users increased visibility and optimization opportunities
Proactively hunt for new opportunities to capture actionable data, utilize external data sets and conduct independent research to enhance the value of the Company’s proprietary data set and business intelligence decisions
Collaborate with the leadership team across different departments to further their business objectives
Present findings and recommendations to management through user friendly presentations

Desired Skills and Experience

5-10 years of marketing or business analytics experience
Bachelor's degree in predictive analytics, statistics, computer science, engineering or a related field
Strong analytical skills, statistical modeling, problem solving and conceptual thinking abilities
Ability to synthesize large amounts of data into relevant themes and communicate findings and recommendations through PowerPoint slides to C-suite executives and institutional shareholders
Entrepreneurial spirit eager to make a mark on the future trajectory of the Company
Solid command of Excel, including pivot tables
Experience in financial services, consulting, credit card industry or marketing desired
Experience with Microsoft technologies (SQL Server, T-SQL, MDX) or familiarity with any relevant software programs (R, SAS, Hadoop, Alteryx, MATLAB, Python) will be valued

Benefits
Oasis offers competitive compensation benefits that include health, dental and vision plans, 401(k) with Company match, and a flexible spending account. Oasis an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. M/F/D/V
Qualified candidates, please send resume to recruiting@oasisfinancial.com

Our company brings together a unique combination of expertise in human computer interaction, machine learning, and hardware integration to create revolutionary interactive solutions.
We are looking for a machine learning expert who loves working with sensor data, loves developing new algorithms, is not afraid of challenging, open-ended problems, and wants to help us shape the future of touch interaction. You will be working with a small and highly capable team of machine learning engineers and will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the growth of a burgeoning startup.
As a Machine Learning Engineer, your responsibilities will include:

Designing experiments to advance our machine learning understanding and techniques
Running experiments to improving the core algorithms of Qeexo products on consumer devices
Modeling accuracy of Qeexo products on new hardware and sensor platforms
Developing new algorithms to improve our engine calibration process
Working with customers to design and implement Qeexo solutions

An ideal candidate will have:

A proven track record of academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning and signal processing, particularly in acoustic analysis
Deep knowledge of statistical and machine learning approaches and problem domains
Computer Science or EE background (MS or BS) with strong coding ability and familiarity with Java, C++ or other OOP language. (You will not be doing production-level coding but you will need to build some prototypes/tools for experiments.)
Proven success with multiple ML/AI/classification projects (research papers, kaggle, open source implementations, etc.)
Expertise in one or more specific areas of research: neural nets/deep learning, signal processing or digital imaging, ensemble learning and system identification
Research-minded, ability to run experiments independently and present results to leadership
Comfortable working in a terminal environment, writing scripts (Bash/Python) to process data
Experience in mobile or other consumer electronic devices

Skills & Requirements:

Machine Learning (expert)
Python (expert)
Deep Learning (proficient)
Ensemble Modeling/Classification (proficient)
Signal Processing (familiar)
Java (familiar)
C (familiar)
Data Structures and Algorithms (familiar)

Bonus Qualifications:

Familiarity with acoustics or mechanical wave propagation, signal processing, approximation theory, and information theory
Understanding of applied mathematics, computational science, computational statistics, approximation theory, compressive sensing, representation learning, and/or pattern recognition

This opportunity is based in Mountain View, CA or Pittsburgh, PA.
location: Mountain View, CA or Pittsburgh, PA

body:
Amazon Services is one of the fastest growing businesses within Amazon. There are over 1.9 million merchants, ranging from students selling their text books to nation-wide retail chains, selling on Amazon’s international marketplaces. Collectively, these merchants are responsible for selling about 1/3rd of all items ordered from Amazon.com world-wide. AmazonServices.com is the destination online for sellers to learn, sign-up and to grow their business with Amazon. The team is looking for passionate, talented, and super-smart software engineers. We’re looking for people who innovate, love solving hard problems, and never take 'no' for an answer. Our engineers are top-notch software developers in the industry, who work hard, have fun, and make history.
We need your experience and expertise to enhance the experience on Amazon seller business marketing websites worldwide. We’re looking for someone with superior technical knowledge in current web development technologies and advanced Machine Learning. Successful members of this team collaborate effectively with internal end-users, aggressive cross-functional software development teams, and technical support/sustaining engineering teams to solve problems, implement new demand generation solutions, and deliver successfully against high operational standards of system availability and reliability. We look for engineers who are excellent communicators, self-motivated, flexible, hard working, and who like to have fun!
Basic Qualifications:
- BS degree in Computer Science and 4+ years of industry experience developing large scale distributed software systems.- Proficiency with an OO language (Java or C++) and design patterns, as well as Machine Learning, including structure modeling, supervised and unsupervised learning, as well as distributed and scalable algorithms.- Experience with RDBMS scaling challenges, data modeling, XML processing, SOAP, REST- Maniacal customer obsession- Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project
Preferred Qualifications:
- Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and designing for performance, scalability, and availability- Knowledge in SQL, XML, and Web services are a plus- Experience with Oracle databases and user interface design/development are highly desired- Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations- Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive- Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast-paced environment
job_title: Software Development Engineer with Machine Learning

body:
Insight Analytics Consultant
PwC is a world leader in the use of data analytics to help business and government clients make better decisions and improve their performance through descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics. Due to team growth, we are seeking analytics professionals to join our Insight Analytics team in Sydney.
About the role:
Working with high performing, multidisciplinary members of the Insight Analytics team daily, you will seek to understand your client’s challenge, design and build analytical models or perform data analysis to assist them in understanding the impact of various financial or operational changes to their business. You will simplify complex ideas and present them to clients in an easy to understand and impactful way.
We pride ourselves on our strong supportive team culture and diverse mix of backgrounds. We also strongly believe in the importance of potential and desire to learn. As such is it important to us that you fit well within our team, have a strong desire to learn and develop your own skills and also support and coach others.
In return for joining our team, you will gain exposure to a wide range of industry and clients, and be rewarded with a career built on a variety of experiences, and the opportunity for development with a management or technical focus. We will also look to provide you with the chance to develop a network of contacts across PwC who will support you in your growth as a consulting professional and analytics professional.
Types of problems you may solve as part of a team:
• What are the growth opportunities in my market and who do I target?• How do I improve the efficiency of my assets to reduce costs or improve margin?• How should I price my product or what discount should I offer to attract customers?• How do I build an effective, productive analytics team to support my business?• How should I optimise my logistics network or supply chain to best serve my customers?
Below are the qualities we look for in candidates, but don’t be discouraged if you don’t possess all or even most of them. We would still love to talk to you about joining our team.
The ideal candidate would have some or all of these qualities:
• 2 – 7 years of work experience working in a data or analytics focused role• Degree in a quantitative discipline, mathematics/statistics, actuarial sciences, computer science, engineering, or life sciences • Demonstrated foundation in and application of statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, and/or probability • Demonstrated ability to quickly pick up new tools and techniques including programming languages• Demonstrated ability to think abstractly, solve problems and deal with ambiguity• Experience working with and manipulating messy and complex data sets to find insight• Possess a self-starter attitude, good time management and communication skills• Experience working with senior stakeholders, communicating complex ideas, and/or managing junior teams 
The ideal candidate would have basic to intermediate skills with two or more of the following:
• Use of relational or graph databases and manipulating large, complex datasets• Building complex spreadsheets for financial or operational modelling, including the use of VBA• Use of statistical modelling packages such as R, including use of predictive or machine learning algorithms• Use of simulation or optimisation software packages and underlying theory• Familiarity and hands-on experience with SQL, Python, Java, and/or C/C++• Designing impactful data visualisations to communicate complex ideas in Tableau or similar
If you are keen to expand your horizons and believe you have the drive, initiative and skills to play an integral role in our team then please express your interest by applying online.
About PwC:
PwC is one of Australia's leading professional services firms, bringing the power of our global network of firms in 157 countries to help Australian businesses, not-for-profit organisations and governments assess their performance and improve the way they work.
The PwC Australia experience will offer you the opportunity to work with the best people and technology, flexible working arrangements, activity based working, up to 18 weeks of paid parental leave a diverse work place and embedded cultural values in everything we do. We offer reward and recognition for your efforts so you can realise your potential through coaching and career development.

Excellent interpersonal skills, oral and written communication skills, and organizational skills

You will be part of projects and activities that aim to transform the Telenor Denmark business to the next stage based on the possibilities and opportunities Telco native data offers. 
Your future work will mainly focus around: 

preparation, development and execution of highly innovative projects in the field of online and media by using big data technologies. Understanding of customer data and the art to transform data into a product 
mining trends and patterns from the data

We are looking for very creative and innovative business thinking person with strong analytical skills.The biggest focus is to understand the customers data and transform them into the valuable insights to increase internal efficiency and customer experience.The person shall work in close co-operation across many teams in the organization i.e IT, Network, Marketing, Sales, FinanceAs a member of Innovation team the person shall bring new and innovative ideas that can help organization to monetize data on, in and out of telco space.As part of Innovation analytical team the person shall use different analytical techniques including descriptive statistics, mathematical modeling and hypothesis testing, statistical methodologiesRefine existing and bring new algorithms, approaches and tools in fast paced and constantly changing discipline of data scienceWork with stakeholders to identify new data sources that can provide useful insights if ingested into analytical ecosystem.
