Don’t just learn how things work, but learn why! Curiosity is the key

This is an exciting opportunity for an exceptional Data Scientist to move into a global macro trading team.
This is a new role that has been created which is fully embedded into a multi-asset class proprietary trading division. The team has flexibility to trade derivatives across fixed income, equities and commodities markets.
The role is for a developer with strong UX skills who has experience working with large data sets, analysing patterns and presenting the data in a clear format that can communicate a vivid story to a broad audience.
The candidate will be required to show significant initiative, to have an avid desire to learn, to take fresh approaches to presenting data and to maintain an open mind at all times to what the information may hold.
The preferred candidate would have deep knowledge in programming languages including R, Python and Java and be capable of interfacing this knowledge with standard Office applications (principally Excel).
In addition, knowledge of publishing packages capable of producing professionally finished charts and documents would be helpful.
The candidate will be expected to have strong analytical and communication skills, be capable of clearly articulating the rationale behind their actions and be excited to work in a highly entrepreneurial environment.
The ideal candidate will come from a top-tier technology firm where he/she has been involved in developing big data analytics from scratch.
Applicants must have a proven track record in exceptional performance and innovation throughout their career and academic history.

Information Technology Technical Associate (Healthcare Data Analyst)Office of the CHIO
The University of Illinois Hospital & Health Sciences System is seeking an Information Technology Technical Associate (Healthcare Data Analyst) -Office of the CHIO.
The Healthcare Data Analyst will implement business intelligence systems that provide effective clinical decision support for the enterprise. The position will design, develop, and support enterprise-wide reports and dashboards. The position will also retrieve, automate, and analyze data into actionable insights.
Key Responsibilities/Duties:
Design and implement reporting solutions that identify trends, performance to goals, compliance rate, and improvement opportunities. Design, build and maintain dashboards that will be used by the enterprise. Leverage best practices of data visualization. Retrieve, clean, and analyze data to discover correlation and causation, and support decision-making. Participate in innovative projects related to clinical practice improvement. Perform other related duties and participate in special projects as assigned.
Minimum Acceptable Qualifications Required:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Health Informatics or related field. A minimum of (1) one year professional IT experience within Data Analytics and Integration which includes experience with large volumes of high velocity, complex, and variable data that require advanced techniques and technologies to enable the capture, storage, distribution, management and analysis of the information. Demonstrated experience within business intelligence, reporting and data visualization. Demonstrated experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools such as but not limited to; Tableau, and/or PowerInsight.
Preferred Qualifications:1. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the analysis and interpretation of complex healthcare data.
Salary & Benefits: The University of Illinois offers competitive benefit packages, including: vacation days, paid holidays, Floating Holidays, State University Retirement System, tuition waiver, tuition discount for dependents, and excellent medical, dental, and vision packages.
To Apply: Go to jobs.uic.edu/UI_Health/jobdetails?jobID=62680
For fullest consideration, please complete an online application by clicking the Apply for Position button below AND submit an Exam Request for HC5173 Information Technology Technical Associate (Healthcare Data Analyst) - Office of the CHIO.
If a degree or college coursework is required you must provide official transcripts.
Transcripts/Licenses/Certifications MUST be uploaded electronically to your online application through the "Documents" page on the Civil Service Employment Application (page 4). Be sure to select the appropriate document type before uploading the document.
Documentation of high school completion (official transcripts, copy of diploma or GED certificate) may be required in order to be eligible for this position within the University of Illinois Hospital and Health Sciences System.
If your educational institution doesn't provide electronic transcripts they must mail the transcripts to:
University of Illinois at ChicagoRecruitment and StaffingHuman Resources Building Room 109715 S. Wood Street M/C 862Chicago IL 60612Attn: HC5173 Information Technology Technical Associate (Healthcare Data Analyst) - Office of the CHIO
Credential Assessment Exam Scoring Information:
You will not be required to report in person for this exam. The updated online application and all uploaded, relevant documents, such as a resume and/or college transcript will be used in the calculation of the exam score. These documents should be uploaded prior to submitting your exam request.
When completing your online application, please be sure to provide detailed information about your job knowledge and specific duties and responsibilities, as your qualifications for any Civil Service position will be primarily determined based on what is contained in the application. Dates of employment and if employed on a full or part time basis (including number of hours per week) must be indicated for each position held. Additional consideration will be given to supporting documentation i.e. resume, transcripts, licenses, and certifications so please be sure to attach all applicable documents.
If an application and exam request are not submitted by the close date, the applicant/employee will not be considered and the exam request will be denied.
For fullest consideration, the above mentioned requirements must be submitted no later than Monday April 29, 2016.

The University of Illinois at Chicago is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

body:
We are looking for a machine learning expert who loves working with sensor data, developing new algorithms, is not afraid to challenge him/herself with open-ended problems, and wants to help us shape the future of touch interaction. You will be leading and growing a small and highly capable team of machine learning engineers, and will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the growth of a burgeoning startup.
As the Manager of Qeexo’s Machine Learning team, you will lead the Machine Learning efforts surrounding R&D and commercial projects.
Your responsibilities will include:

Leading our engineering team and helping to ensure they can be as efficient and productive as possible
Managing the multiple work streams our Machine Learning Team juggles on a daily basis
Understanding the necessary steps to complete each project, estimating how long each step will take, and prioritizing tasks within the team
Designing experiments to advance our machine learning understanding and techniques
Running experiments to improve the core algorithms of Qeexo products on consumer devices
Modeling accuracy of Qeexo products on new hardware and sensor platforms
Developing new algorithms to improve our engine calibration process
Working with customers to design and implement Qeexo solutions
We expect you to help our team excel and provide tremendous value to our company. You will be interfacing regularly with senior management, and are expected to be a leader and a communicator.

Ideal Candidate
An ideal candidate will have:

A proven track record managing a team of engineers, and academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning and signal processing, particularly in acoustic analysis
Deep knowledge of statistical and machine learning approaches and problem domains
2+ years of engineering management experience
Computer Science or EE background (MS or BS) with strong coding ability and familiarity with Java, C++ or other OOP language (You will not be doing production-level coding but you will need to build some prototypes/tools for experiments.)
Proven success with multiple ML/AI/classification projects (research papers, kaggle, open source implementations, etc.)
Expertise in one or more specific areas of research: neural nets/deep learning, signal processing or digital imaging, ensemble learning and system identification
Research-minded, ability to run experiments independently and present results to leadership
Comfortable working in a terminal environment, writing scripts (Bash/Python) to process data
Experience in mobile or other consumer electronic devices
Solid communication skill

Skills & Requirements:

Machine Learning (expert)
Python (expert)
Deep Learning (proficient)
Ensemble Modeling/Classification (proficient)
Signal Processing (familiar)
Java (familiar)
C (familiar)
Data Structures and Algorithms (familiar)
U.S. Work Authorization required

Bonus Qualifications:

Familiarity with acoustics or mechanical wave propagation, signal processing, approximation theory, and information theory
Understanding of applied mathematics, computational science, computational statistics, approximation theory, compressive sensing, representation learning, and/or pattern recognition

This opportunity is based in Mountain View, CA or Pittsburgh, PA.
location: Mountain View, CA or Pittsburgh, PA

body:
About Us
At Diffbot, we believe that access to structured information will be the critical resource for the coming wave of intelligent applications—for everything from new app experiences, to search assistants, to enterprise business intelligence.
That’s why our team of world-class AI researchers is building a machine that can autonomously synthesize the world’s largest database of structured information and looking for those that want to join us on this mission.
AI Researcher
We’re looking for talented and driven AI researchers with a unique area of expertise that can be applied to improving the performance and capabilities of our autonomous knowledge acquisition system. You like ambitious (but rigorous) objective functions that are tied strongly to business goals.
Responsibilities

Develop systems for better-than-human level knowledge extraction
Improve the accuracy of existing machine learning systems

Requirements

Bachelor’s or equivalent in engineering discipline
Specialized research (non-academic is OK) in machine learning methods
Success optimizing machine learning benchmarks to competitive levels of accuracy
Experience in writing algorithms for speed and scalability

Preferred Skills

Masters or PhD in computer science
Java, Python, C++, CUDA
Experience in knowledge fusion and entity linking problems

To apply, please submit:

Resume / LinkedIn / homepage
A short self-introduction (describe your interest and area of speciality)
Kaggle competitions you have participated in that are relevant

Uber has a simple mission: Transportation as reliable as running water, everywhere, for everyone. As Uber data scientists, we use deep algorithmic insight to power our products and services at every second of every day.
Uber data science covers a wide range of different domains - from marketplace optimization to map services, from applied economics to product analytics, from Uber Everything to experimentation. We tackle these areas by leveraging an insurmountable amount of real-world data that our business generates every day. Currently we have these openings:

Data Science - Marketplace Optimization

Build Uber’s dynamic pricing engine; identify and predict city specific traffic, travel, and demand patterns; optimize the assignment process of matching/dispatching drivers to riders; match multiple riders to a driver for our UberPool product.

Data Science - Real Time Marketplace Forecasting

Develop a variety of forecasting models together with engineered implementations for use in Uber’s marketplace decision systems. Not only will you will be modeling localized demand, hourly & weekly temporal demand patterns, and driving behaviors, but also the effects of other external factors such as weather, sporting events, and even other transportation schedules.

Data Science - Product Analytics

Partner with Product and Engineering to drive actionable data insights and solutions from Uber’s large datasets. You will work on every aspect of the product — whether it's exploratory research to understand user behavior for riders and drivers, or running experiments to optimize untapped areas of growth, or building machine learning models to mitigate fraud on our platform.

For more job openings, go to Uber Data Science Jobs to check details.  

Roles are available at all levels. Broadly speaking, we are looking for people satisfying these requirements:

Minimum 1 year practical data science or engineering work experience out of school, in quantitative domains.
Strong quantitative background: MS or PhD preferred. 
Familiarity with technical tools for analysis - Python (with Pandas, etc.), R, SQL.
Programming chops - demonstrable familiarity (work experience, Github commit) with programming concepts. Python skills and previous software engineering background is a plus.
Research mindset - ability to structure a project from idea to experimentation to prototype to implementation.
Driven and focused self-starters, great communicators, amazing follow-through - you aggressively tackle your work and love the responsibility of being individually empowered.
A preference for quality over quantity - you get the math right and aspire to build the right solution; you like a team that holds each other to a high bar.

We're bringing Uber to every major city in the world. We need brains and passion to make it happen and to make it happen in style.
You don’t want to miss it, do you? Go to Uber Data Science Jobs and apply!

(Please note ASCAP does not sponsor work authorization)
ASCAP is the intersection for capturing listening data globally, hundreds of billions of data points per year and this is a unique opportunity to visually tell the narrative of what is happening in the music industry.
The Data Visualization Lead will create compelling visual narratives for some of the world's most creative and recognized people, also known as ASCAP's song writer and publisher members. This individual is responsible for simplifying complex data insights into easy to understand and memorable stories for our members, licensees and executives.
You will work cross-functionally with ASCAP industry experts, data scientists, product managers and executives to gauge key-stakeholder needs for consuming analytics and articulating ASCAP's value to the entire industry. We work in an Agile environment rapidly iterating, prototyping and implementing visualizations that meet ASCAP's business needs.
The data visualizations are expected to consider composition, color, texture as well as optimizing depth and information density across a variety of delivery vehicles including mobile, web dashboards and email. Important to note, there is a strong emphasis on self-service including drill-downs, filtering and layering.
Areas of responsibility/accountability:

Collaborate cross-functionally to create clean, intuitive and beautiful data visualizations
Enable users to navigate through data and visually manipulate massive data sets to gain new insights and also to share and tell stories around ASCAP's big data
 Partner with product management and data teams to deliver compelling, relevant and valuable data products
Evangelize the use of data products that push the boundaries of interactive data visualization
Just a few of the things we want to visually understand
Works activity and trending by popularity and by social activity and sentiment
Current and predicted popularity across platforms e.g. satellite, terrestrial and digital
Who are the influencers today in the social sphere and who is on the rise

Qualifications and Requirements:

 Amazing story telling and data narrative skills
 Expert in D3 
 Node.JS
 Backend API programming into machine learning environment a plus
 SQL/Hadoop/MapReduce/Spark
 Leading discovery and collaboration sessions

Picture yourself working on one of the best and brightest Data Science teams disrupting the financial services industry with the goal of building a revolutionary data product. If you eat, sleep and breathe Statistical Modelling and love programming in R too, we should be talking. If you are an excellent communicator, fun, super smart and love to win, you'll fit right in.
Clear Capital is looking for an extremely talented Statistical Data Analyst with exceptional programming skills in R. We're solving problems and building solutions for some of the leading financial institutions in the mortgage industry. As Clear Capital continues to grow our lines of business including valuation solutions, data analytics and SaaS platform delivery, we seek to add a Statistical Data Analyst to our high-powered analytics group. You will be working on next generation statistical models to support our growing client base who seek world class data analysis and data mining solutions.
Our offices and facilities are very modern with incredible views which creates a laid back working atmosphere in a professional environment. We offer 2 Major Medical plans, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Account, 401K w/match, paid vacation, paid holidays, Life Insurance and a host of other benefits. We are near 5 major ski areas within 15 - 30 min. of our offices. World class mountain biking, fishing, hiking, water sports and scenery. We offer a casual working environment, casual dress code and super friendly people.
Relocation Assistance available
YOUR MISSION

You will develop and implement advanced statistical methodologies, interpreting business logic into production code, and providing solutions for complex data mining problems.
Help us advance Clear Capital's robust proprietary database and advance our analytical efforts 
Leverage Clear Capital's proprietary database to develop and implement business rules analyzing real estate market dynamics
You get to integrate statistical scripts, database operations, and web based platforms to provide holistic solutions

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, economics or a minimum of 4 yrs performing data analysis, data mining, and working with data models. Ph.D. degree a plus. 
Strong programming skills in R. If no experience in R, we would consider Python, Matlab or SAS
Advanced anlaytical, mathematical and quantitative skills
Ability to gather and analyze data, through various systems, and generate complex reports 
Ability to visualize and compile large sets of data into a clear and presentable format
Strong documentation and presentation skills

THINGS YOU MAY KNOW

Experience with the package data.table, Shiny and any of the parallel computing packages such as RMPI and multicore
Functional programming concepts would be a big help

At Clear Capital, we build platform software and deliver data and analytics to the mortgage finance industry. We’re a FinTech company pushing technology in the mortgage world more than ever, leveraging a modern tech stack. Our goal: make lives easier and transform the mortgage finance industry for the better. We are a technology data driven company, and a significant portion of our company is made up of extremely bright, entrepreneurial-minded engineers, developers, project managers, product managers, analysts and architects that strive to build world-class solutions and tools that delight users. The real estate valuation industry - which has experienced many years of business as usual - invites for innovation and modern technology to improve the process, workflow, and user experience. So, we at Clear Capital are pioneering a new frontier to make a better industry and challenge the status quo.
CompensationSalary commensurate with experience
Clear Capital is an equal opportunity employer

Zillow is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to for our growing world-class data science group dedicated to excellence. Our data science group is producing cutting-edge analytic products and building machine learned prediction models and big data systems for Zestimates, Rent Zestimates, personalization, housing indices, fraud detection, user segmentation, and many other predictive and advanced modeling applications for Zillow. This job is at the core of Zillow’s mission to empower the consumer. If you want to be part of this opportunity, you should apply!
Key Responsibilities:

Create predictive models for Zestimates, Rent Zestimates, and Home Indices
Create personalized recommendation models
Improve relevance ranking for search
Collaborate with software developers to put predictive models in production

Required Qualifications:

10+ years of hands on experience with machine learning applied to big data
Proven ability and experience in using data science, statistical computing, and modeling to improve business KPIs.
Expert level knowledge of platforms / languages like R, Python, Java, and Spark
Graduate degree (MS or PhD) from a top-tier university in a Computer Science or Statistics related discipline.

Working at Snapwiz is like doing Kaggle problems all day, and getting paid for it.
We work in the domain of education, and in particular: knowledge acquisition, adaptive learning, professional development, skill mastery and skill networks.
Be part of a fun and cool company that is not too big so you can easily see the impact of your contributions.
We have offices in Fremont, CA and in Bangalore, India and are seeking to expand our data science teams in both locations. 
Our only requirement is that you have some impressive Kaggle results to share. Our team mostly uses these tools: python, Java, mongoDB, SQL and Tableau.
We are staffing for internships as well as full-time positions.
location: Fremont, San Francisco Bay Area and Bangalore, India

body:
Position Summary:
It is a great time to join the CVS Caremark team and be part of the largest integrated pharmacy company in the United States. We are looking for a talented and experienced Data and Analytics expert seeking the career growth that CVS Health can offer.
The position will be responsible for development of Pharmacy data solutions and reporting products focused on enabling and empowering business analytics teams across retail pharmacy to leverage data to innovate our business.
The Pharmacy Data Advisor will serve as a key leader in driving enhanced value from improvements in data warehouse and analytics as part of an Enterprise-wide initiative. The ideal candidate will have:The vision and purpose to drive meaningful business impact through the identification and delivery of data process enhancement opportunities.The ability to operate with equal comfort in both business and technical spheres - excellent communication and influence skills will be critical for success in the role (this role will work closely with both business stakeholders and technical IT development and architecture teams).The technical ability to get their hands dirty and do analytics work as well as lead and consult on technical projects. Some coding will be required.
Responsibilities:
Rapidly develop deep understanding of business data and serve as a thought partner to guide Enterprise teams and different groups in Retail Pharmacy in navigating data assets;Daily hands-on analytic work to answer business questions – including querying relational databases to summarize data for further analyses as a core component of daily work;Responsible for working with the different groups in Retail Pharmacy to standardize best practice in reporting through development and roll-out of standard calculations and metrics;Support the development and maintenance of documentation (including data dictionary/wiki) that enables self-service support for business users of retail pharmacy domains;Provide suggestions on possible need for governance policies and processes;Subject matter expert for data quality requirements;Participate in BI development projects as a stakeholder and/or technical advisor to create data solution and data visualization prototypes.
Required Qualifications:
To qualify for this opportunity, you will have a minimum of 5 years of strong data analysis experience within the retail or healthcare industry and will have demonstrated experience working with very large data (1 million + records), driving strategy and influencing decisions based on data insights. Your experience will also include strong proficiency in analytical tools including SQL, SAS and Tableau or MicroStrategy along with MS Office products. 
Preferred Qualifications:
A strong curiosity to learn and apply data science techniques and tools;Proven ability to work within a climate of ambiguity;Willingness to challenge the status quo;Demonstrated leadership competencies such as teamwork, creative problem solving and flexibility;Strong personal and team organizational skills;Excellent relationship management, strong team building, and the ability to work across business units within a complex organization.
Education:
Bachelor's degree; Master's preferred.Business Overview:
CVS Health, through our unmatched breadth of service offerings, is transforming the delivery of health care services in the U.S. We are an innovative, fast-growing company guided by values that focus on teamwork, integrity and respect for our colleagues and customers. What are we looking for in our colleagues? We seek fresh ideas, new perspectives, a diversity of experiences, and a dedication to service that will help us better meet the needs of the many people and businesses that rely on us each day. As the nation’s largest pharmacy health care provider, we offer a wide range of exciting and fulfilling career opportunities across our three business units – MinuteClinic, pharmacy benefit management (PBM) and retail pharmacy. Our energetic and service-oriented colleagues work hard every day to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers.
job_title: Pharmacy Data Advisor Retail Rx Center of Excellence

body:
This is an excellent ground floor opportunity to become a key player in a computational imaging software startup based in Los Angeles area, which was recently picked by Nvidia as one of the finalists in the GTC 2016 Early Stage Challenge competition.
We are looking for a Computational Imaging Scientist with both creative vision and a strong technical know-how. We're developing ground-breaking applications of computational imaging involving High Performance Computing on NVIDIA GPUs. The company offers competitive salary and benefits, stock options, and a creative working environment where your input and ideas are highly valued.
Requirements:
PhD/MS in CS, EE, Mathematics, or similar.Background in computational imaging / computational photography, close familiarity with related mathematical methods, tools, and techniques with applications to  image denoising, debluring, and super-resolution.
Familiarity with deep learning and convolutional neural networks, and the related open source frameworks, such as Caffe, Theano, TensorFlow.  Experience with OpenCV.
Additional skills:
Understanding of conventional image signal processing pipeline (demosaicing, noise filtering, exposure control, white balance, color correction, color space conversion, video compression).
Please apply at: info@entropix.com

We are looking someone who would love to help us to set up partnerships with both academics and industry experts in the data science space to jointly create courses. You should have experience with data science technologies (R, Python, ...) and/or a strong knowledge of statistics and/or machine learning. You’ll also be responsible for sourcing partnerships and guiding the development of new interactive courses that will be added to our course curriculum. You should love keeping up with the latest data science technologies and methodologies. You should like to explain complex ideas in a simple, understandable and fun way. You should love to convince top people from both academia and industry to work with us.
The ideal candidate:

Loves statistics and data science
Loves teaching
Loves networking
Loves to do presentations
Works well in a team
Has outstanding English skills (written and verbal)
Has at least 2 years of experience with R / Python
Involvement in an open-source project or community is a plus
Teaching experience is a plus, PhD's may apply as well
Experience with new open-source data analysis technologies (e.g. Spark) is a plus

What we offer:
In addition to joining an innovative, flexible and data-driven start-up, you’ll enjoy the following:

A salary, of course!
Stock options in an early stage start-up with a lot of growth potential
Flexibility: Want to work from home? Want to take a week off to go on holidays? Want to work different hours? We can work something out.
Exciting and unique job at the crossroad of data science, teaching and business development.
Opportunity to work in an internationally focused, fast-paced technology start-up

Cognizant is looking for a Data Project Manager to join our Analytics & Information Management (AIM) Practice, onsite for a large and well known Banking client of ours in Canary Wharf, East London.Job Description:• Planning and designing the programme and proactively monitoring its overall progress, resolving issues and initiating corrective action as appropriate;• Defining the programme’s governance arrangements;• Quality assurance and overall integrity of the programme - focusing inwardly on the internal consistency of the programme; and outwardly on its coherence with infrastructure planning, interfaces with other programmes and corporate technical and specialist standards;• Managing the programme’s budget monitoring the expenditures and costs against delivered and realized benefits as the programme progresses;• Facilitating the appointment of individuals to the project delivery teams;• Ensuring that there is efficient allocation of common resources and skills within the project portfolio;• Managing the communications with all stakeholders;• Managing both the dependencies and the interfaces between projects;• Managing risks to the programme’s successful outcome;• Initiating extra activities and other management interventions wherever gaps in the programme are identified or issues arise;• Reporting progress of the programme at regular intervals to the programme director• People Management – supervise the onshore team• Onshore – Offshore Relationship management Essential Skills: • Project Management experience in managing large Data warehouse and Business Intelligence programmes gained in Investment Banking.• Good skill in any enterprise level ETL tool (Preferably Informatica)• Good skill in any of Reporting tools Business Objects, QlikView etc.• Experience in DWH platforms - SQL Server• Knowledge and experience in emerging technologies - Big Data• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills• Mange project timeline, scope, financials, issues and risks• PMP or PRINCE2 certification• Excellent written and verbal communication skills; good team player; highly motivated self-starter; good relationship builder with strong diplomacy skills• Must be able to work proactively and under pressure• Ability to coach new team members About AIM:Cognizant’s Analytics & Information Management (AIM) Practice has over 25,000 Data professionals globally with approximately 4,000 working on UK client projects.AIM covers the full spectrum of client information requirements from the most basic management of application data stores through every aspect of Data Governance on to Big Data including every Analytical & Insight requirement and the complete information infrastructure for every Digital business initiative.Over the last 3 years Cognizant’s UK AIM business unit has more than doubled the size of the team, generating very profitable revenues well in excess of $100m.Cognizant’s AIM business continues to invest in client initiatives creating an enviable track record of client success with the highest levels of satisfaction. This continued success has created many career progression opportunities for highly skilled information experts wishing to expand and accelerate their information careers.Over the last 22 years Cognizant’s has delivered meteoric growth and continues to outstrip the consulting marketplace. AIM is one of the core enabling propositions. Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. With over 100 development and delivery centres worldwide and approximately 219,300 employees as of September 30, 2015, Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. Visit us online at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: Cognizant.

body:
This is a very high visibility role to Cognizant as a Banking and Financial Services (BFS) Engagement Manager to join our Analytics & Information Management (AIM) Practice, in London.
You will be focused on analytics and data management (including big data) to drive digital transformation conversations with clients leading to successful implementations and brand value.The role involves the development and management of the existing client accounts within AIM BFS UK & Ireland. Responsibilities:
• Acting as a thought leader demonstrating strong analytics and data management industry experience • Work with key stakeholders in customer environments in an advisory capacity by bringing in key thought leadership and Cognizant assets to customers• Onsite delivery management and co-ordination with offshoreo Establish Cognizant AIM brand and mindshare by delivery assurance, management and delivery thought leadership. Specifically create mindshare with Client architecture and delivery organisation aligning with CIO and Business objectiveso Demonstrate Cognizant ethos “Keep Challenging” by driving continuous improvement and innovationo Expand/ grow existing client accounts by developing new opportunities riding on strengths of delivery excellence and solution/technology innovation. This includes leading response team for associated proposals/ RFPs/ RFIs• Liaison with AIM specialist arms and center of excellence such as Big data, quality assurance, architecture, consulting and technology functions such as Informatica, Ab Initio, MSBI, in-memory. Thus ensure right solution and services for end client• Establishing strong relationship with key AIM stakeholders in customer environments and establish highest level of customer satisfaction• Liaison with partners to drive innovation and value add within client accounts• Managing and motivating the team members - including career development, mentoring and performance management. Essential Skills Required:
• Proven track record in managing large and complex data management and analytics programmes.• Strong stakeholder management experience including a hard fought and fiercely protected key executive contact network • Exceptional business development and relationship management skills• Banking and Financial services industry experience will additional advantage• Data management experience and appreciation covering but not limited to - BI, DW, Data Governance, Database Management, Data Archiving and Retention, Data Quality, MDM, Data Migration, Data Lake, Semantic modelling and Big Data About AIM:Cognizant’s Analytics & Information Management (AIM) Practice has over 25,000 Data professionals globally with approximately 4,000 working on UK client projects.AIM covers the full spectrum of client information requirements from the most basic management of application data stores through every aspect of Data Governance on to Big Data including every Analytical & Insight requirement and the complete information infrastructure for every Digital business initiative.Over the last 3 years Cognizant’s UK AIM business unit has more than doubled the size of the team, generating very profitable revenues well in excess of $100m.Cognizant’s AIM business continues to invest in client initiatives creating an enviable track record of client success with the highest levels of satisfaction. This continued success has created many career progression opportunities for highly skilled information experts wishing to expand and accelerate their information careers.Over the last 22 years Cognizant’s has delivered meteoric growth and continues to outstrip the consulting marketplace. AIM is one of the core enabling propositions. 
• Graduate/Masters degree in Computer Science or similar or equivalent relevant work experience.Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. With over 100 development and delivery centres worldwide and approximately 219,300 employees as of September 30, 2015, Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. Visit us online at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: Cognizant.

body:
ELTE Faculty of Informatics (ELTE FI) in collaboration with Deutsche Telekom Innovation Laboratories (T-Labs), establishes industry driven, R&D&I oriented department in order to carry out research, development and teaching in data science and data engineering theory, technologies and their applications. ELTE FI is one of the top ranked faculties in computer science in Hungary, with over 100 faculty members and strong focus on R&D&I activities. ELTE FI leads the EIT Digital Budapest Associate Partner Group being the only EIT Digital partner located in the Central and Eastern European region (www.inf.elte.hu, www.elte.hu, budapestictnetwork.elte.hu).T-Labs is the central R&I unit of Deutsche Telekom (DT), Europe's leading telecommunications company. T-Labs is also a joint institute of DT and Technische Universität Berlin (TUB). Budapest is the next centre to be established of the international network, which provides a bridge between commerce and science, so as to turn novel ideas for real problems into marketable innovations as quickly as possible. Around 360 Telekom experts and scientists from various disciplines from all over the world work in Berlin, Darmstadt, Bonn (Germany), Beer Sheva (Israel) and Los Altos (USA) on developing novel solutions and new services for Deutsche Telekom. Functions to be carried out:• the head of department will set up the new unit of ELTE FI and T-Labs focusing  on Data Science and Engineering, contributing to data-driven business applications by fostering research and open innovation in this emerging area. The department to be established will be subsidized by DTAG and closely cooperate with its innovation network, including the national telecommunications provider Hungarian Telekom and TUB. • demonstration of an internationally relevant and competitive research program,  meeting defined business requirements and problems on the following fields:
     o Application-oriented and fundamental research in data science and data     engineering, which involves methodologies and methods from statistics and     computer science, including utilization and further development of algorithms     and models in the fields of data mining, machine learning, data visualization.      Definition and development of new and innovative platforms, architectures,      programming languages and APIs. • contributing to the Faculty’s general research activities at operational and strategic levels • appropriate planning and organizing of staff and resources on department level • planning and preparing significant research funding proposals • planning, preparing and delivering effective teaching, supervision and assessment of postgraduate/PhD students • participating in, and where appropriate leading, development of the curriculum and of teaching methods, creating synergies between research and education with involvement of students into research activities of Department
Requirements:• PhD degree in computer science • applicants should state with a commensurate track record being expected for candidates to associate professor positions • on the basis of scientific performance ability to obtain habilitated doctor title within two years • university teaching experience • actual experience with Big Data and Complexity • candidates must have carried out outstanding scientific research in the field of data science, which is proven by research output of a high level in peer-reviewed international publications (journals and/or books), demonstrating a distinguished research profile • candidates must have experience in heading up industrial research projects and coaching PhD studentsType of employment contract: public employee, full-time, 5 yearsStarting date: Starting date for the position is as soon as possibleSalary: Salary upon agreement – a salary ensuring an outstanding level of life in Hungary
To apply: Please submit the complete application as a ZIP archive to dean@fi.elte.hu The application must include:• Cover letter • CV including a full list of publications • Scanned copies of your certificates • Statement of research interest and teaching objectives • Documentation of additional relevant qualifications according to above specifications
more about ELTE in a short video
job_title: Head of Data Science and Engineering Department

body: Guided Knowledge is looking for a Senior Data Scientist - Motion to join our newly established team on the south coast of Hampshire. The team is re-imagining learning and we are assembling a world class team of scientists, engineers, machine learning specialists and computer scientists to create systems that accelerate learning and skills acquisition. We are creating state of the art technology to digitally capture the wisdom of experts and stars to replicate the conversations between coach and student and transform data into powerful, affordable training solutions that empower people.If you have a Ph.D. in a quantitative field and extensive experience in managing data pipelines and the ability to build tools to extract, process and analyse large quantities of motion and sensor data then this opportunity will be of interest to you. A significant advantage will be experience of C/C++, Matlab, and Python software programs with machine learning capability. We are seeking somebody who has a collaborative, positive and team oriented mindset and will relish the opportunity to work at the leading edge of motion capture and inference work.This is an exciting time for the team here at Guided Knowledge and this is a tremendous opportunity for somebody who wants to develop their career and join an enthusiastic group of like-minded people.

Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a work environment that encourages new ideas, having fun and challenging the status quo!
At trivago we take data-informed decisions. In undertaking analyses of big data, our Business Intelligence team provides insights that help to determine the strategies of all of our departments. Now the Business Intelligence Team is looking for an analytical thinker to work with our Quality Assurance team in order to help them find the root cause of website issues. Your main responsibility will be to provide consultation to the QA team; you will do this by supporting them in analysing critical incidents and showing them how to correctly read data and interpret results so that they understand the meaning behind the data. You will also be responsible for assisting in analysing the large amounts of data coming from our many A/B tests and search for anomalies. You will thoroughly search through our logging and data warehouse infrastructure in order to understand bugs that appear on our website or in data. We are always looking for ways to improve our current processes so you will be encouraged to enhance our automated anomaly detection system in order to detect anomalies close to real time and allow issues to be quickly resolved.
The ideal candidate:• Speaks English (our company language) fluently.• Holds a B.A. or B.Sc. in one of the natural sciences (Maths, Physics, etc.), Computer Science or a Business-related course where there was a focus on statistics or data analysis.• Has some previous professional experience, including internships, working with data analysis.• Has good Excel skills.• Has at least a basic understanding of analytics tools. Knowledge of SQL or Hadoop, as well as any IT architecture knowledge, would be a plus.• Is analytically minded and capable of drawing valuable insights from raw data.• Is capable of communicating complex information in a simple, crisp and concise way.• Can start as soon as possible.
Life at trivago is...• The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.• Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.• Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.• The freedom to embrace small-scale failures on the path to large-scale success.• The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free workshops, seminars, sports and activities.• The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.• Living in Düsseldorf, the 6th highest quality of living city in the world for expats.
Additional information:• Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.• This is a fixed-term position of 1 year with a long-term perspective.• We do not require the services of an agency for this position.
job_title: Junior Data Analyst – Quality Assurance – Business Intelligence

body:
Position Summary: Work with elite cybersecurity experts and university faculty to build new data mining technologies that will influence the national strategy against cyber attacks in the coming decades. Projects may include developing metrics and experimental designs for large-scale cybersecurity research programs, researching human-in-the-loop machine learning, and analyzing cybersecurity incident data. You will co-author research proposals, execute studies, and present findings to DoD sponsors and academic conferences. Consider applying for this position if you are a proven computer science expert with a firm grasp of security principles and statistical theory.
Candidates will undergo a background check and must be eligible to obtain and maintain a Department of Defense security clearance. This position may involve the training and supervision of graduate students and junior employees.
Minimum Qualifications and Requirements:
Education/Training: Background in machine learning, security, statistics, or related quantitative field with a Bachelor’s degree and eight (8) years of experience; Master’s degree and five (5) years of experience; PhD and two (2) years of experience; or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Skills/Abilities: An ideal candidate will have expertise in the following areas. Experience with specific methods is less important than evidence that you can learn.
Ability to perform computer science research related to cybersecurityBasic grasp of statistical modelsComfortable working in the Unix command lineDemonstrated ability to work in a multi-disciplinary environmentExpert communicationPreferred Qualifications and Requirements:
Education/Training: PhD with five plus (5+) years of experience in machine learning, computer science, statistics, or other related quantitative field.
Skills/Abilities:
Expertise implementing machine learning techniques (e.g., K-means, SVM, neural networks)Familiar with at least one mathematical/statistical programming package (e.g., python numpy/scipy/pandas, R, MATLAB, etc.)Strong software engineering skillsCybersecurity or privacy experienceExperience supporting test and evaluation for large-scale government research programs is a plusJob Functions or Responsibilities:
40%  Data analysis & data analysis tool development.
25%  Other types of research support including designing experiments and metrics.
15%  Participating in the research community, including attending and presenting at conferences, and reading and writing academic papers.
10%  Writing proposals and reports.                 
10%  Consulting and project planning with other groups in the SEI.
100% Total Effort

body:
We are EA Mobile
Electronic Arts (NASDAQ: EA) is the world’s top mobile game publisher with an industry-leading portfolio including games such as Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes, Madden NFL Mobile, Simpsons Tapped Out, Real Racing 3, Plants vs. Zombies 2, and SimCity BuildIt. Ranked as the #1 publisher by downloads in 2015, EA has shown a clear dedication to winning on the mobile platform.
The mobile gaming industry is exploding. Consumer spending will top $30B globally this year and is expected to grow double digits in the coming years. The introduction of the iPhone, iPad, and Android devices has created unprecedented access to consumers and created a massive new crop of engaged gamers. Free-To-Play mobile games now dominate the top charts on Apple and Android as micro transactions and in-game economies have successfully migrated from Facebook to the mobile platform. Simultaneously, the international market is growing at a rapid pace as games are localized to reach new and emerging markets including China, Brazil, and Korea.
The position is based in EA’s Los Angeles (Playa Vista, just 10 minutes from the beach ) offices as part of the EA Mobile Publishing team.Yup - it’s the coolest job on the planet!
You have a deep mathematics and statistics background with a bent toward using those skills in a data-driven role. You also have a passion for gaming. EA is looking for experienced data science practitioners who are ready to dig in to consumer data. You will be responsible for building advanced predictive models, providing thought leadership across EA in regard to analytics best practices, and identifying potential opportunities for innovation and application of the latest statistical methods in order to inform EA’s business and communications with their players. Work closely with game studios, product marketing, business development and the executive team to drive insights and execution that produce better games and delighted players. 
RESPONSIBILITIES
•    To work collaboratively with analysts, game producers, product managers, and central stakeholders to present analyses and findings that will provide actionable insight into the game to improve the acquisition, engagement and monetization of our audience.•    Produce statistical and machine learning models that inform how we communicate with our players•    Drive improvement in our methodologies, systems and processes•    Prepare and present results of modeling efforts and performance to senior management•    Be actively engaged in assigned products and develop a deep understanding of game mechanics including microtransactions, gameplay and economyRequirements•    B.A./B.S. degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative field•    Quantitative oriented Masters Degree or Ph.D  highly preferred•    Minimum 7 years of experience in analytics•    5+ years of experience with building predictive models in R, Python, or other computer programming languages•    Strong history of identifying opportunities for developing predictive models to meet business needs•    Expertise in machine learning and statistical analysis approaches such as classification, regression, structural equation modeling, etc
BenefitsWe are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. Next StepsRead more about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/los-angeles-eala EA is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.
job_title: Sr. Manager/Sr. Team Lead, Data Science

body:
Min Doktor is the leading Nordic online primary medical care provider. We are setting up a group that will leverage the latest techniques in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to improve patient safety, as well as both doctor’s and patient’s experience of the service. Since we are vertically integrated, providing primary medical care from start to finish, you can expect to work on unique datasets, with direct access to skilled physicians for labelling of data and learning supervision. You will have impact: new ideas can be quickly prototyped against historic patient data and quickly implemented in our service with immediate effect on medical outcome for real patients.We are now looking for talented Data Scientists or Software Engineers with applied experience and strong interest in the fields of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to join our team. Beyond strong problem modelling and solution skills you must be passionate about working with medical experts to understand data and provide explanations for the output of the machine learning algorithms you develop.Primarily we are looking for candidates willing to relocate to Malmö, Sweden. But exceptional remote candidates will be considered. You can impress us with something you’ve built or an original thought.Responsibilities

Participate in cutting edge research in the application of artificial intelligence and machine learning to solve problems in primary medical care.
Develop predictive models for real world problems in Python, C/C++, Java, Scala, Go or similar programming languages.
Analyze data and interpret results.
In the role of Data Scientist support the development team in the production implementation of your proposed solutions.

Minimum qualifications

MS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or related technical field (or equivalent practical experience).

Preferred qualifications

MS or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or related technical field (or equivalent practical experience).
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Python, C/C++, Java, Scala or Go.
Strong problem formulation, mathematical modelling and logical reasoning ability.

Company Description
Are you a hands-on person that finds the challenge of building scalable technologies for modeling and analyzing large amounts of data exciting?
If you do, come work with us as a Data Scientist, and use your technological, research, and development skills to make technologies that distill insight from huge amounts of data from the marketplace.
Aol Convertro is a quantitative marketing impact analytics software and service provider. This is NOT a marketing research or “analytics” job. We are looking for data scientists with engineering and software development discipline. We have openings in Los Angeles (Playa Vista) CA, and in Ra-anana Israel.
Job Description
This role is to research and develop marketing impact modeling methods using Machine Learning, Statistical, and Economic sciences to analyze and provide data-driven decision support in the form of cloud based dashboard software.
You should be self-sufficient in the ability to retrieve the data from datastores, cleanse it and process it into a useful format to research, develop, prototype, scale, and deploy code for automated analysis of within a big data software stack. You will work with teams of other engineers to develop these solutions, processing data on a large scale in an automated manner as part of our cloud based data-driven business decision support system.
You will work with product managers and analytic modelers to both understand the needs of our clients and the actionable insights they seek to make business decisions, as well as ideate new ways to extract valuable information from our vast pools of data.
You will work with big data engineers responsible for developing and maintaining systems for collecting and processing data, and obtain a deep understanding of which data is collected, how is it structured, what information it provides, as well as how it may be biased or incomplete.
You are expected to communicate with teams of data scientist, analyst, and product managers, and you are expected to maintain and adhere to standards for a well organized source-controled system for development.
Qualifications
M.Sc. or Ph.d in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Financial Economics, Applied Mathematics, and other quantitatively rigorous Engineering disciplines.

Experience solving problems that required the use of machine learning algorithms or statistical modeling

Proven programming skills including knowledge in languages for modeling and statistical analysis such as R or Matlab.

Excellent communication skills and ability to describe complex technical concepts in clear language and the ability and desire to be constantly learning, both new technologies and new algorithmic approaches
Additional Information
EEO/AA Women, Minorities, Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities Employer: AOL offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including 401(k) match and performance bonus. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or other protected category.

Highmark Inc. is among the largest health insurers in the United States and the fourth-largest Blue Cross and Blue Shield-affiliated company. Highmark and its diversified businesses and affiliates operate health insurance plans in Pennsylvania, Delaware and West Virginia that serve 5.2 million members. Its diversified health businesses serve group customer and individual health needs across the United States through dental insurance, vision care and other related health businesses. Highmark is an independent licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, an association of independent Blue Cross and Blue Shield companies. For more information, visit www.highmark.com.
Job TitleSr Decision Support Analyst
DescriptionGeneral Overview:Works closely with customers and design teams in prioritizing data and information requirements. This position provides analysis in the development and support of projects and data analysis. Determines how decision support systems will provide information required to make effective business decisions; translates requirements into applications that employ appropriate decision support and reporting tools. Recommends innovative approaches to analytical investigations. Performs modeling of data sources and flows, works with data management staff to define an operational framework that will define, develop and implement policies and security frameworks to ensure precise and secure delivery of knowledge and information.
Essential Job Functions:1. Develop and foster internal relationships across the corporation. Provide analytic and consultative support to a broad spectrum of internal customer areas and external business partners.2. Mentor colleagues with less experience on both the technical and business aspects of project and consultative work.3. Determines how decision support systems will provide information required to make effective business decisions, translates requirements into applications that employ appropriate decision support and reporting tools. Uses broad experience and technical knowledge to propose solutions to complex business problems. Takes the lead in driving the implementation of the recommended solutions. 4. Takes the lead in defining issues and ideas to be studied as well as the approach (methodological and technical) to be used in addressing studies and projects. Creates and/or develops new methods of analysis, database design and performance measurement or, in some cases, adaptation of existing solutions to new areas. 5. Performs modeling of data sources and flows, works with data management staff to define an operational framework that will define, develop and implement policies and security frameworks to ensure precise and secure deliver of knowledge and information.6. Provides assistance and, depending on skill and experience, leads with interpretation of raw data, statistical results or otherwise compiled information, identify follow-up action items and prepare or assist in the preparation of written reports and/or oral presentation of findings to internal and external audiences, customer managers, clinical staff, compliance agencies, group accounts, providers, agent plans, and brokers.7. Develops and maintains moderate- to extremely-complex computer programs using 4GL programming languages (such as SAS, R, SQL) and other database technology (DB2, Teradata, and Oracle).8. Other duties as assigned or requested.
Minimum Qualifications:
*Bachelor's degree*8 or more years of experience in decision support
Preferred Qualifications:
*SAS experience*Experience with predictive modeling software such as R, Python, Alteryx, etc.*Experience and demonstrated proficiency as a Decision Support Analyst or equivalent training and experience in a business or clinical environment with direct responsibility for applying technology.*An advanced degree in or related to Computer/Information Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Economics, Industrial Engineering or Operations Research
